title: Hestan - ProBond Collection - TITUM Nonstick Triple Bonded Stainless Steel Skillets with Lids, Induction Cooktop Compatible, Made without PFOAs (8.5 & 11-inch)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I absolutely love these pans!', 'author': 'Brandy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I absolutely love these pans! They are very well made, contain no forever chemicals (PFAO/PFAS), very easy to clean, and cook evenly. The 12 inch pan is much larger than you think as the sides allow for more surface area comapred to traditional pans. They are well worth the money and belive Hestan has a life time guarentee on their pans which means the cost upfront will save you in the end!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A joy to use', 'author': 'George K', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These skillets are totally worth their price - I already own a non-nonstick Hestan and loved its looks and how easy it was to clean, but after doing my research and having had enough with 'high quality' non-stick pans from Calphalon and Zwilling, I decided to splurge for this set (it's actually a steal, compared to the price you'd pay if you were to buy two individual Hestans). I'll say they are truly a joy to use. They heat evenly, the surface has just the right amount of roughness to sear, but still after 4 months use, they still maintain their excellent non-stick ability (unlike their supposedly high end competitors). They can also take some abuse: No special instructions for what temperatures they need to be before you can wet/wash them, and they are perfectly fine in the dishwasher. Add these features to their looks, and you'll have a skillet set you'll want to use everyday. Totally worth their price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent brand overall', 'author': 'Reagan S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have several pieces of Hestan cookware.. Titum non stick, Nano Bond, and 3 ply stainless - also some with lids. I love LOVE these products.The quality and workmanship is outstanding, the different choices of pots and pans provides a great selection to suit almost every need. I have spoken to the concierge for help and he was really good at explaining and giving direction. This brand is expensive but I have found deals and specials on almost every item and the value is great based on quality and my overall satisfaction of performance. I have other cookware that simply will NOT clean up but this line looks like new even after many uses. I look forward to expanding my collection as needed. Very Very happy with every item I've bought and will recommend to anyone interested and will buy again !", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for good quality fry pans!', 'author': 'Spook74', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good heat distribution, but it is SUPER at ease of cleaning! These are some good pans! We still do use a pat of butter sometimes to slicken it up a bit, but it will even fry eggs, etc., just as it is!We saw the comments that the handle can get hot, so we added a Lodge silicone hot handle holder (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00C61O4ZI?ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_details&th=1), which fits snug and still lets you hand it up by the hole in the handle.Great pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super well constructed', 'author': 'Doug Walker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really appreciate the flush rivets as the pan is easier to keep clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great deal on great pans', 'author': 'Dean Eric', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We love these as safe from harmful chemicals and they go into the oven, deal on Amazon extraordinaire!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Hestan - NanoBond Collection - Titanium Stainless Steel 8.5-Inch Frying Pan - Toxin, PFAS, & Chemical Free Clean Cookware, Induction Cooktop Compatible
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome cookware for a bad cook!', 'author': 'JPDMyers', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Two months ago, I bought the 8.5” pan as a test before investing further in the Heston Nanobond line. I’d been wanted to ditch my non-stick cookware for several years for health reasons but couldn’t find the right fit. I’m spoiled by growing up cooking with only non-stick cookware. And I’m NOT a good cook so I tend to overheat pans & burn food. AND I sooo dislike cleaning up after cooking that I’d prefer to do it later (like the next day). I’m possibly the worst case scenario for testing any cookware line. I’d honestly much rather enjoy being served nice meals in restaurants. But, I’m immunocompromised so COVID changed all that. So, I’ve needed to up my game & learn to cook decently.I first tested several brands of stainless steel cookware. It was a total nightmare for me to clean. I then tried out ceramic cookware but found it to be too heavy for my arthritic joints. After reading about and researching Hestan’s Nanobond’s titanium coating, I thought it sounded promising & ordered this pan. Besides, the design of all of Hestan’s cookware is simply gorgeous.This Hestan Nanobond pan turned out to be AMAZING. My 1st test was fried eggs that turned out perfect with no sticking and easy cleanup afterwards. I’d read to heat the pan first, then add the oil/butter next & let it heat, and to then add the eggs. That definitely works to make the surface as close to being non-stick without actually having a non-stick coating. I’ve used it repeatedly for sticky foods like fried eggs, scrambled eggs, grilled cheese sandwiches, etc. with thrilling results. Best of all, it’s easy to clean afterwards.The Hestan Nanobond cookware is fantastic & suits my needs perfectly. I’ve now bought many more of the pots and pans in all shapes & sizes. I’m thrilled with the good looks & performance of the Nanobond line, the ease of cleaning up afterwards, and the titanium coating’s overall forgivingness for bad cooks. I accidentally added ground sausage needing to be browned for a casserole directly to their still-warming 3.5 quart sauté pan. The sausage stuck immediately to the bottom & I knew I’d really screwed up. While stirring the rest of the meat with only a silicon spatula, however, the stuck remnants surprisingly released completely from the bottom! I then decided to go ahead & try baking the entire casserole in the covered Nanobond pan in the oven instead of dirtying up a casserole dish. The casserole turned out fantastic with perfectly browned sides & bottom. The servings easily released from the pan without falling apart. And the very baked-on food remnants STILL cleaned up easily. The beautiful design of Hestan’s cookware really makes it equally appealing for stove/oven to table presentation. I’m now totally in love with the Hestan Nanobond line!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great brand', 'author': 'june', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have two nano bond pans from them and both are my two favorite and most used. They clean great. You don't need non-stick if you have these.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This is a high quality pan! Expensive but will last forever!', 'author': 'Charlie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I just got rid of my nonstick T-Fal professional pan and that was great but the coating was starting to come off...Lasted just about maybe a year or year + 1/2...So I was getting tired of buying a new pan constantly.While this is not a non-stick pan, it is solidly built, and the nanocoat looks fantastic, and the rivets are not sticking out inside the pan.You need to warm up the pan and I like to do the water test to make sure the pan is hot enough.Be prepared to use oil and/or butter otherwise you will have food stick.I had to practice with eggs and finally got it figured out to where I can cook a over easy egg w/o making a mess on our electric range.Cleanup is pretty easy, soap + water.I believe if you have food stuck, just soak it and then clean.For anything that blemishes the pan, I think you can buy barkeepers friend and rub it out (cheaper than buying Hestan's polishing compound).If the price was lower, I would jump on the larger pan for sure...This is perfect for cooking a couple of eggs...Just wish it was a little cheaper.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This pan is non stick as long as you follow directions', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This pan is a beautiful little gem. Feels nice in hand and completely non stick if you follow directions and heat it until water drops dance and scatter. Add oil and cook away!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not worthy.', 'author': 'Sebas', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I recently purchased an expensive pan, and I have to say, I'm thoroughly disappointed with its performance. Despite the hefty price tag, the pan fails to deliver even the most basic cooking capabilities. Food sticks to the pan, and it cooks unevenly, leaving some parts burnt and others undercooked.I've tried using different oils and heat settings, but nothing seems to prevent the food from sticking or ensure an even cook. It's incredibly frustrating to spend so much money on a pan that doesn't perform as advertised.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars sticks', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Well made frying pan. We purchased the pan to fry eggs. The first time we used it the eges did not stick.Subsequent egg frying they stuck to the bottom of the pan regardless of how much butter was used to prevent sticking. Not worth the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pan ever!', 'author': 'Naser Ali Abbas Altaib', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This is the Hestan NanoBond 8.5” that I purchased last Oct 2022. After over 8 months of daily usage, the pan is still shining, easy to clean, and nothing sticks if you just preheat your pan properly before adding your fat. The pan is still as GREAT as new, if not BETTER, it’s the best durable high-quality elegant pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars DERAILED REVIEW —— Not perfect but I like it', 'author': 'Bobbler', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought the 8 inch pan.. I am hesitant to buy the larger skillets if they are going to be super thin like the 8 inch is.BOTTOM LINE:I think I’m going to love this pan for scrambled eggs, and I don’t know what else.. I plan to try a reverse sear with salmon or a hamburger.. I usually slow cook vegetables in an enameled cast iron sauce pan, so I don’t have to worry about salt and other seasonings leaching the SS.. But I suppose I will try some vegetables in the nano bond titanium (as a little browning is supposed to add a layer of flavor.. but I suspect browning anything is less healthy).STICK, OR NOT TO STICK?Mystery solved.. I was perplexed by so many reviews complaining about things sticking to the titanium nanobond, because my scrambled eggs were sliding around, almost like a nonstick pan. I just watched a video comparison of three different stainless steel pans.. The Heston nanobond, and demeyere (both of which I have cooked scrambled eggs on).. In the video they got the pans hot until the water drops danced around, which I think of it as a trick that allows you to cook scrambled eggs in cast-iron.. Plus they used what looked like some kind of vegetable oil.. And the egg was stuck in the pan bad.. I use butter at a low temperature (which I believe is appropriate for eggs), and the eggs don’t stick at all..LEACHING INTO FOODI’ve always heard that titanium is extremely non-reactive, but I have been UNABLE to find any information (other than manufacturers claims) whether titanium cookware will leach anything into food while cooking (ie: acidic foods, like tomato paste, or how it’s well known that salt will pit stainless steel).. Titanium is supposed to be completely safe for humans, so we can only hope if anything leeches it would be pure titanium (manufacturers tend to be untrustworthy, I can only hope in Italy they have tighter regulations for such things than in America).. If you search the Internet you can find where testing was done with SS pans.. Some manufacturers claim you can cook tomato red sauce in them (even though tomatoes do leech from SS)..SUPER THIN?When I say super thin, perhaps I’m spoiled by using expensive aluminum clad cookware from other brands that have a hefty amount of aluminum.. Because of the high price of Heston nano bond cookware, they should pop for thick enough aluminum layer to where we should have to wonder if it’s enough.. And to be clear I don’t know how thick the aluminum layer needs to be to do. It’s job..The thin-ness of the pan makes me wonder if it would be prone to warping (with my other stainless steel pans, I clean them while they are hot, but I am fearful to put water into these thin nano bond skillets).. NOTE: I don’t put a lot of cold water into a hot pan, rather a little bit that steam cleans most of the pan (none of my pans have ever warped).HEAT MOMENTUM:The other problem with extra thin aluminum cladding is heat momentum.. Heat momentum is one of the reasons cast-iron pans work so well for certain things (such as putting a frozen hamburger patty, and getting heat momentum to create the seer.. instead of the frozen patty immediately cooling off the pan which destroys the seer). In my particular case, using the control freak induction burner that has a built-in temperature probe, it will probably compensate by instantly turning the power up (which I hear it doing when I take a little off, to try to maintain temperature).. I doubt the thin aluminum will work in this instance, if you’re trying to cook a frozen steak or anything substantial without cool in the pan off..NON-STICK:I have not used nonstick pans for decades, but I have been cooking scrambled eggs in aluminum clad stainless steel pans for years.. And for the past year. I’ve been using Demeyere SS skillets, which have a treated SS surface that concentrates the chromium and nickel and removes the iron (it makes the stainless steel, more stainless steel, and it does stick less than regular SS, but not by much)..[Again contrary to what many reviews are saying], when I cooked scrambled eggs in the Heston nanobond it felt like nonstick to me. There was an obvious non-stick quality even compared to my demeyere). Like my demeyere pans, I expect I will have to occasionally use the special cleaner, or barkeepers friend, to get rid of the haze/seasoning that develops (this is expected)..Likewise cleanup was very easy (like I would imagine non-stick would be).TOO—LIGHT—WEIGHT?I know other reviews think it’s thick/heavy, but it is by far the lightest pan I have ever held in my hands (and I’ve used a few different brands of aluminum clad stainless steel pans).. I realize titanium is light weight, but the nano bond is a very thin layer of titanium (presumably over stainless steel)..The pan is so light weight that it’s causing the problem with my control, freak induction burner.. The 8” or will sit flat by itself, but because it’s so light weight, and the handle is relatively heavy, it will not sit flat on the induction burner for preheating, because there is a temperature probe in the center (that has a lightweight spring)..And (when cooking anything sensitive to uneven heat) you very much need to preheat pans on an induction burner, because the nature of induction heats the pan itself so there is always a hot ring in the center of the pan that matches the induction ring (preheating for a while lets the heat spread out)..BOTTOM LINE: I was able to preheat the pan to cook my scrambled eggs, but one end of the pan was about 1/8” off the induction burner (and induction burners are sensitive to this.I WOULD HATE: to try to preheat the 8” pan for a seer on this induction burner (the 1/8” in the air might end up a huge problem at high power settings)..COOKING TECHNIQUES:There is technique to consider in whether eggs or anything sticks or not..For scrambled eggs I use low heat (228F.. since my induction burner controls the temperature).. and I use plenty of butter (I am convinced, low carb is healthy, and butter and egg yolks are healthy fats).. my eggs were sliding around the pan like the nonstick advertisements..CLEANUP:My experience with cleanup was like you would imagine nonstick. But I’ve seen many reviews complain about food sticking to the pan (I can only assume they were using high heat, and maybe little or no oil).. I can’t say for sure, but I know with my other stainless steel pans anytime something sticks, I just put a squeeze of dish soap and a little water and come back in an hour (or the next morning).. If I’m in a hurry, I’ll turn on the burner for a few seconds so warm soap will work faster.. Then whatever was stuck on usually falls off.. Sometimes I use vinegar (I don’t know whether dish soap vinegar would be more effective)..', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very high quality in ALMOST every area.', 'author': 'Teddy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Pros: the finish looks beautiful as it’s slightly a smoky grey color which is very smooth and though not nonstick is less sticky than other stainless steel pans I’ve used. Good weight, feels sturdy and i love the flush rivets. Heats up quick and the high heat resistance is great so it works I’m pretty much any cooking environment other than a microwave.Cons. Mostly small nitpicks but for an expensive pan small can be big depending on your taste. Pricey. On my induction top at least the pan bottom warps very slightly so as thin coat of oil tends to pool towards the outer edges of the pan, this pretty common in a lot of pans but i do wish at this price it could be avoided. The handle feels high quality but could be slightly more comfortable if the part that rests against your palm was just a bit wider.Overall: If you can deal with those nitpicks this will make a great pan for small tasks like a grilled cheese or an omelet etc. and last a long time. happy cooking!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for searing', 'author': 'L. Bencze', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Yes, food will definitely stick to this pan; no doubt about it. But it's not that hard to clean out. Most importantly, the pan will not pick up any staining. My wife uses it for searing steaks. She puts it in a hot oven. It's perfect for this. So its searing abilities justify the purchase. Other pans, like Swiss Diamond, are much better for cooking eggs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Hestan - CopperBond Collection - 100% Pure Copper Frying Pan, Induction Cooktop Compatible, 11-Inch
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it.', 'author': 'Timothy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It’s a wonderful pan. I look forward to using it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome', 'author': 'Zachary Newman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very good pan. I probably could have gotten a similar item for less money, but I do not regret the purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars excellent heat distribution', 'author': 'A Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'boils water FAST', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 29, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Overpriced for what you get', 'author': 'ZCharnecki', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'If you want ornamental pots and pans, go for it. But if you actually want to use them, move on. I thought these were beautiful but after one use the copper color is gone for all but a gross yellow tinge. The practicality of these is nil and hopefully this helps keep you from making a quick decision on aesthetics only.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars YOU NEED TO SEASON UR COPPER PANS !!!!!', 'author': 'David', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'YOU NEED TO SEASON UR COPPER PANS !!!!!After viewing the review section am amazed at how naive people r.... one needs to season ALL metal pans...geez... copper is far safer and the body NEEDS copper... other metal pans, especially nonstick , cast iron, stainless steel, even ceramic give off toxic gasses... ya, copper discolors over time, pots and pans r not art nor jewelry so appearance is a mute point.... if u have to then polish them', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Copper Bond care', 'author': 'Roy G. Becker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are absolutely pieces of art and I don’t understand why there are a hand full of people putting these down?Not one problem have I had and I dont foresee ever having one 👍As for the care of these copper bond line , We all learned in grade school that copper ‘Tarnishes’ and will need some extra care to keep them the same way as you received them , it’s no different than anything else ….. You buy nice things , You take care of Nice things so don’t throw your hate towards the company that gave you the option to have something so elegant and will last a life time ‘Providing you Care for them’ .All the very best to all that have these , And Happy Cooking 🧑\u200d🍳', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made and pretty', 'author': 'Tiffany Sanders', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I noticed the poor reviews revolve around the heat patina that forms on the copper after use, as well as the food sticking to the pan despite adding oil. To use steel pans, one must learn the steps: 1. Heat the pan first 2. Add the oil once pan is hot, let oil warm up for a few seconds 3. Add food.I have used a pot and my large pan from this ten piece set so far; cooked ground beef and rice, veggies like mushrooms, onions, garlic, and bell peppers so far, as well as made creamed spinach. I have not experienced any sticking whatsoever and find the pans cook my food more evenly with less risk of burning. These are the best pans i have ever used! If you don’t want the copper to change color, then you shouldn’t buy a set with visible copper parts, otherwise you can condition it to remove the natural patina that forms from heat exposure. I personally like the patina, it doesn’t bother me. I would recommend this set to anyone who cooks regularly and wants to do it the way the pros do it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed so far - updated APRIL 7, 2022', 'author': 'Eflows414', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I have decided to get rid of my nonstick Calphalon pans..I love them but the coating comes off and I"m very careful with my pans. I decided to try Hestan. First thing I cooked was scrambled eggs. I oiled the pan well but the eggs stuck really badly and was hard to get out. I forget what I cooked next in it but whatever it was, it was fine..so I tried eggs again, this time using olive oil to coat the pan. It was slightly better but the eggs still stuck to the pan however the pan cleaned up much easier. I\'m hoping it\'s just a matter of getting used to these as I want to get more pcs. This one has just been my trial piece. It is a beautiful pan, I will say thatApril 7, 2022 I thought I would add a little update. I don\'t use this pan that often, but I have cooked scrambled eggs a few more times...first coating the pan with olive oil, getting the oil hot before adding the eggs and then turning the heat down. They still stick but not as badly. I soaked the pan in hot water and it came clean easily. I will need to polish the copper but years ago when I had Revere ware copper bottom pans, I had to polish those as well. I hate not having it be a non stick pan but I spent a lot of money on the Calphalon only to have the nonstick peel off....so that\'s a waste. I never wash my pans in a dishwasher so that doesn\'t bother me either.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Cooks great, looks horrible', 'author': 'Belize Bradley', 'rating': 3, 'content': "My pots and pans are on display on a hanging rack so appearance is not as important as functionality but still important to me. This cookware looked horrible after the first few uses. I love the way it cooks but hate the way it looks unless you want to polish it after every use. It's also very heavy - so heavy I cannot manage the sautee pan with one hand. I had such high hopes for this set as it got great reviews and looked stunning out of the box (last photo).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful until you use it. Photos are after one use.', 'author': 'Matt D', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I haven’t cooked with high end cookware before and I’m tempted not to. This is a beautiful piece of cookware but…. It’s not non-stick or dishwasher safe. I did like the heat distribution but cleaning this thing is a chore. I only bought this one pan to test and I’m sorry I spent so much on it. Once you use it the beautiful copper tarnishes. It still works but the beauty is gone unless you polish it. Gonna try another brand that had a copper core but is dishwasher safe. This is a good pan. Just don’t buy it because it looks good. It won’t after you use it once.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: SENSARTE Nonstick Frying Pan Skillet, Swiss Granite Coating Omelette Pan, Healthy Stone Cookware Chef's Pan, PFOA Free (8/9.5/10/11/12.5 Inch) (9.5 Inch)

It wAs priced less than anything in this quality range", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan!', 'author': 'nadjia', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been using this pan frequently since it was delivered. It's reasonably priced so I'm considering purchasing other pieces from this line.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 9 months of use and still loving it!!', 'author': 'Ms Nouveau', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this new pan to replace one in a long line of "nonstick" pans we\'ve owned over the years. I liked the idea of there not being bolts that are difficult to clean sticking out into the cooking surface, so the hidden bolt and the many 5-star reviews led me to make this purchase. I purposefully waited several months (and forgot multiple times) to write a review of this pan so that I would have used it for more than just a week or a month before reviewing it. Our family of six has used this pan for many different kinds of foods for over nine months and we have had nothing but success with cooking or cleaning. I bought a silicone spatula to use with it, which has not scratched the inside surface at all. The only minor negative about this pan, which I was warned about, is that it does minorly scratch our glass cooktop. We have just learned to place the pan on the burner we\'re going to use for cooking and not to move it too much while cooking. If we need to replace any other pans, I will definitely purchase more in this line.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Pan', 'author': 'Sean', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am in the process of replacing all my Calphelon pans, they\'ve served me well for a decade, but the Teflon is wearing thin and they\'re not really non-stick anymore. Our first few meals have cooked quicker and better due to this pan. It was purchased at a comfortable price ($32), and it better than the pan it\'s replacing. It has a deeper bowl to the pan, meaning more food can be cooked in it, and it measures out perfectly to 10" so my Calphelon lids, which are still perfectly good, fit it perfectly, as well.We\'re looking forward to buying more Sensarte pots and pans.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Very happy with my purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy grip handle, no stick working great', 'author': 'D Faul', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Our smaller version of this pan has held up well, and we are still using it. Very nice pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Our new favorite pan - a great options for vegetable-heavy stir fries.', 'author': 'Ben B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My husband got this for me as a holiday present because I\'ve been looking for a 14" non-stick to replace our smaller 12" which was not roomy enough for our stir fries. We cook with a lot of vegetables and it\'s a pain having to fry in batches. This pan is super roomy, allowing us to fry a large amount of food without crowding the pan and steam rather than fry.I find that non-stick pans are best for stir fries, since while it is harder to get browning compared to non plastic lined pans, the browning you do get stays on the food and does not need to be deglazed off the pan and into the sauce. title: Blue Diamond Cookware Diamond Infused Ceramic Nonstick 8" Frying Pan Skillet, PFAS-Free, Dishwasher Safe, Oven Safe, Blue
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good', 'author': 'Sergej M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The Blue Diamond Cookware Diamond Infused Ceramic Nonstick 12" Frying Pan Skillet has truly been a game-changer in my kitchen. This beautiful blue skillet not only adds a pop of color but also delivers exceptional performance.From the moment I started using it, I was impressed by its nonstick surface. I could cook with minimal oil, and nothing stuck to the pan. It made cooking and cleaning up a breeze. Plus, knowing that it\'s PFAS-free gave me peace of mind, knowing that my family\'s health was a priority.What I love most about this skillet is its versatility. I could use it on the stovetop to sear meats perfectly, and it also performed flawlessly in the oven. It\'s truly an all-in-one solution for various cooking needs.The durability of the Blue Diamond Cookware skillet is another highlight. It has held up beautifully over time, showing no signs of wear and tear. And the fact that it\'s dishwasher safe makes cleanup even easier.In summary, the Blue Diamond Cookware Diamond Infused Ceramic Nonstick 12" Frying Pan Skillet has become an essential tool in my kitchen. Its performance, versatility, and durability have won me over, and I couldn\'t be happier with my purchase. If you\'re looking for a top-notch frying pan, this one is definitely worth considering.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best found so far', 'author': 'Rodney K. Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Had been buying Gothan Steel copper colored pans, but found non-stick surface started sticking after around 4 months. Always use wooden utensils when cooking.Switched to Blue Diamond and am very happy. Going on 7 months and so far non-stick surface is still working like new.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This pan is amazing!', 'author': 'Stacy Thibodeaux', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been through many pans and this one is hands down the best one on the market. The quality& design gives you cullinaty results. It’s the #1 pan on the market! It’s scratch resistant, nonstick, lightweight, oven , broiler & dishwasher safe. It’s flawless!! If you don’t own one get you one!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars After 9 months this skillet is starting to stick', 'author': 'Cathy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This skillet worked really good for the first 9 months, now it is starting to stick, Loved that it was dishwasher safe and the non stick,,, but now it sticks.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid construction. Non-stick is excellent.', 'author': 'Waldo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These pans are a good value for the price. Sturdy, thick, construction. I haven't had any problems with paint chipping, etc. Handles work well to disappate heat.The ceramic nonstick works very well. But, in my experience, the lifespan is not as long as with Teflon. But if you are trying to avoid PFAS, this is the next best thing.All ceramic nonstick I've bought (across several brands including GreenPan) all wear out in about a year (of almost daily use and hand washing). I've found cleaning with a soft sponge, not the scratchy side of a ScotchBrite or ScrubDaddy, will help prolong the life a little. But, even then, be prepared to buy new ones after 12-18 months or deal with some sticking.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Frying Pan Skillet!', 'author': 'Glen Moon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Really nice frying pan skillet! Super easy to clean, scratch resistant, no stick mess. Perfect for eggs, french toast, sandwiches, grilled cheese, etc. Perfect for a single person and single meals. Great frying pan! Hope to get another one a bit bigger for other cooking needs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan!!!!!!!', 'author': 'John C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Pan is a bargain. So slick eggs don't stick. Love the pan. Easy clean up. Real value at the price! Buy 2.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A cooking dream, but mine was apparently defective', 'author': 'West Texas', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I wanted some nice pans that would make cooking easier so I bought a set of ceramic pans, but wanted a larger pan too so I purchased this 12 inch one. I would rather it came with a glass lid, but since it didn’t I purchased that as well. Cooking on these ceramic pans is like a dream come true with nothing sticking and easy cleanup. Food slides around so easily that I can flip things like a professional chef. Somehow, breakfast tastes better when cooking in these pans. Perhaps because I’m not having to scrap it off the bottom of the pan. However...Upon receiving the pan(s) the first thing I did was season it along with my full set. It then went into the cupboard. Each pan with it’s own lid. It sat in there for a month. Although I have used all the pans in the full set I purchased, I have never used this particular pan, but please keep reading. My rules for my pans are: • Do not go above medium heat • Silicone and wooden utensils only • Hand wash only with sponge – no scouring pads - not even plastic ones • Let pans cool before washing • No nesting the pans • Season pans once a monthI season by coating the pan with oil. Place it in a 300 degree oven for two minutes. Let the pan cool and wipe out the remaining oil. I feel the little bit of time this task takes was well worth it to keep the pans non stick ceramic coating from degrading.I went so far as to post a notice on the exhaust fan above the stove listing the rules for family members. Imagine my dismay when I went to season my pans for the second time only to find a chip in the ceramic coating and gouges along the rim of this pan – even though the pan has just been sitting in the cupboard with the lid sitting on top of it. Is it possible that the lid caused the gouges? Hard to believe the pan could be so easily susceptible to damage, but there is no way the lid can cause the chip in the ceramic coating as the lid can’t touch that spot. Note that there is PLENTY of room in this cupboard so the pans are not packed in there stacked on top of each other. Is this pan really so vulnerable that it becomes damaged just sitting in the cupboard?I’ve examined my other ceramic pans and have found no damage so I’m hoping I simply received a defective 12 inch pan and have arranged to receive a replacement. Not wanting to risk potential damage on the rim of the new pan, I have also ordered a new lid with a silicone rim. It will protect the rim of the pan. This should be unnecessary as the pan should be able to tolerate putting a lid on it without causing damage. Chips in the ceramic coating is another story. We’ll see what happens.Putting aside my negative experience with this particular pan, they are all great to cook with. The only issue might be the handle. It’s metal, but it’s hollow. This allows heat to travel up the handle more quickly than a solid handle. I haven’t had any problems with the handle getting too hot as others have had, but I do notice that the closer the handle is to the pan then the hotter it is. Sure, that’s normal, but this gets hotter quicker. As I said, I have not yet hat an issue with the handle getting to hot to handle, but as a precaution I also purchased silicone handle holders that are used like pot holders. So far I’ve only used them when removing the pan from the oven after seasoning. I recommend the silicone handle holders – whatever style fits your fancy – as they provide a better, safer and less awkward grip than cloth pot holders.I love this (these) pans and am so disappointed that this one turned out not to be very durable, but hopefully the replacement will fair better.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Blue Diamond Skillet is terrific but…', 'author': 'Linda P.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought it as a used- new item to save a few bucks. What could be wrong with that? I wish I had taken a picture of this. The pan was inside a plastic bag. Still no worries. I remove the pan from the bag and what to my horror do I see? Someone had the audacity to return this pan dirty. Yes I said dirty. At first I thought no problem a little Dawn Powerwash and we are good to go. What I didn’t see was the baked on grease around the edge and handle. It needed elbow grease to get this crud off. I brought out the Pink Stuff (also an Amazon purchase) It removed the grease but also a little of the painted coating on the pans edge. Still no worries. The pan surface is fine and it truly is a no stick. I guess my only complaint is I should have paid even less for this pan considering it was dirty and more than new- used. It was USED full stop. Buyer beware. I was too stunned to call Amazon and that’s on me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice!', 'author': 'michael g. hauptly', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a lot of frying pan for the buck, I bought similarly priced pans at a store that didn't last long, they were nonstick for about 5 minutes. These however are holding up beautifully and as they say you can use metal utensils in them I have yet to scratch one. We don't use them heavily because we still like our cast iron, but for what we use these for they work fabulous. Highly recommend them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Wallace', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This product is consistent with the my previous pan purchases from Carote they are light yet distributes heat very well even on electric stoves. On gas they really rock. They are easy to clean and lids fit just right. I think for the price there is no better.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great addition', 'author': 'Jade Dragonfly', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are my observations using the CAROTE cookware:Pros: Even cooking, meaning heating up to desired temperature and staying there; attractive skillet for any kitchen; pinhole in lids to allow steam to vent; well-packaged upon delivery, foods do not seem to stick or burn easily (unlike my Anolon 12" skillet that overheats AND developed a scratch/spot that kept growing with each use. I had only been cooking in it about 2 months and always used wooden spoons) BUT...I digress.Cons: Only one handle, no secondary grip like my Anolon cookware. This was on me, because I didn\'t notice at the time of purchase; both lids of the 12" and 10" have dents in the metal rings, and you have to work them to make them fit the skillets. I don\'t know if this is by design (it almost looks that way but not sure what purpose that would serve) or maybe this is a result of production defects, etc. As I stated above, both skillets and lids were very well packaged. Now that I think of it...maybe I just don\'t know how to maneuver the lids. That is a possibility.Overall, and even with the weird lids...for me, these CAROTE skillets had more pros than cons.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent product! And 100% ethical company , responsive, easy to deal with ,and trustworthy .', 'author': 'patti austin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This company is an amazing example of trustworthiness, ethical and responsible and responsive conduct. I had purchased a pan from them and had emailed them for information about cleaning it. They further evaluated my inquiry and based on their own evaluation, decided to replace the frypan. That replacement process turned out to be complicated because of my purchase method and they hung in there every step of the way with guidance And handled everything so that I was refunded my purchase price. I will be replacing it. The pan itself is amazing and I 100% love it . It’s easy to clean, ( my eggs, hash browns, sausages, reheating leftovers, you name it!) cooks things beautifully, it’s construction is solid and very high quality and I love it. I am going to be buying another one from them in a bigger size. I can’t say enough good things about this company they went above and beyond in their dedication to customer satisfaction and pride in their products. They are amazingly easy to work with. Their pan is fantastic.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE This Pan', 'author': 'Margie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have had my pan for a bit over a week now, and I am so sorry I didn't have this many years ago. I am buying one for all of my children. It cooks evenly, is non-stick, cleans wonderfully, and it super easy to hold. I love the handle. You won't regret buying this pan.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Wtf!', 'author': 'Kariatid', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'EDIT: The Carote company reached out to me and expressed what they could do to make matters right. That, alone, impressed me. Most companies today wouldn\'t care. That,alone, impressed me. They refunded my money which made me happy. I\'m considering buying their removable handle set and investing in some plastic/silicon cooking utensils.I\'ve changed my rating. I do think the frying pan was beautiful, weighted nicely in the hand quite sturdy. I do hope I can find a solution to the staining on the side. All in all, I would say buy these but treat them with some amount of care. I wish thank the Carote company for reaching out.Namaste ppl!Where are all these great reviews coming from? I was so delighted when I recieved this frying pan but that didn\'t last long. First trial was the omelet test. Perfect, slid right out of the pan. Next was straight up fried eggs. Meh. They didn\'t slide around as the omelet. I had to use a spatula. Nothing in the description alerted the buyer that plastic/silicon were needed. As you can see from my photo after 6 uses the pan looks like it\'s been used for years. Not only that but steam from the lid slid down the outside of the pan. This happened often with my old frying pans but a little scubbing and usually came off with a bit of elbow. Not the Carote. Nope nope. Absolutely nothing worked. I use Dawn Professional and a Dobie pad. Both work extremely well on my everyday dishwasher. Truthfully, I was going to try bleach but I thought pffffft if I have use bleach the stain wasn\'t worth the effort. I often read these reviews and wonder if buyers have contacted the product company. I filed a complaint via Prime when I answered the "how was your experience with this seller?" Replied with the same information I\'ve given here. One would think the seller would have contacted me after such an unhappy customer. It\'s been more than a few days. I keep checking my Amazon messages and my account email. LOL and, yes, I\'ve checked the spam folder. Nada. Too bad for them. If I had at least an apology I might invested in some new cooking tools and purchased additional Carote cookware. I\'m still thinking about doing those things but I just don\'t know. The thing that is really holding me back is the stain on the out side. New kitchen implements won\'t have any effect that. It\'s a shame because cookware is quite lovely. If there are any changes to this review I will add an addendum to the post.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A**kicking skillet', 'author': 'Skosh', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have been cooking with this for 8 months..one use is I make myself a morning omelet, many different types, cheese in each one with no oil added...and then I eat it right out of this skillet with a metal spoon...after 8 months it still looks as clean and like its new...no scratches..and what really surprises me is the bottom of the skillet looks brand new..no stains, burns or discoloration...its heavy duty and well made...the lid is also heavy duty and well made...well worth every penny I spent on it. I have cooked a lot of different items in the skillet and so far every one has just wiped clean with a paper towel..wash it about once a week...doesn't really need it but old habits die hard...go ahead, buy one or two....", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A good set of non-stick pans.', 'author': 'John B. Young', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It was time to replace an aging set of three "Teflon" surfaced frying pans that were exhibiting wear and some food adhesion occurrences. title: Farberware Glide Deep Nonstick Frying Pan / Fry Pan / Skillet with Helper Handle - 12.5 Inch, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cooks evenly great non-stick', 'author': 'feedback', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have this product about 2 weeks I'll use it almost everyday nothing sticks and it's easy to clean stays bright and shiny like new", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Buy Farberware pots and pans and you will have them for a lifetime!', 'author': 'JW Ricker', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Farberware brand has been synonymous in our family for as long as I can remember.
