title: CAROTE 12Inch Nonstick Deep Frying Pan with Lid, 5.5 Qt Jumbo Cooker Saute Pan with Pour Spout, Skillet Induction Cookware, Non Stick Cooking Pan PFOA Free, Classic Granite
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Non-Stick. Easy to Clean', 'author': 'J. Uy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The CAROTE 12.5 Inch Nonstick Deep Frying Pan Skillet with Lid is a versatile and durable frying pan that is perfect for a variety of cooking tasks. The pan is made from high-quality aluminum with a non-stick coating that is free of PFOA and PTFE, making it safe for your health.The pan has a large 12.5-inch diameter, making it ideal for frying, searing, or sauteing large batches of food. The deep sides make it also suitable for frying chicken or fish, or making sauces and soups.The pan heats up evenly and quickly, thanks to the aluminum construction. The non-stick coating also helps to prevent food from sticking to the pan, making it easy to clean. The pan comes with a tempered glass lid, which helps to keep food moist while cooking.Overall, the CAROTE 12.5 Inch Nonstick Deep Frying Pan Skillet with Lid is a great value for the price. It is a versatile and durable pan that is perfect for a variety of cooking tasks.What I like the most is the cleaning process. This is by far the easiest cookware to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Non-stick Saute Pan', 'author': 'Susan Mulley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This Non-stick Saute Pan is great for cooking large batches of everything. I love that it has a vented lid and not one but, two pour spouts. This makes it so much easier to pour from the pan. The non-stick surface is very easy to clean. You can really reduce the amount of oil you use because the non-stick surface is so good. It heats quickly and evenly. This is a very heavy duty pan. It is a bit heavy but, the comfortable wooden handle makes it easy to hold.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Large, non-stick that literally doesn't stick", 'author': 'AmazonWoman', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I could not be happier with this pan! I scrambled 8 eggs with plenty of room to maneuver without any spill over, and the residue just rinsed off with a spray of water, wow! I did use a little bit of butter, but other pans I've used would have stuck on egg residue and this one definitely did not. It has the capacity to brown 2 lb of meat along with a couple of onions with plenty of room to spare. Great pan to cook full meals for my family of four, including two growth-spurting pre-teens. We have an electric stove with glass cooktop and have had no issues with this pan.Stop looking and buy it :)-----I put in an update to this review that was not posted, not sure why. Recap, I had used this pan daily for maybe a month before the non-stick coating was chipped and started rusting underneath that spot. It was small but I knew it wasn't going to get any better from there, and I was able to return it to Amazon.---Well, in part 3 of the pan saga, I have been on the hunt for a similarly awesome pan since returning this one. Found a very similar one by another brand that seems a bit heavier and may be more sturdy, but too small. This pan is the one to which all others are now compared- I didn't know the extra inch of width and the higher sides were missing until I tried them, but they mean the difference between a great pan sauce soaking into al dente pasta as it thickens... and having food flinging about the stove as you're trying to hustle up a weeknight meal in the chaos that is life.As I have not been able to find one as big, I'm at the point of ordering a second one of these in hopes there's more longevity with it, because I really, really want to love this pan 4life.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 5 out of 5', 'author': 'Kelsey Myers', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Doesn’t heat up as fast as my last set but they do disperse the heat seemingly even, which is a huge plus! Especially with eggs and ground beef, I can step away for a moment to deal with the littles and it won’t burn or stick to the bottom, the nonstick is amazing. Another fantastic thing about the nonstick is that dried food comes right off. A little bit of soap and the green side of a sponge, makes me feel like a luxury queen with how EASY they are to clean. Pop it in the dishwasher afterwards 🤌🏼 the size varieties are well thought out also and easy to cook a large meal for my family.They are pretty, aesthetically pleasing with the wood handle and stone like design, bringing a calm mood to the room and while cooking. A perfect addition to your kitchen.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect non stick deep frying pan.', 'author': 'Lorraine Fleury', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great quality. The granite surface does not scratch off. Somebody complained that it was too large. But it was advertised as a deep non stick frying pan. It is large enough for stews or even a small chicken. Cleans up great. I am super pleased.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent non-stick, but heavy, fussy to maintain', 'author': 'Janice Geiger', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Functionally, this pan is great. It heats up relatively fast despite not being able to use high heat, cooks food great, very versatile, it\'s truly, I mean truly, non-stick, and it\'s such a dream to clean.That being said, I can only give it 4 stars because:- It\'s kinda heavy. Not crazy heavy, just uncomfortable to hold for very long with one hand. Because of the weight, the handle started getting lose relatively quickly and had to be tightened.- I feel I have to be paranoid about not letting it get scratched and ruining that wonderful non-stick coating. Silicone utensils only. No high heat. Clean with soft sponge only instead of my usual dish wand (yes, even though the dish wand scrubber says non-stick safe, over a long period of time, it\'s not). I wash it asap and don\'t let it sit in the sink, because family members will inevitably throw metal utensils or other dishes inside it and scratch it. Can\'t nest any other cooking pans inside it for the same reason, so it takes up a lot of space in my cupboard.If you don\'t want a fussy-to-maintain pan, it\'s not technically the fault of the pan, but people should be aware. I was really hesitant to buy this because of the negative reviews and pictures, and honestly, most of those problems are probably due to poor maintenance, like all the "dos and don\'ts" I mentioned above.If you treat it right, it\'s fine. And even though it\'s a little annoying to be that fussy about a pan, overall I still feel like it\'s worth it and would buy this again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pan I have ever bought-- bar none.', 'author': 'Joe M. from LA', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am 85 years old now, and over the years I have bought about 100 pots and pans. During the last 10 years I purchased over a dozen so-called "Non-Stick" pans some of which were advertised on TV. Within a few months to 1 year all of these Non-Stick Pans purchases were burned & stained heavily with grease and were no longer Non-Stick at all. I have disposed of about 11 of them. I only kept one for toasting one side of a bagel- it is good for little else. I eventually came to the conclusion that non-stick pans were far from perfected. Then in browsing through pots & pans (in Amazon) I came upon one 12inch pan that was written to be made of "granite stone" whatever that meant. Now, the word "granite" struck me, since I have a Brazilian granite kitchen Countertop that even after 15 years of daily use, it still looks like the day it was delivered-- perfectly smooth, glistening and unbreakable. My other definite memory of granite relates to a trip, I had made as a visiting professor to The University Hospital of Padua, Italy, some 30+ years ago. At this Hospital the Head of The Hospital, took me on a tour to experience many interesting exhibits of ancient wonders, since this Hospital was founded some 400 years ago, around the time of Leonardo Da Vinci. Leonardo was the most important figure to herald in "The Renaissance". He was one of the first to perform autopsies, in order to learn human anatomy, for his works of art that included the human figure. Anyway, the Head Doctor of Padua Hospital took me to a room which he explained to me, was the very first autopsy table, which was made of granite, and was over 400 years old. He also explained to me that Padua Hospital, was the home of the first autopsies, ever performed in modern Western Civilization. I was amazed by the fact that The table was still absolutely pristine in terms of its appearance of the granite slab, even though several thousand autopsies were performed on this historic table. For the above reasons I decided to take my chances one more time on a "Non-Stick Pan" despite my many prior disappointments. I received this pan about 3 months ago, and have used it many times since, to make recipes such as: Sicilian Pasta Tomato Sauce (2-3 hours of cooking time); Pork Chops cooked in 50/50 Milk & Cream Bologonaise style (2 hours); Wor Wonton Soups (Cantonese Style); Sirloin & Rib-Eye Steaks, perfectly braised & fried; and 3 inch high omelettes that slide right out of the pan after using only 1 to 2 tablespoons of olive and/or avocado oil. The pan still looks completely like the day I took it out of its box. I also love the 12 inch beautifully made glass cover. It also displays a long, pretty pan handle on one side, and a much shorter handle on the opposite side, that lets you easily pick up or turn the pan without need for gloves. I also love the two side spout-like bends in the pot with which to enable you to pour out its remaining contents more easily without spillage. Also impressive is its 5.5 quart size excellent for making sauces and soups and the nice height of the pan, preventing splatter. Yes, I truly and wholeheartedly recommend buying this pan with a few words of caution related to the following: when I read a small minority of the buyer reviews, I was concerned by the fact that several of these purchasers were most unhappy with the burning of the granite even with some flaking described of the granite-stone lining itself. The question I asked myself-- why did I not corroborate these nasty findings. This did not happen, for example when I cooked using high heat to sear & cook several steaks in 1-2 tbl. of oil. I have come up with a probable explanation. Even though it is described as granite-stone I do not believe it is the actual Granite Stone of which our kitchen countertops are made of, but probably, a composite of granite chips pressed together using many tons of pressure when manufacturing the pan (refer to Non-Stick Pan Manufacturing Processes on "You Tube" to understand this better). If this supposition is correct, then it is likely, that this pan\'s granite material has a certain heat tolerance beyond which it may actually burn and breakdown. Recently my 20 year old electric stove-top broke down by getting extremely hot and even burned perfectly good stainless steel pots. A few weeks before I bought the above pan, I purchased (from Amazon again) a new electric stove-top that shuts off if a heat- element, if it gets too hot after removing the old stove-top The new electric stove top is definitely superior to the old one I got rid, which likely goes back to past times when such top were in their early infancy to childhood phases of development. Many years later many improvements must have been made. So for those of you that had this pan burn and flake on you-- you should consider that perhaps your stove top is getting to 600 to 700 (too hot) or more degrees, rather that a much safer 500 degrees and below. I sincerely hope that your stove top is compatible with this pan, should you decide to purchase it, based upon this review.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan!', 'author': 'Tucker T', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking for an oversized pan for my new induction range and this turned out to be exactly what I wanted! Super large, high sides, holds a ton of chicken and dumplings, a family favorite. No stick, cleans nicely! Highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great company!', 'author': 'Katie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my second pan from this company, and I use both a couple of times every week. They cook well and are so easy to clean. I had a question, and the company got right back to me. Amazing to get such good customer service these days! I love these pans and will definitely order again. They look great on my stovetop in addition to working well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE IT', 'author': "Steffi's", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I would give this 100 stars if I could. Nothing sticks even with minimal oil used. Cleans out super easy with hot water and a drop of soap. Planning to buy whole set. Definitely recommend!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: T-fal Ultimate Hard Anodized Nonstick Fry Pan 12 Inch Oven Safe 400F, Lid Safe 350F Cookware, Pots and Pans, Dishwasher Safe Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Nonstick Fry Pan for Everyday Cooking', 'author': 'Eric', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Extremely satisfied with my purchase. This fry pan has quickly become a staple in my kitchen, and I would recommend it to anyone.Pros:- Perfectly nonstick: The nonstick coating on this pan is truly impressive. I've cooked various dishes, from eggs to stir-fries, and nothing sticks to the surface. This makes cooking and cleaning a breeze.- Heats up quickly: The hard-anodized aluminum construction of the pan ensures that it heats up quickly and evenly. This feature has significantly reduced my cooking time and ensures that my food is cooked uniformly.- Durable and long-lasting: The pan's hard-anodized exterior provides a strong protective layer, making it resistant to scratches and other signs of wear. I am confident that this pan will last me for years to come.Cons:- None so far: I have not encountered any issues with this fry pan, and I am thoroughly satisfied with its performance.In conclusion, the T-fal Ultimate Hard Anodized Nonstick Fry Pan has exceeded my expectations. Its nonstick surface, quick heating, and durability make it a valuable addition to my kitchen. I highly recommend this fry pan to anyone in search of a reliable and efficient nonstick pan for everyday cooking.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works Great -- Easy To Use & Clean', 'author': 'Kort', 'rating': 5, 'content': "T-Fal Ultimate Hard Anodized Nonstick Fry Pan came well packaged in large box. The pan is beautiful! It's solid and substantial but not too heavy. The coated surface is typical of a Teflon pan but it has ridges on the bottom for more even heating. I tried it and fried some meatballs and onions. The pan takes a few minutes to warm up but then it does an excellent job cooking everything evenly. Nothing sticks to the surface (yet). The handle is a comfortable rubber like grip that stays cool while the pan is in use.It's also easy to clean. You do have to cure the pan before use by heating the pan up on low and wiping it with vegetable oil. Repeat after 10 cycles in the dishwasher. I'm not going to be putting mine in the dishwasher. It's easy enough to clean with a sponge and detergent in the sink.Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase.~ Kort", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works like a charm', 'author': 'Megan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is our new favorite pan! It's very well made and very nonstick. Evenly distributes heat, is a great size for anything from grilled cheese to sauce making- I love the higher sides. Cleans up easily.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love this pan', 'author': 'AintSheSweet', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is an amazing pan. Non stick, heats up fast and very easy to clean. I bought a large size and will be replacing my smaller pans with this brand.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great pan, but warping and handle are a big drawback.', 'author': 'Scott Mayle', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The pan was never actually even. From the first time it was heated (on medium heat) the pan warped so liquids always run off to sides. So hard to cook evenly when butter or oil is all around the edge and dry in the middle.Also after about 9 months with normal use the handle is loose with no way of tightening it.The pan is however very easy to clean and has maintained it's non-stickyness for the last 11 months.For the price it's a good value for something you know you will replace with something better down the line.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Durable Easy-to-Clean Pan', 'author': 'Hot Dog', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My regular pan has held up well. No coating removal or damage. Best pan, by far, I have ever owned. Strongly recommend this pan. Heat not even but using on small electric burner, so that may be to blame. Considered giving as Christmas gift to mother.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Decent Product', 'author': 'J. Allen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought one of these 12" skillets a couple of months ago. I was delivered within 2 days (I\'m a Prime member) and it arrived safely packed and undamaged. It comes with a very nice vented, clear glass lid. The construction is very solid - it feels well-made and a little heavy. The material it\'s built from (Titanium) appears to be excellent - no more worrying about flaking Teflon. I did a lot of research on no-stick skillets and this brand (company) often made it into the top 10, so I thought I\'d try it out. The price is excellent considering what you get.I usually cook on high heat and so far, have had no issues (no warping, charring, distortions, etc.) with this skillet. I mainly cook omelets but have also cooked chicken breasts and steaks. I usually cook with Canola or Olive oil and sometimes Coconut oil. Some people have claimed that you don\'t need any oil or anything to prevent sticking when using these. I experimented with cooking eggs with no oil and it was nearly a disaster - the eggs stuck for the most part (not too badly though). I don\'t cooking without some sort of oil to prevent sticking.My biggest complaint is the bottom of the skillet. I have a gas range and unfortunately, the bottom of the skillet is extremely slippery. On a few occasions the skillet nearly slipped off the stove. I got used to it and was more careful and to date, have had no accidents (keep the little ones away from this when it\'s used for cooking). The other thing about the red dot in the center (inside the pan) glowing red when it\'s ready... meh. I haven\'t noticed it glowing. None of these issues really lowers my rating on this product. I recommend it. We\'ll see how it holds up over the years.Also, I just bought a second one recently because it\'s a solid product and I couldn\'t stand my awful Rachel Ray Teflon skillets anymore.I hope this is helpful.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for cooking Chinese dishes!', 'author': 'Michelle Tan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I use it to cook Chinese dishes. It is wide enough when stirring and not flipping foods on the stovetop. If you want to cook Chinese dishes, it is the One to try.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The little red heat indicator is much more helpful than I expected!', 'author': 'Sean Lambert', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I heard that these pans were a great value and were designed for searing. Older non-stick technology always warned against high heat, but I frequently use high heat which probably led to the eventual failure of the non-stick coating in my older pans. This pan also says it is dishwasher and metal utensil safe, neither of which were recommended for my older pans. I'm still not going to use metal utensils; I've been fine without them for over 30 years.The cooking performance of this pan (on a gas stove) is fantastic, and I've cooked some amazing steaks in it with effortless cleanup. The red heat indicator that I initially dismissed as gimmicky turns out to be really handy, especially when cooking pancakes.I generally prefer the look and feel of a steel handle, but the synthetic handle on this pan is comfortable and lightweight, and the lid's handle stays much cooler than the metal ones on my other lids.This pan is at least as good as my other much more expensive new pans and is _way_ better than my older technology pans were when they were new.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So easy to cook on', 'author': 'Chimere M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a really good pan. It's definitely non stick and so easy to cook on. It's my favorite pan! I had it for 7 months so far. I wish they would make a wok style pan like this", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Cuisinart MultiClad Pro 8" Open Skillet, 8-Inch, Stainless Steel
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Always great manufacturer!', 'author': 'Gwen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Heavy, sturdy, nonstick, pretty!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great little frying pan', 'author': 'Barb H', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought one of these pans on October 3, and liked it so well that I bought another one 3 weeks later. This size is perfect for single servings. Now my husband and I each have one to cook our individual breakfasts in. I like the shiny surface inside the pan. I considered buying a non-stick frying pan, but I wanted to try this one. I'm glad I didn't go for the extra expense of non-toxic non-stick, because this pan does so well with cleaning up. I think the price is very good for the quality of the pan. I don't often write reviews but I am enjoying using these little Cuisinart frying pans so much that I thought I'd share my thoughts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this skillet!', 'author': 'Julie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I researched stainless steel cookware for quite awhile and decided to try the Cuisinart Multiclad. It was the highest quality that I could get for a reasonable price. I tried this skillet and loved it. As long as I use a little oil when frying things, like eggs, it worked beautifully. Did not stick and was easy to clean. The cookware itself is very nice looking too. I ended up buying an entire set.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great quality', 'author': 'mel', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'But sticks.. like you’ll have to follow the instructions on how to use stainless steel pots and pans', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it.', 'author': 'Jan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great pan for my glasstop stove. It cooks very evenly. Love it and plan to order it in more sizes.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 8" Perfection Pan for Ease of Cooking, Frying and Sauteing', 'author': 'KURLYLOX', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This pan looks and acts like jewelry. I would have taken a pic for you but I am unable to at this time.There is a polished edge at the top and a brushed finished 3/4 way down. Also, there is a curve insidewhich distributes the heat evenly. We have many Cuisinart products in our home. We decided to replace the 8" with the coating on the inside for this pan because I prefer to add this to my dishwasher rather than hand-washing. The pan cooks at a lower temp; therefore a better textured omelet as well no burnt onions, mushrooms,etc. which until today, was my Husband"s MO! He read the insert and now will abide by Cuisinart\'s suggestion. He burns the sides of pots because he turns the gas burner on high. I would put a stamp of approval on the Multi-Clad Pro line of pans. Try the 8" and you will discover the reason you should update your pans for yourself.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works as well as the other "C" brand pans', 'author': 'T. S. Ferguson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have a set of Calphalon and All-Clad pots and pans that were given to me as part of a wedding present set. We have owned that set for over 10 years now. However, the one thing that set didn't come with was a small frying pan. When I finally decided to add the small pan to the collection, I was stunned as to how expensive it was! Considering how much a complete set of pots and pans cost, I couldn't understand how a single add-on pan could be so expensive. I guess that is how they get you to spend all that $$.Anyway, I was looking for an alternative pan that cost less. I found the Cuisinart pan and saw that it had good reviews. It was also fairly inexpensive, compared to the All-Clad pan. I have now been cooking with it for about two weeks, and I love it! I find very little difference cooking with it compared to my other pans. It heats quickly and evenly and cleans up great. My daycare provider accidentally over-cooked oil in the pan and it turned all brown and hard. I sprayed some oven cleaner on it and sat it in the sun for about 20 minutes, and the pan looks like new.The only area I find a very, very slight difference is at high temperatures. It doesn't seem to handle them quite as well--maybe it is that it ends up getting too hot compared to the All-Clad set, but it is probably because I am just so used to the other set. I figure that is more an adjustment that I need to make, so the pan itself still gets 5 stars.I would gladly buy a complete set of Cuisinart pans and I will have no problem filling in other pieces with Cuisinart. I highly recommend this pan!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 20, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not so non-stick.', 'author': 'JAM', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'We like everything about the pan provided we are willing to use extra olive oil to Sautee.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars These pans destroy eggs', 'author': 'David M. Powers', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I originally purchased 4 of these (one was included in a multiple pan set). I have done nothing but struggle with them and I\'ve lost count on how many eggs they have ruined. I admit that when I got them, I used a spray olive oil on them because I had NO IDEA that this would cause a problem. I\'ve used spray oils on my pans without an issue since spray oils became a thing. My bad. So I followed Cuisnart\'s instructions on cleaning them after using a spray oil (white vinegar/baking soda treatments and Barkeepers Friend). I\'ve scrubbed and scrubbed them. They continue to destroy fried eggs. These things are incredibly finicky to cook with. You must follow specific heating instructions to have any hope that they will work: Heat on medium high, do the water drop test, if the water drop test passes treat only with a high temp oil (from a bottle NOT a spray!) If you don\'t do it just exactly right, they fail. So I figured by having used a spray oil on the original 4 I had wrecked them. So I went a bought a 5th one, brand new. Never had any spray oil applied to it. Followed the strict procedure for heating and oiled with grapeseed oil. Same result! I\'m going to have to go find and buy different pans, these aren\'t working. They work OK for other things, but I specifically use these ones (the 8") for frying eggs and making omelettes. Very disappointing and in no way useable for what I bought them.Hey, Cuisinart! Maybe you could put on the front of the box that the pans come in a warning about not using spray oils on them in big bright letters. That might be helpful.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality', 'author': 'KateM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this skillet because of the high rating and the many good reviews, and have to say it is performing very well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Lodge 10.25 Inch Cast Iron Pre-Seasoned Skillet – Signature Teardrop Handle - Use in the Oven, on the Stove, on the Grill, or Over a Campfire, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic skillets perfect for serving individual portions of brownies', 'author': 'JSS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fantastic skillets perfect for serving individual portions of brownies, cornbread, or anything you can dream up! Love the affordability and quality of these made-in-the-USA Lodge brand pans, especially when ordering a set of them! Well worth the cost and highly recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Five Stars', 'author': 'Sully  G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Good as expected. I've used them before.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Timeless classic for the modern kitchen', 'author': 'Joe Bob', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Sorry for the long review - for the short review, count the stars!I\'m a bit of a purist. I always season my cast iron - new, or used (hey, I don\'t know WHAT someone else used that old piece of cast iron for - maybe cleaning auto parts). I sand it down to bare metal, starting with about an 80 grit and finishing with 200.Then I season. The end result is a glossy black mirror that puts Teflon to shame. There are two mistakes people make when seasoning - not hot enough, not long enough. These mistakes give the same result - a sticky brown coating that is definitely not non-stick, and the first time they bring any real heat to the pan, clouds of smoke that they neither expected or wanted. I see several complaints here that are completely due to not knowing this.But there were a few pieces I needed (yes, needed, cast iron isn\'t about want, it\'s a need), and this was one of them, so I thought I\'d give the Lodge pre-seasoning a try. Ordered last Friday, received this Friday - free shipping, yay!The first thing I noticed was the bumpy coating. The inside is actually rougher than the outside, and my hand was itching for the sandpaper, but that would have defeated the experiment. This time, I was going to give the Lodge pre-seasoning a chance before I broke out the sandpaper. So I scrubbed the pan out with a plastic brush and a little soapy water, rinsed well, put it on a medium burner, and waited. Cast iron tip number one - give it a little time. Then give it a little more time. Cast iron conducts heat much more slowly than aluminum, so you have to have a little patience.Then I threw in a pat of butter, and brought out the natural enemy of badly seasoned cast iron - the egg. And, sure enough, it stuck - but not badly, just in the middle. A bit of spatula work and I actually got a passable over-medium egg. Hmmm. But still not good enough. So I cleaned up the pan, and broke out the lard.I have only one justification for using lard. I don\'t remember Grandma using refined hand-pressed organic flax oil, or purified extra-virgin olive oil made by real virgins. Nope, it was pretty much animal fat in her iron. A scoop of bacon grease from the mason jar beside the stove and she was ready to cook anything. Grandaddy wouldn\'t eat a piece of meat that had less than a half-inch of fat around it. "Tastes like a dry old shoe.", he\'d declare if it was too lean. In the end, I\'m sure their diet killed them, but they ate well in the meantime. Grandaddy was cut down at the tender age of 96, and Grandma lasted till 98. Eat what you want folks - in the end, it\'s pretty much up to your genetics.So I warmed up my new pieces, and smeared a very thin layer of lard all over them - use your fingers. Towels, especially paper towels, will shed lint, and lint in your seasoning coat doesn\'t help things at all. Besides, it\'s kinda fun.Here\'s cast iron tip number two - season at the highest temp you think you\'ll ever cook at - or higher. If you don\'t, you won\'t get the full non-stick thing, and the first time you bring it up to that temp you\'ll get clouds of smoke from the unfinished seasoning. I put my pieces in a cold oven, and set the temp for an hour at 500 degrees (F, not C). Yeah, I know, Lodge says 350. Lodge doesn\'t want panicked support calls from people whose house is full of smoke. Crank the heat up.You have two choices here. You can put a fan in the kitchen window and blow smoke out of your house like the battleship Bismarck under attack by the Royal Navy, or invest in an oxygen mask. You will get smoke. You will get lots of smoke, especially if you\'re doing several pieces at once, like I just did. This is a good thing - that\'s smoke that won\'t be jumping out to surprise you the first time you try to cook with any real heat. The goal is to heat until you don\'t get smoke, and in my experience, 500 degrees for an hour does that pretty well.Let the pieces cool in the closed oven. Then re-grease and repeat. And repeat again. And don\'t glop the fat on. Just enough to coat. More thin layers are better than fewer gloppy layers. I managed four layers last night without my neighbors calling the fire department.Seems like a lot of work? Look at it this way. It\'s a lifetime commitment. Treat your iron well, and it will love you right back like you\'ve never been loved before. And this is pretty much a one-time deal, unless you do something silly.The end result of my all-night smoking up the kitchen exercise? Dry, absolutely no stickiness, black as a coal mine at midnight and shiny - but still bumpy - could it possibly work with that rough surface?I put the skillet back on a medium burner, put a pat of butter on and tossed in a couple of eggs. After the whites had set a little, I nudged them with a spatula, and they scooted across the pan. I\'ll be... it works. My wife came back from the store and wanted scrambled eggs. If there\'s anything that cast iron likes less than fried eggs, it\'s scrambled. But it was the same thing all over again. No stick. No cleanup. Just a quick hot water rinse with a brush in case something got left on the pan (I couldn\'t see anything, but hey), then I put it on a med-hi burner till dry, put a thin coat of lard on the pan and waited until I saw smoke for a minute. Let cool and hang up. Done.So. do I like the bumpy texture of the Lodge pre-season? Nope. Does it work? Yes, and contrary to my misgivings, it works very well. My wife pointed out that even some Teflon cookware has textured patterns in it. The Lodge pre-season isn\'t a perfect surface out of the box - but it does give you a big head-start. After a night\'s work, my iron is ready to face anything, and you just can\'t beat that.Lodge makes a great product. For the quality, durability, and versatility, you can\'t beat Lodge cast iron. Plus, it\'s made in America. I like that. If you\'ve never experienced cast iron cooking, you\'ve just been cheating yourself. Plus, the price, for a piece of lifetime cookware, is insanely cheap.And my sandpaper is still on the tool shelf.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2007', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just the Right Size', 'author': 'Linda B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the perfect size for eggs, potatoes, bacon, etc. easy clean up and very little seasoning needed. Would definitely order again. Will be getting a few more pieces.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Skillet', 'author': 'PhillieBaby', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Cooks really well. Well made and should last a life time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Used once then gave it away', 'author': 'Cloud9', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I was excited to try a new way of cooking after using Teflon and Stainless Steel pans for years. I'm health conscious, but a little lazy, and after reading many reviews thought this pan would solve the problem of eating off of potentially hazardous Teflon or sticky Stainless Steel. I used the pan to cook eggs and ham. I used coconut oil to cook with. The eggs stuck worse than my stainless steel pans. I know eggs are tough but I make them often so that is the test. The pan is pre-seasoned but that didn't seam to make a difference. It also seemed to me that some of the seasoning came off into my food. I hope it was safe. I cleaned with water and salt and it looked like the seasoning was coming off as the bottom of the pan was getting lighter than the rest of the pan.I searched the internet on the topic of cast iron and after reading many articles came to the conclusion that the problem with this pan is that it has a rough surface. I learned that the iron pans from the past and some current manufacturers use a different manufacturing process that produces a smooth surface which is much easier to clean and the food actually does slide out after proper seasoning. If you want a cheap pan it works but in my opinion is not worth the work to season and clean it if the food is going to stick anyway.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Horrible defective pans', 'author': 'Sheena', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I ordered a 9in cast iron pan. I own several cast iron pans but I don't have the 9 in one yet which would be perfect for making corn bread. So I ordered one from here, big mistake! It arrived in a timely manner how ever it seemed rather light n weight and upon further inspection I noticed rust spots that were eating into the pan! These pans are rough on the surface like they weren't finished properly. In my opinion these are defective pans loge wouldn't sell so amazon is.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Five Stars', 'author': 'redlips', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect for one person,,,,LOVE it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Useful', 'author': 'Gordon K. Niedan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Useful', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Skillett', 'author': 'MS2005', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So far this is a great skillet. Have cooked with it and it has even heat and does well in the oven. Would buy again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2010', 'is_verified': True}]

title: ESLITE LIFE 8 Inch Nonstick Skillet Frying Pan Egg Omelette Pan, Healthy Granite Coating Cookware Compatible with All Stovetops (Gas, Electric & Induction), PFOA Free
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan, great price', 'author': 'Kathy Wilcox', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I liked the looks of these pans (especially the wooden handle). I bought one a couple of years ago. Nothing sticks to it and it is easy cleanup. I liked it so much, I bought a small one for my daughter-in-law, who has all the big name brand pots and pans. She loved it. She told me she may buy a bigger one. I asked her to let me get her a set for her birthday. so I bought this one. She will love it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use, easy to clean', 'author': 'Tom', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Being a widower, my cooking needs are small. This fry pan is just what I was looking for. It's well made. Looks to be long lasting. I can fry small steaks instead of broiling and the same for fish. It really shines as an omelet cooker. The cover helps control splatter and holds heat where it belongs. The bottom is thick so it takes a bit to warm up and on the flip side, it cools off slowly- I like that as I can better control the last few minutes of cooking. It's dream when it comes to clean up time. I just wipe up any grease with a paper towel, splash a bit of detergent, and add hot water. I usually can clean it with just my fingers. Rinse and dry and it's ready to go again. I'd give it more than five stars if I could.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect omelette pan perfect. Perfect!!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I make my husband an omelette every morning. The pan I had been using for years, was scraped up and not doing the trick. I invested in this pan and I could not believe the quality. I don’t believe you even need any Pam spray when cooking with it. It is the perfect size for an omelette. And it wipes clean without any sticking whatsoever. Looks like it’s ready to use right after you slide the eggs off. Top quality I recommend to anyone I would like to have a whole set of these pans. And it’s a good looking pan as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent, versatile pans', 'author': 'Issendai', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like these pans so much that after I tried one, I bought two more in different sizes, and when one finally became too scratched to use, I bought an exact replacement.The deep saucepan is exceptionally useful. It’s great for making recipes where you start by frying something in a pan, then add more ingredients until you have a soup or chili. The bottom is the size of a normal saucepan, giving you plenty of room to cook—so much better than trying to fry in a soup pot—and the sides are more than high enough to hold a soup recipe. It’s an unusual size of pan in the US, but after trying it, I’m surprised that it’s not more common.The non-stick surface is excellent. The one drawback is that it discolors after a while, developing a brownish stain from either heat or food, I’m not sure which. In my experience this is common with all pans, and it’s purely cosmetic. Don’t let it discourage you from buying these excellent pans. But maybe choose the black ones, not the white ones.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Smaller than expected', 'author': 'Lolita Wike', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Still works great for eggs or one piece of French toast or one grilled sandwich. Love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Best set of pans I've ever owned!", 'author': 'Kristie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My husband picked these out because it looked like a good set and having lids for all the pans was important to him. We both love them. No issues with food sticking to them and clean up is a breeze.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars style and nonsticking', 'author': 'nancy  Scargall', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Have used this skillet for a while now. Love it! Non stick, cooks well, and easy to clean!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars LOVE this pan!', 'author': '45thParallel', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Don't hesitate to buy this cookware. Probably one of the best purchases I've made in recent years. I use this pan constantly and just bought a 2nd one. So why the 4 stars? I'm replacing the original pan after 2 years of almost daily use because there's a spot where the coating is missing inside the pan. I'm suspecting that the cause is using nylon utensils. I've never used metal anything in this pan. It's never been harshly scrubbed or left to soak for a long time in the sink. Yet it developed scratches and finally lost some skin. So, while I highly recommend Eslite Life cookware to anyone considering it - don't use anything but silicone utensils in it. The vendor really needs to make that suggestion more prominent. Nylon utensils are not that great anyway but this pan is awesome. Cooks even and does an excellent job at anything that doesn't need high heat. I have the whole set but the rest don't get used nearly as often. Armed with silicone utensils, I'll see if it remains scratch free. Not that I mind them, it still works like a charm... it's the not wanting to eat any type of non-stick coating I worry about. I love this pan so much I'd replace it again in a couple of years if it develops this much scratching again. but at least I'll know it isn't the utensils to blame.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars so far it's working well", 'author': 'STANLEY STARR', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'had to toss 2 older 8" granite stone pans because they got a bit scratched up and food was sticking in the middle. used this a few times and only the first time when i did not use any cooking spray, did my eggs stick. when using a little spray, nothing sticks. what i am afraid to do now is flips because i feel the pan wall is a bit high.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: OXO Good Grips 8" Frying Pan Skillet, 3-Layered German Engineered Nonstick Coating, Stainless Steel Handle with Nonslip Silicone, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great everyday pan', 'author': 'Derek', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is honestly my favorite/go to pan for regular everyday things. I’m a big fan of smaller 8” pans rather than large 12” or 10” (unless you’re making something that requires the larger pan or are making a lot of something) but when you’re cooking for just you and your partner or just yourself, this is better tbh. It’s non stick, and the coating is great and durable. The pan itself is made well, with it being thick and heavy. It’s gotta nice rubber-type handle for good grip and it didn’t get hot when cooking. You can also put it in the oven up to a certain temperature, so it’s good for finishing off things. It’s easy to clean as well. And though it’s simple, it also looks nice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Best skillet I've ever owned", 'author': 'BJR', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This skillet truly is non-stick, unlike some other pans I've had that were supposed to be non-stick. Makes great omelets and they slide off the pan effortlessly. Easy to clean.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My daily workhorse', 'author': 'Fitness Celebrity', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pan gets used almost every day and is my favorite skillet. It's small but I can cook my morning eggs or a grilled cheese sandwich in it easily. The handle is comfortable and the coating will last if you are very careful, don't use metal utensils, and don't put it through the dishwasher.OXO has become a favorite brand for me, because their stuff is not expensive but gives great performance and value for money. I have lots of their plastic spatulas and kitchen tools and they all work beautifully. I expect this pan to last for at least three years. If you buy one of the more expensive non-stick pans, you will not get appreiably more life, but will have spent too much. Oxo's pans are not built for the long haul, especially if you use it as much as I do, but it won't owe you anything when it's finally time to replace it with another.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best nonstick pan', 'author': 'Sam', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The OXO Good Grips 10" Frying Pan Skillet has truly impressed me in the kitchen. It\'s like magic how easily food glides across the pan. Cooking an egg? No problem. It effortlessly slides off, leaving no residue behind.Cleaning up after cooking is an absolute breeze. A quick wash, and it\'s ready to go again. The combination of its non-stick prowess and easy cleanup has turned cooking into a delight rather than a chore.In conclusion, the OXO Good Grips 10" Frying Pan Skillet has earned its spot as a staple in my kitchen. Its ideal size, exceptional non-stick surface, and effortless cleaning make it a standout choice for any home cook.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Even heat', 'author': 'BadKharma', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This pan works very well, it heats evenly and food doesn’t stick to the nonstick coating.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to Clean', 'author': 'Jeremy Nelson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought the pan because when cooking marinated chicken in old pan the marinade would burn and stick to the bottom making it very difficult to wash pan. Have only had the new Oxo pan for two weeks, but it cooks the chicken well and is very easy to wash afterwards.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value for a non-stick pan', 'author': 'Gonza B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great value for a non-stick pan. Will update the review if something happens to the coating.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So Far - So Good', 'author': 'Kemo Sabe', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Bought two of these in order to cook two veggie omelets simultaneously. title: Cuisinart Chef's Classic Stainless Nonstick 8-Inch Open Skillet
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The First Time', 'author': 'Graham K. Glover', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The first time is always awkward. You fumble, you don't know how it will go, but you laugh and you have fun! You also realize your trust was well founded and you look forward to more intense times. I ordered this little skillet on a Friday night and it arrived Saturday morning. I had to try it!I made a grilled roast beef and cheese sandwich with it (pictured). My old skillet (different brand) had failed, hence the replacement. The grilled sandwich would be an easy test of the new skillet. I prepared it as usual and started cooking it on the stovetop. Heat distribution was nice and even. The sandwich, while cooking, slid very easily on the surface of the skillet. The cheese melted and the bread, coated with mayo (it really works!), developed this nice golden toastiness. The sandwich was yummy!Next will be a cold seared pork chop...Would I recommend it? Yes! There are much more expensive skillets at this size, but we already had a Cuisinart pan and it was well made, so it was easy to choose another Cuisinart. This skillet is solid and hefty, and seems well made. The non-stick coating seems to be properly applied and is very effective. Durability is something that can only be evaluated over time, but this one looks to be a keeper. You can find others for a little less or a lot more, but this hit the sweet spot for me. I can't wait to cook with it again!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nontoxic durability nonstick', 'author': 'TD', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have used Cuisinart for a decade n totally like them. I will be ordering more stainless steel pieces soon. Thanks Cuisinart n Amazon.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love Cuisinart pans and this one can go in the dishwasher!', 'author': 'A. Grrr ... I hate it when that happens. So I finally decided rather than continue to be disappointed with the pan, I would replace it with this lovely dishwasher-safe pan, which is also from Cuiisinart. I love the pan. It is so well made. title: GOTHAM STEEL 14 Inch Non Stick Frying Pans with Lid, Large Frying Pans Nonstick with Lid, Non Toxic Ceramic Pan Skillet, Nonstick Frying Pan, Induction Pan, Oven/Dishwasher Safe – Cream Hammered
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this pan - perfect 🥰', 'author': 'Misty Parsons', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this skillet. 98% on point from me* it doesn't burn food, but can get things crispy if that's what you want - like with fried potatoes.* no need for lots of butter or oil to keep the food able to slide along without getting stuck to the bottom - nothing sticks 😀* cleanup is a breeze - so far, nothing has stuck to any part of the pan - not potatoes, not eggs, not cheese, not grilled buns or bread... so nice and easy cleaning - I haven't had to use much pressure to clean it* easy transference from stove to oven to plate* height of sides is such that you can't flip items (it's sides are too vertical instead of lower horizontal) you have to use a spatula or other turning device, but it makes up for that one issue in that it cooks so evenly across the skillet**** the only issue really, thst needs addressed is that the lid has a handle that is just metal... I'm sure it because thst allows the pan to go in the oven at higher temperatures with the lid on it, but it would be nice not to burn.myself from hitting a piece of my hand on that handle and it coming away like I'd been branded from it.... a coating for the lid's handle would be nice... but it's easy enough to deal.with..So overall, this is an excellent buy. I love it. 98%. Only taking off points for the lid getting too hot and the skillet's handle getting too hot too.... everything else is awesome. The height of the sides is more than I expected, but it's such a small thing to deal with its negligible...So far it's very durable, easy to use, pretty... oh, it's just a little heavy for the skillet handle. It's a little hard to keep it even in the air. Trying to turn it one-handed is even harder, but again, those things can be worked around because everything else is do good. But in future, if it could be balanced better, it'd be appreciated.Just the right size for family cooking, or single use if you want some leftovers.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nothing sticks in this skillet at all.', 'author': 'Kathy M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I use this for eggs, bacon. I bought it at the end of 2022 and it's still perfect. I think the key is in heating it up. Never blast it with high heat. I let it heat up gradually and wait until the pan gets hot before adding anything to it, like oil or butter. You're not supposed to use high heat with these types of fry pans. title: Granitestone 10 Inch Non Stick Frying Pan Nonstick Pan with Mineral/Diamond Coating for Long Lasting Nonstick Frying Pan Skillet for Cooking with Stay Cool Handles, Oven/Dishwasher Safe, Non Toxic
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars You need this!', 'author': 'Kevin (inventimark)', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought my second one after my daughter's ex ruined my first one by cooking with it at full temperature for too long. The first pan still works great as new, just looks bad because the coating browned somewhat. You're not supposed to use nonstick pans on high without anything in them..... Other than that. This is the best pan I have ever owned. The main reason, is it is super super easy to clean. Nothing sticks to this, and it doesn't scratch very easy, if at all. (I haven't noticed any scratches) I do use metal utensils with it, but not harshly, but prefer to use firm silicon utensils when they are available and not dirty. Get this pan!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made!', 'author': 'Joseph B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this brand after watching a You Tube video that did a great job of comparing it to other non-stick pans priced from $18 - $130. The non-stick quality is GREAT. I can actually flip an egg for sunny side up without breaking the yoke. Pancakes come out looking the picture on the box because the pan eats evenly with only about 70 degrees difference between the center and edges. My other pan which was a few dollars cheaper than this one started to lose its coating after a year or so. The video on this one really showed it to be scratch resistant. 2 egg omelets are really easy as well. I liked the qualities and performance so much that I ordered the larger 12" pan. Great buy and value for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It is a good product.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It works as advertised but it does scratch easily with metal tools. So use only non-scratch tools. Cleaning is a breeze and you do not need to use any oil to cook with it. I find that I can get excellent results at half the temperature I used to use in my pans. A setting of 3-4 on my electric cooktop aways seems to get me properly cooked and tender meats.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works decently well, with a few Caveats.', 'author': 'Paul', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I purchased 3 of these as Christmas Gifts for family and friends.My dad had seen these on TV and was always complaining about scratchesand food burning in the pans he had. When I ordered one for him,I decided to give a few of them as gifts..My sister right away tried to fry and egg in hers without butter or oil, likethey did in the commercial. The egg stuck, and burnt. After a search onlineI saw someone refer to the instructions which state not to cook food at highheat, to cook food at medium heat. She had better success on her second attempt.My friend who just got her pan today cooked turkey burgers in her pan, she said sheburnt her burgers as well, but also commented "but it came right off". She said shecooked some more and they came out good.All 3 people have burnt food in their pans, but all 3 said the pan was very easy to clean,they just wiped it with a wet rag or paper towel.The one my dad uses, shows no wear at all, and hes been using it daily for 2 weeks.So my conclusion here, is that maybe these pans transfer the heat better than the pansthey have been using and the food is cooking faster. I warned my friend as soon as I gaveit to her, not to cook on high, and she still burnt the burgers.Also the claim that they are easy to clean holds up, because everyone has commented aboutthat, because they all burnt food.. which is kind of funny. But this also a reason I bought themthese pans in the first place, 1 was constantly complained about food sticking to their old pan,and blaming it on everyone else scratching the pans, the other person was burning food frequentlyprobably from distractions and not watching the food closely.So far these have been a good purchase for this people. Time will tell how these pans hold up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pan holds up to its claim', 'author': 'MARY', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This pan works great on an electric glass top stove, it heats evenly and cleans up easily. title: Gotham Steel 11 Inch Non Stick Frying Pan Nonstick Pan with Ceramic Copper Coating for Long Lasting Nonstick Frying Pan Skillet for Cooking with Stay Cool Handle, Oven/Dishwasher Safe, Non Toxic
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cooks Great!', 'author': 'Kyle Hodges', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Skillet works great love the gotham steel products', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 3 month follow-up review', 'author': 'debd', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have used my Gotham Steel 11-inch skillet nearly every morning since my purchase 3 months ago. I prepared the pan as per instructions, and have used it faithfully following suggestions in other reviews and from the manufacturer. I only use it for my egg-white omelets - same EVERY day. I saute some spinach in butter, add egg whites, and top with avocado and a small amount of diced meat. I use medium heat (lower heat than with my other omelet pans). This has worked perfectly until a week ago. Now my omelets have begun to stick. The skillet still cleans up well, but the omelets no longer slide out perfectly as before. I wish the perfection had remained. I still will use my pan, but wish it had lasted longer!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars good pan BUT!!!!', 'author': 'gabe', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Why in the world would you put a heavy glue on a label on the BOTTOM of the pan. Kind of dumb BUT the pan does work well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lovelu', 'author': 'KShawnS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great pan. Non-stick, easy to cook in and very easy to clean. Love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars What's with the sticker on the bottom?", 'author': 'BJB', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I wonder if I'll ever get to actually use this pan. As others have said, there's a giant plastic sticker covering the bottom of the pan. The sticker peeled off with some effort, but the entire bottom of the pan is still covered in sticky adhesive. I sure don't want that melting all over my glass top stove, not to mention the toxic fumes that would create. I might give it another try to get it off, but at this point, it's not worth the time or trouble. I will probably send it back. Somebody at Gotham wasn't thinking, they knew this was to be used for cooking-on a hot surface-very close to food that would pick up the taste & maybe even toxicity from the fumes of melting plastic, right? Also, the handle is not as pictured, it's flat & might be hard to hold level if there was anything off center or on the heavy side.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan but with lousy handle', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Pan itself is great but the handles leave a lot to be desired. True they are cool to the touch but are very hard to handle as they are rather sharp and I have hurt my hand on several occasions.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Sticker Problem', 'author': 'CNSE666', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Frying pan arrived in good condition and works fine NOW that I can use it. BEWARE it arrives with a 5" +/- round sticker on the bottom of the pan that leaves a lot of sticky residue on the bottom. Had to use half a bottle of Goo Gone and a lot of elbow grease to remove it. Why would someone put a sticker on a pan like that????', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far a great pan.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I will start off by saying this is a one week review. I will update after a month to see if anything has changed. I only bought this pan after my father had me order him one then he told me I needed one and even tried to pay for it himself. Pan came in and I gave it a quick wash then set it on the stove until later. Now a few things. One is that I love to cook and I am picky about what I cook with. Two is that my stove is electric and setup with 1-10 on the dials on the stove top. I have cooked in it each night and I have had no issues. I have to wonder if some of the sticking issue people are having with eggs is from cooking too hot. This morning for example I turned the burner on 8 and let the pan warm up while i beat the eggs for my omelette and prepared everything. That took about 3 minutes. I dropped a small about of butter into the pan for flavor.(about a 1/4 teaspoon) Then I poured the egg in,turned the burner down to 7 and cooked my breakfast. No sticking at all, even the shredded cheese that feel to the sides flipped with the omelette when i closed it up. That made me wonder. I placed the pan back on the burner and pulled out a slice of sharp cheddar. Thick sliced not thin. I dropped it in the pan and let it melt for 30 seconds. I then poured the melted slice out and onto the top of the omelette. No scrapping or anything. So far it is good. I will update in a month to see if it is still standing up to almost everyday use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not the quality I was hoping for', 'author': 'Dot Moreau', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This will be my 3rd copper pan and it's not as high of a quality as my other 2. The glue from the sticker on the bottom of the pan was difficult to remove.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Sticky residue from label', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This pan is a replacement from an older version. It seemed to be ok but there was a very sticky label on most of the entire botton of the pan. Once removed, it left a very sticky residue which was very difficult to remove. The company rep was not too helpful with the issue..she made suggestions to remove the stickiness but did not think it was an issue and said my complaint was here first one..no owness for the problem.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: All-Clad Essentials Hard Anodized Nonstick Fry Pan Set 2 Piece, 8, 10,5 Inch Oven Broiler Safe 500F, Lid Safe 350F Pots and Pans, Cookware Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Never look back.', 'author': 'Samantha Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got this pan set a few months ago for a screaming Black Friday deal, and they're my favorite pans I've owned thus far. Two classic sizes, one great for solo cooking and the other for two. Good heat distribution, and eggs slide right off with barely any oil. Super easy to clean. Surface holding up well with wooden/bamboo and plastic implements. I love the weight, just enough to sit well on the stove and be taken seriously without straining my wrists. The weight of the pan itself balances nicely with the weight of the handle, no teeter tottering. The sturdy handle attachment design makes me doubt that there will ever be an undesirable angle in this equation. Great value for the price, I'll be hard-pressed to buy anything else.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good', 'author': 'V', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've only used them a few times, so I can't speak to durability, but so far, exactly as advertised.They clean easily, are truly non-stick, and hard anodized is one of the safest nonstick coatings you can get (from what I've read).They are solid, medium to heavy, which I like. Handles never got hot for me, but I only cooked things for less than 10 mins, so far. Will update after cooking larger, more time consuming meals.Made pancakes, eggs, grilled cheese, which all came out great.Next up is stir fry.They should last for years if you properly take care of them. Most people sadly don't know how to treat non-stick coatings, and crank the heat up too high, let the pans sit empty on heat, stack them without padding in between, use metal utensils, all no-no's with any non-stick coated pans.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pro- chef Quality', 'author': 'Ronald Amendola', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Heavy duty,great non stick,works as advertised,easy clean up.Now let’s see how long the non stick works,too soon to know,check with me in 3 months.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price', 'author': 'Jorge Casanova', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After you season the pans they work great; nice non stick.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great strong pans to use every day.', 'author': 'Donner-daws', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. That being said I do need to mention that what is happening with the pans after I’ve had them about six months now is what other customers complain about is the pans are with time warping . title: T-fal Specialty Nonstick Fry Pan Set 3 Piece, 8, 9.5, 11 Inch Oven Safe 350F Cookware, Pots and Pans, Dishwasher Safe Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pans', 'author': 'Providential', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These pans are tremendous at their price point, and work perfect on my gas oven. I love them.Pros:-Amazingly nonstick. I wanted a quick omelette for my first test. I only had to give the pan two shakes to finish my eggs. After letting the eggs heat up to firm on the bottom I gave the pan one shake to cause one side to fold over, and one final shake to flip it over and finish the other side. The omelette easily slid out onto my plate. I wiped out the pan with a paper towel, and it looks like new. That's true nonstick. No tools, no cleaning, the pan does all the work.-Inexpensive. There are 2 schools for nonstick pans. One says you should buy a really expensive, maybe a ceramic Le Creuset type pan, which will last a long time and give the best experience. The other says you should go with something relatively inexpensive like this T-Fal set, because you know over time someone in your family is going to be an idiot and scrape the coating off your pans with metal utensils. I'm in the latter camp, so I absolutely love this set.Cons:-None. As said, so long as you're in the school where you'd prefer inexpensive nonstick pans, these things are wonders. Sure they don't retain heat like a big ceramic, sure a heavier pan could distribute heat better. But these are amazing at their price point, and their heat distribution is way better than you'd expect.Overall:This is my go-to for nonstick pans. Get something inexpensive, and in 5+ years when they're starting to get scraped up from misuse, you don't feel bad about replacing them. My mom's the type to always go for the heavy ceramic nonstick, and it kills her every time she has to replace one - but that doesn't stop her from damaging the coating with metal implements all the time either! I'd rather use my T-Fal, it makes me happy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 10, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful pan set, the best', 'author': 'Cherished', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This skillet set is excellent. It's durable, anti-scorching, non stick, and cooks your meals with an even temperature. I'd buy this set again and do recommend. Regarding the red dot heat indicator, it does not activate when the pans are hot. I even turned off my kitchen lights to see if there was a faint light, but nothing. Otherwise, the pans are amazing and I do recommend. 👍", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars well made', 'author': 'Danny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'fun to use', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice pans', 'author': 'Postal Suzi', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Used the smallest fry pan to fry eggs... seasoned the pans according to manual directions. Did not use commercial cooking spray (all of the cooking website reviews said not to) used canola oil, lightly. Everything went okay until it was time to flip the eggs.... they stuck just enough to break the yolks... but then slipped right out of the pan. Clean up was simple and easy. These pans cost $37.42 and for 3 non stick fry pans... that is a good price. I am replacing my Circulon fry pans after 10 years because the anodized coating is coming off. Checked many cooking sites and reviewing sites.. and bought these because they had good reviews at a price I was comfortable with. Preformed better than the "copper" and "diamond" brands and at a better price (from Amazon).I did have some problems registering for warranty... the model/serial number on the box was damaged. The product registration form would not accept any of the numbers I tried and I could not find the exact product combo on the T-fal website. I finally emailed customer service at t-fal.com and sent them a photos of the box info panel and fry pans and received a reply that says my product has been registered.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars At this price is essential.', 'author': 'RC G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Very good value. Lightweight with nice handles. Keep a star screwdriver near in case the handle gets loose. I'd buy these again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars As expected', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good products. Fast shipping.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars PFOA free, cheap and high quality...', 'author': 'Muttley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this set after my previous similar sized pans wore out completely. I have always been concerned with the safety claims related to teflon (PFTE) and thus before turning back to them, I tried ceramic options as an alternative. However they turned out to be such under-performers, with food sticking all the time and causing permanent stains which looks (and probably is) burnt. Besides, those alternatives, that are sold with greener and healthier claims, are also questionable due to the possibility they might be leeching heavy metals to the food.Besides, recently, I have come across reports saying that the nastier effects are mostly due to the chemical called PFOA rather than the actual teflon material which is PFTE. PFOA has been shown to cause cancer in experimental models but it is almost entirely gone after the pans came to their final state of manufacturing. Yet again, even those who work in teflon industry (so getting much higher exposure than general household user did not suffer an increased cancer rate according to WebMD) The good news is that for most modern models PFOA is removed from the manufacturing process and this set is among them with no PFOA to worry about. The other chemical which is the main ingredient of teflon is PFTE and it can start fuming out at very high temperatures (higher than most normal cooking procedures) and the only adverse effect that has been shown after massive exposure (which is unlikely in household settings) is some flu like symptoms. After these data, I obtained from various sources, I decided to come back to teflon again.However despite all those claims, I recommend potential buyers to limit teflon use as much as possible and use stainless steel cookware everywhere possible (if sticking is not a major problem for what you are cooking). Additionally I recommend not to use the pans when they start showing signs of wearing out. I believe that precautions would make me safer for the known and unknown effects and yet allow me to enjoy the convenience teflon has over other so called non-stick stuff. (Please make your own research for complete peace of mind rather than taking my word as true)Finally, I particularly liked this product due to its decent price-tag ($23 for 3 pans as of august 2014), even cooking and the company reputation (T-fal). I have used many different brands and T-fal has prevailed in most cases. If you are in the market for a decent set of small to medium sized nonstick pans then this product is a real good option', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Great pans, but don't stack them without insulation. Privets are good.", 'author': 'KH', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love these pans. They heat evenly, handles are not hot and the non-stick is amazing. Just don't stack them together without something between them. The bottoms of these pans are very abrasive with any movement. Get some cheap silicone privets and put them between the pans when storing. And don't use anything metal or abrasive to clean them and they will last forever. Enjoy your omelets and easy cleanup!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Most used pans in our kitchen', 'author': 'Jerm Addams', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My wife and I were looking for a pan to use strictly for making our dogs meals and took a chance on these and be honest, they ended up being our most used pans . They wipe clean very easily , depending on what you’re cooking and for those tougher , greasier meals , they come easily clean . We have literally abused these, as we are cooks, and really enjoy being in the kitchen, and these have been a great addition to our cast-iron pans we have used the most for years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very good', 'author': 'daniel schultz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'They seem to hold up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]
