title: T-fal Experience Nonstick Fry Pan 8 Inch Induction Oven Safe 400F Cookware, Pots and Pans, Dishwasher Safe Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars top-notch Performance!', 'author': 'Anthony Olsen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'this is the winner among all the pans I bought. Absolutely in love with its performance and reliability. The size is perfect for cooking larger meals, and its compatibility with my induction stove is a major plus.The non-stick coating on this is real deal. Not only is it durable and long-lasting, but it also lives up to its promise of being truly nonstick. Cooking and cleaning have become a breeze, as even the most delicate dishes slide right off the surface.The quick heating on my induction stove is impressive. It cuts my cooking time by two thirds of normal time with a tradition stove otherwise. and it is dishwasher suitable saving me time on clean up. It is the go to pan in my kitchen. It is worth every penny. Highly recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works as advertised', 'author': 'Scotty B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE (May 2017): After a little over 2 years, the non-stick surface finally lost it\'s non-stick properties. Part of that was due to the fact that my wife loved this pan so much, she used it all the time for everything, and non-stick pans will last longer if you only use them for applications where you really need a non-stick surface. NO non-stick surfaces last forever, however, which is why I think it\'s silly to spend a fortune on a non-stick pan. Of all the non-stick skillets I\'ve tried (including some of the expensive ones) T-fal has the best non-stick surface.Some notes, though. This pan did exhibit the "hump" in the middle of the cooking surface, but I still say the constant belly-aching over this is way overstated. It never affected the ability to cook anything I wanted to. If anything runs towards the edge, just give it a quick swirl – problem solved. It made great, thin omelets, even with the "hump, until the non-stick surface wore out.However, this pan did warp. Just enough that it wouldn\'t lie perfectly flat on a ceramic cooktop. I think it had something to do with the construction. Although it conducts heat evenly, this is not a heavy duty pan. The stainless steel bottom is a thin disk mated to an aluminum body, which is different than more expensive pans that sandwich an aluminum disk between layers of stainless steel. The two metals expand and contract at different rates, so I think warping is inevitable with this design.Because of that, I opted for the Ultimate Anodized version of this pan for its replacement, which features solid anodized aluminum construction. Same non-stick surface. Same handle. I\'ve been very happy with it.If you have an induction cook-top, then this Professional version is your only option. It\'s a good pan. Just don\'t overheat it and maybe avoid super hot dishwasher cycles to make it last longer.(May, 2014) It\'s still pretty much brand new. So I can\'t comment on its durability, yet.The build quality is fine. I prefer a slightly longer handle and ones with the slip-on silicone sleeves, but it\'s fine. This pan is oven-safe, but only at less than 400 degrees. But this pan is not made for super-hot cooking - no non-stick pans are. It\'s not a super heavy pan, but it\'s not super thin like so many cheap ones. But the purpose is to quickly heat things up, and it does so evenly. Mine did not exhibit the "bow" that some complain about. Even if it does bow slightly over time and the oil runs to the sides, I\'m not concerned. With a non-stick skillet, you are adding fat strictly for flavor. A quick swirl is all that\'s necessary when you add the food.(Note: If you actually watch ATK like I do, you would see that their skillet actually DOES exhibit the bow and their oil runs to the sides. Doesn\'t seem to stop them from making great food, so I think the bellyaching over this is a bit overstated)If you are adding more than, say, a tablespoon of oil, you probably need to use a different pan, anyway. You should be using this pan to cook quickly sauté veggies or cook delicate foods like fish and eggs, not to cook burgers and steaks or simmer foods for a long time. Use stainless steel or cast iron for those things.The non-stick surface is excellent. Omelets are a breeze. Fish releases easily and intact while still getting a little color. To make the surface last as long as possible, hand washing is best, and cleanup is easy.This is more than I\'ve spent on a non-stick skillet in the past - I usually just buy inexpensive commercial non-stick pans from restaurant supply companies. But the America\'s Test Kitchen tests and reviews seem to suggest that this one will put up with a little more abuse and retain it\'s excellent non-stick properties longer than most. I can\'t comment on that yet, but I haven\'t seen the non-stick properties of any of these skillets last longer than a year - or two, at best. Dings and scratches are normal wear-and-tear, unless you really baby these things, - always hand wash them, always use soft utensils (wood and silicone are best - hard plastic can still scratch the surface), and store them in a way that the non-stick surface never contacts any other surfaces.This skillet does the types of cooking it was made for extremely well. That\'s why you should buy it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 5, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I will never buy another brand of pots and pans again...', 'author': 'SFG Electronics', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are the best pots/pans I have ever used! This particular one I actually purchased as a gift for my mom, but I have completely switched all of my pots and pans to the T-Fal E series. I have yet to cook (or burn) anything that actually stuck to the surface and couldn\'t just be wiped out. FOR EXAMPLE: I occasionally make sandwiches for my family, and one thing that I do is throw deli meat (whether it\'s turkey, ham, salami, etc.) in the pan to heat it up and give it a slight crispiness, and top it with cheese (processed, shredded, real cheese, whatever we have at the time). I will then flip it over to "toast" the cheese side. Again, the cheese releases from the surface as good as the meat does, and this gives it a little smoky flavor that adds to the overall taste. This is by far the best non-stick pan I have ever used!PROS: Incredibly non-stick No harmful chemicals in the coating (does NOT contain PTFE (Teflon) Super easy to clean Lightweight, but solid Has a color changing circle in the center to let you know when it\'s hot Retains a considerable amount of heat (you can cook the same with less heat from the burner)CONS: Does not hold up to use with metal utensils -- have to use silicone-coated or plastic Made of aluminum -- this contributes to the light weight, but is soft and dents/bends easily if not properly cared for Lids are not readily available (T-Fal does not make them)After about 2 1/2 years of near daily use, this particular pan became "sticky" due to improper care (the non-stick surface became VERY scratched, down to metal in some spots), but this is not a fault of the pan. It could have easily been prevented.I cook just about every meal for my family, and after using this I would never switch to a different brand or series of pots and pans. But, like any high-quality item, they must be properly cared for.SUGGESTIONS: ALWAYS wash by hand, do NOT put in dishwasher!! (This should be self-explanatory, it takes approximately 30 seconds to completely clean by hand). For me, washing consists of a rinse under hot water, a simple wipe (NO SCRUBBING NEEDED) with either a soapy soft-sponge or cloth, followed by a hot water rinse and towel dry. DONE! NEVER heat pan with nothing in it!! (Even though it is non-stick, you should always add a little oil/butter or whatever you are cooking to the pan while heating). This prevents the pan from overheating. DO NOT overheat!! Overheating the pan causes the coating to "scorch" and will greatly reduces it\'s effectiveness. ALWAYS use plastic or silicone-coated utensils, as metal utensils WILL damage the surface. Pay attention to your cooking temperature! The design of these pans allow you to get a better cook in the same amount of time with less heat on the burner! For example, I can boil water with the burner set at 6 in the same amount of time that it takes an aluminum or stainless pot to boil with the burner on 9 or 10. Frying (say, eggs or burgers) can be done on 4 or 5, whereas other pans need to be on 7 or 8. **YOU\'RE SETTINGS MAY DIFFER!! EVERY STOVETOP CAN PRODUCE DIFFERENT LEVELS OF HEAT!!**I have used everything from cheap ceramic-coated non-stick to very expensive (and overpriced, if you ask me) PROFESSIONAL stainless steel cookware, and nothing I have used in the past can even begin to compare with the quality of this series of pots and pans by T-Fal. Not to mention, the price on this series is outstanding, and i would easily pay double for them if I had to, and they are definitely worth it!.I have repeatedly, and continue to recommend these to ANYONE looking for pots/pans or having a problem with sticking food. Now, I am not a professional chef, and I do not consider myself to be, but I do cook with multiple pots/pans a lot, and these have made cooking a much better experience for me, and cleanup is much simpler (no soaking to get the stuck-on crud off!).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellenyt quality no stick fry pan', 'author': 'Carol', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is Hugh (Carols Hubbly Bubly) This is a sturdy high quality non stick fry pan. The pan was on sale and because it was so affordable I wasn't expecting such a high level of quality. I would definitely rercommend this T-fal no stick fry pan to anyone. I also own one of the more affordable T-fal non stick fry pans as well. It is much lighter in weight, but it has held up really well. So I have no problem recommending the T-fal brand. I have had the less expencive one about two years, and use it quite often. The non stick surface still looks perfect. And the outer finish still looks great too. I only use non metal spatulas ans egg flippers, stirring spoons etc etc on these or any non stick fry pans. I hope this helps", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Ego blemishes an otherwise perfect product (uodated)', 'author': 'andrewwynn', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Update: bumped up to 4 Starr\'s from 3: the easy fix stayed for 15 months before I sold my pan to a buddy and bought a new one. The new 12" had the hump (about 1/16 inch tall). I put a star back because in practice very few items have a problem with cooking on the hump and though every indication is t-fal is backpeddling on trying to say it\'s on purpose that is obviously not true if it\'s not always. "We purposely make SOME of them domed". My 10" is perfectly flat.As promised and only 4mo. after getting my new 12" I developed a new way to flatten the pan: one step and worked like a charm.How\'d I do it? Drove over it with my SUV. NOT KIDDING check out the photos.I was trying to figure out a fool proof method somebody could copy using on-hand items.Items:➀ sawdust or kitty litter etc➁ sheet of plywood about 18" square➂ several "drive over boards" (3/4 plywood about the width of your car tire good)➃ some bricks or 2x limber cut to size➄ small pieces of plywood cut to size as neededAs the last photos show, clips from my movie, I put sawdust down in a circle under the pan, slightly concave in the middleI put the 18" square of 1/2 plywood over the sawdustI put the pan on that sheetI assembled a ramp from bricks and plywood to get car tire over the lip of pan.I put a square of 2x4 on top of a 4" square of 1/2" thick plywood to do the pressing.I drove over using front wheel for more weight.I stopped for a second or two centered on pan and drove off.My dome dropped 58/1000 on one pass and the flat c-channel I used for flat reference shows nearly perfectly flat after and a test with some soapy water shows absolutely zero "moat" effect. 100% solved!For whatever reason my 10" model was perfectly flat out he gate so no fix needed.For naysayers that drank the t-fal koolaid: in addition to the problems of food like crepes and eggs being hard to cook: flat top stoves lose about 80% of their conductive heat transfer when only touching on the outer edges so it makes for uneven cooking which is my primary motivation for fixing my ONE AND ONLY EVER domed pan.Original review:As many have noted: the pan may actually be the holy grail of non stick but the ego stamped on the bottom makes for a mini mountain in the centre of the pan.Wheat happens is that you will get a "moat" of oil around the center island of dry in the center of the pan. Nice if you want to make donut shaped crépes I suppose. Not super nice for anything else.QC so "out of whack" for a top tier vendor like t-fal is inexcusable. Somebody should be fired literally.Is it too much to ask that the flat bottom of a pan is flat without having to fix it yourself? Yeesh!The good news: easy to fix. I\'ve used the trick of standing in a pan on carpet to un-mound a dozen pans in then past, and a similar trick worked on this pan.Then trick: the thick aluminum bottom was more robust than the pans I\'ve fixed in the past so i used a slightly different method:I formed a donut shape with a rolled up towel and set the pan on it, then I stepped inside and while standing on the ball of my foot I lunged up and down "hopping but keping foot On the ground".I checked for flatness with a ruler both outside and inside until I was satisfied. In the end, two teaspoons of water with a tiny bit of dish soap to "wet" the surface spread edge to edge, no island. Also 1 1/2 tbsp. of oil once heated filled the bottom of the pan perfectly. (When cold it puddled in the center and stayed).So, "A" for non stick, "D" for putting a hill in the center of every pan by stamping a logo in without the proper compensation in the blank or the very least a follow up stamp to make the pan flat and some friggin\' quality control!Ok, so after 1-2 minutes of hopping up and down, the hump in the middle went from nearly 1mm tall (about 1/4 the thickness of the metal to put that into perspective) down to about a 0.2mm dent in the bottom and darn near perfectly flat inside. (There are a couple areas maybe 0.1mm shallow inside, enough to take maybe 0.1 tsp of liquid but inconsequential. The fact the bottom still has a shallow when the top is flat means the stamping process (for the logo) is making the metal thinner in the center in addition to making the little hill.Love the pan and can\'t wait to get some cooking done and a follow-up if the fix is relatively permanent.I\'ll post pics when I get a chance.-awrupdate: so i got to try it out, and freakeshly non-stick; was so easy to cook crepes in this pan! especially with the thermo-dot. It turns color just a little too hot for perfect crepes but they were amazing and tasty; and just slid out of the pan!I ended up having to re-level my stove before i could really test the flattened out fixed copy, but with only 2 tsp of oil to lightly oil the pan (probably not even remotely needed for these crepes), there were just random spots of oil; it doesn\'t want to adhere to the pan enough to make a coating.I have a neat picture of 2 tsp of oil just sitting in a puddle in the dead-center of the pan while heating. I also was able to make an \'oil moat\' just about 3/8" wide around the entire pan at one point, so there is still a little bit of a \'low spot\' or perhaps just the fact there is a bend in the pan gives the oil something to grab onto.Now if i can only get my wife to stop using metal instruments and get the pan to last a while.considering it was 1/3 to 1/4 the price of a decent tri-ply pan the same size, this pan in spite of its hiccups is a home-run.-awr', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan great price', 'author': 'JEN', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Finally bought myself a new frying pan after probably a decade and I'm so glad I picked this one. The non-stick is amazing. The eggs cook so much faster and come out way better. I was afraid it would be too small for four eggs but it works fine", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great small pan for eggs and other non-stick needs.', 'author': 'J.J. In NY', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed to replace my aging, non-stick pans. I noticed that Andrew Rea (aka Babish) has used this brand, and decided to give it a shot.I have a smaller, old electric cook top, so the 8" pan was a good fit for my needs.It heats quick and even, despite my temperamental stovetop. It cleans up easily, and has held up really well. The handle is easy to grip, and insulates well against the pan when hot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars OK this one works. Works well', 'author': 'ComputerGuy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I usually do not use non stick pans anymore. Stainless is the way to go but there are things where you kind of need/want it. Like eggs. Thats why I always bought an 8" non stick pan for little thigs like eggs and a quick fish filet. I used to have the Amazon essential pan but they seem to have stopped selling that. I remembered T-Fal was always good if the pan was small. Larger ones always warped but the small ones were good.This one.... unfortunately would stick. I tried oil and pam. Cooks welll on heat, burner setting on 4 or 5.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Non Stick 10" Skillet at a fair price', 'author': 'Billy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This review is not just a review for the Cuisinart 622-24 10" Non Stick Skillet I purchased on Amazon for $25.95, but also of the Cuisinart 10" Non Stick Skillet purchased from TJ Max that looks almost identical with part number 6622-24PP for $16.99 before tax. We\'ve had an older 622-24 for several years now (over 5) and my wife wanted to get a new one because the old one had been scratched up enough that the non stick coating wasn\'t working as good as it once did, plus she just likes things that look new. I first went to TJ Max because sometimes you can get good stuff there for much less and found the pan that looked identical, but with a different part number on the pan. I wanted to see how different the cheaper pan from TJ Max was and bought it for comparison, but will be returning that pan because the one with part number 622-24 to me seems like a better pan and worth the extra $9. Just looking at them side by side you can\'t tell a difference, but when I weighed them the 622-24 pan purchased on Amazon was a little heavier. (34.53 oz versus 32.35 oz) The 622-24 seems like it is also just a smidge thicker when looking at them side by side. The main thing I noticed was the pan from Amazon has a label on the pan itself that says Quantanium which is supposed to be a premium coating so you can use metal utensils with the skillet. The one from TJ Max doesn\'t say that or has the sticker. The packaging sleeve with all the marketing material is similar and goes over all the same features, but have different presentations. The main Title difference is the 622-24 has "Chef\'s" in the title were the other does not which I\'m assuming is because of the added Quantanium coating and reason the pan is a little over 2 oz more in weight. So now that you know that lets talk about the 622-24 pan performance. It has been a trusted skillet we\'ve used for over 5 years and has impressed us enough to purchase another one to replace the one we use all the time nearly every day. I contemplated trying the new Ninja Cookware, but it is more money and figured I\'d stay with what we know and what we\'ve used for years so we don\'t have to change our cooking routines. We still use the old pan, but not for delicate items or items were we think it will be difficult to clean afterwards. The nonstick coating holds up well, but the pan will scratch over time despite the Quantanium marketing addition. The pan has a nice weight and look to it, but not as nice as other higher priced pans. Heat distribution is good too and will evenly cook an egg quickly and evenly. I do believe the cheaper pan from TJ Max will do just as good, but may not last as long. That is strictly my opinion though as I haven\'t cooked with it. I did want to add one more thing regarding my purchase on Amazon for the 622-24 pan I purchased. When it came in it had a scratch on the side rim of the non stick coating. Considering it will likley get a scratch like that in the future I decided to keep it instead of requesting a replacement, but did contact customer service and they were willing to give me a small discount on the pan because of the scratch which I am very appreciative of and also why I try to purchase everything from Amazon, because their customer service is really second to none in that respect. Well over 95% of the time they have met or went above my expectations with any issue I\'ve ever had with anything. The key is to report it to them as quickly as possible. Hope this review helped someone and gave many the difference between the two pans because beforehand I couldn\'t find any info on the 6622-24PP skillet from TJ Max. Thanks!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Non stick frying pan', 'author': 'Jacqueline fife', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this pan . Easy clean up', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This pan cooks evenly and is very nonstick.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Attractive and functional', 'author': 'Sergeant Sayles', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great non stick surface, nice looking and heavy duty.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Needs to be seasoned before use', 'author': 'Jack Archambault', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Instructions should describe how to season before first use. Couldn’t believe how eggs stuck the first time used with no seasoning.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Cuisinart 422-30H Contour Stainless 12-Inch Open Skillet with Helper Handle, Silver
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A swell little pan that will give YEARS of use!!!!', 'author': 'Darkgardyner', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a GREAT pan!!! The lid fits well, and its glass-so you can keep an eye on what you are cooking, the bottom hearts evenly and quickly, and if you follow the 'hot pan, cold oil' rule, you should have a nice surface that doesn't stick AND cleans up well.While I have ALWAYS used and loved the natural non-stick qualities of the large cast iron fry pans used to cook family meals, I wanted something that could go thru the dishwasher, wasn't hard on my wrists, and was big enough to cook a whole casserole. This pan TOTALLY fits the bill.I also love that it can go from stove top to oven, and that the handles aren't long, wieldy and clumsy. They do get hot if you are cooking for a long period, like a rice or one-pot pasta meal, however they are designed well, and nicely accommodate pot mitts.This pan is also very pretty, shiny inside and out, pretty enough to display on open shelving.I just want to say that think's it's unfair to compare this modestly priced item to pans that go for 15 times as much, and then give this pan an unfair rating. I have read a lot of reviews for pans around this price, and have found a few people saying that they prefer their $350.00 french chef pan they picked up while on holiday….apples to oranges.All in all, this is swell little pan that is appropriately priced..I know I am going to get YEARS of use from this pan. The shape of this pan makes it perfect for Chicken pot pie, One-pot pasta, Shepherds pie, baked fish and chicken, enchiladas, breakfast casserole, stir fry, biscuits, and much more.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A weekday workhorse', 'author': 'Nathan S', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Perfect everyday pan. The handles are hefty and sturdy, the bottom is weighted and balanced nicely to sit very still while lightly stirring with one hand on a glass top or induction surface. This pan heats evenly and quickly and holds temperature surprisingly well when large cuts of cold meat or food enter the pan.This makes short work of sauteeing, simmering, braising, and just about anything other regular household cooking duties you can throw at it. Being dishwasher safe makes it even better, once the visible food particles have been sprayed or cleaned off this thing can just be popped right in the dishwasher to save tedious scrubbing that nobody wants to do after a meal. Comes out of a regular dishwasher cycle looking brand new.The only downside, and this isn't even really a huge deal but is just worth mentioning in case someone has delicate or sensitive skin on their hands, is the fact that the very outer lip edge of the pan appears to be slightly squared/angled instead of polished or ground to a smooth edge. The very edge of the lip is noticeably sharp to the touch, not enough to actually cut skin but it is uncomfortable to run your bare hand or finger over the lip of the pan while cleaning. Good thing the handles on this are top notch and minimize the amount of times you will ever realistically need to touch the edge of the pan itself. Minor detail, but it feels a little unfinished on the edge compared with how smooth and nice the texture of the handles, exterior, and interior of the actual pan are.Overall for the price point this is a no-brainer to pick up for a great all-purpose pan. title: 10-12 Inch Tri-ply Stainless Steel Frying Pan Set,Skillets,Chef's Pan,Cookware Set,Induction Pans,Dishwasher and Oven Safe. (Removable Handle)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy & easy to clean', 'author': 'M M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am thoroughly impressed with the quality. It is easy to clean. I really am enjoying the nice touch of having the bolts only on the outside so there’s no annoying bump on the inside. I believe the people who are saying the food sticks don’t know how to clean on stainless steel because I’ve cooked eggs, chicken, veggies, fried rice, etc on this pan with absolutely 0 sticking. If you have stuck on food, heat the pan with a bit of water in it and use a wooden spatula to scrape it off once it’s hot. Then wash as usual. No rusting, no warping. Cooks evenly, even though it’s bigger than my largest burner. Fairly lightweight without feeling cheap. The lid is very sleek looking. Happy with my purchase and will buy more from this company to complete my collection', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Pan Set', 'author': 'James Shepard', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very nice, professional, chef-quality stainless steel frying pan set. The largest one is actually deep enough to work as a wok. And as far as that goes, the small & medium-sized pans are also the same depth and could work as smaller woks. Otherwise, they are made to be able to "flip" food over in the pan using the handle, like the professional chefs do. Plus a magnet will stick to them, meaning they will work with induction stovetops or portable induction cookers.The set comes with four spare nuts in case you ever need one. That being said, the spanner tool used to tighten the nuts is generally too small. The crescent wrench side won\'t fit over the nuts at all, and the closed wrench side just barely fits with some difficulty getting it on, but it worked. Of course, a regular small adjustable crescent wrench can also be used.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Unexpectedly good', 'author': 'Mutlu Bozokluoglu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had my doubts and I have tried so many different non stick pans before.These pans are hands down the best I ever owned. Not a scratch after months of heavy use. Not one single scratch. Cleans very easily and hardly anything sticks to it. Heats up really high allowing high heat control for cooling. I highly recommend and I would buy another set if I had the space. Amazing pans.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value,durable, no warp at all after heating', 'author': 'Han', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Purchasing such a high-quality product at this price is quite surprising. title: 7 in 1 Multipurpose 11 Inch 5 Quart Heat Indicator Nonstick Deep Frying Pan with Glass Lid, Steamed Grid
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Dream pan', 'author': 'deborah falcone', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this product. It's strong,and versatile.cook,bake,and clean one Pan. And beautiful. Worth the money", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome pan!!', 'author': 'Susan Viglione', 'rating': 5, 'content': "UPDATE: I love this pan so much I bought another one in purple just in case something happens to my pink one. Needles to say I am very happy with my purchase.I love this pan and can't say enough about it!!! It heats fast and evenly so everything cooks at the same rate not just what's closest to the center. Clean up is a breeze. The pressure valve in the cover does come out easily but is not the issue some reviews are making it out to be. I just put it back in the cover...no big deal. The size is great. Wide enough to do 4 chicken breasts and deep enough to make soup. The spatula included is of substantial weight and feels good in your hand. The removable handle so it can go into the oven adds to the versatility of this pan. The heat sensor in the handle is nice too making it easy to know when the pan is hot enough to get a nice sear on the meat. I bought the pink. I love that I had a choice of colors. All this and a reasonable price too? Very happy with my purchase!!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars excellent', 'author': 'Ronesinger', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'my wife love this cook pan. she professional cook. she say this is the best she ever had .it cook very even get hot very quickly no oil needed, and very easy to clean. no elbow grease needed. work great in dishwasher too , we love it. beautiful finish. very sturdy and easy to handle, and the price is so right its amazing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good pan but silly pressure doohickey', 'author': 'Proctor Smith', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The pan is fine and works well for all intended circumstances. Cooks food evenly and quickly!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value!', 'author': 'Tracy Bertapelle', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been using this ever since Christmas and I absolutely love it. Other than that, I love this pan.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love, but one piece of advice.', 'author': 'Alicia', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I have nothing but positive things to say about this pot/pan. I also like that it can go into the oven after the handle is removed.One word of advice, the newer pots have a handle that screws in. Because it's metal on metal, it can become almost impossible to remove, especially if water has seeped in. This happened to me and I ended up having to use pipe pliers to remove it. I also applied WD40.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: YOSUKATA Carbon Steel Wok Pan – 13,5 “ Stir Fry Pans - Chinese Wok with Flat Bottom Pow Wok - Traditional Japanese Woks - Black Carbon Steel
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great wok, easy to lift with one hand', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was always afraid to buy a carbon steel wok because I heard they were tough to maintain. I was wrong. This wok is lightweight but strong, easy to maneuver, and once the initial seasoning is done, it's truly nonstick and simple to clean (quick wash with soap, wipe with oil and dry it on the stove). They charge a lot for the lid and utensils, so I would buy those elsewhere.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent wok', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this wok! It heats quickly and evenly, and after a quick seasoning is virtually non- stick. The 14" size holds a lot of food and is a huge improvement on my former 10.5 " one"', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight and fast to heat up, but warps easily and tricky to season.', 'author': 'Vincent Galbo', 'rating': 4, 'content': "A wok is such a great tool in the kitchen, I'm really glad I added one to my kitchen arsenal and I recommend it to anyone who is even considering it. It makes stir-fry so much easier and cleaner, and learning how to flip food in the pan makes you feel very cool.Pros:* Heats up fast* Lightweight and easy to manipulate through space* Fantastic customer service* It's carbon steel, so super durableCons:* Can be a little tricky to season on an electric glass stove. Wood handle doesn't remove easily and prevents you from seasoning in the oven.* Warps easily -- especially on an electric glass stove. I have two other carbon steel pans, one thin and one thick and I haven't permanently warped any of those. This one I warped during seasoning, they sent me another one (amazing customer service^), and the new one warped immediately again. That said, the warp doesn't really impact the cooking as far as I can tell, at least not significantly. Also, I reduced the warp by hitting it with a rubber mallet.* Comes with a weird film on top that needs to be removed but not completely removed? It's a little tricky cleaning it when you first get it.Summary: If you're thinking about a wok, definitely get a wok. If you have an electric stove, maybe consider a different style of pan (like a cast iron one with a burner bottom) as this will probably warp. This is a good pan and it works really well and the customer service is top tier.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really nice Wok!', 'author': 'patrick kozal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First off, this is not a coated pan and it needs to be seasoned and maintained properly!! All the negative comments on here are 100% user error. Carbon steel pans like this Wok need to be treated similarly to cast iron. After a few rounds of seasoning mine is slick as non stick and cooks great! The edges were a bit sharp so before seasoning I filed them smooth, but other than that it’s a well made pan that should last a long long time!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars I think I'm gonna love this", 'author': 'Anne M', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I just got this wok. I have only used it once. So this is what I can tell you so far. Make sure you follow the before you use it instructions. I have found that seasoning my cast iron with spray on non stick oil, Pam or whomevers you like, work great. It also works really well on this wok. It has some weight to it but not so much that it is hard to use. The meal I made was probably the best stir fry I have ever made. It didn't take long for it to heat up so I could begin cooking. Cooking was quick and easy, clean up was a breeze, then I heated it up, sprayed it with cooking spray, turned off the heat and let it cool on the burner, whipped out the extra oil and it is ready for next time. Yes!, I would recommend this product.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This even FEELS like quality!', 'author': 'Ryan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I havent cooked with it yet, (I know, I know I hate reviews like that!) but I expect it will perform well. The balance in my hand is great! It is light, but feels solid. Im rather excited about this pan.Im switching from an electric coil stove 🙄 to an induction burner, as I rent and gas isnt an option.There is a coating on the pan to protect it from rust in shipping... Ill be removing that and seasoning it tomorrow... as suggested in the booklet that came with it... using a fatty piece of pork... a piece of pork belly. Anyone who has used cast iron will get it... this is the same as that seasoning, and same restrictions for care.I decided to get the matching cover/lid with glass at the top and the two matching stainless cooking untensils... Im pleased with the whole set, even though its not exactly a set.What got my attention (why I chose this over at least 25 others I looked at) is the welded handle(s). Im not even sure who, but someone in the last week mentioned a pop rivet coming loose on a pot, and when I saw this was welded... and not tack welded, but fully welded... game over.I really love the black carbon steel coloring, and the wood handle is both beautiful and it fits nicely in my hand. My hands are a good size but not giant... a petite woman (or smaller sized man) may find the handle a bit large in the hand.Final note... the warranty for this pan is 30 days, however, it specifies only if purchased in their store. So I presume that warranty is voided. Im not worried, but also, if some immediate defect shows up, Amazon's policy will cover. Barring it cracking in half or some freak problem... I expect to have this for years.When Ive seasoned it a bit, if I remember, Ill add more pics.This was more than other options, I feel the money is (very) well spent on this wok.Do be aware this is flat bottomed for my induction burner... if I had gas I would have ordered their round bottom model, but lid and utensils the same...", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent wok!', 'author': 'J. Holston', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Completely satisfied with this wok. The seasoning process does produce some smoke-just open a window and follow the excellent directions and you'll be fine. Once seasoned, it is virtually nonstick. The cleanup is fast and easy. Just water and a scrubby. Everytime I use this wok, I'm thankful that I purchased it!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for electric stovetops', 'author': 'Anonymous', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Very good for the money, I spent 3 weeks going over reviews before choosing this one. the biggest draw for me was the ability to remove the wood handle and season it... Well, that was really, really hard to do. The handle must have been mounted while the socket was very warm and expanded because just removing the screws did nothing. I had to even heat it up with a torch to remove it. But other than that it is a great wok. it heats nicely, cooks well, and is like any cast iron I have to care for. seasoning is a must. I got some done on my stovetop but w/o a gas range, you can\'t do the upper portion of it without burning off the bottom coatings. I am replacing a hammered Carbon steel wok that the handles burned off seasoning it in the oven a few times over 20 years. I would like a slightly bigger bottom and about .5" in height but for the money it outclasses most others I have handled. Do yourself a favor and do not heat it fast if you don\'t want it to warp the bottom, it returns to flat when all evenly heated so not a huge deal. I like this one for home use on a glasstop range. I would have gone round bottom if I had gas.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Is it supposed to scratch that easily', 'author': 'Marianela Mohr', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So my review many woks, this one was highly recommended. I used it for the first time tonight. Made Chorizo and potatoes for the week. At first, I was using my wooden spoon, then my husband said use the spatula that we got.I did, trust me I’m very careful with my pots and pans. Have all All Clad for over 25 years. I made a sound when I noticed a scratched on the wok from their spatula.. I finished cooking with my wooden spoon. Then, I cleaned it and I see all these scratches. Are they supposed to be there using the spatula, I haven’t use the ladle, I think that’s the name.The one thing I have to say about this company, I really love the Lid. Maybe, this is what cooking is supposed to look like, not sure. It’s a beautiful Wok', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great wok but clean and re-season', 'author': 'Nonprofit Colo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After reading about seasoning and watching some Chinese videos on seasoning woks, I cleaned the inside of the wok to strip off the pre-seasoning and then completely reseasoned.I used vinegar and water, filling the wok to 1/2 inch below the brim and left it over night. Then scrubbed it with steel wool pad and soap to completely remove oils. I also took oil and paper towels to wipe the I side until there was no dark residue coming off the pan. Washed with soap and water, rinsed well, and then dried it over a gas stove. Let it cool, and then began the seasoning process.You first have to blue the metal over an open flame. The bare steel will turn bluish and you do this to the whole wok. The put a thin layer of canola or vegetable oil in it and heat over heat until it smokes. Continue to wipe oil in it with a paper towel and oil and let it get hot enough to smoke. Do this 3 to 4 times and you are done.Well worth the effort as it is truly non-stick. You must heat the wok until the oil begins to smoke before putting food into it to stir fry.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Farberware Cookstart DiamondMax Nonstick Frying Pan/Skillet, Dishwasher Safe, 12 Inch - Aqua
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good everyday pan', 'author': 'J. Barr', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Medium weight but heats evenly and cooks well. Very pleased!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Don't be married to a color!", 'author': 'MYMAINE1', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Always been a fan of Farberware, and this is the first time I've had their product in color. I like the build quality as they are riveted and have no screws to loosen or strip. I chose Aqua to go with everything in my kitchen, and perhaps understandably, but unexpectedly, the beautiful Aqua finish turned dark olive green after using the pans. Great product, (and I use them extensively) and have had none of the negative experiences' others seem to have. I cook on gas stove only, as these would definitely scratch the surface of a glass top electric stove. I would only say that you should use only wood or silicone utensils (my preference) to preserve and protect the cooking surface. Although it states dishwasher safe, I am not a fan of the dishwasher, so can't make any observations there. Thankfully Analon made it good via the lifetime warranty.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality', 'author': 'Danwood', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have bought a total of three of these skillets and have used them for every dinner for about a month, and they are truly a pleasure to use. The bottoms are thicker than most, the heat distribution is perfect, the coating appears to be extremely strong and they are easy to clean. I anticipate these will last me for years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars After two months of use, this is a 5+ star pan!!!', 'author': 'Kevin Bastian', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this 2 months ago. Have used it several dozen times.Will it wear out in a few years? Maybe. If so, I\'ll buy another without complaints. If they only rented this pan for $10/year, I\'d sign a lifelong agreement, it\'s that good.This is an awesome pan, and no matter what else you own, spring for $20 and change and get one of these. Great price for gifting, too, which I\'m considering right now.This is my go-to pan now, and I only pick another if I need bigger or want cast iron. Otherwise, this is it. You can NOT go wrong. Silicone handle means it doesn\'t get hot and can go in the oven up to 400°. The metal tip at the end does not get hot on the stove, although the metal part of the handle right next to the pan does. So you do have to be a little careful.The only thing that would make me up my rating to 5.5 stars is if the silicone handle extended another 1/2" or so closer to the pan, but then it would be exposed to gas flames and might melt, or whatever silicone does when it\'s overheated. But the silicone part is big enough for my hand; just be normally cautious and you\'ll be fine. I wasn\'t once and I didn\'t burn myself much, just an annoyance that taught me to be a little more careful.Eggs for one or two people are what this pan is perfect for.It is the only pan I\'ve ever owned that I considered more than just a utilitarian pan. This is a work of art. The color, the weight, the balance, the handle, the temperature tolerance. I guess that\'s both art and engineering. Even if you don\'t need the pan, buy one and use it as a coffee table conversation piece.One last practical comment. If you own an infrared thermometer, I encourage you to use it the first few times you use the pan to see how hot you\'re getting it based on your burner settings. Then you shouldn\'t have to worry about it. The pan is so small that it will heat up fast and hot, and you could go over the 500° limit if you went to high heat and weren\'t cooking much in it. No reason at all to destroy this pan if you use a little common sense. The 400° limit for traditional Teflon was one I never seemed to be able to stay within, and I cooked many a Teflon pan in the past. This Dupont Autograph 2 coating is wonderful and should last years if you don\'t abuse it.Oh, and if you don\'t own an infrared thermometer, why not? Amazon has them as cheap as a dozen bucks. I can\'t attest to how good one would be that\'s that cheap, but do your research. I bought a Maverick on here a couple years ago for $38 and it\'s been one of the best purchases I\'ve ever made. It\'s extremely accurate; I have a Thermapen and have tested both with ice water and boiling water and the Maverick is within 1° accuracy (Thermapen is obviously the gold standard here and it was right on as well). It\'ll pay for itself by helping you avoid ruining food and pans in the kitchen, and will let you run around the house checking temperatures of walls, furniture, whatever. You\'ll be able to better balance your heating system by adjusting vents. You\'ll be able to test sleeping people to be sure they\'re still alive. And the laser beam is great entertainment for pets. So many uses!!!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great set of skillets.', 'author': 'Lavidalocatexan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Purchased these Anolon Advanced Home Hard-Anodized Nonstick Skillets for a Christmas gift for my spouse. We always had trouble of food sticking with those expensive brands. We decided to try these Anolon skillets and now we're glad we did. We've cooked all kinds of food with absolutely no sticking. Everything easily washed off wind very little scrubbing. I would recommend these skillets if your looking for a great non-stick solution.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality is remembered', 'author': 'Robert Chin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My old 10 and 12 inch non stick fry pans finally died from overuse, and I was forced to replace them. Little did I know how many choices and price points were out there. They ranged from dirt cheap to ridiculous. I eventually came upon my new favorites made by Anolon.I have nothing but praise for this company. The pans are a joy to use in part because of the handle design which give the pans a nice balance and a more secure feel. This is especially important if you’re in a busy kitchen or at home. The construction is first rate; heavy aluminum with a nice nonstick surface. No short cuts here in quality.And the best part is the price: I got both pans for what the fancier brands were charging for only one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The pans are very easy to use and to clean.', 'author': 'James Allen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The non stick surface works the best of any of my non stick pans I have ever bought. We like the handles very much for not worrying about heat on the handles. We use them mostly every day for cooking meals with easy cleanup.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great', 'author': 'Babs from G town', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just what I was looking for a really nice price for a nonstick pan that I can put in the oven. I need very little butter or any kind of oil when cooking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Utopia Kitchen Saute Fry Pan - Chefs Pan, Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Skillet - Frying Pan 6.5 Inch - Safe Grill Cookware for indoor & Outdoor Use - Cast Iron Pan (Green)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cast iron skillet review', 'author': 'Nobody', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A very substantial piece of iron. Great heat retention and very even cooking. A quality pan at a very good price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality', 'author': 'Paul Chiodo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a heavy cast iron pan, fry or bake works great', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Might need to reseason if you have some sticking.', 'author': 'Tegra Ford', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice pan. I like how it cooks. I don’t like that there’s some sticking and I may reseason the pan again after I try another few times of cooking. I’ve noticed that fully nonstick pans still have some sticking as well so.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice pan; bad packaging', 'author': 'Carol S.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a decent-quality cast-iron pan. I got it because I moved to a house with a ceramic cooktop, and the cast-iron pans I had have a rough texture that I was afraid would scratch my stove-top.This pan has an enamalled coating on the outside, so the surface that will come in contact with my stove is much smoother and less abrasive than my standard cast-iron pans. I got the blue enamel color (because it was cheapest!), and it looks o.k.My only complaint is the packaging, which was ridiculously inadequate. It was shipped in a regular box -- like a box it would come in if you bought it at a store, etc., i.e. a flimsy, non-corregated box. Not only was the box thin & flimsy, it wasn't even taped up, and the handle had actually punched a hole in one side and was hanging out of the box. So between the hole on the one end and the non-sealed open flap on the other, I was concerned that the pan had already been dropped, but I didn't see any marks or damage, so I guess I'll keep it.There were no care instructions with the pan (unless they were in the box, in which case I'm sure they dropped out and are long gone), just some badly translated instructions on the outside of the box, which basically made no sense.All-in-all, a good buy for the money, but the packaging definitely needs some improvement!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fabulous pan, affordable and well made! The double handle really aid in handling!', 'author': 'kar', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Important to season the pan after use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan, after re-seasoning it!', 'author': 'D. Loken', 'rating': 5, 'content': "UPDATE:Okay people, it's been a little over a month since I posted this review and how I re-seasoned it. I added another picture showing how much darker the color is, and it's still smooth as glass! And it will continue to get darker the more I use it!Okay people, I've had this cast iron skillet a few weeks now and here's my thoughts.When I got the skillet every surface of the skillet inside and out was very rough like sandpaper. So here's how I fixed it.I took an orbital sander and sanded it down the inside of the skillet. Then I took some Scotch Brite and used a lot of elbow Grease and scrapes all around the rest of the skillet until it was smooth. Then I took some oil, I usually use flaxseed oil, but was out so I used grapeseed oil and put a thin coat all over the pan with a lint free cloth. You could use any high smoke point oil you want. Then I preheated my oven to 400 degrees and put the pan inside upside down. Let it sit in there for an hour and turned the oven off. I let it rest in there overnight until the next day when it was cool and did the same thing, this time at 350 degrees. The next day I did the same thing one more time at 350 degrees.And now the skillet is really smooth top and bottom, and is re-seasoned, top and bottom. Nothing sticks to it, heat distribution is great because it's cast iron, and I can use it for virtually anything that I want to cook. And it goes from stove to oven without worrying about damaging the skillet.The thing is every time after you cook you have to clean it, without soap! Put it on the stovetop on medium heat to make sure you totally dry it off, get rid of the water! And while it's really warm want to put a quarter-size spot of oil on the bottom and take a lint free cloth and coat the inside on the skillet with that oil. This is called seasoning your cast iron skillet and it must be done every time after you use it!First few months I'll be using non-stick cookware on it until it gets a really good coating of seasoning on it. After that I could use metal cookware but for the meantime I'm just going to use nonstick cookware to protect that coating. If you re-season the cast iron skillet this way if it will have a bronze color when you're done seasoning, this is to be expected! It will get darker in time if the more you use it and the more you season it. You can look on YouTube and find many tutorials on re-season a cast iron skillet this way.If you take care of this pan it can last you a lifetime, or more, you can pass it down to your kids.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 21, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best cast irons I’ve had.', 'author': 'Rivers717', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have about 6 cast irons and this by far is still my favorite! I’ve had my utopia cast iron for almost 3 years and since then, I’ve gifted two to family members that had been wanting to try to cook on cast irons. Not a single time have I had an issue with rust but that mainly because I dry them as soon as I’m done washing them. Then lightly coat it. And every couple months I fire up my smoker to cook some brisket and take the opportunity to re-season my skillets. This 12” pan is great for family meals and making bread!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this pan!', 'author': 'Autumn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wanted a cast iron pan and was a bit wary of buying online but this one is great quality! You do have to season about 3-4 times but after that it works great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this smooth surface!', 'author': 'Kiki', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been using this pretty much on a daily basis and it cleans up so nicely. Love the large size -especially when cooking for gatherings or meal prep. The enameled surface on the bottom and handle makes it easier to clean up. What I love about this the most is the smooth surface— hard to find any more— most cast-irons sold now are textured.I also appreciate that I can sear and then pop in the oven to finish off! Every dish I make in this cast-iron so far comes out so delectable!For easy clean up: while still hot, wipe surface with paper towel to remove any remnants of food, for stuck on food-shake some kosher salt in the pan (the coarseness makes a great cleaning agent), wet bristles of a good scrub brush and scrub the salt around to remove any debris. Set pan back on the burner, wipe surface with paper towel, turn burner on, allow surface to dry completely, apply a small amount of avocado, canola, or olive oil to surface and spread around to coat a light/thin layer, let the heat penetrate the pan until you see a few streaks of smoke, turn burner off let cool!I’ve attached a couple pics of the most recent culinary divinities I made 🫶', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality cast iron', 'author': 'Pamela Perkins', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this because my collection of cast iron got misplaced when I moved. I will now be building back up a new collection. Good solid skillet no rust problems. Would purchase again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: imarku Frying Pan - 12inch Non Stick Frying Pan Honeycomb Cast Iron Skillets, Large Frying Pans Nonstick Dishwasher Safe, Oven Safe Kitchen Pans for Cooking With Stay-cool Wood Handle
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars In a League of Its Own', 'author': 'Francis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Having meticulously researched and tested numerous non-stick pans, I can confidently assert that the Imarku Frying Pan - 12inch is in a league of its own. Its honeycomb cast iron construction not only guarantees exceptional durability but also facilitates beautiful searing. The generous size provides ample cooking space, while the non-stick coating ensures effortless food release and hassle-free cleaning, even in the dishwasher. title: 11 Inch Nonstick Pan, Daily Cooking Pan, Deep frying pan with lid, non stick pan, sartenes para cocinar antiadherentes, Nonstick Skillet Pans, Fry pan with lid, Induction non stick pans
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best frying pan I have ever owned!', 'author': 'Dale A Terry', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've got to say I Love this frying pan! The pictures in the listing look smaller then actual skillet is when you open the box. It amazingly looks just like a large size iron skillet. It's well made and importantly has a true flat bottom that so far after making pancakes, bacon and eggs, hamburgers, 3 cheese and hamburger dinner and fried pork chops in hasn't warped, burned the food or had food stuck so bad that I had to use a plastic scrapper to scrape it out of the pan with afterward. When hubby cooks he doesn't understand that not everything needs to be cooked on high! The nonstick coating is even over the entire pan and shows no signs so far of peeling, chipping, scratching or bubbling but I threaten everyone with their life if they put any utensils in my pots and pans that aren't wooden, heat resistant plastic or silicone. This baby is bigger then you'd expect and I love the straight sides so no more slopping out food as your stirring it. I swear this pan feels and looks as big as some of my 12 inch chicken fryer skillets. Love that it also has a nice glass lid with silicone covering both the lid knob and the skillet handle although in my opinion they should have also covered the helping handle with it because it gets really hot and could cause you to burn your hand if you get in a hurry and forget to grab a potholder. I like the helping handle especially with this size pan because it'll get pretty heavy when your cooking a big meal. This skillet will hold an amazing amount of food so you could feed a large family with it. It's super easy to clean, just a bit of dawn and wash with a soft dishcloth or sponge. Speaking of sponge, the skillet comes with a nice terrycloth covered sponge on one side and a soft silver scrubby on the other side and it has a loop so you can hang it to dry with so no ugly germs growing on it before it gets dry and you can throw it in the dishwasher or washing machine and dryer if you like. The manufactures also nicely provide you with a screwdriver and enough extra screws and lock washers so that you can replace the screw on the handle and the lid knob twice plus one extra if you ever loose all the screws. The only thing you have to put on once you open the box is the handle and it only takes one screw so It literally take a minute to have it ready to wash and cook with. It comes well packed and promptly delivered. So far I haven't made anything that has stuck to my skillet and even though this skillet and lid are dishwasher safe I will opt to just wash mine in the sink since it's so easy and fast to wash. We have hard water which leaves white spots on black silicone plus I've found that dishwasher detergent seems to over time fade black or dark colored silicone and I'd rather keep my cooking pots and pans with silicone looking new as long as possible. I'd give this skillet a 10 star rating if I could. I can't tell you how many pots and pans over the many years I've been cooking that I have been utterly disappointed in but this baby looks, feels and cooks like a good quality product and I'd be willing to bet it will outlast some of the big named cookware on the market to day. Oh yeah the reason I bought this product was because it was affordable, it was the size I wanted, it had the straight sides I wanted, it looked like it had a true flat bottom, it had way more good customer reviews then bad ones, and most importantly I wanted to be able to cook on both my radiant halogen cooktop and my induction hotplate, the kids got me for Christmas a year ago and only had one pot that came with it to cook with on it. By the way this skillet lives up to their advertising, it really works great on my induction hotplate. I tried to find a skillet that you could use on both an induction hotplate and my radiant halogen cooktop. While I found several skillets that stated you could use their skillet on both radiant and induction cooking surfaces I found that in the reviews very few of them actually worked on customers induction hotplates or induction stove tops. Put your mind at rest this one works great on both as well as coil and gas. NOW for the cons on this skillet, They really need to also cover the helping handle with silicone because sooner or later someone will forget to grab a potholder and get burned. It heats evenly but does heat and little hotter where the burner is under the skillet although the sides are only slightly less hot then the center so this is not a big deal. The skillet takes a little bit more time to reach temperature then thinner cheaper skillets do but this isn't a deal breaker either. It's heavier then other skillets of the same size but not that much heavier and nowhere near as heavy as an iron skillet. They don't tell you that you can cook with it in the oven but I'm pretty sure it wouldn't be a problem as long as you don't bake over 400 degrees and never use it under a broiler at all or have your racks close the the heating element either lower or higher ones. I'm going to buy another one of these skillets before the company figures out what a great skillet they have and decides to raise their price to match the big named companies prices. I highly recommend this skillet to anyone who is looking for a good quality skillet with tall straight sides, a flat bottom that doesn't warp when hot, scratch resistant coating, a breeze to clean, can handle a meal for two or to feed a small army all at a very reasonable price, works and looks like an iron skillet. This baby is for you too!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars outstanding love this pan', 'author': 'very well made holds up', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I find that this is my new go to pan for almost everything I cook. The pan is large enough to cook 5 or six pieces of fried chicken ,and its deep enough to make meat and gravy dishes without making a mess on the stove. it comes with a really nice glass lid to prevent splatter. and . the non stick surface extends to the outside of the pan so its very easy to clean .The pan is heavy duty and holds heat very well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Still great after 2 years!', 'author': 'Asa', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I don't like to review products at purchase because that doesn't give me time to truly know the product. Unfortunately, I usually end up forgetting to go back and review. I'm in the market for a full set and stumbled across this familiar pan. I've had it for nearly 2 years, and I can honestly say that it is one of the two best nonstick pans I've owned. I use this pan at least once most days.Nonstick coating: Arguably the most important thing about this product. The pan started off super slick. Put something on it and it would slide right off. After two years, I can tell that the surface isn't as frictionless as when I purchased it. That said, unlike other pans, I can still cook in this one without oil and without fear of food sticking. I use silicone spatulas and handwash, but otherwise have not babied the pan. It's survived the oven.Other wear/tear: Minor scratches and scrapes from careless use, but the pan still looks pretty good, all things considered. One thing I'm not sure about is that the center of the pan bottom bows up slightly, so if you put oil in the pan it drifts to the edges. I don't recall if the pan was like that at purchase or became that way over time.I would definitely buy again, but I don't have to because this one is still awesome!Pros:-Nonstick coating is amazing!-Confirmed works on induction cooktops-Large size is fantastic-Survived oven use (without handle)Cons:-Handle did get a little loose around the 1-year mark (retightened, no problem)-Small handle is metal and gets hot-Center of pan bottom is slightly higher than outside radius-Not part of a set", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Pan', 'author': 'Shannon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’ve used it everyday since I got it about a week ago. No issues with sticking or any other cook surface issues. I noticed yesterday that the handle is loose, which is annoying, so hopefully it doesn’t get worse. It doesn’t get tighter when I try to tighten the screw. I may exchange it if it gets worse. Overall it’s very nice. I like the flat lid with the “vent” feature to let out the steam. I’m not regretful so I guess it was an okay buy as long as this handle doesn’t fall off. Pictures are as of today with a week or two of cooking and washing by hand except once, under its belt.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars great so far', 'author': 'Tuisto', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought this to replace another pan I had for many years where the non-stick coating was wearing off in the center. I would buy it again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight easy cleanup', 'author': 'Nancy Kelly', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is definitely a nonstick pan. The sauce pictured above rinsed off an hour later.Seriously, buy this pan, and if you know where I can get a full set, let me know!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Has the feel of cast iron, with the easy clean of a non-stick', 'author': 'Daniel D. I will say that if you drain grease off the meat you cook in your pans using the lid as a "strainer" like I do, the flat lid does make it harder to control, but that is just a very minor fault in what I have found to be a great product so far.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars The pan's extra depth is exactly what I wanted", 'author': 'Kathie Ballatore', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This 11" fry pan is so versatile and is an ideal size. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfection!!!', 'author': 'Angel', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Made my spinach egg white omelette in this pan this morning and it came out perfectly! It's not a lightweight, but still is easy to manage. The long handle is perfect and gives balance when the pan is carried. I love this pan for making things like risotto. I can cook pasta in a small amount of liquid, adding more as needed, which is perfect for me because as an older adult it's hard for me to manage large pots of water, especially when the water is very hot.And cleanup is incredibly easy. The pan's finish is completely stick-proof. I'm thinking of buying another one to keep as a backup in case anything happens to this one. I can't believe it's available for such a comparatively low price. I've tried to think of anything negative I could say about it, but there's nothing.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazingly non-stick, cooks quickly', 'author': 'Linda R', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've had other non-stick pans, but this one is so much better than those, they don't even belong in the same category. I still use a little olive oil when I cook -- habit -- but I think that's not really necessary. Even when the food starts to burn, it doesn't stick.RE: food starts to burn -- this pan cooks so much faster, and at lower heat, that it took some adjustments to my cooking. This pan cooks well with about 2/3rds the amount of heat as my other pans, in about 2/3rds the time. Now that I've figured all that out, I hardly ever burn the meat. <grin>Cleanup is a breeze. I wipe the pan with a damp paper towel as soon as I put the food on the plate, just to get rid of the leftover oil, sauce, whatever. (Probably not necessary, but I'd rather throw that stuff in the trash than run it down the drain.) When the pan is cool, I set it in the sink, add a few drops of dish liquid, fill it with water, and let it set for a while. I go back later and use a dishcloth or paper towel to rub the surface of the pan with the soapy water, rinse, and it's done. There's been no scrubbing necessary. (Maybe if I burned something to a crisp, but I haven't done that.)I bought the 8-inch skillet for single-person meals (4 oz meat) and the 12-inch skillet for family-sized meals (1 lb. meat). I like them so much that I've just ordered the 11-inch flat griddle; I expect it'll make reheating leftover pizza much easier. These pans are absolutely wonderful, and I highly recommend them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Non stick, great brand', 'author': 'sharlene m reed', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is nonstick, oven safe', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars great for cooking eggs.', 'author': 'james m.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Scratches fairly easily, when using plastic constructed utensils, but nothing severe. title: MICHELANGELO 10 Inch Frying Pan with Lid, Nonstick Frying Pan with Healthy Granite Coating, Nonstick Pan with Anti-Scald Handle, Induction Compatible
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lo e this pan', 'author': 'vvokie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am almost 75 years old and picking up an 8 lb frying pan is almost.impossible This pan is.light weight and the surface is perfect, food slides off and cleans really easy. Love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars BY FAR THE BEST!!!', 'author': 'Talk2dedgy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ve had A LOT of cookware over the years... This 8" MICHELANGELO is BY FAR THE BEST i\'ve ever owned... no stick... sturdy... easy to clean... food cooks evenly... and the heat is controllable... AND the lid doesn\'t warp in the heat. SO GOOD!!! When it\'s time to retire my other pans I know what I\'ll replace them with.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is one terrific pan!', 'author': 'REM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a really beatifully designed and made pan — the no-stick surface is a wonder! Nothing sticks to it, not even water! Cooks great and keeping foods from burning is easy. The handles stay cool, which is a nice feature, and the domed glass top is another. For this price, this is a sure bet. Nice work, Michelangelo!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not the prettiest pan, but it works very well', 'author': 'Sandra Dyl', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Most of my cookware is stainless steel or cast iron, but I like to have one small, non-stick pan, and my old one was scratched and needed to be replaced. I looked for a pan that was not Teflon that had some thickness and looked like it might last. I also wanted a pan that was guaranteed food safe.This pan is thick and sturdy, and it heats evenly. It is raised very slightly from the outside towards the center, which has both pros and cons, but the raised middle is so slight that it is barely noticeable, and I would not hesitate to cook an omellete in it. It does let the grease drain towards the outside of the pan rather than staying under the food, which it nice. I like the glass cover that lets me see food as it cooks, and it is about as easy to clean as any other glass lid.One caution: the directions say to never use the pan above medium heat, and I have been careful not to do that. Even on medium, the pan heats quickly and gets hot enough, and I have found that at medium temperature the pan cooks very evenly without burning or scorching. However, my gas stove does not have a really high flame or get as hot as some other gas stoves even on the burner with the highest btu, and people with stoves that get really hot will need to be very careful and might need to use low heat rather than medium to avoid damage to the pan. It will depend upon individual stoves. So far, nothing sticks, although I have not tried really sticky cheese yet. It cleans up very nicely with soap and water, and I have not had to scrub it. Time will tell whether or not that lasts.The handle is wood look-alike, and it stays cool when cooking on a stove top. It is very wide - especially where it joins the pan - which makes the pan steadier to hold and pour with less strain on my hand and wrist and without slipping or over-tipping.The only reason for 4 stars is that I personally find this pan kind of ugly because of the speckling and the light-colored wood look-alike handle. That is just my personal taste, and it isn't a serving dish.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific non-stick pan!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had purchased one of these non-stick pans at the same time my husband purchased a different brand non-stick pan. Me - no trouble whatever I cooked and clean-up was a breeze! My husband\'s - not so good. I ended up buying him one of these for his use!...pancake and easy-over eggs and things that you "flip" - because the food actually flips and doesn\'t stick! I would highly recommend this. I do not put mine in the dishwasher because I don\'t want the detergent affecting the wooden handle finish. Actually, no need to put it in there anyway because the clean up is easy - wipe out!! Once in a while I do use some dish detergent to give it a fresh clean, then season it a little like you would an iron skillet. After two years, it still looks new!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made', 'author': 'Person', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Looking for a sturdy but lightweight frying pan? Here you go-nice easy feel and a bit handier than my adorable little 8 inch one-very happy with it and the wooden handle on pan and lid are wonderful as you don’t constantly get burned and need oven mitts to handle! Highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 12inch pan', 'author': 'Bozskills', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is an excellant frying pan,for the price.
