title: Mueller 10-Inch Non Stick Frying Pans, No PFOA or APEO, Heavy Duty German Stone Coating Cookware, Aluminum Body, EverCool Stainless Steel Handle, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I’ve been cooking over 60 years and NEVER had a skillet this good', 'author': 'iTerk', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My new skillet just arrived but I've already run salmon and a couple of breakfasts across it. It appears to be very even heat distribution despite the slight slant of my outdoor gas kitchen. Here in the FL Keys I cook under shelter outside the regular kitchen on a serious two burner propane Camp Chef stove to keep the heavy flavors from recirculating with the 24/7 air conditioning. Even with the heavy winds the last couple days the pan has been showing very uniform heat. That's a big deal for me cooking delicate fish or even bacon, eggs etc. So far this has been the best skillet I've ever had. It has been easy to clean and almost non stick even with hot pork, a traditional problem. I'm going to offer an early vote and highly recommend this one.**************. This is a follow up after a few months in service. I don’t go out of my way to praise things I expect to perform. This skillet goes way beyond my best expectation. Be sure to season it when new but I use this, as above, on a serious gas burner. I have been astounded. It wipes clean even after sautéing fish or cooking multiple batches of bacon or butter soaked eggs. Even the edges wipe clean with little water and no scrubbing. I’m tempted to buy a second one just because the really good stuff in life tends to stop being available when I do want another…maybe as a gift…It’s been 9 mos. I stumbled on my original write up. My skillet is starting to discolor a bit but that’s because I use it hard, almost every day. It is awesome…still. title: Granitestone 14 Inch Family Size Nonstick Frying Pan, Large Induction Skillet for Cooking, Oven Safe Dishwasher Safe
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The first one that lived up to its hype', 'author': 'LegoDad', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I use a 12" pan just about every day for dinner. So my pans get a lot of use. I had one that lasted really well for about 2 years that finally was no longer cleaning up well, so it was time to get a new one. I tried several, and most didn\'t last a week. Even the hammered copper ones that are on TV commercials all the time was useless after about four days.THIS one so far has lasted more than a month, which puts it heads and shoulders above all the rest I\'ve been trying. Even after a month it\'s performing as it did when I first received it. Non stick is outstanding, cleanup is generally just rinsing under the faucet with the spray function, and it\'s 99% clean. Some swipes then with my dishcloth and it\'s ready for use again, no scrubbing necessary no matter what I\'ve been making.The side already has a stain on it from where something poured out down the side a bit when putting things onto a plate, but I don\'t care about the exterior. It probably would\'ve cleaned well had I known it was there and gotten to it, but it sat for an hour or so before I got to it, and by that time it was well set. Simply wiping the outside sooner would probably avoid this for anyone else.But it was nice to finally try one that advertised how wonderful it was, and actually have it BE a great pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Use on induction stove', 'author': 'MS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Recently switch to induction stove, which I love, of course had to find all new cookwareThis has worked perfectly replacing my big skillet for eggs, bacon etcWorks perfect, non stick great, good price', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love it but heavy!', 'author': 'Monika', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I really like this pan. Stewart', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got the 8" and 10" skillet set. Not big enough for me. You can fry 3 eggs in there but they are really touching or overlapping. Guess I need the 12" skillet.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great, long lasting pans!', 'author': 'Tom', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’ve owned these pans for over two years now and decided to write a review today. These pans pretty much look exactly like they did when I bought them, their nonstick coating is still working like it did the first time I used them. They are excellent, durable pans that heat up quickly. I store them on top of each other and put a folded up white flower sack cloth in between them- this has kept them from getting any scratches inside or outside of the pans. I highly recommend doing this because, as I said, they pretty much look brand new still, and I use them almost every day! I also bought the large 14 inch pan which is not part of the set but pictured in my photo. Also a great pan with lots of room for cooking large quantities of food in one pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Slightly Larger and Lighter! Update: 12/16/23', 'author': 'Granny Gems', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Pro: I wanted to replace my 8 quart black Circulon Stockpot I'd own for 14 years as it was looking worn out from weekly use. It came with a great glass lid that felt snug and also fit a skillet that wasn't the same brand, but came in handy. It still works great and my friend has already said he would like it to make chili in larger quantities. That's how durable it has been for me, although it is quite a bit heavier than the new 10 quart gray stockpot that I received. I can see that my new one is lighter because the metal edges are much thinner now, but the larger lid that comes with it is still a very snug fit. Unfortunately, it is too big for any of my other cookware now, but I appreciate how much easier it is to lift it and yet holds more for when I make food for potlucks to share with the community. I had to rearrange my cookware in order to fit this larger pot more easily in my tiny kitchen, but that was fine since I only have room for one stockpot. The description of the new one looks identical on the inside, but not on the bottom, so I will have to update my review after using it for at least a month as to how durable it is compared to my old black one. It's not a whole lot of difference in size, but I can fit the older one inside the larger one up to the handles without the lids on and still have a 1/4 inch gap on all sides. I wouldn't recommend that to avoid scratching both, but mention it to indicate the slight size difference.Con: I don't have any at this point, so I've rated it a 4 until I've tested it out on cooking spinach, cream cheese, spaghetti, sauces, ground turkey sausage, beans for chili, and such. I don't use metal utensils, and prefer to use silicone covered spatulas, spoons, and tongs with metal inside of them for strength and length of tools that reach all the way down to keep the food moving. Keep the heat on lower to medium temperatures to minimize the need to prevent scorching and to protect from scratches. I don't have a dishwasher, so hand washing is all I can comment on as to durability. Hope that helps folks decide if this stockpot is for you. I'm happy to recommend it as it meets my needs just fine. UPDATED!! Not pleased with the bottom of this stockpot because it doesn't have the same grid type on it that protected it from scratching on the electric stove! It heats well just like the older one, but now it is subject to scratching on the bottom of the pot because they no longer use the grid on the bottom. I've downgraded it from 4 stars to 3, and that's a shame. It used to be the best brand I'd ever own.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pans!', 'author': 'Matt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have a circulon pot and pan set, so I know they’re good quality and the non stick lasts a long time. I bought this one for my girlfriend, and I’m probably going to buy one for myself too! It’s big! Love how non-stick it is, and having a lid is great for steaming vegetables and preventing a mess. Love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Gotham Steel Hammered Egg Pan Nonstick, 5.5 Inch Small Frying Pan Nonstick, Egg Frying Pan, Small Pan for Cooking, Copper Pan Skillet with Rubber Grip Handle, Dishwasher & Oven Safe, 100% Toxin Free
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gotham Steel Hammered Copper Collection - A Sleek and Stylish Addition to Your Kitchen!', 'author': 'Zephyr', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Gotham Steel Hammered Copper Collection for my kitchen, and I must say, it has exceeded my expectations in both functionality and style. This cookware set truly deserves all the positive buzz it's been getting!First off, let's talk about the aesthetics. The hammered copper finish gives the pots and pans a stunning, rustic look that instantly adds a touch of elegance to my kitchen. It's a real showstopper! The gleaming copper exterior combined with the sleek black handles makes this collection a visual delight.But looks aren't everything, and I'm happy to report that the performance matches the beauty. The non-stick surface of the cookware is exceptional. Whether I'm frying eggs or simmering sauces, nothing sticks to these pans. I no longer have to worry about scrubbing and scraping after each use. Plus, the even heat distribution ensures that my food cooks evenly, giving me consistent and delicious results every time.Another fantastic feature of the Gotham Steel Hammered Copper Collection is its durability. Despite regular use, the pots and pans have held up exceptionally well. The sturdy construction and high-quality materials give me confidence that this cookware will last for years to come. It's definitely a worthwhile investment.In terms of functionality, this collection has all the essentials. It includes a variety of sizes, from small saucepans to a large stockpot, catering to all my cooking needs. The lids fit snugly, preventing any steam from escaping and helping to retain moisture and flavors in my dishes. The ergonomic handles stay cool to the touch, making it easy and safe to handle the cookware even when it's hot.Lastly, cleaning is a breeze with the Gotham Steel Hammered Copper Collection. I appreciate that it's dishwasher safe, but honestly, it's so easy to wipe clean that I often prefer handwashing. A quick rinse and a gentle wipe with a sponge, and the cookware looks as good as new.To sum it up, the Gotham Steel Hammered Copper Collection is a true winner in my kitchen. Its stunning appearance, outstanding non-stick performance, and long-lasting durability make it a must-have for any cooking enthusiast. If you're looking to elevate your culinary experience while adding a touch of elegance to your kitchen, I highly recommend this cookware set. You won't be disappointed!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 5.5" & 10" reviewed! Works as intended, efficient and non-stick.', 'author': 'Good Reviews', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Amazon won\'t allow separate reviews for multiple sizes, so both the 5.5" egg pan and the 10" skillet with lid are reviewed here. --The 5.5" egg pan is big enough to cook two eggs or a large patty or three links. Thermal performance: The pan heats up to full cooking temperature quickly and does a good job maintaining that on the medium heat setting. Non-stick: I always use a little oil/butter to get food started, but the non-stick coating and reasonable turning times work well to keep food from sticking. Cleaning: Cleaning is easy, although the top rim and underside need a little special care to keep clean and preserve the pan\'s quality without causing abrasion during cleaning. The low sides make it easy to pour food out. The handle provides plenty of control and heat insulation. The pan is smooth, well-finished.--10" Skillet with Lid: This pan is big enough to cook about four servings of meat and vegetables. Thermal performance: The pan seems to take longer than I expected to heat up to full cooking temperature, but the lid helps shorted that time, and once reaches the desired temperature, it does a good job maintaining that. This might be due to the decently-thick bottom clad. The sides certainly do eventually get hot and help cook larger volumes, even on the medium heat setting. Non-stick: I always use a little oil/butter to get food started, but the non-stick coating and reasonable turning times work well to keep food from sticking. Cleaning: Cleaning is easy, although the top rim and underside need a little special care to keep clean and preserve the pan\'s quality without causing abrasion during cleaning. Design: I wish there were more curvature of the sidewalls to the bottom, since it would help pour food out easier than this angled version does, but on the other hand this design reduces as much slosh and splash when stirring or moving food around. The handle provides plenty of control. The lid fits well. The handle can get hot enough to require the use of a pad, etc. to hold when lifting. Finish: The pan is almost entirely well-finished and polished, with a few exceptions. The hollow handle exhibits sheet metal edges which have not been ground and polished finely, thus leaving the feel of a sharp edge. There is a slight risk of laceration during handling, especially in cleaning and storing, although it would take a quick or forceful action of the hand or fingers to cause injury. Otherwise, there are very slightly rough areas left around the upper rims of the rivets on the pan and lid. This is a common occurrence in similar products.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent but one minor flaw', 'author': 'Mrs. Snyder', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I was so excited to get this pan. it is the perfect size for a quick serving of eggs. Gotham steel pans cook evenly and clean easily. And this one looked cool. The one minor flaw is that the handle sticks up higher than the rim and prevents me from putting a flat plate a top of the pan in order to steam my eggs. This is very disappointing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!', 'author': 'Pat M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super even cooking, nothing stuck, cleaning a breeze. Holds a lot of food and looks great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars !!!NOT for induction!!!', 'author': 'Joe', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I see a lot of people using these on glass cook tops, but no pictures of induction cook tops. title: Lodge Cast Iron Skillet with Red Silicone Hot Handle Holder, 12-inch
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan!', 'author': 'Alejandro M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this pan so much! I can't believe I spent so many years of my life without a cast iron pan. Fact is, I just never understood how easy these are to cook with and maintain. Yes, you have to season it. Yes, that takes a little getting used to at first. No, it's not hard and really doesn't take much time to maintain. It's much easier than I thought it would be, and I love the way my food comes out!Once properly seasoned, this pan is as non-stick as any other pan I've ever used. I did the initial seasoning in my gas grill. That way you don't fill your kitchen with smoke. You can certainly use a regular oven if you don't have a grill. Give it a good 2-3 seasonings before using it to cook. There are plenty of articles and videos online explaining how to season a cast iron pan.As for the cooking, if you haven't used cast iron, you don't know what you're missing. The heat distribution and retention are amazing. For best results, make sure to pre-heat to your desired temp for several minutes before adding oil or food. Cooking with oil also helps maintain the non-stick surface, so the surface improves the more you use the pan. I've used this for steaks, fried/scrambled eggs, bacon, arepas, and shepherd's pie. I find myself looking for more recipes I can use it for. I haven't tried using it on my gas grill yet, but I'm eager to try. This thing makes me want to cook more!I like the 12-in size, though many people may prefer the 10.25-in version. I can prepare a NY Strip and a Fillet in this pan at the same time, with room to spare for a butter baste. It's a bit large for a 3-egg scramble, but still works well.The one down-side is the weight. You're not likely to flip an omelet with this puppy, unless you have very strong wrists. Of course, that's not specific to this brand - it's a cast iron thing. Maybe the 10.25-in version would be easier to handle for some purposes. That said, this pan feels like it's going to last for generations to come.Oh, and if it seems like I'm being sponsored by Lodge, please know that I'm not. I'm just a regular guy sharing his thoughts about a product I truly enjoy using. Happy cooking!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great skillet, really big.', 'author': 'Elizabeth J. Spears', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like that this is a good sturdy cast iron skillet. It is really big and holds a whole meal. It can be put in the oven as well. What I don\'t like is that is SO heavy (well, what did I expect?) and I have to use both hands to hold it. It does have the lip on the opposite end of the handle to help with picking it up. While it was "preseasoned," food stuck to it. I had to season it myself over a period of time. The trick is to keep using it and keep adding lard and heating it up and then letting it always have some grease in it. It takes time to get it where its really stick-free.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The skillet I always wanted!', 'author': 'Knownasjim', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Well my skillet and glass lid arrived today in two different deliveries. I almost immediately tried cooking some bacon just to test it out. I put the bacon in the pan and let it heat to medium. According to what I had read online, that would let the bacon render, prevent curling, and make sure it wouldn’t stick. When it was time to flip the strips over, I learned that they were pretty much adhered to the pan. I had to scrape it up in little bits.Refusing to be defeated by a pan, I carefully cleaned it with hot water and scrubbed to get off all the stuck bits. Then, I followed the directions to do the stove top seasoning method two times. Once it was cooled all the way, I decided on a major test. I cooked four more strips of center-cut bacon, two over easy eggs, and a kimchi pancake for supper. NOTHING stuck! Everything came out of the pan looking like it had been prepared for a magazine photo article. I waited for the pan to cool down completely, took it to the sink, and rinsed it with hot water. Then, I wiped it dry with a paper towel before giving it a rub down with a nearly non-existent coat of canola oil. It is now sitting on the stove waiting for my next adventure.I am 100% satisfied with this skillet so far. I do caution other buyers to just pretend it is not “pre-seasoned” and season it. These are the instructions I followed:Seasoning your cast iron skillet on the stovetop is a simple process that builds up a protective layer of polymerized oil, making it naturally non-stick and preventing rust. Here's a quick guide:What you'll need:Your cast iron skilletHigh smoke point oil like canola, grapeseed, or avocado oilPaper towelsTongs (optional)Steps:Wash and dry your skillet. Scrub away any food residue with warm water and dish soap. Rinse thoroughly and dry completely with paper towels or heat it on the stovetop over low heat for a few minutes to evaporate any remaining moisture.Heat the skillet over medium heat. Let it get nice and hot for about 5 minutes.Pour in a thin layer of oil. About 1 tablespoon should be enough for a 12-inch skillet. Tilt the pan to coat the bottom and sides evenly.Wipe out the excess oil. Use a paper towel to spread the oil around the pan in a thin, even layer. You don't want any pooling oil.Heat the oil until it smokes. This takes about 2-3 minutes. Keep an eye on it and adjust the heat if necessary to avoid burning the oil.Turn off the heat and let the pan cool. The oil will polymerize as it cools, creating the seasoned layer.Repeat steps 3-6 two or three more times. Each layer builds upon the previous one, creating a stronger and more durable seasoning.Wipe away any excess oil and store your skillet. Once the pan is cool, use a paper towel to wipe away any remaining oil. Store your skillet in a dry place.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive quality', 'author': 'Anonymous', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was a gift for my partner. He loves it!It has very impressive quality. It cooks evenly, even on an old electric stovetop. This thing could survive a bomb.My partner also has a stand alone induction top. It doesn’t not seem to work well with that. The cast iron take forever to heat on induction and seem to only get hot in the very center.The cast iron is so heavy it’s challenge to lift / pour food out of. This would not be a good fit for someone older / with mobility concerns.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lodge Cast Iron Fry Pan', 'author': 'Аmazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’m in love with this pan. I fry EVERYTHING in it & it pleases me to know that you’re also gaining some health benefits from frying in a cast iron pan, because iron gets put into your food. Cooks everything so even & the pan acquires more flavor with the different foods that you fry. Also love the little silicone handle cover. 💯 % recommend the “Lodge” cast iron pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love cast iron!', 'author': 'cininthecity', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I love cooking with cast iron--the even heat distribution, the ability to cook at high temperatures, the way it creates a hard sear--cast iron is the best, imho. This pan specifically is a good size for cooking for a small family. It can handle 2-3 large chicken breasts or steaks, approximately 1/2-3/4 lb of bacon or a bunch of veggies. It was easy to season and clean up is a breeze with hot water and a scrub daddy.The reason for the 4 stars? The wimpy little red handle is useless. It doesn't fit properly and moves around when the handle is being used which is potentially dangerous. Do yourself a favor and buy a sturdier silicone piece or invest in good potholders.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy & good quality', 'author': 'Roseanne Haglin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my first cast iron skillet! It is convenient and seasoned easily. Gives food a much richer flavor.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great cast iron at a good price.', 'author': 'Christopher Barry', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very solid well made cast iron.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Still A Great Cooking Pan For The Money', 'author': 'Bill T.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I have a few older Lodge pans, and noticed that the finish on this pan was rougher than the finish on the older pans. However, the rougher finish did not appear to significantly affect it's performance. I find the non-stick qualities to be just fine without the need for sanding to create a smoother finish. The pan came pre-seasoned, but I oven seasoned it with two coats of Crisco before cooking. It passed the egg test with flying colors. For most applications, I cook at low-medium to medium heat settings. It takes a good 5 minutes for the pan to come up to temp., but once it does it cooks evenly. I've used it for pancakes and crepes, and they both brown evenly from end to end. Cast iron is very versatile, and I use it almost as much in the oven as on the cooktop. The Lodge may not be the most stylish pan, but does what it's supposed to do.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A kitchen classic (but they can crack)', 'author': 'J. Fraser', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I just replaced a Lodge cast iron skillet that I had for years that has cracked thru. I don't know how it happened, but it did. I didn't abuse it or drop it and I never put it in the dishwasher. I like it so much and had it for years that I bought another. They are worth it.I gave this 4 stars for two reasons. 1) the pan is heavy. (this is both good and bad; good for heat distribution and bad for your wrist.) 2) they can crack for no reason (rare but it happens.)I should say I've owned other lodge cast iron skillets and had them for more than a decade or two and handed them down to my kids and they still have/use/love them. So, your mileage may vary.great skillet for so many high heat cooking styles.this is a 5 star item but I give it 4 stars because you need to be aware this is a heavy pan and these do fail every now and again, but the cost is so reasonable that it doesn't matter. buy this, you will love it.The fact they provide a silicone handle cover is a plus. You can't touch that otherwise.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: KitchenAid Stainless Steel Frying Pan/Skillet, 12 Inch, Brushed Stainless Steel
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and beautiful pan', 'author': "apricot's mom", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is a good pan. The handle is good quality, does not get heated with the pot, and is helpflu in handling the pan. The pan is made of sturdy, thick layer of material. Has scale engraved on the inner side which is superful helpful in pouring just the right amount into the pan. The spout is another great feature of the pan. Also, have to mention, it does look nice with its great finish. To be honest, this pan at this price is a great buy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just Bought my Second One', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this saucepan so much. It’s the perfect size for a lot of things like heating up soup for one person, melting butter, and so much more. The measurements on the inside are helpful. The handle stays cool. It’s a good quality pan at an affordable price. The best part is the pour spouts on each side. I just bought a second one to keep in our RV.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great stock pot', 'author': 'Squirrel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this stock pot for my best friend who just purchased her first house. She was incredibly happy when she opened this gift. Great quality, thick pot. Kitchenaid never disappoints with the quality or style.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars cooks in 1/2 of time but don't like the steamer pan", 'author': 'tulsadoberman', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I just got these yesterday, January 5, 2024, and immediately through everything in the dishwasher.They came out just fine so they are dishwasher safe.I really like how heavy and solid they feel and the silicone coated handles on the pans and lids are great to get a firm grip on and avoid the heat.I've only used the large frying pan this morning, January 6, 2024 to make my breakfast of a quarter pound sausage pattie, hashbrowns, 2 pieces of French toast, and 2 scrambled eggs.Normally with my old frying pan, I would weigh my sausage and flatten it out and then put it right in the frying pan before turning on the burner. I've figured out that it took 20 minutes for the first side to get done and then flipping it over for 10 minutes for the second side.However, I noticed with this new frying pan, it started burning after 10 minutes and flipped it over and the second side started to burn after 5 minutes so it only took 1/2 of the time to make my sausage pattie.This was a pain because I always had time to wash my potato and shred it for the hashbrowns, get out all the ingredients for the French toast and scrambled eggs before I even needed to flip the sausage pattie but today, I really had to bust my butt to get everything else ready.Grabbing the lid handle was easy with the silicone coating since my old frying pan had a glass lid with a glass handle and the handle would get really hot.Hashbrowns also cooked in 1/2 of the time and they stuck a little bit because I forgot how fast the sausage pattie cooked so the hashbrowns also cooked much faster.The French toast also stuck but only a little but I kept close to them flipping them after 2 minutes.The scrambled eggs also only took about 3 minutes instead of about 5 minutes.Haven't cleaned the large frying pan since it's still hot and wanted to get this out right away.Now, what I don't like about these is the steamer pan because it only fits about 1/3 of the way into the medium sauce pan instead of all the way down. I was really hoping to use it like a strainer for making spaghetti so I didn't need to get the large colander out to drain the spaghetti.I was hoping to boil the spaghetti right in the steamer pan and pull it right out draining all the water at the same time.Other than the steamer pan, I really like the feel, weight, and sturdiness of these pans so far but I've only used the large frying pan and lid. If I have any issues with the other pans, I'll update this and post about them but I'm guessing there won't be any issues since how well the large frying pan did this morning.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful pans.', 'author': 'Earlene', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought these pans because they were Kitchenaid. The clean easily and these are the best non-stick pans I have ever used. I've bought 4 or 5 that have not held up. These are great. The brushed Stainless Steel outside does not show cleaning marks.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works on induction cooktops!', 'author': 'SteveRI', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This works on induction cooktops, which is why I bought it. I needed a one quart sauce pan with a cover and pour spouts. This fit the bill precisely. It is a regular workhorse, easy to clean, and heats stuff up. What more could you ask for !', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Frying pan', 'author': 'Sandra R', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was a gift, it looked very good quality and I have seen it on her drying rack, cleaned up very good. She had not complained about it not cooking well, so i am guessing it does, or I would have heard a statement so.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Basic Pan!', 'author': 'eg326', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Its a great pan! Ensure you have a nice scotch bright sponge to keep it shiny!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent', 'author': 'Debra H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is now my daily used saucepan in the kitchen. I love it because I don’t have to worry about the utensils I use with it & it heats evenly if I’m preparing a meal you can bet it’s in use. Thank You!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good thermal conductivity', 'author': 'Subin Chae', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Great product!But I feel sad about the dent after I unwrap whole things :'(", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: DELARLO Whole body Tri-Ply Stainless Steel 12inch Frying Pan, Oven safe induction skillet,pots and pans set,Suitable for All Stove (Detachable Handle)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No rivets, easy cleaning, uniform temp. distribution', 'author': 'Tinkererguy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Having been on the business end of countless cooking vessels, the first thing I will say is I dislike handles with rivets protruding into the inside of the pan. I have not seen any riveted pans that are NSF certified, due to bacteria/food being difficult to clean, especially with dishwasher-only process. There's no good reason not to weld the handles, or attaching hardware, other than maybe being cheaper? It's nice to use a spatula and cleanly swipe the inside of the pan to get what you're cooking off the sides....rivets prevent that. The removable handle(s) are a nice touch. I have never had any issues with the nuts or attachment process. Maybe some people did but could be a defect in the threads, or overtightening. Put a drop of oil on the threads before tightening, and lift the handle up and down while final-tightening, which allows a completely solid connection, which I have never had loosen. BTW, the thread is a 5mmx.8mm common metric thread, so if you lose a nut (they give you extras) you can buy them on amazon. Some pans have the handle permanently welded to the pan but I like the removable feature, allowing storage in tight areas, or I sometimes keep it off and use the pan like a pie pan to bake with, and the handle being off, makes it less cumbersome in the oven. If you make skillet-browned cornbread, this works almost as well as a cast iron skillet. There are no lids with this but the price is great, and you can buy lids, or if you're like me, you already have lids that fit these saute pans. The lip of these pans are flared out, making pouring liquid/stew/etc out clean with no drips down the side of the pan. I measured temperatures across the bottom of the pan while heating on an induction cooktop. The temperature was very uniform across the interior, and the magnetic coupling to the induction coils was very efficient, indicating a good magnetic stainless steel used in the mfg process. To season the pan, I use either coconut oil, or avacado oil (not spray oil, as the lecithin used for release agent will break down under high heat). So heat the pan to around 400F (after first cleaning it), then wipe the oil to coat the pan's inside with a paper towel and oven mitten(s). This will greatly reduce sticking. So to recap, great pan, flat bottom, great handle and attachment hardware, easy to clean and use. Price is also very good for high quality pans. I've cooked several meals, cornbread, and desserts with them, and am still happy with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for the Price', 'author': 'Leonardo Gonzalez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Came in quick and it looks real sturdy. Been using it for everything and its way better than any nonstick nonsense. Cooks nice and evenly and is easy to clean. Got it for like $30 and its worth it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A terrific value!', 'author': 'Cactus99', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'First, in full disclosure. I am no chef and I purchased this for home use. I do however have a professional background as a food and beverage manager, and do know my way around a kitchen :) To be honest, whether this works for you will primarily depend on two things 1) Your expectations, and 2) The type of stove that you have or primarily use (Gas, Exposed Heating Element/Electric Coil, Induction, Glass Top with Enclosed Heating Element). "Even Heat Distribution" will depend not only on the pan, but also the type of stove and the size of the burner. So when reading reviews, look at the reviews using the same stove type that you will be cooking with :) I like and prefer induction, but at the moment I have a glass top with enclosed elements. I find that the pan heats up alright, but will be a bit slower than with gas or induction. For home use, I find this pan to work just fine :) The materials, finish, handle, comfort and heft (solidity) are all better than I had expected in this price range. I think this is a terrific value at this price point. Please note that as this is stainless steel, it will clean differently than a "non stick" type of pan :) Also, it feels very solid, and has the weight to back it up, so it is significantly heavier than a "non stick" pan. So if you might not have the hand, wrist or arm strength for heavy items, this may not be the right choice for you (this would not be a good choice for my 75+ yr old mother.) Also, this will not fit your needs if you want a "branded" pan with snob appeal or status benefits. (Those pans can cost 300% and 400% more). Lastly, it\'s impossible to speak of durability with new purchases. So, what\'s the bottom line here? I really think that most people with appropriate expectations will really like this pan! It will do its job well, and will look good and feel good in your hand while doing it! And it feels like it will last for years to come. Can you spend more on a pan? Yes. If you are a regular person, do you need to? No. I can afford to buy a more expensive pan if I wish, but there is no need to. I am happy with this purchase at a great price, and I think you will be as well. I give it a thumbs up :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy & non stick', 'author': 'Jay M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was adequately satisfied and impressed with the quality & the dependability of the pan. And you can’t beat the price. I am a huge fan of Hexclad products however - I was on a budget. I’m thoroughly glad that I chose this brand and type. Really happy I chose it !', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pan', 'author': 'fran', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Perfect size and he's a nice weight to it. Also easy to clean.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars WASTE OF MONEY', 'author': 'shawna', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Well I have tried eggs/ sausage/ bacon/ french toast and many other things in this pan. I am no chef, just want a pan to cook things in. Everything I cook in this pan cooks in the middle and not the outskirts. I posted the video to show the raw pork sausages on the outside and cooked ones in the center. When I say center, it is just the center and very small radius. Takes 2x as long to cook something as when the center ones are cooked I take them out and have to move the ones on the outside to the center and cook them. Eggs too. 1/2 cooks 1/2 doesnt. Maybe I will just stick with those walmart pans as they did not have this trouble. Very dissapointed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Even better than expected', 'author': 'Patrobot', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A great pan for a reasonable price. The brushed finish is well executed and looks good.After seasoning once I had no problems cooking most finicky foods like eggs and chicken.I have had stainless cookware that would stick to cooking oil, this pan is totally fine to work with.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value!', 'author': 'Angelo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This 12-inch stainless steel pan is a great deal! I snagged it for just $26 (after a $10 clip-on coupon on the product page), and it has exceeded my expectations, especially considering the price.The heat distribution is good, seems about average from other pans I have seen reviewed. The pan takes longer than I expected to heat up, but it being my first stainless pan it could be normal. Following simple YT tutorials, I had zero sticking issues with my first-ever stainless steel cook - fried eggs and pancakes turned out perfectly. There is some discoloration after cooking however I read it is normal and doesn't affect the food and can be removed with some elbow grease(there are plenty of tutorials online how).The rivetless design is a nice addition and one I don't see in many stainless pans. The pan has a nice weight to it giving it a high-end feel. I personally really like the handle, It feels very comfortable in my hand and I can get a good grip, I was able to install it with no issues.In summary, my initial review is that this stainless steel pan offers really good performance and at its price point it is a great value. A solid 5-star rating for me!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The only pan I will ever need', 'author': 'JO', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wanted to wait until I began to use this pan regularly before I wrote my review.My husband hates my old small Revere Ware skillet. He tends to use higher heat than is necessary and it sticks.This new pan came with instructions! I found that if I follow them my food does not stick.My husband seared a steak and he said he ruined my new skillet. I said "no". Don\'t worry. I put water in it, a touch of Dawn and boiled the water. Everything came out with ease.I would love to have one of their pots to see if they work as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great pan', 'author': 'Kim', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This pan cooks evenly. Food comes out good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Rachael Ray Brights Hard Anodized Nonstick Frying Pan / Fry Pan / Hard Anodized Skillet - 8.5 Inch, Gray with Orange Handles
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price', 'author': 'lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this grilling pan. The nonstick is excellent cooks and cleans up like a dream. The pan itself cooks very evenly with great heat distribution. the size and depth are perfect for my needs, and it is heavy, not light and cheap. made well... I plan on purchasing a set of frying pans I love her product so much...', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I then noticed the attractive orange handles they were made and the beautiful clear lids with clear view glass view', 'author': 'Dasari Anusha', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is my first experience with Rachael Ray cookware. When I first removed the cookware from the set, I first noticed how light weight it was. I then noticed the attractive orange handles they were made and the beautiful clear lids with clear view glass view. It's not high end cookware, but it would be welcome in many or most homes.I used this to cook maggi. It was so perfectly cooked and also i don't see any thing stick to the bottom of the pan. They are made beautifully and perfectly for the use of cooking. I love to cook in Rachael Ray cookware. The food was delicious and tasty whenever i use these product for cooking.I always use to cook dal. Unfortunately, one day I forgot to turn off the stove and i see all mess in my kitchen. I see the dal was totally overcooked and some part of it was sticked to the cookware. That could have resulted in quite a mess with some other types of cookware, but it cleaned up quickly and still looked brand new.What I liked:* The design is very modern and attractive.* The glass lids have a sturdy rim that is designed so food will not be easily trapped* The orange handles are non-slip and easy to grip, and they keep very cool while cooking* The small size pots are very handy, and the 6 quart stock pot is a nice small-size stockpot that I'm finding a much better size for my use.* Cleanup was super easyWhat I didn't like:* The pots seem to be about half the thickness of most of my other pots and pans. While I don't think they would dent easily if dropped, they don't have a sturdy, well made feel to them.* When compared to my Calphalon, they also do not have the same quality hard anodized finish on the outside.* The nonstick coating doesn't feel as high quality as other brands. So far, so good though!* The pans do not have a thick bottom, and seem to heat unevenly. My food scorched quickly, so cooking time and technique will vary from my other cookware.I think this would make a great starter set for someone just starting out on their own. Despite the few flaws that I noticed , I am enjoying using this cookware and cooking just became a little more fun!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent cook pot', 'author': 'Vickie Bailey', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love my new cook pot. Easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A really nice grilling pan, nice size and function', 'author': 'Bert', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have used this grill pan for 5 months about 1-2 times a week. Structurally this pan is 11" square and ~2 to 2-1/2 deep. It arrived intact, no scrapes of anything like that. I purchased the pan w/orange colored handle. The handle is ~9" long, so if you are planning storage space, the overall span, then is about 20" (see pics) and diagonally it is 13-1/4", so I have it stacked on a 14" round pan. The grill nubs/ridges are about 1/16" high, ~ 5-1/2 " long.The handle feels like a soft silicone and there is a nice indentation for your thumb to grab on to the handle. The handle is nice in that it doesn\'t within reason heat up (like a metal handle) or if you keep an eye on location, does not burn. The handle does not fold. The ad / info says it can withstand oven temps to 350 degrees. It is made of anodized aluminum and should not rust. The attachment of the handle to the pan is well done and study- with the rivets being a good size. The grill pan weighs 2 lbs-5 oz for those conscious of weight, much less than a cast iron skillet. No seasoning / pre -seasoning needed. I use it on a gas stove, but the Q&A info indicates it works on electric, ceramic, glass, and electric cooktops; but not induction. In contrast to cast iron, the pan does not hold heat once the burner is turned off.The gill is divided up into 4 sections, great for burgers, steaks, grilled cheese sandwiches, and seared AHI tuna, of course for longer cuts of meat such as a flank steak, it does not provide the continuous (pretty) pattern of the outdoor BBQ. I use the grill on a Viking gas stove with a 4" burner with a grate of about 8" and the pan heats quickly and evenly. I think I read somewhere to not cook at higher than medium-high. The non-stick surface has worked well thus far and I use less oil than maybe other pans. For splash/splatter control I use a round lid. Rachel Ray does not make a square lid, but there is one avail from another vendor (see link below), I haven\'t purchased this.Cleaning is easy with a scouring/sponge pad / brush designed for teflon type surfaces, sometimes letting it soak awhile after dinner. If overcooked in particular, the brush will work well to clean between the folds of the grill. Other times I just throw it in the dishwasher. Clean-up is so easy, I have gotten away from using the gas grill on the Viking gas stove.Overall pleased with this grilling pan, functional, easy to use, cleans easily, a great size for the typical burner/cooking appliance.Link to square lid:https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07CP1CL2T/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A solid, non-stick grill pan', 'author': 'Chella', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a solid grill pan, especially for the relatively inexpensive price. I wanted to start to cook my own grilled chicken, burgers, etc. at home, and this was a nice jump. Keep in mind, I've never had a grill pan before, so this is my first experience with one!First, this pan is a decent size - it can easily hold four burgers at once, or multiple chicken breasts. If you allow the pan to pre-heat, you do get those nice grill marks on the food. It's still as non-stick as ever, but I took note of the directions before hand (medium heat and a soft sponge!) to ensure it lasts a long time.The biggest issue I have with this pan is the time it takes to cook food, especially things like chicken. It takes a LONG time to grill chicken breasts unless they are super thin. The first few times I used this pan, I had to put the chicken back to cook, even after 5 minutes per side. I have resulted to adding a bit of water to the pan at the end of the cooking process to create some steam to super-heat the pan, but I shouldn't have to do that. Also, this pan did not come with a cover, so I am using other lids to trap the heat in place.In addition, the pan is a pain in the butt to clean. It's definitely nonstick, but food tends to get trapped in the ridges of the grill sections. I am sure this is a common problem with grill pans... but I just thought I would mention it! I usually use a paper towel to clean this pan, and I have to really dig into those ridges in order to get the gunk out.Like I mentioned, this is a solid nonstick grill pan that does what it promises. If you buy this, just be sure to leave chicken on this pan for a little extra time!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and so big!', 'author': 'CSP', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect non-stick surface. Heats evenly, beautiful orange accent color, cleans super easily, cooks to perfection.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Pan', 'author': 'J. W.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I needed a big pan for some of the meals I cooked and decided on this one. So far it's been a really good pan. The one downside is when I drain the fat from ground beef dishes, it's a little big to hang on to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars best money spent ever! bought one for a friend i loved it that much.', 'author': 'jennifer mccausland', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'nothing to dislike it is perfect. easy to clean. has not burnt a thing gorgeous colors looks great on the stove when cooking', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Professional Chef Saying This is Great', 'author': 'danny boylen, II', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love the shape of this sauce pan. It may not last forever (I’ve only had it for a month and non-stick pans never last forever), but I love this pan. If it is good for a year, it’s worth it to me. If it’s good for two, it’s really great value. If it’s good for three, it’s incredible. Buy this pan.And not for nothing, but RR ain’t my favorite food personality, so if I can get beyond that and still love this pan, maybe you might consider it too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cute and Practical', 'author': 'Ashleyreb', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this pan set. I was surprised at how easy they are to clean. You can literally wipe them clean. I do wish the large frying pan had a lid but its not a deal breaker. Great quality and I love the color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Tape left a lot of gumminess on both sided of the glass- certainly can't use it until that comes off. Since it is glass and NOT the granite interior, I had to experiment with different cleaners, also that wouldn't hurt the glass or the wooden knob. FINALLY, sprayed with Dawn power wash, and scrubbed with a standard Mr. Clean eraser- added some elbow grease to get it done. Thought this might be helpful.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: imarku Non Stick Frying Pans 10inch Frying Pan Nonstick with Detachable Wooden Handle, Egg Pan Honeycomb Cast Iron Skillet Pan, Dishwasher Safe, Oven Safe To 500°F Pans
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is not a light weight pan', 'author': 'Henry A. title: Cuisinart 10-Inch Crepe Pan, Chef's Classic Nonstick Hard Anodized, Black, 623-24
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I expected', 'author': 'Monique', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Cuisinart 10-Inch Crepe Pan is a culinary gem that brings the art of crepe-making to your kitchen with finesse and ease. Crafted with precision and functionality in mind, this pan is an essential tool for both seasoned chefs and home cooks looking to create delicate, thin crepes that melt in your mouth.Constructed with a high-quality non-stick surface, the pan ensures effortless food release and easy cleanup, allowing you to focus on perfecting your crepe technique rather than worrying about sticking or burning. The 10-inch size strikes a perfect balance between versatility and manageability, making it ideal for crafting crepes of various sizes and thicknesses.The low sides of the pan enable easy flipping and turning, ensuring your crepes maintain their delicate form without tearing or sticking. Its even heat distribution guarantees uniform cooking and golden browning, resulting in picture-perfect crepes that rival those from your favorite bistro.The sturdy handle stays cool even during extended cooking sessions, providing a secure grip and comfortable control as you swirl and spread batter. Whether you're making traditional French crepes, savory galettes, or sweet dessert crepes, the Cuisinart Crepe Pan is your trusty companion for achieving delectable results every time.Beyond its crepe-making prowess, this pan's versatility extends to other culinary creations, making it a go-to tool for pancakes, omelets, and more. Its durable construction promises longevity, ensuring it remains a staple in your kitchen for years to come.In essence, the Cuisinart 10-Inch Crepe Pan combines premium craftsmanship with practical design to deliver a culinary experience that celebrates the art of crepe-making. Elevate your cooking skills and delight your taste buds with the exquisite results you can achieve using this exceptional pan.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan!', 'author': 'Big Rudy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I definitely use the pan for crepes, but for SO MUCH MORE!! Because it has shallow sides, it makes flipping sandwiches and pancakes (for example) super easy. Buy one of these!!! I use this pan every day! I hand wash it. Even with this heavy usage, this pan lasts about 1 year (before the coating wears off).Big Rudy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for crepes', 'author': 'Dave A', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Pan is very shallow which is why good for crepes', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for all sorts of Flatbreads, crepes!', 'author': 'Yogafan', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought this crepe pan in Oct 2020. Since then I've used it everyday at least twice a day, sometimes more than that. Started with simple soap and warm water wash, wiped it and then started using it. I've used it initially on coils for first 8 months, always between medium-high heat and the same with gas stove. After I'm done using it, I always remove it from heat immediately on a colder side of the stove, thus avoiding unnecessary overheating. Another simple care is I never use water on it when it was hot. For cleaning it, simple tap water is best except when I used oil on it. For any oil cooking, normal dish soap and soft sponge was sufficient. I've cooked eggs, many sorts of flatbreads (used twice everyday for Indian flatbreads) and different types of crepes, pancakes, dosa and....many more! Never had any warping problem or any other problem. Great for both with and without oil cooking. I've never used it in oven so no idea about that. After putting it to rigorous use all these months, now my pan looks like this, little scratches and discoloration at some places. But it is working really fine, no issues with over heating or even heat distribution. If used reasonably with proper cleaning and with non-metal spatula, this pan is really really good! Might buy another one as a back up.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'Dave', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love making French crepes, German & Scandinavian pancakes in this relatively non-stick pan. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It’s my kind of pan', 'author': 'Cara', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So very happy with this very versatile pan great for pancakes, omelettes or a little bit of stirfried vegetables so easy to flip over what’s inside The pan and it doesn’t stick. Seriously Best pan I’ve found in a long time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great little omelette pan.', 'author': 'John L Adams', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect size for a single omelette in about 4 or 5 minutes with sauteed mixed peppers, onion and mushrooms and one slice of bacon. One large or two small eggs whipped with a little milk. Has really made my breakfast decision really easy! My wife loves them. Wish I had gotten this years ago.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The best pan for pancakes', 'author': 'Haley McDole', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We absolutely love this non stick pan. It's perfect for pancakes. We use it at least once a week. Easy to clean. Lightweight. It is a small pan so easy to store. Durable. Just buy it !!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This pan is ALMOST perfect. ALMOST', 'author': 'Changing Fate', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I make a lot of omelets, as in almost every day I am making one for me. I have used this pan to make them for years now and I wanted to point out a couple of issues that may not be readily noticeable. But first I will talk about the plusses to this item. First, the price is really good for what you get. The surface of the pan has been easy to clean and since mine gets daily use I would say overall it holds up pretty well to the many times I use it. But there are a couple of issues that should be noted.The first, if you will look at the pictures of this pan, you will see the handles are attached by screws. The Screw heads are inside the pan. These Screw heads are not Copper stick free screw heads, therefore if you make thick pancakes or thick omelets like I do, the egg will stick to these screw heads every time. Every Time. I have to spray these screws with Pam in order to use these without it sticking which kinda makes them "almost non-stick" instead of truely no-stick.Second, the hinges are weak. the hinges are made of the flimsiest of all flimsiest metals. The pan surface itself will outlast the hinges by a long shot. Since I use mine to make omelets, having the hinges is important in that it makes it really easy to flip the pan. What should last me many many years only last a few.All that being said, if they would fix these two issues, either construct these with the handles incorporated in the metal and affixed internally and make hinges that are truely made to last, I would easily pay double for one. It does a good job for what I need it to do and would be a tremendous product if they addressed these two issues.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works as advertised.', 'author': 'Stephen Worley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Have used this item quite a number of times. Cooks pancakes quickly. Do not place your burner above Medium heat as the pancake mix will burn. Low heat baking is better and will provide a better outcome. One thing I noticed is that the longer this pan is one the stove burner, the faster the pancake mix cooks. So, you must pay attention to the heat of the pan when cooking. That is my two cents worth. I highly recommend this product for single pancake cooking. From my standpoint, it works as advertised.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Okay', 'author': 'Allyn L', 'rating': 3, 'content': "It's not quite what I hoped, but it's okay. Heats and cooks quickly. Seems flimsy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use', 'author': 'kai', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pan is small, but perfect for regular sized pancakes and omelettes. Even grilled cheese sandwiches. I only have used the pan for omelettes, but as long as you spray with nonstick spray and flip quickly, your eggs will turn out perfect! Also, make sure you cook the first side long enough to ensure that the heat contained in the enclosed pan has almost fully cooked the eggs, so they won't be super runny when flipping them. I haven't had any issues with the hinge, but I could see it being somewhat weak after a while of continued use. I don't use mine very often. Maybe once every couple of weeks. Good luck!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fun to use!!', 'author': 'Vickie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fast delivery. Not hard to use, only use up to 3egg omelet otherwise gets messy. Doesn’t stick slides right out!! Grilled cheese too!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It is a great pan but.....', 'author': 'Joy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great pan for something you need to flip like pancakes or eggs or burgers whatever, however do not buy the claim that it is so stick free that you can make pancakes without any oil. I tried every possible way to do this without oil, adhere to the instructions and it made an absolute mess, first side sticks, and when you try to flip it you get a big dripping mess of pancake batter streaming out of the pan and onto your stove. In order to get it to flip without oil you have to try to loosen it up with a spatula before flipping and what's the point if you need to use a spatula on this. However if you put a little oil before you put the pancake batter in, it will flip properly, sometimes with a little jerk down motion will make it drop. You don't need a lot of oil just a few drops swirl it around and you're good to go. Because this does work with oil I'm keeping it as it is a very nifty tool in the kitchen. It is also why it's not getting five stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars So wrong', 'author': 'PhotoGraphics', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Whenever I have seen any item, no matter what it is, that has the As Seen on TV sticker I know it’s going to go badly. This thing was no exception, so why would I have bought it anyway? I had one and only one task for it in mind, and that so seldomly durability was not that important to me. My one use for it was to make one large pancake for myself for breakfast onto which I could put a fried egg or any other topping of my choice. So my first question, one that any manufacturer of such a product would have in big bold letters, was what is its diameter. Nowhere on their ad page could I find one word about that, only that it is “large” and that it is two-inches thick. I would never in my life expect to make a pancake two inches thick so I don’t know why I would want to know that.IT GOES DOWNHILLThe breathless worded ad copy continued in the royal tradition of the seen on TV tradition, including the extensive use of the word copper as if it has a health benefit. Okay there are some claims about wearing a pure copper bracelet that some say to have magical qualities but are you ready for the honest truth now? There isn’t evidence of an ounce of copper in this thing, it is only a copper colored non-stick coating, or at least supposedly non-stick. As if that farce wasn’t enough they actually go on to say, or make you think they say, that it is made from titanium encrusted with diamonds. That is so funny I can hardly type the words without laughing. No, it is aluminum with a copper colored coating. The cleverly worded fine print is that it has a “diamond sparkle look coating”. And the wording “titanium ceramic” seem to be some well disguised trademarked terminology. So much for believing what you see on TV.QUALITYIt doesn’t sound right to use the word quality in a sentence describing this thing, but to be fair it only cost twenty bucks, about what a cheap frying pan cost at the discount store. I always suggest to read the one star reviews first and this is a great example of that, they are spot on accurate and you know they aren’t planted by employees of the maker. They all point to the extremely bad hinge design that is uses two pop rivets that are almost guaranteed to break. Even being really careful with it it’s just not designed well. Yes but isn’t it true that I went ahead and bought it anyway? I admit to that, but I said earlier that I expected to use it maybe once or at the most twice a month, and the only thing that attracted me over an ordinary frying pan is I am really bad at turning pancakes over and the best ones are cooked equally on both sides. I didn’t want yet another electric appliance because most of them don’t heat 100% evenly anyway, this held the promise, weak as it was, that it could spread the heat more evenly on my electric stovetop and I told myself that if I wait until the pancake (or even an omelet) as half cooked it shouldn’t leak out if I flip it over really fast. That idea sort of works but if I can’t see the food cooking I would have to experiment many times to get it even half right. One detail I did not like was that the rivets used to attach the handles are prone to having food stick to the crevices, which would make it a chore to clean it.SIZE MATTERSMy opening thought was about the diameter. Not trusting gadgets like this I had high hopes that they weren’t trying to pull another fast one on me and that it wasn’t anywhere near as big as they make it look. My instincts were right, I had hopes this would make one pancake that’s big enough for an adult, that would be about nine inches, but no, the maximum working area inside the pan is only a meager five inches. Using their directions it would take me about five minutes to make one five inch pancake. If I wanted four of them, which I guess is a full stack, it would take me at least 20 minutes to make breakfast for myself. On the same subject, since the pan tapers down to around five inches it is smaller than the smallest burner on my stove, which means the rising heat would eventually scorch the entire pan.THE FINE PRINTHere’s the shocker. Cleverly hidden inside the box, looking like one of those warranty sheets that no one ever reads, on the reverse side is a contract. No seriously, it is a lengthy legal contract that tells you that you already agreed to a long list of terms and conditions when you pressed the “buy” button, including giving up your legal rights and having to pay your own costs for any legal action. I have never seen anything so audacious on any product in my life and that instantly dropped their rating to zero and I put the thing back in the box and returned it. As public notice I do not accept or agree to any conditions they say I agreed to by buying this thing and by accepting my return Gotham Steel/Emson has agreed to my terms which will be available to them upon written request. On every count this is thing is rejected.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: T-fal B039S264 Excite ProGlide Nonstick Thermo-Spot Heat Indicator Dishwasher Oven Safe 8 Inch and 10.5 Inch Fry Pan Cookware Set, 2-Piece, Rio Red
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value. Works well. Use with good habits', 'author': 'Luis Garcia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ll review this in order but overall if you want to know now this is the best "cheap" product I have ever purchased on amazon.Main points: Due to other reviews claiming the nonstick surface scratched off their pans I\'d recommend you Never use any metal items against this pans surface or else you will scratch off the nonstick surface (this goes with any pan but I guess it has to be restated here). Scratching off teflon is highly carcinogenic as well as for metal pans their coatings are also not good to ingest so get into the habit of not scratching your pans. Use wood or anything non metallic that can handle the high heat for cooking.Another thing to consider potentially based on other reviewers: Dont immediately cool down your pan (or any pans ever) if they have been heated or just taken off the heat. If you do then the surface of the teflon may crack as seen in other reviews.Another thing to NOT do is based on the assumption that the handle may not be perfectly secured (it\'s not a fusion or welded mold) the handle coating itself seems to be maybe glued or coated on the inner metal handle which may come off if you place the entire pan in your oven. This pan doesn\'t look like it\'s capable of being placed into an oven to roast your food. I wouldn\'t suggest it nor try it myself due to this minor potential quality "flaw". You shouldn\'t need to place the pan into the oven, it wasn\'t made for that.Heat Distribution - 5/5The pan heats up well if you have any issues it may be your electric stovetop taking a while to heat up itself. The pan cooks the sides of my food very well. Anything touching the pan or oil within the pan will be hot. If you are having issues it may be due to lack of contact with a hot part which may cause uneven heating of your food.Easy to Clean - 5/5The product has a very good nonstick surface and it makes the food that was cooked on the pan and even if the food was left on over night if you persoak the pan with soap then it will come right off due to that non stick surface. Use a rough sponge but dont use a steel wool since that will probably scratch the nonstick surface.Value for money - 5/5This product works and is very useful for the price. I\'d gladly order another pair when and if these pans do eventually fail but for now the coating is very nice and hasn\'t failed me yet in any capacity.This pan seems like a great value. It works incredibly well and if you treat it right and dont scratch the surface then it will last you as long as you can maintain good pan handling habits!Conclusion:If you want a durable pan that can handle your every mistake, this may not be for you. If you are a diligent owner that wants to preserve their pans and tools, then this will be perfect for you. I havent had any issues with my pans and I dont expect to. But if I do I\'ll detail in a revision/ edit of what occured and by what rough time frame from purchase that it occured.1 month of constant use from this post.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Heat transfers evenly over the surface, and light-weught handles prevent pans from tipping.', 'author': 'Ralph E. Walker', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I especially like the small pan; it's just right for frying two eggs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Treat your pan right and cook beautifully', 'author': 'CC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The pans do what they say. They heat up evenly and if you follow how to care for them, there is no issue with sticking food. They’re great for eggs, stir fry, etc. we are a big fan of steak in my house so that’s when I will put the pan to true test. Like I said, if you follow how to care for them and cool food without blasting the heat on high every time, you will get a lot out of pans like this. The clean up is very easy since I usually wipe it out with a damp towel. I don’t recommend using a dishwasher if you can avoid it only because it can wear out the longevity of your pans lifespan. Hot water and a bit of soup will do for tougher to clean situations. Also, season your pan before use as directed and everything you make will be a breeze from pan to plate. A lot of reviews say that food stuck and the pans in pictures look like they’ve been through hell. Pretreat and watch your heat. No need to put the burner on high for certain foods because that’s what will kill your pan and lead to you rendering it useless. Happy cooking ♥️', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Best non stick pan!', 'author': 'Heather O. Cain', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These are the best non-stick pans I have ever had. After 2 years I will need to replace the bigger one that we used the most. Most nonstick pans, even the expensive ones, only last a few months for us. The handle does get loose though!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Can't go wrong with t-Fal", 'author': 'A. J. Most of the time you need to purchase separate lids, but the end product is a very long-term product that you will use for many years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good price for 2 pans', 'author': 'WasabiKid', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good buy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these pans', 'author': 'Nancy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The sizes are great, no sticking and clean up is a breeze.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good products for everyday cooking.', 'author': 'Melissa L Yaglowski', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have used your pans before and they were used hard until we received new pots and pans that are heavier and thicker . They will be well "loved" in the near future.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nonstick pans', 'author': 'Rachael', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love these pans, got my son a set when I used them I had to get me a set…', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these non stick frying pans', 'author': 'Norma M.
