title: Hestan - ProBond Collection - TITUM Nonstick Triple Bonded Stainless Steel Skillets with Lids, Induction Cooktop Compatible, Made without PFOAs (8.5 & 11-inch)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I absolutely love these pans!', 'author': 'Brandy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I absolutely love these pans! They are very well made, contain no forever chemicals (PFAO/PFAS), very easy to clean, and cook evenly. The 12 inch pan is much larger than you think as the sides allow for more surface area comapred to traditional pans. They are well worth the money and belive Hestan has a life time guarentee on their pans which means the cost upfront will save you in the end!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A joy to use', 'author': 'George K', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These skillets are totally worth their price - I already own a non-nonstick Hestan and loved its looks and how easy it was to clean, but after doing my research and having had enough with 'high quality' non-stick pans from Calphalon and Zwilling, I decided to splurge for this set (it's actually a steal, compared to the price you'd pay if you were to buy two individual Hestans). I'll say they are truly a joy to use. They heat evenly, the surface has just the right amount of roughness to sear, but still after 4 months use, they still maintain their excellent non-stick ability (unlike their supposedly high end competitors). They can also take some abuse: No special instructions for what temperatures they need to be before you can wet/wash them, and they are perfectly fine in the dishwasher. Add these features to their looks, and you'll have a skillet set you'll want to use everyday. Totally worth their price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent brand overall', 'author': 'Reagan S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have several pieces of Hestan cookware.. Titum non stick, Nano Bond, and 3 ply stainless - also some with lids. I love LOVE these products.The quality and workmanship is outstanding, the different choices of pots and pans provides a great selection to suit almost every need. I have spoken to the concierge for help and he was really good at explaining and giving direction. This brand is expensive but I have found deals and specials on almost every item and the value is great based on quality and my overall satisfaction of performance. I have other cookware that simply will NOT clean up but this line looks like new even after many uses. I look forward to expanding my collection as needed. Very Very happy with every item I've bought and will recommend to anyone interested and will buy again !", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for good quality fry pans!', 'author': 'Spook74', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good heat distribution, but it is SUPER at ease of cleaning! These are some good pans! We still do use a pat of butter sometimes to slicken it up a bit, but it will even fry eggs, etc., just as it is!We saw the comments that the handle can get hot, so we added a Lodge silicone hot handle holder (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00C61O4ZI?ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_details&th=1), which fits snug and still lets you hand it up by the hole in the handle.Great pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super well constructed', 'author': 'Doug Walker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really appreciate the flush rivets as the pan is easier to keep clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great deal on great pans', 'author': 'Dean Eric', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We love these as safe from harmful chemicals and they go into the oven, deal on Amazon extraordinaire!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Hestan - NanoBond Collection - Titanium Stainless Steel 8.5-Inch Frying Pan - Toxin, PFAS, & Chemical Free Clean Cookware, Induction Cooktop Compatible
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome cookware for a bad cook!', 'author': 'JPDMyers', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Two months ago, I bought the 8.5” pan as a test before investing further in the Heston Nanobond line. I’d been wanted to ditch my non-stick cookware for several years for health reasons but couldn’t find the right fit. I’m spoiled by growing up cooking with only non-stick cookware. And I’m NOT a good cook so I tend to overheat pans & burn food. AND I sooo dislike cleaning up after cooking that I’d prefer to do it later (like the next day). I’m possibly the worst case scenario for testing any cookware line. I’d honestly much rather enjoy being served nice meals in restaurants. But, I’m immunocompromised so COVID changed all that. So, I’ve needed to up my game & learn to cook decently.I first tested several brands of stainless steel cookware. It was a total nightmare for me to clean. I then tried out ceramic cookware but found it to be too heavy for my arthritic joints. After reading about and researching Hestan’s Nanobond’s titanium coating, I thought it sounded promising & ordered this pan. Besides, the design of all of Hestan’s cookware is simply gorgeous.This Hestan Nanobond pan turned out to be AMAZING. My 1st test was fried eggs that turned out perfect with no sticking and easy cleanup afterwards. I’d read to heat the pan first, then add the oil/butter next & let it heat, and to then add the eggs. That definitely works to make the surface as close to being non-stick without actually having a non-stick coating. I’ve used it repeatedly for sticky foods like fried eggs, scrambled eggs, grilled cheese sandwiches, etc. with thrilling results. Best of all, it’s easy to clean afterwards.The Hestan Nanobond cookware is fantastic & suits my needs perfectly. I’ve now bought many more of the pots and pans in all shapes & sizes. I’m thrilled with the good looks & performance of the Nanobond line, the ease of cleaning up afterwards, and the titanium coating’s overall forgivingness for bad cooks. I accidentally added ground sausage needing to be browned for a casserole directly to their still-warming 3.5 quart sauté pan. The sausage stuck immediately to the bottom & I knew I’d really screwed up. While stirring the rest of the meat with only a silicon spatula, however, the stuck remnants surprisingly released completely from the bottom! I then decided to go ahead & try baking the entire casserole in the covered Nanobond pan in the oven instead of dirtying up a casserole dish. The casserole turned out fantastic with perfectly browned sides & bottom. The servings easily released from the pan without falling apart. And the very baked-on food remnants STILL cleaned up easily. The beautiful design of Hestan’s cookware really makes it equally appealing for stove/oven to table presentation. I’m now totally in love with the Hestan Nanobond line!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great brand', 'author': 'june', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have two nano bond pans from them and both are my two favorite and most used. They clean great. You don't need non-stick if you have these.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This is a high quality pan! Expensive but will last forever!', 'author': 'Charlie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I just got rid of my nonstick T-Fal professional pan and that was great but the coating was starting to come off...Lasted just about maybe a year or year + 1/2...So I was getting tired of buying a new pan constantly.While this is not a non-stick pan, it is solidly built, and the nanocoat looks fantastic, and the rivets are not sticking out inside the pan.You need to warm up the pan and I like to do the water test to make sure the pan is hot enough.Be prepared to use oil and/or butter otherwise you will have food stick.I had to practice with eggs and finally got it figured out to where I can cook a over easy egg w/o making a mess on our electric range.Cleanup is pretty easy, soap + water.I believe if you have food stuck, just soak it and then clean.For anything that blemishes the pan, I think you can buy barkeepers friend and rub it out (cheaper than buying Hestan's polishing compound).If the price was lower, I would jump on the larger pan for sure...This is perfect for cooking a couple of eggs...Just wish it was a little cheaper.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This pan is non stick as long as you follow directions', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This pan is a beautiful little gem. Feels nice in hand and completely non stick if you follow directions and heat it until water drops dance and scatter. Add oil and cook away!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not worthy.', 'author': 'Sebas', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I recently purchased an expensive pan, and I have to say, I'm thoroughly disappointed with its performance. Despite the hefty price tag, the pan fails to deliver even the most basic cooking capabilities. Food sticks to the pan, and it cooks unevenly, leaving some parts burnt and others undercooked.I've tried using different oils and heat settings, but nothing seems to prevent the food from sticking or ensure an even cook. It's incredibly frustrating to spend so much money on a pan that doesn't perform as advertised.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars sticks', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Well made frying pan. We purchased the pan to fry eggs. The first time we used it the eges did not stick.Subsequent egg frying they stuck to the bottom of the pan regardless of how much butter was used to prevent sticking. Not worth the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pan ever!', 'author': 'Naser Ali Abbas Altaib', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This is the Hestan NanoBond 8.5” that I purchased last Oct 2022. After over 8 months of daily usage, the pan is still shining, easy to clean, and nothing sticks if you just preheat your pan properly before adding your fat. The pan is still as GREAT as new, if not BETTER, it’s the best durable high-quality elegant pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars DERAILED REVIEW —— Not perfect but I like it', 'author': 'Bobbler', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought the 8 inch pan.. I am hesitant to buy the larger skillets if they are going to be super thin like the 8 inch is.BOTTOM LINE:I think I’m going to love this pan for scrambled eggs, and I don’t know what else.. I plan to try a reverse sear with salmon or a hamburger.. I usually slow cook vegetables in an enameled cast iron sauce pan, so I don’t have to worry about salt and other seasonings leaching the SS.. But I suppose I will try some vegetables in the nano bond titanium (as a little browning is supposed to add a layer of flavor.. but I suspect browning anything is less healthy).STICK, OR NOT TO STICK?Mystery solved.. I was perplexed by so many reviews complaining about things sticking to the titanium nanobond, because my scrambled eggs were sliding around, almost like a nonstick pan. I just watched a video comparison of three different stainless steel pans.. The Heston nanobond, and demeyere (both of which I have cooked scrambled eggs on).. In the video they got the pans hot until the water drops danced around, which I think of it as a trick that allows you to cook scrambled eggs in cast-iron.. Plus they used what looked like some kind of vegetable oil.. And the egg was stuck in the pan bad.. I use butter at a low temperature (which I believe is appropriate for eggs), and the eggs don’t stick at all..LEACHING INTO FOODI’ve always heard that titanium is extremely non-reactive, but I have been UNABLE to find any information (other than manufacturers claims) whether titanium cookware will leach anything into food while cooking (ie: acidic foods, like tomato paste, or how it’s well known that salt will pit stainless steel).. Titanium is supposed to be completely safe for humans, so we can only hope if anything leeches it would be pure titanium (manufacturers tend to be untrustworthy, I can only hope in Italy they have tighter regulations for such things than in America).. If you search the Internet you can find where testing was done with SS pans.. Some manufacturers claim you can cook tomato red sauce in them (even though tomatoes do leech from SS)..SUPER THIN?When I say super thin, perhaps I’m spoiled by using expensive aluminum clad cookware from other brands that have a hefty amount of aluminum.. Because of the high price of Heston nano bond cookware, they should pop for thick enough aluminum layer to where we should have to wonder if it’s enough.. And to be clear I don’t know how thick the aluminum layer needs to be to do. It’s job..The thin-ness of the pan makes me wonder if it would be prone to warping (with my other stainless steel pans, I clean them while they are hot, but I am fearful to put water into these thin nano bond skillets).. NOTE: I don’t put a lot of cold water into a hot pan, rather a little bit that steam cleans most of the pan (none of my pans have ever warped).HEAT MOMENTUM:The other problem with extra thin aluminum cladding is heat momentum.. Heat momentum is one of the reasons cast-iron pans work so well for certain things (such as putting a frozen hamburger patty, and getting heat momentum to create the seer.. instead of the frozen patty immediately cooling off the pan which destroys the seer). In my particular case, using the control freak induction burner that has a built-in temperature probe, it will probably compensate by instantly turning the power up (which I hear it doing when I take a little off, to try to maintain temperature).. I doubt the thin aluminum will work in this instance, if you’re trying to cook a frozen steak or anything substantial without cool in the pan off..NON-STICK:I have not used nonstick pans for decades, but I have been cooking scrambled eggs in aluminum clad stainless steel pans for years.. And for the past year. I’ve been using Demeyere SS skillets, which have a treated SS surface that concentrates the chromium and nickel and removes the iron (it makes the stainless steel, more stainless steel, and it does stick less than regular SS, but not by much)..[Again contrary to what many reviews are saying], when I cooked scrambled eggs in the Heston nanobond it felt like nonstick to me. There was an obvious non-stick quality even compared to my demeyere). Like my demeyere pans, I expect I will have to occasionally use the special cleaner, or barkeepers friend, to get rid of the haze/seasoning that develops (this is expected)..Likewise cleanup was very easy (like I would imagine non-stick would be).TOO—LIGHT—WEIGHT?I know other reviews think it’s thick/heavy, but it is by far the lightest pan I have ever held in my hands (and I’ve used a few different brands of aluminum clad stainless steel pans).. I realize titanium is light weight, but the nano bond is a very thin layer of titanium (presumably over stainless steel)..The pan is so light weight that it’s causing the problem with my control, freak induction burner.. The 8” or will sit flat by itself, but because it’s so light weight, and the handle is relatively heavy, it will not sit flat on the induction burner for preheating, because there is a temperature probe in the center (that has a lightweight spring)..And (when cooking anything sensitive to uneven heat) you very much need to preheat pans on an induction burner, because the nature of induction heats the pan itself so there is always a hot ring in the center of the pan that matches the induction ring (preheating for a while lets the heat spread out)..BOTTOM LINE: I was able to preheat the pan to cook my scrambled eggs, but one end of the pan was about 1/8” off the induction burner (and induction burners are sensitive to this.I WOULD HATE: to try to preheat the 8” pan for a seer on this induction burner (the 1/8” in the air might end up a huge problem at high power settings)..COOKING TECHNIQUES:There is technique to consider in whether eggs or anything sticks or not..For scrambled eggs I use low heat (228F.. since my induction burner controls the temperature).. and I use plenty of butter (I am convinced, low carb is healthy, and butter and egg yolks are healthy fats).. my eggs were sliding around the pan like the nonstick advertisements..CLEANUP:My experience with cleanup was like you would imagine nonstick. But I’ve seen many reviews complain about food sticking to the pan (I can only assume they were using high heat, and maybe little or no oil).. I can’t say for sure, but I know with my other stainless steel pans anytime something sticks, I just put a squeeze of dish soap and a little water and come back in an hour (or the next morning).. If I’m in a hurry, I’ll turn on the burner for a few seconds so warm soap will work faster.. Then whatever was stuck on usually falls off.. Sometimes I use vinegar (I don’t know whether dish soap vinegar would be more effective)..', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very high quality in ALMOST every area.', 'author': 'Teddy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Pros: the finish looks beautiful as it’s slightly a smoky grey color which is very smooth and though not nonstick is less sticky than other stainless steel pans I’ve used. Good weight, feels sturdy and i love the flush rivets. Heats up quick and the high heat resistance is great so it works I’m pretty much any cooking environment other than a microwave.Cons. Mostly small nitpicks but for an expensive pan small can be big depending on your taste. Pricey. On my induction top at least the pan bottom warps very slightly so as thin coat of oil tends to pool towards the outer edges of the pan, this pretty common in a lot of pans but i do wish at this price it could be avoided. The handle feels high quality but could be slightly more comfortable if the part that rests against your palm was just a bit wider.Overall: If you can deal with those nitpicks this will make a great pan for small tasks like a grilled cheese or an omelet etc. and last a long time. happy cooking!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for searing', 'author': 'L. Bencze', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Yes, food will definitely stick to this pan; no doubt about it. But it's not that hard to clean out. Most importantly, the pan will not pick up any staining. My wife uses it for searing steaks. She puts it in a hot oven. It's perfect for this. So its searing abilities justify the purchase. Other pans, like Swiss Diamond, are much better for cooking eggs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it.', 'author': 'Timothy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It’s a wonderful pan. I look forward to using it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome', 'author': 'Zachary Newman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very good pan. I wish it came with a lid. I probably could have gotten a similar item for less money, but I do not regret the purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars excellent heat distribution', 'author': 'A Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'boils water FAST', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 29, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Overpriced for what you get', 'author': 'ZCharnecki', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'If you want ornamental pots and pans, go for it. The practicality of these is nil and hopefully this helps keep you from making a quick decision on aesthetics only.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars YOU NEED TO SEASON UR COPPER PANS !!!!!', 'author': 'David', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'YOU NEED TO SEASON UR COPPER PANS !!!!!After viewing the review section am amazed at how naive people r.... one needs to season ALL metal pans...geez... copper is far safer and the body NEEDS copper... other metal pans, especially nonstick , cast iron, stainless steel, even ceramic give off toxic gasses... ya, copper discolors over time, pots and pans r not art nor jewelry so appearance is a mute point.... if u have to then polish them', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Copper Bond care', 'author': 'Roy G. Becker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are absolutely pieces of art and I don’t understand why there are a hand full of people putting these down?Not one problem have I had and I dont foresee ever having one 👍As for the care of these copper bond line , We all learned in grade school that copper ‘Tarnishes’ and will need some extra care to keep them the same way as you received them , it’s no different than anything else ….. You buy nice things , You take care of Nice things so don’t throw your hate towards the company that gave you the option to have something so elegant and will last a life time ‘Providing you Care for them’ .All the very best to all that have these , And Happy Cooking 🧑\u200d🍳', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made and pretty', 'author': 'Tiffany Sanders', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I noticed the poor reviews revolve around the heat patina that forms on the copper after use, as well as the food sticking to the pan despite adding oil. To use steel pans, one must learn the steps: 1. Heat the pan first 2. Add the oil once pan is hot, let oil warm up for a few seconds 3. Add food.I have used a pot and my large pan from this ten piece set so far; cooked ground beef and rice, veggies like mushrooms, onions, garlic, and bell peppers so far, as well as made creamed spinach. I have not experienced any sticking whatsoever and find the pans cook my food more evenly with less risk of burning. These are the best pans i have ever used! If you don’t want the copper to change color, then you shouldn’t buy a set with visible copper parts, otherwise you can condition it to remove the natural patina that forms from heat exposure. I personally like the patina, it doesn’t bother me. I would recommend this set to anyone who cooks regularly and wants to do it the way the pros do it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed so far - updated APRIL 7, 2022', 'author': 'Eflows414', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I have decided to get rid of my nonstick Calphalon pans..I love them but the coating comes off and I"m very careful with my pans. I decided to try Hestan. First thing I cooked was scrambled eggs. I oiled the pan well but the eggs stuck really badly and was hard to get out. I forget what I cooked next in it but whatever it was, it was fine..so I tried eggs again, this time using olive oil to coat the pan. It was slightly better but the eggs still stuck to the pan however the pan cleaned up much easier. I\'m hoping it\'s just a matter of getting used to these as I want to get more pcs. This one has just been my trial piece. It is a beautiful pan, I will say thatApril 7, 2022 I thought I would add a little update. I don\'t use this pan that often, but I have cooked scrambled eggs a few more times...first coating the pan with olive oil, getting the oil hot before adding the eggs and then turning the heat down. They still stick but not as badly. I soaked the pan in hot water and it came clean easily. I will need to polish the copper but years ago when I had Revere ware copper bottom pans, I had to polish those as well. I hate not having it be a non stick pan but I spent a lot of money on the Calphalon only to have the nonstick peel off....so that\'s a waste. I never wash my pans in a dishwasher so that doesn\'t bother me either.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Cooks great, looks horrible', 'author': 'Belize Bradley', 'rating': 3, 'content': "My pots and pans are on display on a hanging rack so appearance is not as important as functionality but still important to me. It's also very heavy - so heavy I cannot manage the sautee pan with one hand. I had such high hopes for this set as it got great reviews and looked stunning out of the box (last photo).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful until you use it. Photos are after one use.', 'author': 'Matt D', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I haven’t cooked with high end cookware before and I’m tempted not to. This is a beautiful piece of cookware but…. It’s not non-stick or dishwasher safe. I did like the heat distribution but cleaning this thing is a chore. I only bought this one pan to test and I’m sorry I spent so much on it. Once you use it the beautiful copper tarnishes. It still works but the beauty is gone unless you polish it. Gonna try another brand that had a copper core but is dishwasher safe. This is a good pan. Just don’t buy it because it looks good. It won’t after you use it once.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Rachael Ray 87631-T Cucina Hard Anodized Nonstick Skillet with Helper Handle, 14 Inch Frying Pan, Gray/Red
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty, sturdy, reasonably priced: easily replaces the expensive Anolon that peeled!', 'author': 'Kathryn Magendie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First let me say that this skillet is big! And I’m happy about that. I needed something larger, but with low sides, as this one has.The blue is pretty—it’s blue only on the handles—and is a sort of blue-green.The bottom came with a scratch—I can barely see it but it’s there and I don’t know if that’s a manufacturer mark, shipping, or what, but otherwise it is perfect. I almost took off a star for that but I’m so pleased with the skillet and the price I bought it for, I left my stars at 5.No sticking so far. I washed mine by hand and though on the bottom is indicates it is dishwasher safe, I’m likely to hand wash it most of the time—due partly to the size of it; however, it does fit fine in the dishwasher.There are two sturdy handles: both handles are stainless but with the colored covering that feels like rubber—cool touch covering. There is the long handle side, firmly attached and sturdy; there is the shorter handle on the other side that is also attached firmly and sturdily—the shorter side helps if you have to pick up the skillet with something heavier in it since it is a large skillet so you aren’t trying to hold it with one hand.The skillet sat evenly on my stovetop without any rocking or movement at all.The price is very reasonable. I had a anodized nonstick skillet from Anolon that cost over $60 and it began peeling very badly after about a year or less; this Rachael Ray is half the cost of that—time will tell how long it will last but at least the price is more reasonable and it’s a bigger and nicer looking skillet than the Anolon.The only other items I have from Rachael Ray’s kitchen collection is a set of blue bowls and I’ve really loved those bowls! They’re quality, they look good on my countertop, and they’re made very well; the price was reasonable on those as well. So I’m likely to take a look at some of her other kitchen items.I’m happy with my purchase and hoping there’s no peeling. It does come with care instructions and I read those to make sure I do everything to care for the skillet properly—it comes with a lifetime warranty as long as you care for it properly!This fits exactly what I needed and I’m so glad I bought it!I hope my review helped you today.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Best Skillet I've Ever Owned!", 'author': 'Olivia Stabler', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this skillet in the 14" size to replace a 10 year old skillet I had that wasn\'t nonstick anymore. This one retails for about $100 and I got it on Amazon for about $39, so I was thrilled with the deal and was amazed at the size of it when it arrived. It is a little bigger than the biggest burner on my stovetop, but it still cooks evenly. I\'ve used it almost daily for the last 2 months and I\'ve made a variety of things in it: stir fry, beef stroganoff, scrambled eggs, sautéed meats, grilled cheese, and French toast to name a few. Because it\'s so large, I can make 3 grilled cheese sandwiches at once and 4 pieces of French toast at once, so it cuts down on cook time for some of the things I make.The pan is excellent quality and the nonstick aspect works wonderfully even without using olive oil or butter. I don\'t use metal cooking utensils with this, so I\'ve had no issues with nonstick coating coming off as others have mentioned. I also wouldn\'t store it underneath other pans, which may have contributed to other reviewers having the coating come off. The rubberized handle is easy to grip and I love the bonus handle on the opposite side, which makes it really easy to pour food out of the skillet. Cleaning it is very easy using a non-scratch sponge. I love this skillet and I highly recommend it for all your cooking needs - wish I would\'ve bought it sooner!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Large, good quality skillet, just no lid', 'author': 'Dustin L Anderson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this in 2018 for the wife. She wanted a large skillet for some recipes and the current set based skillets just were not large enough.This thing is huge in comparison. Perfect for her pastas and just about anything else we throw at it.There is no lid with this, or at least not when I bought it. So if you need to steam something you have to get creative like a cookie sheet, sadly. It also doesn’t fit in the dishwasher well. Would probably look for a mode with a lid next time I am in the market. But if one doesn’t exist, I will come back to this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfectly imperfect ...', 'author': 'NorthFork3', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This skillet is LARGE but easy to handle. It is shallow so perfect for bacon and eggs, browning meat, hasbrowns, etc but not so good for sauces, as the non stick coating works very well.... food slides right out without issue and the low sides would make it challenging to stir without making a mess. As far as even heating, I have a gas range that has a power burner (flame is larger than the rest) and it heats the entire skillet, so for me, it cooks evenly. ... Not sure how it would do on elecric burners. The coating has not scratched using silicone utensils. I hand wash it after it cools completely, which is how non stick surface pans should be washed, no matter what brand. Nylon utensils WILL scratch non stick pans due to the firm edges... use silicone and your skillets will last longer. Is it perfect? No. ... but overall, I really like this skillet and recommend it for anyone needing a large skillet.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 1, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great skillet, nice size and clean up is effortless.', 'author': 'Jeremy S.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We were in the need for a new skillet and this is the one we landed on. The non stick coating works great and good doesn’t get stuck. Clean up is also easy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and cooked scrambled eggs perfectly.', 'author': 'AW', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I saw a negative review about heat distribution but decided to take a chance anyway. I will buy another one as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this pan', 'author': 'Derrick', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this as a Christmas gift and have loved it. The large size is very useful and nothing sticks to it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Skillet', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Was a gift, recipient loves it. Rachel Ray's products are great", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Pan lasted only 2 years before it warped', 'author': 'Jewel Reid', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Initially I loved this 14 inch nonstick pan. I took very good care of it- hand washed it always, and never used heat above medium. Like other reviewers, this pan is now warped so that only the middle heats up and the rest of the pan doesn’t heat up evenly because of being warped. It is exactly 2 years old this month. I attempted to contact the manufacturer for the lifetime warranty but the website does not work and the telephone number says to call back during business hours (I was calling during their suggested hours). Very disappointing.Edit: I did additional research and found the working website for Rachael Ray cookware warranties. I filled in their form, and submitted photos of my warped pan. I received this response: Your inspection is completed, the issue is not found to be a manufactured defect. Per the warranty normal ware is not a manufactured defect as seen in your photos. Also included in normal ware is scratches, as the natural characteristic of nonstick coating will wear over time under normal use. The coating may begin to show signs of scratches, can lose the nonstick release properties, can discolor, and wear thin and come off. Please know the coating is inert which means it doesn’t react with the body, if ingested it will leave the body and there are no toxins being released into any foods being cooked.\u200bA onetime courtesy replacement is being sent with the item we have in stock.I received the replacement pan today. It is not warped & I am happy to have it so I have changed my rating to 4 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars It's a great pan, but it needs to be replaced every 2-3 years due to scratches", 'author': 'Michelle', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I love this pan, and I am on my 3rd one of the same exact pan. No matter how careful I am with this pan (metal, and harder plastic spatulas NEVER touches the nonstick), it needs to be replaced about every 2-3 years due to scratches. The size is wonderful. 14" frying pans aren\'t the easiest to find.The shape is wonderful too. I love how the sides aren\'t too high like some other brands.It mainly gets used in my home for pancakes, and that\'s only once a week, so it\'s not in heavy rotation. I realize non stick pans need to be replaced more often than other pans, and I love this pan. I just wish it was a little sturdier and would hold up for about 4 years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Circulon Symmetry Hard-Anodized Nonstick Frying Pan, 8.5-Inch, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice looking, heavy duty stainless steel base, heats evenly', 'author': 'GoodToBeBob', 'rating': 5, 'content': "02-04-2014 Review, 5*Scrambled eggs wipe off easily with a damp paper towel (I wait until its cool to the touch). I also fry skinless chicken breasts, pork, & hamburgers. But one needs to be careful not to overheat the skillet. Also, although they say the skillet will handle metal utensils, I just can't bring myself to use them.I didn't plan on such a long response but one thing leads to another. I'm new at cooking and didn't realize that there's more to it than I realized. Especially when it comes to pan frying chicken at the proper temperature. I've got to say that I admire the knowledge that you cooks have & that I've just taken for granted. So, maybe you'll have a good chuckle at my lack of cooking knowledge.Turns out that all non-stick skillets have a temperature limit before the surface gets damaged. Apparently, I was supposed to read the instructions before bringing fire into the mix. So, please follow the instructions so that you don't exceed the temperature range like I did. I overheated (>525 deg F) one of my 2 skillets without realizing it, multiple times, when frying hamburgers, skinless chicken breasts , and pork. I've since dedicated the overheated damaged pan to only frying the meats as they have their own fat/oil to reduce sticking. I can't use it for eggs anymore because they stick and I don't want to use any oil. I use my 2nd Circulon Symmetry skillet for eggs. One thing nice about frying eggs is that it's easy to tell when the heat is too high, the eggs quickly burn. Meat, however, takes a while to burn & even longer for me to notice that the skillet is way too hot. What can I say, I'm an amateur.The temperature limit is in the skillet's instructions. For the gas range, I now use the same 400 deg limit that they state for oven use. Ever since the tainted chicken scare, I've been using an old infrared thermometer to check the temperature of the top of the meat (& now also the bottom of the skillet). Just point the red dot and read the temperature on the display. It's an easy way to make sure that the top of the chicken reaches 160 deg F without overheating the pan.I've just recently noticed/realized that chicken breasts take longer to cook when I don't use oil. Without oil, I have to flip the chicken more often to ensure that it gets cooked throughout at over 160 deg F. The temperature of the top of the chicken barely gets to 160 Deg F when the frying pan is at 400 deg F (I think they invented infrared thermometers just for me).This made me realize another reason for using some oil, heat transfer. The oil transfers the heat of the skillet into the meat a lot quicker/better. This means that: 1) By using oil, the meat cooks hotter & quicker, at a lower skillet temperature and/or does NOT need flipped as often. 2) By NOT using oil, the meat reaches a lower temperature & takes longer to cook, needs a hotter skillet and/or needs flipping more often.That's all I have to say about that. Time to finish my box of chocolates.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars FINALLY!', 'author': 'Cynthia B. Mckee', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We have had All-Clad, Wagner Cast Iron, several sets of pots and pans over the years. The Circulon Symmetry are the best pots and pans I've ever used. My husband who only cooks bacon loves them too. But, he does the dishes and he likes the way they clean up because he doesn't hear me complaining how he washed them. They are made to withstand everyday cooking and cleaning! So many wonderful dishes come out of the one large pan and for cooking eggs in the morning you can't beat the small fry pan. Best thing is the Circulon Symmetry pans work great on an induction stovetop! Do I love these Circulon Symmetry Pans - Yes I do!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality pan', 'author': 'Sabako', 'rating': 5, 'content': '1, Reason why I chose :I was looking for PFOA free nonstick. I first purchased 12" nonstick pan and liked it a lot, so I ended up buying the entire family of this series.2, like & dislike :I\'m not a professional chef but cook dinner daily. After I used this for 8 month, I should say this is probably the best nonstick pan I\'ve had. It\'s well built and durable, yet it\'s not too heavy. Plus, the handle softly sticks to your hand. So, when I shake the pan, it holds pretty well.Cooking surface is nonstick and it really does work well as advertised. I can cook with or without oil. Like other nonstick pans, as long as you handle with care, such as not using metal silverware to stir food, or using only soft sponge to wash, coating should last a long time. Mine has been used at least every other day for 8 month, but the surface still looks like brand new. It works for any temperature from low to high.Like the other 10" or 12" pans , the way edge is designed (sort of steep wall ), that holds food better for my use, compared to round shape edge pan.3, Recommend this product to :If you\'re looking for a good quality nonstick pan, this should work great.4, Price :Fair price', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice frying pan', 'author': 'STACY R NIX', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like it. It was worth the money', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pan ever!', 'author': 'Linda Orr', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Cooks evenly, easy to clean', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars GREAT Skillet!', 'author': 'Frank', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I found what I was looking for in a pan; non-stick, it has lasted through a month of regular use and still no sticking. Given the number of not-so-good reviews, I hem and hawed over my decision to by this pan or not . I decided to buy the skillet for a lesser price from Amazon Warehouse Deals (a part of Amazon.com that specializes in offering great deals on returned, warehouse-damaged, used, or refurbished products that are in good condition but do not meet Amazon.com rigorous standards as "new." We also offer products in new and open-box condition) just to see if it was what I wanted without a bigger investment. sure enough, it arrived with a couple of minor scratches not on the surface where it would affect cooking directly. It is a great skillet. I will wait to see if the coating lasts longer than previous non-stick pans I have owned but at this time, I have absolutely no complaints. I like the weight of the skillet too, it has cast iron pan feel to it. I gave it four stars because I am sure there are higher quality pans available but for my budget, I LIKE IT A LOT!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars More Than Expected', 'author': 'Bud001', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I used my skillet for the first time today. We own two other Circulon pans so I was expecting a well designed and well finished product! I was not disappointed! For even heat distribution the skillet is some what heavy, again as expected. The non-stick surface preforms very well as it does for all of our Circulon pans. The handle of the skillet deserves special notice. It is insulated and the insulation is fixed. You won\'t have to look for the handle cover each time you go to use the skillet or fool with the handle covering when you go to wash the skillet. The handle itself is well designed, riveted to the skillet and adds somewhat to the skillet overall weight, again as you would expect. BUT while holding the skillet the handle does not give you the feeling that the skillet is about to "turn over" in your hand. I totally recommend Circulon products. However, I was slightly disappointed the skillet was made in Thailand, but not as disappointed as I would have been if it had been made in China!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It really is non-stick', 'author': 'Aged hippie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my 4th piece of Circulon Symmetry cookware. I also have a 12" sauté, 10" and 12" skillets. The sauté came with a stylish glass lid. The other pieces did not.I selected this line of cookware, because I\'d previously purchased stainless Anolon cookware compatible with my new induction cooktop (love the cooktop, not so keen on the cookware...it sticks). The Symmetry cookware is anodized aluminum, but with an induction-compatible flat stainless base. I can\'t speak to its performance on conventional electric or gas cooktops, but all pieces heat very evenly on my induction cooktop. I expect their performance on conventional cooktops would be superior, as well.It\'s touted as non-stick inside and out, and I\'ve found this to be true. Cleanup is easy. I hand wash even though it\'s "dishwasher-safe". It\'s also compatible with metal utensils. But I still have my Anolon plastic and silicone utensils from previous non-stick cookware I owned. So, I don\'t intend to test this cookware\'s resistance to scratching.My only gripe is that there are no lids like that of the sauté available specifically for the Symmetry skillets. Amazon does offer lids for the 10" and 12" skillets from a different Circulon line. But I haven\'t seen one for the 8.5" skillet. I\'ve used the stainless steel lids from my Anolon cookware for this purpose (at least the Anolon is good for something).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent', 'author': 'Miss Jude', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Thisi pan was strong, sturdy, beautifully made, and cooks food excellently. Arrived quickly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars First rate fry pan!', 'author': 'greg', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We were pleased with the fry pan. It is solid and handy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

They are made well, sturdy, and cook/heat well. I have several different sizes of Ballarini fry pans and sauce pans. The pans are a bit spendy and but when on sale, it's a great deal. Reading the instructions is important. When cleaning, let the pan cool and then handwash (easy to handwash) -- not recommended for a dishwasher. Would recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars geat pan', 'author': 'lorraine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'easy to clean cooks really well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Red Copper 10 inch Pan by BulbHead Ceramic Copper Infused Non-Stick Fry Pan Skillet Scratch Resistant Without PFOA and PTFE Heat Resistant From Stove To Oven Up To 500 Degrees
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars FINALLY, a nontoxic, nonstick pan that REALLY WORKS!!!', 'author': 'TS', 'rating': 5, 'content': '***UPDATE 10/18***I\'ve now been using both the 10" and 12" version of this pan several times per week for six months or more. I saw many negative reviews where people didn\'t use any oil or butter in the pan first and were unhappy with the results. While I found the same thing, simply adding a little butter or Smart Balance to cover the bottom of the pan results in an excellent non-stick experience. Just this morning I cooked three sunny side up eggs and they slid out of the pan without a spatula. So, while it may me disappointing that the pan doesn\'t work well with no oil or butter, the fact that it does work extremely well with it still puts these pans light years ahead of the many other non-stick pans I\'ve used and thrown out. DON\'T LET THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS DISSUADE YOU -- IF YOU SEASON THE PAN PROPERLY (as per the instructions) AND USE A LITTLE BUTTER OR OIL THESE PANS ARE OUTSTANDING.****************As most people I started out with teflon pans years ago. They eventually lost their nonstick properties, so I searched for healthier options without toxic chemicals to replace them. First I tried pans from Ozeri, which I felt better about for health reasons, but as with most "nonstick" pans they quickly lost their nonstick properties. Next I tried pans from Denmark after a good experience with them at a summer rental a few years back, but that yielded basically the same result. At this point I\'d pretty much lost hope that any of these healthier nonstick pans would continue to work after a few months. Finally I decided to use my Consumer Reports subscription to see if they had anything worth trying. Duh! I was surprised to see that Red Copper pans were highly rated so I gave them a shot. FINALLY, a nontoxic, nonstick pan that ACTUALLY WORKS!!!I\'ve had the 10- and 12-inch sizes for several months under fairly heavy use so this seemed like a long enough time to write a worthwhile review -- but I WILL UPDATE if these pans end up disappointing down the road. First, I strictly followed the directions and seasoned both pans before using them (none of the other pans required or specified this step and I wonder if it would\'ve helped at all). I don\'t know how important this step is, but given my positive results I\'ll just say MAKE SURE YOU DO THIS FIRST BEFORE USING THE PAN. Also, the directions state that if the pans do start to lose their nonstick properties, just repeat this seasoning procedure. This actually gives me some hope that these pans might actually continue to work down the line. At first I was disappointed because the second batch of scrambled eggs I made -- right after the first batch without adding any more oil or butter -- started to stick pretty badly. Out of habit, for the first batch I used a little Smart Balance (the regular stuff, not the light version that doesn\'t melt well -- by the way I NEVER use real butter anymore as this tastes just like butter but MUCH healthier -- TRY IT!) so the next batch I added a little Smart Balance before cooking the eggs and, YIPPEE!!!!!! Although I\'m just slightly disappointed that I can\'t just cook without adding anything to the pan first, adding a little Smart Balance is a small price to pay to have a truly nonstick experience. Seriously, eggs just slide right out of the pan. Even sunny side up eggs, with maybe just a little bit of coaxing with a spatula, literally slide right onto the plate. AMAZING!!! I don\'t add anything when cooking stuff like hamburger meat for tacos and the pan works great without any significant sticking. BTW, I kept the plastic covers the pans came in so I can stack them without risking damaging the nonstick surface, and I do NOT use any metal utensils while cooking with these pans in the hope of prolonging their nonstick life.So, what I like about the pans (other than the excellent nontoxic and nonstick properties) are that they seem well built, and the bottoms of the pans are actually pretty flat. Ozeri pans were not flat and oil or butter would collect around the outside of the pan and away from the center. Argh! Despite the handle being metal it somehow remains relatively cool as long as you grab it more toward the end, and it\'s great that the pans can be used in the oven if necessary.All this goodness notwithstanding, there are some things I wish were a little better. Despite being well built the pans are still relatively light weight, and with not much in them the weight of the handle is enough to tip the pan toward it if you put it down quickly or carelessly. And the pans seem relatively shallow, which means they don\'t hold as much and also make flipping food a little more difficult than a deeper pan. The most annoying thing though is that my standard lids will not lock into place on these pans. This seems like a cheap trick to incentivize customers to buy Red Copper lids. I just continue to use my lids as they do sit on top of the pan, but they will slide off if they\'re pushed or the pan is tilted. Despite these not insignificant negatives, I\'m GLADLY living with them because they are so far outweighed by having a healthy nonstick pan that actually works.So in the end, while they\'re not perfect (name me something that is), overall I\'m thrilled with these pans and most likely will be buying more. Very highly recommended!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 1, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan Reasonable Price', 'author': 'Mark Fairchild', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I gauge my pans by how easily I can cook scrambled eggs- It\'s no stick and cleans up easily. I\'ve used more expensive pans and eventually they all lose "nonstick"- get some scuffing in the bottom. These are priced so that you can just replace them. I use my pans daily- clean very easily- Quality pan and longlastingI can\'t comment on how long they last with dishwasher cleaning- I hand wash my pans', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pan in my house!', 'author': 'Meghan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "let me start off by saying I love this pan so much! It is the best pan to make my omelets in since they slip right out once they are done cooking. The clean up is super easy as the only place I need to scrub is the metal circles inside the pan that hold the handle.I had this pan for many years and it finally became a little less nonstick so I ordered another one. It is definitely worth the price for having it last so many years. Also, make sure you don't use the spray cans on this pan as I found it left a sticky residue which was what ultimately led me to needed a new one. Now I only use butter, a splash of oil, or just some water when cooking and it always turns out perfect without any stick.I never use metal utensils on this pan, I have plenty of plastic or silicone spatulas so there is no point in taking the risk of ruining the pan. To wrap this all up, it really is a great pan and if you take care of it then it should last you a very long time. Hope this helps!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 27, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice pan, but uncomfortable handle', 'author': 'Daniel Griscom', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought this to replace the last in a series of classic Teflon non-stick pan. After seasoning, it's incredibly slick, and food just wipes off. Very cool. There are two problems, though:- The handle, which is stamped metal, is pretty uncomfortable, especially when you're flipping something. I understand that not using plastic allows it to be oven-safe, but a tubular metal handle would be a big improvement.- Although it seems very slick, fried eggs just will NOT slide in the pan. You can easily lift them off with a spatula, but try and just flip them and no dice: they stay where they are. So, I now have to dirty a spatula every time I fry some eggs. (Again, the pan itself seems extremely slick; it's just something about the surface which resists sliding by eggs.)I miss flipping my eggs. I'll see how long the pan lasts, but unless it's for a good three or four years I'll probably switch back to Teflon.Edit: after a week of breakfasts, eggs now slide just fine, and I'm back to flipping. I guess the factory-recommended seasoning doesn't do enough; perhaps more time in the oven, or repeating, would be better, or perhaps you just need to fry a series of eggs. The handle hasn't improved over time, though; it's still uncomfortable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great', 'author': 'elan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great pan does not stick and easy to clean', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Who would have thunk it!?!?!', 'author': 'Connie N.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this to replace an old pan that had nonstick on it. Looking for no PFOAS, this one was twenty bucks. I was hesitant because it\'s one of those "Bulbhead" as seen on tv items, which are usually trashy. Decided it was only twenty bucks so would give it a try. LOVE LOVE LOVE it! Highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Third Purchase Over Time', 'author': 'WV Bender', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Keep the surface treatment instructions as it does help maintain. It seems like maybe adding spices directly to cooking increases food to stick.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Nonstick my $#@#$%^!!!!!', 'author': 'Ray', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I bought this product because it claimed to be "nonstick" and had a "lifetime" warranty. Both are a lie. While it worked OK for a couple of months, things began to stick. I went to the web site to see what they said about the issue. They obviously are aware that the product does not perform as advertised for a "lifetime" and suggested baking it in the oven to restore the "nonstick" properties. I have done this several times and as you can see from my photos and video, that is also a lie. Looking to exercise my "lifetime warranty" I came to find out that if you wanted to pay the price of a new pan they would send you another one. Pleas see the "Camalizer" snapshot on the selling price of this product. As you can see it has sold for around $9. Bruce at Bulbhead tells me that to replace the pan under the "lifetime warranty" I had to pay them $9.99 for the replacement. If I had not purchased it on Amazon and had an order number I would be required to also pay to ship the defective pan back to Bulbhead. The net cost would be more than the price of the pan. Before you entertain any thought of buying any product from Bulbhead please see the the cut and paste below from their web site."What is my warranty on my product?We are confident the value and quality of our merchandise will meet, if not exceed your expectations. In the event you are not completely satisfied, we\'ll gladly provide an exchange or refund your purchase price for items returned in their original condition within 30 days after you receive them (excluding return shipping charges, discounts, shipping and handling charges and any separate fees). Refunds will be made to your original form of payment."', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good pan', 'author': 'Buddy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fair price fast shipping good seller I’m happy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Seems good', 'author': 'LLP', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I just got it cannot right a review that fast.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: KitchenAid Stainless Steel Frying Pan/Skillet, 12 Inch, Brushed Stainless Steel
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and beautiful pan', 'author': "apricot's mom", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is a good pan. The handle is good quality, does not get heated with the pot, and is helpflu in handling the pan. The pan is made of sturdy, thick layer of material. Has scale engraved on the inner side which is superful helpful in pouring just the right amount into the pan. The spout is another great feature of the pan. Also, have to mention, it does look nice with its great finish. To be honest, this pan at this price is a great buy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just Bought my Second One', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this saucepan so much. It’s the perfect size for a lot of things like heating up soup for one person, melting butter, and so much more. The measurements on the inside are helpful. The handle stays cool. It’s a good quality pan at an affordable price. The best part is the pour spouts on each side. I just bought a second one to keep in our RV.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great stock pot', 'author': 'Squirrel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this stock pot for my best friend who just purchased her first house. She was incredibly happy when she opened this gift. Great quality, thick pot. Kitchenaid never disappoints with the quality or style.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars cooks in 1/2 of time but don't like the steamer pan", 'author': 'tulsadoberman', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I just got these yesterday, January 5, 2024, and immediately through everything in the dishwasher.They came out just fine so they are dishwasher safe.I really like how heavy and solid they feel and the silicone coated handles on the pans and lids are great to get a firm grip on and avoid the heat.I've only used the large frying pan this morning, January 6, 2024 to make my breakfast of a quarter pound sausage pattie, hashbrowns, 2 pieces of French toast, and 2 scrambled eggs.Normally with my old frying pan, I would weigh my sausage and flatten it out and then put it right in the frying pan before turning on the burner. I've figured out that it took 20 minutes for the first side to get done and then flipping it over for 10 minutes for the second side.However, I noticed with this new frying pan, it started burning after 10 minutes and flipped it over and the second side started to burn after 5 minutes so it only took 1/2 of the time to make my sausage pattie.This was a pain because I always had time to wash my potato and shred it for the hashbrowns, get out all the ingredients for the French toast and scrambled eggs before I even needed to flip the sausage pattie but today, I really had to bust my butt to get everything else ready.Grabbing the lid handle was easy with the silicone coating since my old frying pan had a glass lid with a glass handle and the handle would get really hot.Hashbrowns also cooked in 1/2 of the time and they stuck a little bit because I forgot how fast the sausage pattie cooked so the hashbrowns also cooked much faster.The French toast also stuck but only a little but I kept close to them flipping them after 2 minutes.The scrambled eggs also only took about 3 minutes instead of about 5 minutes.Haven't cleaned the large frying pan since it's still hot and wanted to get this out right away.Now, what I don't like about these is the steamer pan because it only fits about 1/3 of the way into the medium sauce pan instead of all the way down. I was really hoping to use it like a strainer for making spaghetti so I didn't need to get the large colander out to drain the spaghetti.I was hoping to boil the spaghetti right in the steamer pan and pull it right out draining all the water at the same time.Other than the steamer pan, I really like the feel, weight, and sturdiness of these pans so far but I've only used the large frying pan and lid. If I have any issues with the other pans, I'll update this and post about them but I'm guessing there won't be any issues since how well the large frying pan did this morning.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful pans.', 'author': 'Earlene', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought these pans because they were Kitchenaid. The clean easily and these are the best non-stick pans I have ever used. I've bought 4 or 5 that have not held up. These are great. The brushed Stainless Steel outside does not show cleaning marks.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works on induction cooktops!', 'author': 'SteveRI', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This works on induction cooktops, which is why I bought it. I needed a one quart sauce pan with a cover and pour spouts. This fit the bill precisely. It is a regular workhorse, easy to clean, and heats stuff up. What more could you ask for !', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Frying pan', 'author': 'Sandra R', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was a gift, it looked very good quality and I have seen it on her drying rack, cleaned up very good. Ensure you have a nice scotch bright sponge to keep it shiny!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent', 'author': 'Debra H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is now my daily used saucepan in the kitchen. Thank You!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good thermal conductivity', 'author': 'Subin Chae', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Great product!But I feel sad about the dent after I unwrap whole things :'(", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Ninja C30020 Foodi NeverStick Premium 8-Inch Fry Pan, Hard-Anodized, Nonstick, Durable & Oven Safe to 500°F, Slate Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'David', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pans are awesome! They will be all you use. Throw all your others out. Zero sticking while your cooking, even heating across whole bottom, and super easy clean up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I FINALLY FOUND THE BEST FRYPAN', 'author': 'sojourner', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Awesome. Excellent. No Surprises! Pan is balanced well and will not lean over when empty, or partially empty. Super durable, easy to clean, excellent heat distribution, handle stays cool. There is a god.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Tough as nails, versatile as any, refuses to stick!', 'author': 'E. Celen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'You don’t need to read a long review to understand the primary feature of these pans: Theses are non-stick pans that actually stay non-stick 😱I’ve seared steaks with them, I’ve cooked lotta acidic food in them, I’ve put them in dishwasher regularly, I’ve even been stacking them with other metal pans, and they just keep going on, just as non-stick, flat, and neat as the day I bought them.Regular teflons flake/scratch/discolor, newer “ceramic” pans are only non-stick until you wash them a handful of times (even if you hand-wash exclusively!), but these are like my carbon-steel/cast-iron pans in how much abuse they can take.The only thing I pay attention to is pre-heating them as instructed (and Ninja put that particular instruction very prominently all over the pans for good reason) and it does make a difference. Kinda like how you gotta pre-heat your (good) stainless steel pans.The fact that they have other nice features (stacking handles, high-temp oven-safe, induction-ready) are just icing on the cake since I would’ve bought more of these simply for their durability if nothing else.Oh, let me kinda sorta point out one downside: that extra handle, while useful for stacking, just means more rivets and gets in the way of quick flips sometimes (think pancakes). Given these pans aren’t heavy unlike steel/cast-iron pans, handles are hardly useful for anything besides stacking pans for storage. Not a deal breaker bu any means, just a note. Flat rivets would’ve helped a lot with this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love these pans. Best non-stick out there.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "If you're thinking about getting them, do it. They're great. I've had them for 5 months now, and have used them a ton. Nothing sticks to them and they hold heat very well. You do need to let them heat up a little longer than your used to, as they are very dense, heavy metal. Takes a couple times to get used to, but worth it. Very high quality. Best non-stick pans I've ever used. I use metal tongs on them, very gently, and have had 0 scratches and no non-stick material come off. I cannot recommend them enough.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice looking, easy to use and store.', 'author': 'MICHAEL R.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These appear to be great NON-STICK pans but have mixed reviews concerning the description on the box and the enclosed instructions! IF they use 30.000 degrees to apply the nonstick, then why are they only rated at 500 degrees in the oven and warning of pan damage on stove top with too much heat?? Instructions tell you how to pre-heat, how to stack them, how to clean them and even how to wash and prevent damage but NOT HOW TO actually use them!!?? First time I tried to make an omelet, French toast, pancakes.... everything stuck to the pan!! Since aerosol sprays are not recommended, I used butter, or some left over bacon grease and cooking was a breeze! WHY is this not covered in the instructions?? (Thus the 4-star rating and no rating on the non-stick as we are still evaluating the pans). Probably would return, but if they last at least 3 years it will be worth the money comparing to similar nonstick cookware. Still working on the 10-year warranty, however, don't have much faith these days in long term warranties as it usually does not pan out for the consumer as the companies tend to find fault in the consumers use and care of said items:(( But they do look nice, stack nice and clean up well, only time will tell the true story and will re-evaluate again at a later date.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan!', 'author': 'K.T.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this grill pan! So much so that I bought one for my son. I’ve cooked ribeye steaks in it when we didn’t feel like firing up the grill and they come out very tender and juicy in this skillet. I’ve also cooked bnls/skls chicken and hamburger patties in it with great results. It is a weighty skillet and very easy to clean. I have always had good luck with the Ninja brand and this was no exception. I highly recommend this product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works as expected.', 'author': 'Michael Moua', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this pan after using a different Ninja non-stick that I had for over 2 1/2 years. The first time I used the pan the eggs stuck to the pan even with oil. I was disappointed that I spent over $40 for a pan that was not non-stick. The second time I used it I heated the pan first and didn't use any oil to test it and it worked great. The eggs didn't stick to the pan and has been working since.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love ninja products', 'author': 'TRains1972', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I don't care what ninja product I've ever purchased, they are all amazing! I have so many things by their company and they last forever. This particular pan is the perfect size and just what I needed to complete my ninja frying pan and sauce pan collection. I highly recommend this pan.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Little gem!!', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We had experience with the Ninja 10 inch fry pan but decided to try a stainless steel 8 inch this time. Big mistake. The Ninja 8 inch is perfect for anything you can fit into it! We followed the instructions before using it the first time and since then we just wipe it out with a paper towel and keep using it. When we wash it, it cleans up super easily and ready to go again. This little gem gets the best possible review we could give it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great griddle, does fit in my dishwasher', 'author': 'G. I've really only used it for pancakes but so far it is doing a great job, and I'm able to make 4 pancakes at once.Before I bought it I was concerned whether or not it would be too long to fit in my dishwasher. I saw the dimensions listed as 21 inches long (which would be too long to fit in my dishwasher), but the pan itself it is actually 19.5 inches long.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Granitestone 14 Inch Frying Pan with Lid, Large Non Stick Skillet for Cooking, Nonstick, Ultra Durable Mineral and Diamond Coating, Family Sized Open Skillet, Oven/Dishwasher Safe, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this large skillet!', 'author': 'C. Runy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Although much larger than I usually use, this one is perfect when I have a recipe that needs a larger than usual skillet. When I have company, this allows me to prepare a meal that requires more room to cook everything at one time. Although I don’t use it as often as I do its smaller companion which I also purchased, it is wonderful to have on those occasions when I need more room. What more can you want?', 'author': 'H. Misso', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this skillet. When we cook we tend to cook large amounts to freeze them later and this pan definitely fills the bill. Disappointing as well is that everything I cook in it now sticks to the middle of the pan where it warped. I have to soak the pan for a while to be able to get the center clean. It will warp.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The 14" Armor Max Pan by Granitestone is a hefty pan. Has been working great for me. I\'d highly recommend. But it does not come with a lid. So being very happy with that pan and needing a lid for some cooking, I thought I\'d try the "Granitestone 14 Inch Frying Pan with Lid, Large Non Stick Skillet". As many of the reviews identify, the pan warps with very little heat. It is a much lighter/thinner pan. I use gas and set my burner to number 2 of 10. Very low heat. Within 30 seconds the pan warped and would not sit flush on the stove. The center puckled. Weird that it does seem to flatten back out when you remove the heat. I\'ll keep it mainly because the lid fits the better Granitestone pan I previously purchased.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "2.0 out of 5 stars Don't buy!", 'author': "This pan sucks! Wouldn't buy!!!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Able to brown meat and veges!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For the price I wasn't expecting too much from this pan, I just needed to replace an old non-stick pan for quick meals during the week. I needed something large, nonstick, and was quick to clean. This fits the bill perfectly. A pleasant surprise has been that I can actually get pretty good browning on meats and veges, something that Teflon-type pans won't do. The only negative is that it's a little light, so it heats very fast but also has a hot spot, but again, this is used for relatively quick, easy dishes during the week, and it excels at that. For more complicated or longer recipes, you may be better served using your cast/porcelain coated iron or heavy stainless steel pans.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Satisfied with purchase', 'author': 'Ellen C.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have some old Granitestone sauce pans (15+ years) that I\'m still using, and love them. title: Calphalon Classic Hard-Anodized Nonstick Cookware, 12-Inch Cooking Pan with Lid
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High qualify, very non stick, easy to clean', 'author': 'Spunky Punky Sparkle Princess', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This Calphalon pan is amazing. I can use it like a regular frying pan or kinda like a wok. It’s versatile and very useful. I like that it is lightweight and easy to clean. The non-stick is perfect - when I fry an egg and it just slides right out of the pan with no coaxing. The lid fits really well and cleans up easy. It’s nearly as heavy as the pan. Both pieces are nice and sturdy.I use this on my gas stove and it works well on low, medium or high heat. I chose this handle design because I wanted something lightweight, and also because I frequently have 2-3 pots on the stove at a time. The kitchen is small so we’ve had a few incidents where the handles of pans got knocked causing spills. These handles are thin and short so don’t expect them to stay as cool as a regular handle. I just use square crochet trivets to grab the handles - cuz the handles don’t get super hot.This is my 3rd Calphalon pan in 20 years. They’ve really never disappointed me. I’m excited to replace my 10” skillet next. The old one lasted over 10 years. Don’t know if I’m meant to keep them that long, but I did. And I’m replacing it because it’s non stick coating doesn’t work properly anymore.Be aware - this is pan I’m reviewing is not the kind of Calphalon that you can use with metal utensils - it’s part of the classic series - so use plastic, silicone or wood tools with it. The packaging tells you this info too. It was packaged nice and arrived quick.I’m in love with my new Calphalon pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect size, perfect depth, very easy to wash. You need absolutely no cooking spray to keep food from sticking to it. Just don't heat it up before putting food into it. Turn on the heat immediately before or immediately after turning the heat on. For the small pan, don't turn the heat up to high because the bottom of the pan is not large enough to withstand the width of the heat and it will darken the part of the handle that is closest to the pan. I loved this so much that i bought another one with the same wonderful characteristics. Another thing I like about theses pans is that there is a place on both sides that makes it easier to pour the contents of the pan out without dribbling down the side of the pan. title: imarku Non Stick Frying Pans 10inch Frying Pan Nonstick with Detachable Wooden Handle, Egg Pan Honeycomb Cast Iron Skillet Pan, Dishwasher Safe, Oven Safe To 500°F Pans
