This pan is not good as a sauce pan as the shape slopes up to the edges like a Wok, but for any other frying pan use it is excellent.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cooks like a cast iron and cleans like a nonstick', 'author': 'Eric  G', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This has become my favorite fry pan. It's durable - at least so far after 3 months of use; it cleans really easily - as good as any nonstick I've used an unlike cast iron pans; it cooks like my cast iron pans - you can get a crisp on cooking that I've only gotten with cast iron. I find you can use a lot less butter or oil and still have it be fully nonstick. In my experience, nonstick pans lose their nonstick pretty quickly and I've owned many - including expensive ones. The weight is fairly easy to manage - it's lighter than cast iron but heavier than a nonstick pan. I liked the pan son much, I purchased one for each of my adult sons as a gift.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: DELARLO Whole body Tri-Ply Stainless Steel 12inch Frying Pan, Oven safe induction skillet,pots and pans set,Suitable for All Stove (Detachable Handle)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No rivets, easy cleaning, uniform temp. distribution', 'author': 'Tinkererguy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Having been on the business end of countless cooking vessels, the first thing I will say is I dislike handles with rivets protruding into the inside of the pan. I have not seen any riveted pans that are NSF certified, due to bacteria/food being difficult to clean, especially with dishwasher-only process. There's no good reason not to weld the handles, or attaching hardware, other than maybe being cheaper? It's nice to use a spatula and cleanly swipe the inside of the pan to get what you're cooking off the sides....rivets prevent that. The removable handle(s) are a nice touch. I have never had any issues with the nuts or attachment process. Maybe some people did but could be a defect in the threads, or overtightening. Put a drop of oil on the threads before tightening, and lift the handle up and down while final-tightening, which allows a completely solid connection, which I have never had loosen. BTW, the thread is a 5mmx.8mm common metric thread, so if you lose a nut (they give you extras) you can buy them on amazon. Some pans have the handle permanently welded to the pan but I like the removable feature, allowing storage in tight areas, or I sometimes keep it off and use the pan like a pie pan to bake with, and the handle being off, makes it less cumbersome in the oven. If you make skillet-browned cornbread, this works almost as well as a cast iron skillet. There are no lids with this but the price is great, and you can buy lids, or if you're like me, you already have lids that fit these saute pans. The lip of these pans are flared out, making pouring liquid/stew/etc out clean with no drips down the side of the pan. I measured temperatures across the bottom of the pan while heating on an induction cooktop. The temperature was very uniform across the interior, and the magnetic coupling to the induction coils was very efficient, indicating a good magnetic stainless steel used in the mfg process. To season the pan, I use either coconut oil, or avacado oil (not spray oil, as the lecithin used for release agent will break down under high heat). So heat the pan to around 400F (after first cleaning it), then wipe the oil to coat the pan's inside with a paper towel and oven mitten(s). This will greatly reduce sticking. So to recap, great pan, flat bottom, great handle and attachment hardware, easy to clean and use. Price is also very good for high quality pans. I've cooked several meals, cornbread, and desserts with them, and am still happy with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for the Price', 'author': 'Leonardo Gonzalez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Came in quick and it looks real sturdy. Been using it for everything and its way better than any nonstick nonsense. Cooks nice and evenly and is easy to clean. Got it for like $30 and its worth it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A terrific value!', 'author': 'Cactus99', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'First, in full disclosure. I am no chef and I purchased this for home use. I do however have a professional background as a food and beverage manager, and do know my way around a kitchen :) To be honest, whether this works for you will primarily depend on two things 1) Your expectations, and 2) The type of stove that you have or primarily use (Gas, Exposed Heating Element/Electric Coil, Induction, Glass Top with Enclosed Heating Element). "Even Heat Distribution" will depend not only on the pan, but also the type of stove and the size of the burner. So when reading reviews, look at the reviews using the same stove type that you will be cooking with :) I like and prefer induction, but at the moment I have a glass top with enclosed elements. I find that the pan heats up alright, but will be a bit slower than with gas or induction. For home use, I find this pan to work just fine :) The materials, finish, handle, comfort and heft (solidity) are all better than I had expected in this price range. I think this is a terrific value at this price point. Please note that as this is stainless steel, it will clean differently than a "non stick" type of pan :) Also, it feels very solid, and has the weight to back it up, so it is significantly heavier than a "non stick" pan. So if you might not have the hand, wrist or arm strength for heavy items, this may not be the right choice for you (this would not be a good choice for my 75+ yr old mother.) Also, this will not fit your needs if you want a "branded" pan with snob appeal or status benefits. (Those pans can cost 300% and 400% more). Lastly, it\'s impossible to speak of durability with new purchases. So, what\'s the bottom line here? I really think that most people with appropriate expectations will really like this pan! It will do its job well, and will look good and feel good in your hand while doing it! And it feels like it will last for years to come. Can you spend more on a pan? Yes. If you are a regular person, do you need to? No. I can afford to buy a more expensive pan if I wish, but there is no need to. I am happy with this purchase at a great price, and I think you will be as well. I give it a thumbs up :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy & non stick', 'author': 'Jay M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was adequately satisfied and impressed with the quality & the dependability of the pan. And you can’t beat the price. I am a huge fan of Hexclad products however - I was on a budget. I’m thoroughly glad that I chose this brand and type. Really happy I chose it !', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pan', 'author': 'fran', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Perfect size and he's a nice weight to it. Also easy to clean.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars WASTE OF MONEY', 'author': 'shawna', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Well I have tried eggs/ sausage/ bacon/ french toast and many other things in this pan. I am no chef, just want a pan to cook things in. Everything I cook in this pan cooks in the middle and not the outskirts. I posted the video to show the raw pork sausages on the outside and cooked ones in the center. When I say center, it is just the center and very small radius. Takes 2x as long to cook something as when the center ones are cooked I take them out and have to move the ones on the outside to the center and cook them. Eggs too. 1/2 cooks 1/2 doesnt. Maybe I will just stick with those walmart pans as they did not have this trouble. Very dissapointed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Even better than expected', 'author': 'Patrobot', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A great pan for a reasonable price. The brushed finish is well executed and looks good.After seasoning once I had no problems cooking most finicky foods like eggs and chicken.I have had stainless cookware that would stick to cooking oil, this pan is totally fine to work with.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value!', 'author': 'Angelo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This 12-inch stainless steel pan is a great deal! I snagged it for just $26 (after a $10 clip-on coupon on the product page), and it has exceeded my expectations, especially considering the price.The heat distribution is good, seems about average from other pans I have seen reviewed. The pan takes longer than I expected to heat up, but it being my first stainless pan it could be normal. Following simple YT tutorials, I had zero sticking issues with my first-ever stainless steel cook - fried eggs and pancakes turned out perfectly. There is some discoloration after cooking however I read it is normal and doesn't affect the food and can be removed with some elbow grease(there are plenty of tutorials online how).The rivetless design is a nice addition and one I don't see in many stainless pans. The pan has a nice weight to it giving it a high-end feel. I personally really like the handle, It feels very comfortable in my hand and I can get a good grip, I was able to install it with no issues.In summary, my initial review is that this stainless steel pan offers really good performance and at its price point it is a great value. A solid 5-star rating for me!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The only pan I will ever need', 'author': 'JO', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wanted to wait until I began to use this pan regularly before I wrote my review.My husband hates my old small Revere Ware skillet. He tends to use higher heat than is necessary and it sticks.This new pan came with instructions! I found that if I follow them my food does not stick.My husband seared a steak and he said he ruined my new skillet. I said "no". Don\'t worry. I put water in it, a touch of Dawn and boiled the water. Everything came out with ease.I would love to have one of their pots to see if they work as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great pan', 'author': 'Kim', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This pan cooks evenly. Food comes out good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Rachael Ray Brights Hard Anodized Nonstick Frying Pan / Fry Pan / Hard Anodized Skillet - 8.5 Inch, Gray with Orange Handles
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price', 'author': 'lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this grilling pan. The nonstick is excellent cooks and cleans up like a dream. The pan itself cooks very evenly with great heat distribution. the size and depth are perfect for my needs, and it is heavy, not light and cheap. made well... I plan on purchasing a set of frying pans I love her product so much...', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I then noticed the attractive orange handles they were made and the beautiful clear lids with clear view glass view', 'author': 'Dasari Anusha', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is my first experience with Rachael Ray cookware. When I first removed the cookware from the set, I first noticed how light weight it was. I then noticed the attractive orange handles they were made and the beautiful clear lids with clear view glass view. It's not high end cookware, but it would be welcome in many or most homes.I used this to cook maggi. It was so perfectly cooked and also i don't see any thing stick to the bottom of the pan. They are made beautifully and perfectly for the use of cooking. I love to cook in Rachael Ray cookware. The food was delicious and tasty whenever i use these product for cooking.I always use to cook dal. Unfortunately, one day I forgot to turn off the stove and i see all mess in my kitchen. I see the dal was totally overcooked and some part of it was sticked to the cookware. That could have resulted in quite a mess with some other types of cookware, but it cleaned up quickly and still looked brand new.What I liked:* The design is very modern and attractive.* The glass lids have a sturdy rim that is designed so food will not be easily trapped* The orange handles are non-slip and easy to grip, and they keep very cool while cooking* The small size pots are very handy, and the 6 quart stock pot is a nice small-size stockpot that I'm finding a much better size for my use.* Cleanup was super easyWhat I didn't like:* The pots seem to be about half the thickness of most of my other pots and pans. While I don't think they would dent easily if dropped, they don't have a sturdy, well made feel to them.* When compared to my Calphalon, they also do not have the same quality hard anodized finish on the outside.* The nonstick coating doesn't feel as high quality as other brands. So far, so good though!* The pans do not have a thick bottom, and seem to heat unevenly. My food scorched quickly, so cooking time and technique will vary from my other cookware.I think this would make a great starter set for someone just starting out on their own. Despite the few flaws that I noticed , I am enjoying using this cookware and cooking just became a little more fun!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent cook pot', 'author': 'Vickie Bailey', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love my new cook pot. Easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A really nice grilling pan, nice size and function', 'author': 'Bert', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have used this grill pan for 5 months about 1-2 times a week. Structurally this pan is 11" square and ~2 to 2-1/2 deep. It arrived intact, no scrapes of anything like that. I purchased the pan w/orange colored handle. The handle is ~9" long, so if you are planning storage space, the overall span, then is about 20" (see pics) and diagonally it is 13-1/4", so I have it stacked on a 14" round pan. The grill nubs/ridges are about 1/16" high, ~ 5-1/2 " long.The handle feels like a soft silicone and there is a nice indentation for your thumb to grab on to the handle. The handle is nice in that it doesn\'t within reason heat up (like a metal handle) or if you keep an eye on location, does not burn. The handle does not fold. The ad / info says it can withstand oven temps to 350 degrees. It is made of anodized aluminum and should not rust. The attachment of the handle to the pan is well done and study- with the rivets being a good size. The grill pan weighs 2 lbs-5 oz for those conscious of weight, much less than a cast iron skillet. No seasoning / pre -seasoning needed. I use it on a gas stove, but the Q&A info indicates it works on electric, ceramic, glass, and electric cooktops; but not induction. In contrast to cast iron, the pan does not hold heat once the burner is turned off.The gill is divided up into 4 sections, great for burgers, steaks, grilled cheese sandwiches, and seared AHI tuna, of course for longer cuts of meat such as a flank steak, it does not provide the continuous (pretty) pattern of the outdoor BBQ. I use the grill on a Viking gas stove with a 4" burner with a grate of about 8" and the pan heats quickly and evenly. I think I read somewhere to not cook at higher than medium-high. The non-stick surface has worked well thus far and I use less oil than maybe other pans. For splash/splatter control I use a round lid. Rachel Ray does not make a square lid, but there is one avail from another vendor (see link below), I haven\'t purchased this.Cleaning is easy with a scouring/sponge pad / brush designed for teflon type surfaces, sometimes letting it soak awhile after dinner. If overcooked in particular, the brush will work well to clean between the folds of the grill. Other times I just throw it in the dishwasher. Clean-up is so easy, I have gotten away from using the gas grill on the Viking gas stove.Overall pleased with this grilling pan, functional, easy to use, cleans easily, a great size for the typical burner/cooking appliance.Link to square lid:https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07CP1CL2T/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A solid, non-stick grill pan', 'author': 'Chella', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a solid grill pan, especially for the relatively inexpensive price. I wanted to start to cook my own grilled chicken, burgers, etc. at home, and this was a nice jump. Keep in mind, I've never had a grill pan before, so this is my first experience with one!First, this pan is a decent size - it can easily hold four burgers at once, or multiple chicken breasts. If you allow the pan to pre-heat, you do get those nice grill marks on the food. It's still as non-stick as ever, but I took note of the directions before hand (medium heat and a soft sponge!) to ensure it lasts a long time.The biggest issue I have with this pan is the time it takes to cook food, especially things like chicken. It takes a LONG time to grill chicken breasts unless they are super thin. The first few times I used this pan, I had to put the chicken back to cook, even after 5 minutes per side. I have resulted to adding a bit of water to the pan at the end of the cooking process to create some steam to super-heat the pan, but I shouldn't have to do that. Also, this pan did not come with a cover, so I am using other lids to trap the heat in place.In addition, the pan is a pain in the butt to clean. It's definitely nonstick, but food tends to get trapped in the ridges of the grill sections. I am sure this is a common problem with grill pans... but I just thought I would mention it! I usually use a paper towel to clean this pan, and I have to really dig into those ridges in order to get the gunk out.Like I mentioned, this is a solid nonstick grill pan that does what it promises. If you buy this, just be sure to leave chicken on this pan for a little extra time!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and so big!', 'author': 'CSP', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect non-stick surface. Heats evenly, beautiful orange accent color, cleans super easily, cooks to perfection.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Pan', 'author': 'J. W.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I needed a big pan for some of the meals I cooked and decided on this one. So far it's been a really good pan. The one downside is when I drain the fat from ground beef dishes, it's a little big to hang on to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars best money spent ever! bought one for a friend i loved it that much.', 'author': 'jennifer mccausland', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'nothing to dislike it is perfect. easy to clean. has not burnt a thing gorgeous colors looks great on the stove when cooking', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Professional Chef Saying This is Great', 'author': 'danny boylen, II', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love the shape of this sauce pan. It may not last forever (I’ve only had it for a month and non-stick pans never last forever), but I love this pan. If it is good for a year, it’s worth it to me. If it’s good for two, it’s really great value. If it’s good for three, it’s incredible. Buy this pan.And not for nothing, but RR ain’t my favorite food personality, so if I can get beyond that and still love this pan, maybe you might consider it too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cute and Practical', 'author': 'Ashleyreb', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this pan set. I was surprised at how easy they are to clean. You can literally wipe them clean. I do wish the large frying pan had a lid but its not a deal breaker. Great quality and I love the color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: DELARLO Tri-Ply Stainless Steel 12 Inch Deep Frying Pan 6 QT Saute Pan Nonstick, Induction Compatible Chef Cooking Pan, Sauté Pan with lid, Dishwasher & Oven Safe
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprised!', 'author': 'michelle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was not expecting much about this pan, boy was I wrong! This is my favorite pan, I make so many different recipes in this pan, anywhere from soups, to sauces, cabbage rolls, stews, breakfast, It is the perfect size and well made, the side handles do not get hot and I love it came with a heavy sturdy glass lid, this was well worth the money, oh and it is super easy to clean!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic, and a HexClad equivalent for a quarter of the price', 'author': 'Greg Taylor', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I didn't want to spend $200 on the HexClad version of this pan - and I'm glad I didn't. Makes a great chicken fryeras it can hold a whole 5 pound fryer split into pieces - also large and deep enough to do a pot roastwith veggies, or a pan lasagna....Point is, it's big enough to cook for a family, it's versatile, well made, heavy duty and well priced. If you're giving this serious consideration I can wholeheartedly say go for it! I saw a lot of negative reviews about this pan, but you have to be able to weed out the reviews written by people who don't know how to use or clean stainless. It's a learning process that has nothing to do with the pans quality. The pan cooked well and evenly and cleaned up like I'm used to, I always boil water at the end and loosen the fond and clean with barkeeper's friend. Great pan at the sale price I paid. Hope it holds up!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great size', 'author': 'islandgirl', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pan is a whopper with some heft to it, which is why it's so great to have that extra handle to move it around. When I took it out of the box it was in its own bag, making me think I was getting something special. The handle came separately with its own tightening wrench and extra nuts. The nuts and handle are well made and nicely polished stainless steel too. It's nice to have the option to remove the handle for cleaning.The pan itself is well made and the screws for the handle don't go through to the inside of the pan; so no hard to clean spots inside. Nice! The sides are extra high and the 6 quart capacity gives the pan versatility. The lid actually stays cool, unlike some other cookware who say they do but don't.The cooking is very even and cleaning is a breeze, as long as you take care of the pan as the manufacturer suggests. This does also clean up nicely in the dishwasher. This pan will be my go-to for many things!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful pan', 'author': 'Just Shopping', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This stainless-steel pan is so versatile and my go-to pan when cooking casseroles, crustless potpie, tacos, and other 1 pot/pan dishes. The wrench is simply too small for the nuts. If you are like many urban dwellers and apartment livers and only have pliers, they will scratch the nuts, and maybe the pan too. So, you have to find someone with a 10mm box-end wrench or a crescent wrench. Basically, you can't use this pan if you don't have tools....so maybe fix that??", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The best pan I have ever met!!', 'author': 'stpzhao', 'rating': 5, 'content': "What I like the most is the fast heat distribution and non stick. Will purchase it again for a backup when the price drops to $35. Don't understand why Amazon marked this pan as a high returned items. I think some people just don't know how t use a stainless steel pan in correct steps.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: GreenPan Chatham Prime Midnight Hard Anodized Healthy Ceramic Nonstick 8" and 10" Frying Pan Skillet Set, Omelette and Egg Pan, PFAS-Free, Dishwasher Safe, Oven Safe, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome set', 'author': 'Mimi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The set of two pans are ideal size. Great heat distribution, and amazing non-stick surface. Highly reccomend this product!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Pans!', 'author': 'richard marko', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice pan. Heats up well and holds heat well. Comfortable handle. Easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Still outstanding more than a year later!', 'author': 'PLano', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After a long awaited kitchen remodel, I treated myself to these new pans in December 2021. It is now April 2023 and I am writing this review about a product that is now very well tried and wonderfully true. They are the best frying pans I have ever owned, and more than a year later, they look and perform like brand new. Perfect surface. Nothing ever sticks, including eggs. These are fantastic.I will also add, these pans are extremely well cared for. They never go in the dishwasher (no big deal since clean up is sooo easy with this surface!). They are never subject to cooking spray. I do use olive oil, sesame oil, avocado oil, and butter when needed, but never an aerosol spray. They are also never used above medium heat, and no metal utensils ever get used with them. Some family members have received mild, slightly veiled threats about consequences if they break the rules for my pans. :-) The positive result is that these pans continue to be fantastic, pristine tools of the trade in my kitchen.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars If you want Nonstick, this is your set.', 'author': 'bakermom', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I received these and waited to review so that I had some time to use in different ways. First, it\'s a great price for 2 pans. The finish appears to be durable with a couple of caveats. 1) don\'t use much or oil or butter and NO cooking sprays. 2) use only medium/low heat ranges. 3) hand wash. I use one or the other pan almost daily. They are kind of light weight but also well made and sturdy. My one complaint (ok 2) are very minor. One is that because they are really nonstick, food can fly around the pan too much. The second part of this is that the sides "could" be a little higher. But it\'s my fault that I didn\'t look closely at measurements. All in all, these are really great pans and should last at least a couple of years. I cook a lot and the appear brand new. I would purchase these or other configurations of them again. They\'re also very nice looking. Love the color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Nonstick Pans', 'author': 'Nate', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These have been perfect. I warm up a little olive oil or butter before adding the food I'm cooking and so far nothing has stuck while cooking. If you let food cool in the pans it will stick a bit but washes off very easily.Haven't had them very long so not sure about long term durability but I only use plastic utensils, hand wash and store with an old rag between them to avoid scratches.Hopefully they are as non-toxic as they claim to be.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars In Love With These Pots.', 'author': 'Denise Brooks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great pans making cooking eggs enjoyable again. Hopefully they will remain this way with the proper care.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Green Pan Set 8" & 10"', 'author': 'Sandra C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Green Pans are great for some time if you take care of them.My last set lasted 2 years.I love them but the finish does not stay good forever.But replacing them won't break the bank.They work very well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars 3 years is the lifetime for this model line of pans', 'author': 'Michael V.', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I've bought 4 different GreenPan pans (all this model line). They all are experiencing the end of their useful life, which has proven to be about 3 years of frequent but not daily use. All have been well cared for, no metal utensils used, no cooking spray used, & all hand washed. The issue is the same for all, that the non-stick coating goes away in about 2yrs for heavily used ones (many times a week) and 3yrs for regularly used (many times a month) ones. They all start off amazing non-stick, but slowly fail in time. Dont buy these if you're looking for longterm or lifelong pans, but if you're OK replacing them all again in about 3yrs, then for the price you should consider these. Beware though in doing your research, there are many different models of these GreenPans and not all even last as long as mine. A family member after my initial great 1st impression of these pans, got a different model GreenPan than I did, and she said they were terrible. Do your research. I would not buy these again as I think non-stick pans should last more than 3 years with proper care in normal residential use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Bang for your buck', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like this pan because it does what is advertised.It’s definitely non-stick and eggs come out perfect every time.Clean up is awesome, I use soap and water with a paper towel.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect and Sturdy', 'author': 'L. Maloney', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love their pans!! Does not disappoint', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: GreenPan Paris Pro Hard Anodized Healthy Ceramic Nonstick, 8" Frying Pan Skillet, PFAS-Free, Dishwasher Safe, Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality green pan', 'author': 'Sharine Borslien', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I absolutely love this pan! After using it over a dozen times now, I can't believe I spent so many years settling for cheap non-stick pans. The Original Green Pan cooks food evenly without sticking, and requires only low to moderate heat. It is so easy to clean! Just let the pan cool down, add a bit of soapy water, and use a kitchen sponge to wipe out food bits and residues. I dry it immediately with a soft cotton towel and return it to its designated cupboard space.Speaking of this pan's non-stick surface, I love that it does not emit harmful chemicals into the air or the food, as I'm quite particular about reducing industrial products and by-products whenever possible.I also really like the style of this particular pan, the Paris Pro model. It has an attractive handle that stays cool even after the pan is over heat for several minutes.The only thing I don't like is that the manufacturer recommends never using cooking sprays because the aspirant can damage the anodized surface. It's an issue for me because I prefer to NOT use pressed oils in my food due to the added unnecessary fat calories (I don't even keep such oils in my kitchen!). But I can use water, wine, broth, or nothing in the case of some foods. Aside from that minor challenge, this pan is quickly becoming my new favorite for sautéing and braising, and re-heating small portions of leftovers.I separately bought the matching glass-and-metal cover, which helps with cooking foods like mushrooms, onions, fennel, and cauliflower, which I like to caramelize before softening.The price for this pan (and the cover) may seem high to some folks, but I feel it is worth the cost to have a pan that will likely last a lifetime when cared for properly! I can't say that for ANY of the other inexpensive non-stick pans I have purchased in the past.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High Quality Non-Stick Pan -- Care Required!', 'author': 'M. Anderson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The only pans I own are GreenPans. I was gifted a set by a family member when I moved out on my own for the first time and, after properly learning how to use these, I now have my kitchen equipped with them.QUALITY: I do enjoy that these are non-stick but safe to use and healthy enough to prep food on top of. The pan, like all GreenPans, is heavy to lift. Construction is solid and elegant. The handle never gets hot, ever.PERFORMANCE: Food cooks evenly, pan heats up fairly quickly. The non-stick on this pan is the best... Food will literally glide around the surface even if you don't put any cooking spray on the pan. Wonderful! I especially love this pan for eggs, because it's the perfect size and I can make them over easy without ever breaking a yolk.LONGEVITY: Here's the kicker -- if you do not treat these pans how they should be treated, they will ruin and in turn they will ruin your food. I made this mistake with my first GreenPan. You absolutely cannot use these pans with metal utensils. You cannot wash these pans with anything abrasive, including gentle abrasive on the back of a sponge. You cannot let a meal burn on this pan. You cannot leave grease in this pan for a few hours to clean it up later. These actions WILL RUIN your pan and it will become sticky when dry no matter how many times you wash it. In addition, your food will not cook properly and will always stick to the pan. If you only use plastic or wooden utensils, cook with care and do not burn, and was promptly with a gentle sponge these pans will last you for a very, very long time and you will enjoy the non-stick coating without any problem.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is the one', 'author': 'colorred', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have tried other ceramic pans and none have worked as well as this one. I have switched to this brand for all my pans. Cooks evenly and cleans easily, couldn't ask for more.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars So far completely non-stick', 'author': 'Barb', 'rating': 4, 'content': "We have used this pan for only a couple weeks so cannot comment on durability. But it is totally non-sticking. Just wipe out the butter or grease and wash lightly with some dish soap. That's it. Also from the manufacturer info, seems to be non-toxic, or as much as this type of pan allows. I did take off one star for the handle. It is a plus that the handle is metal with metal fasteners. The negative is that it is too long for such a small pan, and the weight of it tips the pan unless set down in exactly the right place on the grate of our gas stove. But still, I would recommend the pan for its excellent functionality.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic lit'l pan😍", 'author': 'ShoeLvr', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just had to write a review after daily using this pan for weeks without any issues whatsoever. This little pan is now my ultimate favorite from cooking eggs/omelettes, chicken and the best seared steak, cheese pasta, etc to perfection❗Nothing burns and everything just slides out of the pan with ease. ↕️The key is to follow the instructions completely and take care to "Not" use high heat "it\'s not necessary". ✔Warm the pan on low heat first, thereafter I prefer just a lit\'l butter, ghee, olive or avocado oil (1 -2 tbsp or less depending on how much protein one uses~I can even get 1lb of thawed chicken tenders in my pan). I generally use this small pan for everything and that\'s truly saying a lot considering the various expensive skillets, pots and pans I own from Europe to Japan, and including America\'s top chefs and companies. This fantastic, essential pan is my permanent go to💚', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love this pan!', 'author': 'Mary C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just trashed a Tramontina 8” that I bought 11 months ago for $25 after reading a Wirecutter review. . Normally, a cheap nonstick frying pan will last me 3-4 years given that I take perfect care: silicon utensils, and always hand-washed. Good riddance! See my review of that pan for details, but the rivets and rim were not just NON-nonstick, they were egg magnets. So hello, Greenpan! I paid $34, did a lot of research, including ATK and other respected sources. Its rivets and rim are nonstick, and, after scrambling eggs, it washes up perfectly with the SOFT side of a sponge. Given that I use my 8” frying pan frequently, I feel okay about the price because it’s free from the pxxx’s. My only “complaint” is that I wish they would eliminate the double-speak in packaging: You’re looking at the packaging around the pan. The white “Quick Tips” sticker in the middle was on the bottom of the pan, and I put it on top of the packaging. Note at middle right in rather large letters, it says “METAL UTENSIL SAFE” with an image of a spatula that one guesses is…metal? The Amazon product description has similar language. But under “Quick Tips” and “Utensils” it says “Silicon utensils are best and will extend the life of your coating.” While researching, I noted numerous examples of the same doublespeak in product descriptions from other manufacturers. But, if I paid $34 based on the expectation that I could use metal spatulas and ??? Whisks??? with aplomb, I would expect to get at least 4-5 years of use. Perhaps’s that’s the case: I don’t know; however, Greenpan’s own packaging contradiction makes me doubtful—and I don’t intend to find out, because I will treat it with loving care! Update after several months of use: This is a dream pan. I cook eggs with the merest amount of fat and they slide right off—and then the pan cleans up with the soft side of a sponge.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars The “non stick” wore off very quickly', 'author': 'Ido Weinberg', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'When the pan first came it worked very well. But food started to stick to it within 5-6 uses despite washing only with soft brushes by hand and only using blunt wooden utensils. Even before food started sticking to it, parts became stained and could not be restored to the “new” / “clean” appearance.The picture I attached is residue from making a simple omelette despite ample butter.So -I would not recommend it at all. Look elsewhere.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The perfect pan!', 'author': 'TJS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very well made and exactly as described… with the proper care this should last a lot longer than our old pan. Everything just slides off!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Follow the directions for cooking and cleaning with this pan.', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have had this pan for over a year and use it 3 or 4 times a week. Still works as good as the day it was new.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Heavy handle and losing sickness already', 'author': 'M Lombardi', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The pan will tip over when placed on a gas tip stove, mainly because the handle is too heavy for the pan, so it is not balanced. This makes it hard to preheat the pan. Also, after a few weeks of use on an almost daily basis, and being very careful to use only silicone or wooden tools and only lightly rinsing and wiping the pan (no dishwasher used) The pan is not as slick as it started out, so it will require some oil to prevent food from sticking in a few weeks. So, once again, a non stick pan that does not live up to the hype of lasting more than a few months before needing oil, which pretty much defeats the purpose of a nonstick pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excedllent for cooking meat', 'author': 'Jill M. Grimard III', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Had to replace another large pan that had Teflon but was starting to flake so did some research and found this one. Been working great so far. Easy to clean, though I wash it by hand and don’t put in dishwasher.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan for the price', 'author': 'Nathan Hoar', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The one I got (12" Fry Pan) was manufactured in Brazil, for anybody that cares about that. FYI to those that do not, the ones made in China are the same spec. As an American, if its not made in America i\'m not paying a premium for it. Being from Brazil or from China is the same thing, it was still a foreign manufacturer.Moving on, this pan is very good. Heats evenly and holds its heat for a while, but not as long as cast iron which is what you\'re looking for in something like this. To get very hot for searing, it only needs to be on medium heat for maybe 2-3 minutes. It transfers heat well so you do not need to put it on high. I have used it for a couple months now and the bottom is still perfectly flat. The only downside to this pan is that is has less flat surface on the bottom compared to my other 12" pan because of the gently sloping sides. I still find myself using this more often though because it just cooks better despite not being non-stick.A quick note on it not being non-stick. This is really not a huge deal. Heat up the oil in the pan first and the food still doesn\'t stick much. It does a must better job at putting a nice crust on food than my non-stick skillet. Also for cleaning, just put some hot water (from the tap is fine) in the pan while it is still hot after use and let it sit while you eat. Rinse it out when you are done and stick it in the dishwasher. So far for me that gets it to come out clean every time. DO NOT USE COLD WATER, the pan may warp.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 13, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome pan/skillet', 'author': 'Teresa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have love this cookware. I won a 6 inch skillet yrs ago and it is awesome. So I knew the 14 inch would be also. I wish I could get the complete set. I have an old wood handle knife that I use and wish I could find another one. Really good quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Why did I wait so long?', 'author': 'Joanna Tolson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We averaged about three years using non-stick skillets. It didn't matter which brand - we did the high-end Calphalon, All-Clad, and some less expensive brands. We also tried the most highly-rated ceramic cookware. Nothing lasted long enough. Eventually, food started sticking, and cleaning became a chore. You couldn't scour the pan without damaging it further, but just using a cloth or sponge took forever.After poking around to find quality stainless steel, Tramontina was recommended regularly - and at less than half the cost of All-Clad, it was a no-brainer. The quality is surprisingly good. Well-balanced, attractive, cooks evenly, and really isn't difficult to clean. Just remember to spritz a little oil insdie and wipe with a paper towel to keep them shiny and cover the water marks left by washing. Easy peasy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars fine frying pan', 'author': 'Abigail C', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'it was bigger than i expected but works fine no complaints', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars SUPER BUENA', 'author': 'Angel Peralta', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'La he comprado y gracias a tutoriales de youtube sobre como manejarlas he logrado hacer mi primer huevo sin que se pegue!! title: Cuisinart 10-Inch Crepe Pan, Chef's Classic Nonstick Hard Anodized, Black, 623-24
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I expected', 'author': 'Monique', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Cuisinart 10-Inch Crepe Pan is a culinary gem that brings the art of crepe-making to your kitchen with finesse and ease. Crafted with precision and functionality in mind, this pan is an essential tool for both seasoned chefs and home cooks looking to create delicate, thin crepes that melt in your mouth.Constructed with a high-quality non-stick surface, the pan ensures effortless food release and easy cleanup, allowing you to focus on perfecting your crepe technique rather than worrying about sticking or burning. The 10-inch size strikes a perfect balance between versatility and manageability, making it ideal for crafting crepes of various sizes and thicknesses.The low sides of the pan enable easy flipping and turning, ensuring your crepes maintain their delicate form without tearing or sticking. Its even heat distribution guarantees uniform cooking and golden browning, resulting in picture-perfect crepes that rival those from your favorite bistro.The sturdy handle stays cool even during extended cooking sessions, providing a secure grip and comfortable control as you swirl and spread batter. Whether you're making traditional French crepes, savory galettes, or sweet dessert crepes, the Cuisinart Crepe Pan is your trusty companion for achieving delectable results every time.Beyond its crepe-making prowess, this pan's versatility extends to other culinary creations, making it a go-to tool for pancakes, omelets, and more. Its durable construction promises longevity, ensuring it remains a staple in your kitchen for years to come.In essence, the Cuisinart 10-Inch Crepe Pan combines premium craftsmanship with practical design to deliver a culinary experience that celebrates the art of crepe-making. Elevate your cooking skills and delight your taste buds with the exquisite results you can achieve using this exceptional pan.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan!', 'author': 'Big Rudy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I definitely use the pan for crepes, but for SO MUCH MORE!! You can make a single egg omelet, grilled sandwiches, pancakes, French toast, quesadillas, and a myriad of other dishes! It is a stick-free pan with unlimited options. Because it has shallow sides, it makes flipping sandwiches and pancakes (for example) super easy. Buy one of these!!! I use this pan every day! I hand wash it. Even with this heavy usage, this pan lasts about 1 year (before the coating wears off).Big Rudy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for crepes', 'author': 'Dave A', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Pan is very shallow which is why good for crepes', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for all sorts of Flatbreads, crepes!', 'author': 'Yogafan', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought this crepe pan in Oct 2020. Since then I've used it everyday at least twice a day, sometimes more than that. Started with simple soap and warm water wash, wiped it and then started using it. I've used it initially on coils for first 8 months, always between medium-high heat and the same with gas stove. After I'm done using it, I always remove it from heat immediately on a colder side of the stove, thus avoiding unnecessary overheating. Another simple care is I never use water on it when it was hot. For cleaning it, simple tap water is best except when I used oil on it. For any oil cooking, normal dish soap and soft sponge was sufficient. I've cooked eggs, many sorts of flatbreads (used twice everyday for Indian flatbreads) and different types of crepes, pancakes, dosa and....many more! Never had any warping problem or any other problem. Great for both with and without oil cooking. I've never used it in oven so no idea about that. After putting it to rigorous use all these months, now my pan looks like this, little scratches and discoloration at some places. But it is working really fine, no issues with over heating or even heat distribution. If used reasonably with proper cleaning and with non-metal spatula, this pan is really really good! Might buy another one as a back up.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'Dave', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love making French crepes, German & Scandinavian pancakes in this relatively non-stick pan. Use extra eggs and get the optimum temperature for best results.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Crepes!', 'author': 'Secrent', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just Love this Cuisinart 10-Inch Crepe Pan. It maintains perfect heat throughout the pan which is a must and no issues whatsoever with sticking. The pan has a nice weight to it and the handle is perfect for holding onto and lifting. Overall, if you make crepes, you will want to try this pan. title: 11" Nonstick Frying Pan with Lid - 11 Inch Nonstick Skillets with USA Blue Gradient Granite Derived Coating, Heat-resisted Silicon Handle, PFOA &PFOS Free, Induction Compatible, Ideal Christmas Gift
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nonstick Excellence!', 'author': 'L. M. Czechowicz', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was on the prowl for a new skillet, as my last one, of the granite variety, had lost its nonstick ability. I've been through a ton of skillets for the same reason: Tfal, Cuisinart, Calphalon, GraniteStone, etc. I was intrigued by this one because it had tall sides, a lid, and was blue. When it came in, I discovered it actually has mermaid type scales on the side and color shifting glitter on the outside as well. It's really quite pretty. But I didn't buy it for beauty. I bought it because I was tired of scraping burnt cottage cheese out of my granite or cast iron skillet every morning. No matter what temperature I used or what time I added it, the cheese in my eggs always stuck. Not any more! Not only did it not stick, but all I had to do to clean it after I was done was use a dry paper towel and it was spot free (see my first photo). The surface is much less textured than granite or cast iron. I'm exceedingly impressed...and happy I won't be soaking skillets anytime soon!There are many other benefits of this skillet in addition to it being completely nonstick. The deep sides are truly deep, as you can see in the photo of the glittery scales, it holds a lot of food. I have a bad habit of flipping food out of more low profile skillets, but have not had that problem with this one, which means less time scrubbing my stove top clean. The lid is also a nice little piece of engineering as the rubber around the ring helps prevent moisture from bubbling out or over the sides hither, thither, and yon. Instead it escapes from two specific places marked on either side of the lid (photo 3). Unlike the metal rimmed lids that have scalded me in the past, I can turn the lid so that steam escapes where I want it and I can attend to other pots and pans on the stove without worrying about being burned. It's sturdy, but not as heavy as cast iron. It heats evenly and the handle never gets hot. It comes with a Phillips screwdriver so you can attach the handle. All in all, I'm very pleased with my purchase and have found no cons. I can't wait to see what else I can cook in it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 6, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan', 'author': 'joeglo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We really like this pan. It is easy to clean and it looks great. Be careful with the small handle because you can get burned if not careful. The long handle is no problem. Great pan to own.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not just a pretty face', 'author': 'O', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Don't be misled by the GERMAN THERMOLON and USA BLUE in the marketing text. This product is manufactured in China.That said, it's a great product. I love the way it looks, and it's a joy to cook in. Time will tell how it holds up to wear, but after a few days of heavy use, it's as good as new and my new go-to for cooking anything I don't need to pop in the oven. The non-stick is very slick, and gives a good sear. The lid fits well, and the silicone edging seems sturdy - I'll stand it on edge while I'm cooking, and it hasn't warped yet. Only minor hot-spotting on a gas range - gets up to temp quick, and the heat is impressively consistent for how light weight it is. Not cast iron level, obviously, but it's on par with our Calphalon pan of similar diameter that weighs twice as much.So far I've used this to brown ground meat, saute aromatics, make gravy, cook burgers, simmer broth, make french toast and omelettes (no stuck egg residue, perfect bake/steaming in the pan with lid on the stovetop), and heat syrup (swirls and pours out cleanly, no stirring implement necessary). Quality cooking, easy clean up. Love it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I think of reasons to use this frying pan!', 'author': 'M. B. Buffaloe', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have never gotten excited about using a frying pan before, but these make me look for reasons to use them! I really don’t fry an awful lot, but when I do, I can’t wait to get out my beautiful blue frying pan! When I realized that the nonstick coating was failing on 2 of my old skillets, I started shopping around in stores and here on Amazon. Many of the reviews for these Ailwyn frying pans were over-the-top, so I ordered both the 9” and 11” pans. Oh my goodness! These are the perfect frying pans, for so many reasons! They are deep enough to fry just about anything and to make recipes with lots of ingredients. Nothing!! sticks to them. They are the most wonderful nonstick pans I’ve ever had! They distribute the heat evenly, and do well at both very low and very high temperatures. I have been frying chicken for over 40 years, but I made my best fried chicken ever a couple of weeks ago, and the only thing that was different was this frying pan! My husband isn’t the biggest fan of fried chicken, but he was going back for seconds! I can’t recommend these pans strongly enough. Don’t be put off by the color — the pans may look frivolous, with their pretty blue color, but they are hard-working and the best frying pans you’ve ever owned! Almost forgot — the lids are wonderful, too! Clear so you can see through them, and they lie flat for a good seal. They have that wonderful steam hole that every good frying pan lid should have! I really only have one complaint — I wish they made a slightly larger frying pan, too, for the times I’m frying food for a crowd! reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It’s my kind of pan', 'author': 'Cara', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So very happy with this very versatile pan great for pancakes, omelettes or a little bit of stirfried vegetables so easy to flip over what’s inside The pan and it doesn’t stick. Seriously Best pan I’ve found in a long time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great little omelette pan.', 'author': 'John L Adams', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect size for a single omelette in about 4 or 5 minutes with sauteed mixed peppers, onion and mushrooms and one slice of bacon. One large or two small eggs whipped with a little milk. Has really made my breakfast decision really easy! My wife loves them. Wish I had gotten this years ago.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The best pan for pancakes', 'author': 'Haley McDole', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We absolutely love this non stick pan. It's perfect for pancakes. We use it at least once a week. Easy to clean. Lightweight. It is a small pan so easy to store. Durable. Just buy it !!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This pan is ALMOST perfect. ALMOST', 'author': 'Changing Fate', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I make a lot of omelets, as in almost every day I am making one for me. I have used this pan to make them for years now and I wanted to point out a couple of issues that may not be readily noticeable. But first I will talk about the plusses to this item. First, the price is really good for what you get. The surface of the pan has been easy to clean and since mine gets daily use I would say overall it holds up pretty well to the many times I use it. But there are a couple of issues that should be noted.The first, if you will look at the pictures of this pan, you will see the handles are attached by screws. The Screw heads are inside the pan. These Screw heads are not Copper stick free screw heads, therefore if you make thick pancakes or thick omelets like I do, the egg will stick to these screw heads every time. Every Time. I have to spray these screws with Pam in order to use these without it sticking which kinda makes them "almost non-stick" instead of truely no-stick.Second, the hinges are weak. the hinges are made of the flimsiest of all flimsiest metals. The pan surface itself will outlast the hinges by a long shot. Since I use mine to make omelets, having the hinges is important in that it makes it really easy to flip the pan. What should last me many many years only last a few.All that being said, if they would fix these two issues, either construct these with the handles incorporated in the metal and affixed internally and make hinges that are truely made to last, I would easily pay double for one. It does a good job for what I need it to do and would be a tremendous product if they addressed these two issues.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works as advertised.', 'author': 'Stephen Worley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Have used this item quite a number of times. Cooks pancakes quickly. Do not place your burner above Medium heat as the pancake mix will burn. Low heat baking is better and will provide a better outcome. One thing I noticed is that the longer this pan is one the stove burner, the faster the pancake mix cooks. So, you must pay attention to the heat of the pan when cooking. That is my two cents worth. I highly recommend this product for single pancake cooking. From my standpoint, it works as advertised.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Okay', 'author': 'Allyn L', 'rating': 3, 'content': "It's not quite what I hoped, but it's okay. Heats and cooks quickly. Seems flimsy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use', 'author': 'kai', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pan is small, but perfect for regular sized pancakes and omelettes. Even grilled cheese sandwiches. I only have used the pan for omelettes, but as long as you spray with nonstick spray and flip quickly, your eggs will turn out perfect! Also, make sure you cook the first side long enough to ensure that the heat contained in the enclosed pan has almost fully cooked the eggs, so they won't be super runny when flipping them. I haven't had any issues with the hinge, but I could see it being somewhat weak after a while of continued use. I don't use mine very often. Maybe once every couple of weeks. Good luck!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fun to use!!', 'author': 'Vickie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fast delivery. Not hard to use, only use up to 3egg omelet otherwise gets messy. Doesn’t stick slides right out!! Grilled cheese too!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It is a great pan but.....', 'author': 'Joy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great pan for something you need to flip like pancakes or eggs or burgers whatever, however do not buy the claim that it is so stick free that you can make pancakes without any oil. I tried every possible way to do this without oil, adhere to the instructions and it made an absolute mess, first side sticks, and when you try to flip it you get a big dripping mess of pancake batter streaming out of the pan and onto your stove. In order to get it to flip without oil you have to try to loosen it up with a spatula before flipping and what's the point if you need to use a spatula on this. However if you put a little oil before you put the pancake batter in, it will flip properly, sometimes with a little jerk down motion will make it drop. You don't need a lot of oil just a few drops swirl it around and you're good to go. Because this does work with oil I'm keeping it as it is a very nifty tool in the kitchen. It is also why it's not getting five stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars So wrong', 'author': 'PhotoGraphics', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Whenever I have seen any item, no matter what it is, that has the As Seen on TV sticker I know it’s going to go badly. This thing was no exception, so why would I have bought it anyway? I had one and only one task for it in mind, and that so seldomly durability was not that important to me. My one use for it was to make one large pancake for myself for breakfast onto which I could put a fried egg or any other topping of my choice. So my first question, one that any manufacturer of such a product would have in big bold letters, was what is its diameter. Nowhere on their ad page could I find one word about that, only that it is “large” and that it is two-inches thick. I would never in my life expect to make a pancake two inches thick so I don’t know why I would want to know that.IT GOES DOWNHILLThe breathless worded ad copy continued in the royal tradition of the seen on TV tradition, including the extensive use of the word copper as if it has a health benefit. Okay there are some claims about wearing a pure copper bracelet that some say to have magical qualities but are you ready for the honest truth now? There isn’t evidence of an ounce of copper in this thing, it is only a copper colored non-stick coating, or at least supposedly non-stick. As if that farce wasn’t enough they actually go on to say, or make you think they say, that it is made from titanium encrusted with diamonds. That is so funny I can hardly type the words without laughing. No, it is aluminum with a copper colored coating. The cleverly worded fine print is that it has a “diamond sparkle look coating”. And the wording “titanium ceramic” seem to be some well disguised trademarked terminology. So much for believing what you see on TV.QUALITYIt doesn’t sound right to use the word quality in a sentence describing this thing, but to be fair it only cost twenty bucks, about what a cheap frying pan cost at the discount store. I always suggest to read the one star reviews first and this is a great example of that, they are spot on accurate and you know they aren’t planted by employees of the maker. They all point to the extremely bad hinge design that is uses two pop rivets that are almost guaranteed to break. Even being really careful with it it’s just not designed well. Yes but isn’t it true that I went ahead and bought it anyway? I admit to that, but I said earlier that I expected to use it maybe once or at the most twice a month, and the only thing that attracted me over an ordinary frying pan is I am really bad at turning pancakes over and the best ones are cooked equally on both sides. I didn’t want yet another electric appliance because most of them don’t heat 100% evenly anyway, this held the promise, weak as it was, that it could spread the heat more evenly on my electric stovetop and I told myself that if I wait until the pancake (or even an omelet) as half cooked it shouldn’t leak out if I flip it over really fast. That idea sort of works but if I can’t see the food cooking I would have to experiment many times to get it even half right. One detail I did not like was that the rivets used to attach the handles are prone to having food stick to the crevices, which would make it a chore to clean it.SIZE MATTERSMy opening thought was about the diameter. Not trusting gadgets like this I had high hopes that they weren’t trying to pull another fast one on me and that it wasn’t anywhere near as big as they make it look. My instincts were right, I had hopes this would make one pancake that’s big enough for an adult, that would be about nine inches, but no, the maximum working area inside the pan is only a meager five inches. Using their directions it would take me about five minutes to make one five inch pancake. If I wanted four of them, which I guess is a full stack, it would take me at least 20 minutes to make breakfast for myself. On the same subject, since the pan tapers down to around five inches it is smaller than the smallest burner on my stove, which means the rising heat would eventually scorch the entire pan.THE FINE PRINTHere’s the shocker. Cleverly hidden inside the box, looking like one of those warranty sheets that no one ever reads, on the reverse side is a contract. No seriously, it is a lengthy legal contract that tells you that you already agreed to a long list of terms and conditions when you pressed the “buy” button, including giving up your legal rights and having to pay your own costs for any legal action. I have never seen anything so audacious on any product in my life and that instantly dropped their rating to zero and I put the thing back in the box and returned it. As public notice I do not accept or agree to any conditions they say I agreed to by buying this thing and by accepting my return Gotham Steel/Emson has agreed to my terms which will be available to them upon written request. On every count this is thing is rejected.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]
