title: T-fal Experience Nonstick Fry Pan 10.5 Inch Induction Oven Safe 400F Cookware, Pots and Pans, Dishwasher Safe Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Confident my brand loyalty is well placed.', 'author': 'Horse with no name.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Back in the early 90\'s I had my first experience with T-Fal. At that time, for whatever marketing reason, I thought of T-Fal as some lesser brand of cookware. I like expensive brand name cookware as much as the next person, but, when I asked a friend what they wanted for a bday present, they said a set of T-Fal. Ok, well, I\'d have bought you AllClad if you\'d have asked, but if that\'s what you want.After paying a little bit of nothing, then seeing the stuff in person, I thought, wow, I am gonna get another set for myself. This is nice stuff. So I did. And, with it being inexpensive and all, I used it really hard, like I didn\'t care if I had to replace it. I also overheated my 10" skillet about as often as a pan can possibly be overheated.Now, I\'ll admit, after almost 20 years, the non-stick coating in several of the pans is not very non-stick any more. But, none of it is missing! No holes in the surface and all that stuff in my food.In spite of the insane temps I\'ve used the pans at, none of them have warped even a little bit. They are as flat as a pancake. I feel bad getting rid of my old trusty 10" skillet, but, its replacement is here. I bought the 8" thinking it would be a nice omelet pan but in truth, it\'s a bit too small for that. Nice pan, but, too small.My 8" skillet didn\'t seem to work real well as an egg pan when I first got it. Eggs seemed to stick pretty good, and clearly I expected better. After frying something in it using coconut oil, it immediately became the non-stick pan I thought it would be. This new 10" pan I broke in by boiling a shallow pool of water, then pouring that out and "seasoning" the pan with a good rub of coconut oil while over the heat. My first French omelet from this pan slid around like it was on an air cushion. Wonderful.This pan feels like a nicer quality pan than my 19 year old one. Though that one still looks nice, the balance of this one is nicer and the handle feels more sturdy. Not that it needed to be since that one isn\'t loose now. This one is also oven safe while the old one was not. The aluminum on the bottom of this is uncoated, where the old one I had was enameled. I use gas, and that one has needed the black crud cleaned off many times in the past. It cleans right up with ez-off, and I expect this one to also.Overall, I\'d say these are the nicest non-stick pan you can get at any price. Cooks Illustrated seems to feel the same way. When you hold this pan in your hand, it\'ll feel like a pan of 5x the price. And, if it lasts like my last one, it\'s worth 5x the price. If you\'re a person who loves quality cookware, consider putting a few pieces of T-Fal in your collection. It\'ll fit right in with others you spent a mortgage payment on.PS. Their electric teakettle is amazing too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Hard wearing, very non-stick, easy to keep clean, comfortable grip - will last YEARS with proper use and care.', 'author': 'Elizabeth1925', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just bought a second one of these after five years of using it daily - sometimes three times a day. The first one held up extremely well. I love the non-stick coating on the outside - the pan doesn\'t get so nasty looking if one is, like me, disinclined to scrub that exterior every time one uses it. The only negative is that it was ever so slightly domed at the center so my eggs, oil, whatever would run to the edges - but I still loved that pan. My newest one doesn\'t have this problem.I find this to be an outstanding non-stick pan for frying perfect "over easy" eggs, omelets, french toast, potstickers and reheating leftovers. That\'s pretty much how I use it. I am also a non-stick skillet commando. I will not let anyone use my pan without giving them a little talk on NO METAL UTENSILS IN MY NON-STICK PAN. I also rarely use soap in it, but rather wipe it out with a paper towel after a quick rinse and swipe with a plastic dish brush. But then, the unthinkable happened...I forgot to give a guest my "no metal utensils in the non-stick pan" lecture. And a knife was used in my pan. AUGHHHH! It was agony politely watching my beautiful pan enter the slippery slope to no longer nonstick-dom. But it was still working pretty well until badly burned some leftovers in it one day. Very badly burned those leftovers. Black, soot, smoke. The pan came clean, but eggs were now sticking - the unthinkable. So, I bought another one. If I hide it whenever I have company and never leave it unattended on high heat, perhaps it will last ten years!I chose this pan the first time because it was recommended by Cook\'s Illustrated. I chose it the second time because the first one was the best non-stick I\'ve owned in over 30 years of using non-stick pans for daily eggs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Non-stick pan', 'author': 'Roger Andrews', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Inexpensive non-stick pan with enough built-in weight to not fall over when empty.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight and comfortable, but could be better at induction cooking', 'author': 'Brian', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I tried several different induction compatible nonstick skillets at this price point. This was the most lightweight and comfortable to use. The only downside is that it could perform better on induction cook tops. My stove has an option to "score" your cookware. They recommend a score of 9-10. This pan scored a 7-8, so it works well enough, but buzzes and vibrates a bit more noticeably than other induction compatible pans.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan', 'author': 'susjon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought in 2021 and held up great. Buying again now to refresh the pan and would recommend to anyone.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A 5 because she says it is', 'author': 'J. Fiato', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Have seen these around for years and I finally got tired of all the old mix and match stuff. She really seems to be pleased with the look, weight, and disbursement of the heat. For me, easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Its great.', 'author': 'Bettie Wailes', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is the only pan I've used that really is nonstick. Love it!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So good, I bought another for my mother in-law', 'author': 'MG', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had recently got fed up with my All-Clad nonstick pan. I paid a couple hundred dollars for a brushed stainless non stick pan, and after just a couple of years of use, it was not only no longer non stick, but it was like velcro for food! Now, I cook daily on these pans, and never at excessive heat, nor do I use abrasives that may remove the teflon coating, yet after normal use, I ended up with a completely worthless and expensive piece of steel.Having been gifted a T-Fal stainless non stick pan and reading some reviews on Amazon, I decided to give this a shot. If a $30 pan gives it up after a year, who cares right? Well, this pan exceeded my expectations. On a gas stove, the aluminium heats up quickly (though it is prone to hot and cool spots) and cools off just as fast for easy cleanup. Compared to steel and cast iron, this is a time saver.As for the pan itself, the rubber handle always stays cool except sometimes nearest to the pan. Just be careful grabbing there if you\'ve had it on the burner for a while. Cleanup with a sponge and soapy water is all it takes. I wouldn\'t recommend the dish washer as in my experience, it won\'t always get all of the food off and then the heated dry kind of bakes it on. A quick hand wash takes care of that though.I haven\'t had any issues with the nonstick coating flaking or getting scratched off. I take care to use silicone utensils to cook with on these pans.So with the pan being easy to cook with, easy to clean, durable, and best yet, really cheap, I couldn\'t be happier. For my non stick purchases going forward, I\'ll be "sticking" with these pans!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great every day fry pan', 'author': 'Carl', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a picture of the pan I got about 2 year ago. And if the new one I just got lasts that long I will be buying another then. I would just kind of like to know why after so long a time not sticking at all, then it only sticks right in the center over the red logo. One way or the other , this is the pan to go to. Bacon and eggs (no stick) every day of the week.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for eggs', 'author': 'Tcubed', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought to fry/scramble eggs, this works well, reasonable price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: T-fal B039S264 Excite ProGlide Nonstick Thermo-Spot Heat Indicator Dishwasher Oven Safe 8 Inch and 10.5 Inch Fry Pan Cookware Set, 2-Piece, Rio Red
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value. Works well. Use with good habits', 'author': 'Luis Garcia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ll review this in order but overall if you want to know now this is the best "cheap" product I have ever purchased on amazon.Main points: Due to other reviews claiming the nonstick surface scratched off their pans I\'d recommend you Never use any metal items against this pans surface or else you will scratch off the nonstick surface (this goes with any pan but I guess it has to be restated here). Scratching off teflon is highly carcinogenic as well as for metal pans their coatings are also not good to ingest so get into the habit of not scratching your pans. Use wood or anything non metallic that can handle the high heat for cooking.Another thing to consider potentially based on other reviewers: Dont immediately cool down your pan (or any pans ever) if they have been heated or just taken off the heat. If you do then the surface of the teflon may crack as seen in other reviews.Another thing to NOT do is based on the assumption that the handle may not be perfectly secured (it\'s not a fusion or welded mold) the handle coating itself seems to be maybe glued or coated on the inner metal handle which may come off if you place the entire pan in your oven. This pan doesn\'t look like it\'s capable of being placed into an oven to roast your food. I wouldn\'t suggest it nor try it myself due to this minor potential quality "flaw". You shouldn\'t need to place the pan into the oven, it wasn\'t made for that.Heat Distribution - 5/5The pan heats up well if you have any issues it may be your electric stovetop taking a while to heat up itself. The pan cooks the sides of my food very well. Anything touching the pan or oil within the pan will be hot. If you are having issues it may be due to lack of contact with a hot part which may cause uneven heating of your food.Easy to Clean - 5/5The product has a very good nonstick surface and it makes the food that was cooked on the pan and even if the food was left on over night if you persoak the pan with soap then it will come right off due to that non stick surface. Use a rough sponge but dont use a steel wool since that will probably scratch the nonstick surface.Value for money - 5/5This product works and is very useful for the price. I\'d gladly order another pair when and if these pans do eventually fail but for now the coating is very nice and hasn\'t failed me yet in any capacity.This pan seems like a great value. It works incredibly well and if you treat it right and dont scratch the surface then it will last you as long as you can maintain good pan handling habits!Conclusion:If you want a durable pan that can handle your every mistake, this may not be for you. If you are a diligent owner that wants to preserve their pans and tools, then this will be perfect for you. I havent had any issues with my pans and I dont expect to. But if I do I\'ll detail in a revision/ edit of what occured and by what rough time frame from purchase that it occured.1 month of constant use from this post.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Heat transfers evenly over the surface, and light-weught handles prevent pans from tipping.', 'author': 'Ralph E. Walker', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I especially like the small pan; it's just right for frying two eggs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Treat your pan right and cook beautifully', 'author': 'CC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The pans do what they say. They heat up evenly and if you follow how to care for them, there is no issue with sticking food. They’re great for eggs, stir fry, etc. we are a big fan of steak in my house so that’s when I will put the pan to true test. Like I said, if you follow how to care for them and cool food without blasting the heat on high every time, you will get a lot out of pans like this. The clean up is very easy since I usually wipe it out with a damp towel. I don’t recommend using a dishwasher if you can avoid it only because it can wear out the longevity of your pans lifespan. Hot water and a bit of soup will do for tougher to clean situations. Also, season your pan before use as directed and everything you make will be a breeze from pan to plate. A lot of reviews say that food stuck and the pans in pictures look like they’ve been through hell. Pretreat and watch your heat. No need to put the burner on high for certain foods because that’s what will kill your pan and lead to you rendering it useless. Happy cooking ♥️', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Best non stick pan!', 'author': 'Heather O. Cain', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These are the best non-stick pans I have ever had. After 2 years I will need to replace the bigger one that we used the most. Most nonstick pans, even the expensive ones, only last a few months for us. The handle does get loose though!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Can't go wrong with t-Fal", 'author': 'A. J. Lafferty', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When ever I can, I purchase T-fal products. They are durable, easy to clean and hold up very well. Most of the time you need to purchase separate lids, but the end product is a very long-term product that you will use for many years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good price for 2 pans', 'author': 'WasabiKid', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good buy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these pans', 'author': 'Nancy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The sizes are great, no sticking and clean up is a breeze.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good products for everyday cooking.', 'author': 'Melissa L Yaglowski', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have used your pans before and they were used hard until we received new pots and pans that are heavier and thicker . The fry pans alone are great. When you add oil to this pan, it all flows to the sides in a perfect ring, leaving the center of the pan high-and-dry like a little island. The whole idea behind buying an enormous frying pan is so that you can use the entire pan to fry things, not just the perimeter. Save yourself some money and pass this one by.I\'m on the hunt for a better 14" pan after just one use!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars love thus pan', 'author': 'Silas Yount', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'its great', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful quality.', 'author': 'Marjorie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love the beautiful blue non stick coating & the weight of this frying pan. I’ve had a chance to try this out for a few batches of scrambled eggs and just tried an omelet this morning. I like a nice plump-with-fillings sort of omelet and this pan was a pinch too small for that. There wasn’t enough bottom of the pan width for the eggs to spread out enough to provide coverage for the amount of veggies I like. So that’s the 1 star deduction. “Make a less stuffed omelet!” cries the peanut gallery. Surely a possibility, but I’m not a fan of omelets where the innards seem like an afterthought rather than part of a balanced, harmonious breakfast meal. Plenty slick, nonstick-wise. I do use a bit of oil and butter to assist with flavor and slipperiness. I’ve had enough of the soaking and scraping with my stainless pans, and don’t want to be disappointed with this pan so I’ll work up to an oil-less attempt at scrambled eggs later. Not sure what technology some of the nonstick offerings on the market are to justify their $50 to $150 price tags. This one seems much more fairly priced. The handle is advertised as Bakelite, but it has a really nice satiny feel to it and is very comfortable in the hand, making flipping veggies easy when sautéing. Hopefully the seller/manufacturer will offer additional sizes for those folks who want a bit more real estate to work with when crafting omelets. It is deep enough to do some stovetop frying, and would handle smaller portions of French fries. Could probably fit a couple servings of tots, chicken tenders or fish sticks too. No lid included, so you’ll probably want a spatter screen. Thumbs up recommendation', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality.', 'author': 'Edwin J. title: Amazon Basics 2-Piece Oven Safe, Riveted Handle Frying Pan - Silver, 8-Inch & 10-Inch
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Two months with this pan, and I love it!', 'author': 'Peter Harrison', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After discarding all our old cookware after buying an induction-top range, I wanted a nice, induction-friendly stainless frypan to compliment our T-Fal non-stick sauté pan. This pan was a nicely priced option with some great reviews, so I thought I\'d give it a try.If you\'re asking yourself, "Why two pans?" I\'ll give you three reasons why. The first is non-stick pans wear out and wear out really quickly if you cook over high heat, like when you sear meat. This pan doesn\'t deteriorate when you heat it on high and will last a lifetime. Non-stick pans also don\'t work well for recipes where a sauté is deglazed into a sauce. Finally, as non-stick surfaces wear out, they deposit chemicals in the food you cook on them, and that bugs me.So I have this non-stick frypan, and I am very happy with it. It has a nice heft to it, heats evenly, does a great job of everything from searing to sautéing, and is genuinely easy to clean. We do a lot of home cooking here and, two months in, it still looks like new.I thought I\'d show you how easily this pan cleans up. The first picture I took was after a dinner where I sautéd all the vegetables for a veggie-heavy, one-pan zucchini-tomato-chickpea curry, then scooped up the leftovers and used a spatula to get the last of the sauce into two leftover storage containers. If you take a look at the picture, the pan was pretty clean even before it hit the sink. The second picture was taken a couple of minutes later after a drip of Dawn dish soap, some water, and few really quick swishes with a scrub brush cleaned it out, and this is what it looked like. No elbow grease was required. It shines!Here\'s one more cool thing about this pan: The lid for our 10-inch T-Fal E93897 non-stick pan is a great fit for this one, too. Having a well-fitting led comes in really handy so, if you\'re looking for that perfect pair of 10-inch standard and non-stick pans, this and the T-Fal might just be your perfect set.Pros:* Induction friendly.* Cooks evenly at every temperature.* No problems with warping.* Really great pan for not a lot of money.* Has been super easy to keep clean.* Mates well with the lid for T-Fal\'s 10-inch non-stick sauté pan, E93897.Cons:* I couldn\'t think of any!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 20, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Yes! Great quality, durable, forever pans!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'No chemical coating to taint food. I wanted to switch out to a quality steel pan set, these fit the bill! Perfect, durable, handle keeps cool, smooooooth cooking. Really a time-tested piece of equipment, stainless pans are a must have for any kitchen. Glad I chose this brand, more affordable and will buy my other 2 pans I need from this brand.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great quality for price; good beginner pan', 'author': 'Torin McFarland', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great pan for the price, but naturally, it's not as high quality as a Cuisinart, Calphalon, All-Clad, etc. It has a great, sturdy handle, and the pan itself is surprisingly light. It heats evenly and relatively quickly, and is very easy to clean. I cook on a gas stovetop and fry eggs/omelets often. With a touch of oil, this pan fried eggs well without any sticking. So, while this is unbeatable, i believe, on price, advanced cooks or those seeking the highest quality pans should look elsewhere. Beginners, budget-conscious, or those who just aren't too particular will likely love this pan, as it's effective, efficient, and high bang-for-buck.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect! Light weight, but heavy duty!', 'author': 'Mrs.Pritchett', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are absolutely perfect! I have used these six times already and have no complaints. I made eggs thus morning and they just slide right out off the pan! Nothing stuck!! Cleanup is super easy too!!! I highly recommend these for everyone and I'm so happy I purchased these. I recommend letting your oil/butter warm up in the pan before adding your food just keeps food from sticking and if it was to stick when you are finished cooking let pan cool down and wipe out what you can and then add water, bring to a boil and scrap off any food stuck on pan 😘", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent product', 'author': 'TheGreyZebra', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent build quality and very sturdy. Will last me for life with proper use. 10/10Definitely recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Pan exploded on stove and a chunk flew out', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'The bigger pan made a loud sound, and a hole had literally exploded through the bottom and a piece of the center flew off. Luckily if I was any closer it would have burnt me but I wasn’t. Took a while to clean up though because the pan had oil in it that spilled out of the new hole. Not sure if this is a defect or it just happened because I cheaped out and bought these :/ It’s a shame cuz they’re gorgeous and worked very well as non stick pans without the chemicals that come with the traditional non sticks.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pans for the price', 'author': 'Pauline H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love these pans! They clean up great and cook food better and faster. I love that the handle doesn’t get hot,too. The secret to cooking with stainless steel is that you have to let the pan get hot before you put in your food and then it won’t stick. Would definitely recommend these!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Starter pan.', 'author': 'The Geekster', 'rating': 3, 'content': "If you are in college or just starting out then this pan will fit most needs. However if you like to really cook look for a better pan. The best pans are tri-ply pans but they cost more. I bought this pan just for one thing cooking sausages. Cleanup was very difficult. So now I just add water, cover and simmer for about 14 minutes. Drain water and roll them around in pan. If you really want to save money, spend the money and get All-Clad pans or similar professional pans as they will last a lifetime as they have lifetime warranty's.These are NOT professional grade pans as one reviewer claims. I am a Chef and professional pans are always tri-ply pans for even heat distribution. In allot restaurants that I have worked in and also at culinary school just use cheap aluminum pans make by Vollrath. I used a Vollrath pan to make a French Classic Omelette. They do not always want to spend money on good Tri=ply pans. However all chefs that I know used Tri-ply made of 18/10 grade stainless steel or Copper pans at home. Usually All-Clad or Calphalon. It all depends on what you are cooking. For non-stick pans I would say just go with a Vollrath non-stick pan. For cooking French Toast I just use a 12 inch T-Fal pan. I just bought a $135 Hex Clad pan combination Tri-ply and non-stick pan. I will write a review on that after I use it for awhile. And for good sakes when using non-stick pans DO NOT use mental utensils!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 23, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bye Bye Teflón!!! Pasó la prueba ✅', 'author': 'Laurie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A Desaprender!!! Back to the basics!!!Dije que si pasaba la prueba del omelette eran buenos, y lo son:- Distribución uniforme del calor.- El haza no se calienta durante la cocción.- Peso medio (no son tan livianos).- Pude hacer un omelette a la primera y sin que se pegara! 🤣 A veces no se consigue ni con el teflón.- Son bellísimos.- Funcionalidad vs Precio: 10/10.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Light weight, fast heating, fun to cook with', 'author': 'daniel f.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'the pans are light weight, heat up very fast and are pretty non-stick.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

They are oven and dishwasher safe according to the instructions received. We usually hand wash them anyway. Nice pans. I did order an additional 12" pan - the 11" just seemed a bit small and its nice to have two large pans. Highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My husband loves these pans!', 'author': 'BJT', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The pans are working great so far and I love that they are dishwasher safe. They are definitely non-stick. We have been using a little oil or butter to cook things but I'm not sure you even need to add anything. They look great and are easy to handle. We're being careful not to use anything that might scratch the surface so I have hopes they last for a long time!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice, non-stick pans but delicate', 'author': 'Natalie R.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Replacing non-stick pans that were scratched and harmful with ceramic coated pans. These are very nice as truly nothing sticks to them and they're a breeze to clean. It is a ceramic coating, so you have to use silicone cooking utensils and a very soft sponge to clean them, otherwise you'll scratch the coating and expose the under material which can create harmful cooking byproduct. Additionally, I'd buy felt squares to place in between each pan if you stack pans inside one another for storage (at the very least use paper towels).They are evenly weighted, so I don't have to constantly be holding the handle to even out the pan. The pans also seem to heat fairly evenly for even cooking. title: GreenPan Lima Hard Anodized Healthy Ceramic Nonstick 8" Frying Pan Skillet, PFAS-Free, Oven Safe, Gray
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nothing sticks to these', 'author': 'Bay Area Parent', 'rating': 5, 'content': "If I could give these an extra star, I would. These are great. I got a two pan set from Target originally. The smaller frying pan was incredible. I had to be careful making scrambled eggs not to have them slide out of the pan while I cooked them. The bigger pan I used for pancakes mostly. I took them back to Target because of the bigger frying pan. It got a build up on the side walls pretty quickly that I couldn't get off and all just from making pancakes a few times. I was nervous because of some of the reviews I had read of people having problems with the pans, but I loved the smaller frying pan so much I bought some more individually.I now have this 8 inch pan, a 12 inch pan with a lid that I don't see on Amazon, and a sauce pot with a lid. All are great. I have had them about 6 months. I can still pretty much clean them with nothing more than a paper towel after cooking. I do wash them very gently with soap, but in a pinch they wipe out clean with a paper towel. The big frying pan again started to get a bit of a build up on the sides after pancakes, but I read another reviewer mention Bar Keeper's Friend cleanser. That stuff does the trick. As soon as a little stuff collects on the side that doesn't just wipe off, I use a tiny bit of that on a wet paper towel and the pan wipes clean as new.So far, I LOVE these. I will say, thought, that they feel a bit lighter than some of my older, more expensive pans. I like the weight of some of the other pans for no other reason than they just feel good being a bit heavy. These work great though, heat up quickly, distribute the heat well, and cool off quickly.NOTE: The manufacturer does suggest NOT using oils like EVOO because of the smoke point. I love olive oil and safflower oil. I avoid using EVOO with these, but I do use it sometimes and so far haven't had any issue. Always use an oil, though, even though it is non-stick. Cooking without an oil can ruin pans. Also, don't use a non-stick spray on non-stick pans.As for the Bar Keeper's Friend, I am using it based on someone else's review. It seems to work great, but I didn't do much research to see if it messes up the finish over time.NOTE: After several years of use and multiple Greenpan pots and pans, my extra advice is to always use oil to distribute heat evenly and do not let the pan get too hot. Excessive heat or prolonged heat on a dry pan has degraded the non-stick surface for me on a couple of pans. Up until that point, the non-stick quality is great.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Fourth Pan we've bought from Green Pan", 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These pans are a dream for easy cooking and cleaning! We bought 3 the first time around and just added in a fourth, if you don't count the tiny little egg pan we purchased which will only cook one egg at a time so isn't really practical. You don't need much oil for these non-stick pans and they cook evenly and on a low heat setting. They also work on our super old fashioned electric stove. All of our Green Pans have been great purchases! We have 2 fry pans, a sauce pan which is great for cooking rice, and a stock pot.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan.', 'author': 'Pam S', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This pan is extremely non stick! I love it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful pan if you take care of it properly.', 'author': 'The Intrepid', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this pan! I was worried about buying it with so many bad reviews saying it worked great for the first 2-3 months, then started sticking and cascading to spectacular failing. I decided to conduct a controlled experiment to see if I could use it for 2 months without any degradation in performance. I am the only person that uses this pan, so I no one else has used and possibly abused this pan, that's the controlled part of the experiment. I use this pan everyday to make a 2 egg omelet with different ingredients that vary day to day. I also like my eggs firm and just starting to brown.I started off using just a little bit of olive oil like I did with my old teflon coated pans. I soon stopped using oil because the pan was too slippery. My eggs almost slipped out of the pan when I picked it up preparing to flip the omelet on a few mornings. I only use a silicone rubber spatula with the pan to keep from scratching it. I always let the pan cool down to room temperature before cleaning it to prevent it from warping. I always use a soft soapy sponge to clean the pan, no abrasive cleaning tools like Scotch Brite sponges or Brillo pads. Stay away from anything that will scratch a metal pan. You can't see it, but they create micro scratches in the ceramic finish that give minerals and food a place to stick. Every time you use these scratching cleaning tools, they degrade your pan a tiny bit, even if you don't perceive it.That all sounds like what many other people and still had the pan fail 2-3 months after using it. There is one more thing that I do that I didn't read about in other reviews. I always dry it with a paper towel immediately after cleaning and rinsing the pan. If you let it air dry, you will have a build up of calcium and lime, common in tap water, especially in hard tap water. If you let it air dry, take a close look at the finish. If there are water spots, that's calcium and lime now stuck to your pan. Rewet the pan and wipe it dry with a tough paper towel with a polishing motion as you go. If you already have a buildup, you can try polishing it with baking soda and a wet paper towel. It should restore your pan to near new condition. So I've been almost burning my eggs for over 2 months now and don't use oil. For me the pan works just fine taking care of it as outlined above. If it has any flaw, it's that it doesn't come with the above care instructions.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Interior, But Very Difficult To Clean Exterior!', 'author': 'Lainey Girl', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I am quite pleased with the ease of use of this GreenPan Lima 8 inch frying pan. The interior is quite easy to clean. Not so for the exterior. I wipe the pan inside and out after using it, however I have not been the only person cooking with it! I find that the exterior is stained and I cannot seem to clean it effectively, so far. I will try Barkeepers Friend next. If anyone has any experience with my problem, and has suggestions for me, I would be so thankful!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Three and a half years of daily use', 'author': 'Rebtile', 'rating': 5, 'content': "UPDATE: I've now had this pan for 3.5 years--using it once or twice daily nearly every day, and it's finally time to buy a new one. The non-stickiness has degraded juuust past the point where an extra-hard scrub can fix it. This is my breakfast-eggs pan (so non-stick is crucial!), and it now requires a bit of an extra coupla scrapes with a spatula to release the eggs ... which is honestly still completely serviceable! I will still use the old pan for plenty of things. Anyhow, I'd call that a pretty long lifespan for a non-stick. Still five stars!ORIGINAL POST:I loved this pan so much, I bought a second in the larger size. But I'll talk about the smaller one because it gets way more abuse. I don't know what people are doing to this pan, but I've used it daily (sometimes twice a day) for the entirety of the pandemic, and near-daily before that -- cooking eggs almost exclusively, at low heat AND high heat -- and it hasn't lost its non-stick capabilities. Perhaps people are not cooking, like, normally? If you don't want to use any cooking fat at all, that might cause problems. Ditto if you're constantly burning your food (which would lead to more stubborn polymerization). But if you don't have any super-power requirements, this pan is great.Few things I've noticed:1. Butter does a much better job than oil at coating the pan (oil likes to pool together in little islands), which does sometimes mean there's a tad more sticking with oil where it doesn't quite get under the food (but no more than a little nudge with a fork can fix). I like a butter/oil combo, personally.2. I always wash this in the dishwasher, but I've noticed that after a few weeks of high-heat cooking, I sometimes need to give it an extra hard scrub with a sponge to get any bits of lingering polymerization off, which completely restores any lost non-stick-ness.3. I don't care about this, but I always wipe the butter knife on the same part of the pan, which, over the years, has worn away the coating in that particular place. The underside of the pan has also become pretty unsightly--stained and patchy. None of this affects its performance, however.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice and healthy Ceramic non stick', 'author': 'Summer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this pan because I wanted a healthy Ceramic and not a Teflon. I also have a 12 inch and these are great and very easy to clean too, it does instruct not to use metal spatula though so be aware of that.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars so far so good', 'author': 'SysArch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'so far no issues. i do wonder if it were to scratch of there are any kinds of harmful chemicals in it like other infused anodized products.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect size pan', 'author': 'RainSong', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Like that it was aluminum free and non toxic non stickIt is definitely non stock now that have used it a bit', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars What I Was Looking For', 'author': 'Eric S.', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Ceramic coated egg pan was what I was looking for. For a safer less chemical transfer to your food experience. Not as non-stick as I expected, but read the Usage Instructions (if listed in the product description) on the packaging. Don’t use spray oils with this pan like my Sister did. It will ruin the surface. Don’t deglaze in pan, or quench in water immediately after use. I use it daily to fry eggs over easy, but I think I am going back to my 8” carbon steel pan, and work on seasoning it better.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: SENSARTE Nonstick Frying Pan Skillet with Lid, Swiss Granite Coating Omelette with Cover, Healthy Cookware Chef's with Top, PFOA Free (8" + Glass Lid)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good heavy duty, non stick fry pan and tight fitting lid', 'author': 'JoeD', 'rating': 5, 'content': "A similar pan was good as a non-stick, but pour spouts vented the pan with the lid on. Consequently, top side or center of food like omelettes, mushrooms and fried eggs did not cook without flipping in the pan.Between the tight fitting lid, the heavy duty construction and Swiss Granite finish, the SENSARTE cooks perfectly and consistently.I almost always have an egg white omelette with spinach, mixed veggies or mushrooms mixed in. Sometimes I add ricotta cheese as filling, fold over, cover and let cook. They come out great. They don't burn, but they are never cold or uncooked in the middle.The eggs lift out clean with a spatula and I can put in a sausage patty and cook it without having to wash out the pan it pick up bits of residue. When done, the pan and lid wash clean, using just dish detergent and a non-abrasive sponge. I'm happy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Cookware, Reasonable Prices', 'author': 'Pixie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a sturdy, well made, perfect capacity frying pan. Back in July, I was looking for an 11" fry pan with a lid that has straight sides that could be used on a glass top electric stove. I purchased the 11" skillet from Walmart at twice the price that it is sold for on Amazon.After several months of using the 11" skillet, I learned that the Sensarte fry pan met & exceeded all of my cooking needs so I decided to look on Amazon to see if other Sensarte cookware was available. I was pleasantly pleased to find that there are many Sensarte cookware items available on Amazon at extremely reasonable prices.I purchased a 8" & 9.5 egg/omelette skillet, 10" 3.5 qt skillet, 12" 5qt skillet, and 1.5 qt, 2 qt & 2.5 qt sauce pans.This cookware is non-stick, cooks evenly, is sturdy and cleans easily. Additionally every single skillet & sauce pan came with a lid, another huge bonus.I have several very expensive pans with the handles attached to the pan itself with rivets, when the rivets come loose, the pans become unusable garbage because the rivets cannot be tightened. The glass lids are a plus and the larger skillets (9.5", 10", 11" & 12") each come came with a really nice screwdriver to attach the handles. I love it!!! a pan with the ability to tighten the handles with a screw driver is a huge bonus.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great skillet for price', 'author': 'Lou', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great for making skillet dishes. I’ve used it almost daily so far great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best fry pan ever!', 'author': 'Grannie Bee', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It is attractive, low profile for a van drawer. 😉 You have to keep the temperature low, not over #4 heat setting. Men will love it, it's quick, its simple, its the same everytime you can add or subtract ingredients but you can't fail too have a simple meal ready very quickly. AND...the lid is glass, easy to see the cooking progress without lifting the lid. It' not particularly fragile. Easy to wipe out and clean with a spritz of white vinegar. We are very happy and they go thru the diswasher at home, nicely too.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love it But', 'author': 'Tamie B.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It cooks great, stove top and oven. Not to happy with that. This is the only reason I didn't give them 5 stars", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The best pans I have ever used', 'author': 'T. Gandol', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pans are exactly what my title says. I normally don’t leave reviews but being a chef I had too. The pans cook evenly. You don’t have to pre season them or anything weird. Like those green pans or gimmick pans. You add a bit of olive oil or whatever oil ( I use olive oil) but that is for cooking. I have had them for a week and so far. I have cooked salmon with the skin, veggie burgers, ground beef burgers, steaks and scrambled eggs all of them slide around the pan. I have never seen this happen only if you used a ton of oil or on t.v. Also, you get the nice browning on your steaks and burgers as well. The best part there are no rivets on the inside, easier clean up and ease of cooking. That was my reason for buying them. No rivets on the inside. For anyone that doesn’t know. This means they are smooth where the handle is attached. I got 3 of the skillets with lids and a sauce pan. The big skillet came with a screw driver a really good one to attach the handle. They are package very well and I don’t have any issues, no dents or anything. I have worked and ran restaurants all my life and used all kinds of cookware, utensils etc. ranging from all different prices and companies. These are good quality pans to have and will actually improve your cooking due to the non sticking and even cooking and your food will taste much better and healthier for you. The scramble eggs I used a bit of olive oil and they didn’t taste like pan spray, butter or oil normally they taste of the oil, or cooking spray since you have to use so much to stop them from sticking. These are great pans for someone starting as the food do not stick and the even cooking ensure you can walk away and prepare your other dish(s) confidently. Read the directions don’t put your pan on the stove on high, do not used abrasive pads to clean them. You wouldn’t need to anyways, a bit of soap and sponge. They are actually dish washer safe. Take care of your pans and you shouldn’t have a problem. Simple care.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cleans up great!', 'author': 'Lance Van Der Stuyf', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Absolutely love this new pan. This is the best non stick pan I have ever had.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars fine product', 'author': 'BobZoom', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We're using this on an induction range and are quite pleased with it. title: Mueller DuraClad Tri-Ply Stainless Steel 8-Inch Fry Pan with Lid, Extra Strong Cookware, 3-layer Bottom, Even Heat Distribution, Ergonomic and EverCool Stainless Steel Handle
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Do your research! I promise it'd be worth it", 'author': 'Trish', 'rating': 5, 'content': "If you are low maintenance with your cookware, I don't think this is for you.I ended up going into research mode looking for good pans that will last me awhile and not get absolutely destroyed and I found this. You WILL need to buy Barkeeper's friend to keep this clean depending on what you cook with it (or baking soda and some diluted vinegar and water). Since it's stainless steel, it heats up pretty quick.This has been perfect for me to make eggs in and sautee some veggies. The key is patience so if you don't have that, probably don't bother. Been using this a couple months now and it still looks amazing. It has a thicker bottom and the handle is sturdy PLUS the lid is good for over easy eggs. It did stain underneath but that was my fault, and I'm not a stickler to keep everything neat besides the inside of the pan but I have seen that it's completely preventable. If you don't want scratches, do NOT use metal scrubbers.Protip: Ya gotta learn some science (Leidenfrost effect) esp if you plan to cook meats and fish on this. Google and Youtube is your friend <3", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect!', 'author': 'CDee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'One of my best purchases. Perfect size! Perfect cooking! Perfect clean-up! Love this!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent little pan for induction', 'author': 'Placeholder', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought this ss page induction use to make Ramen eggs - did not need anything bulky and Teflon coated. This little thing heated uniformly and was perfect for my needs, although I wish the walls were higher for a true mini wok exp. The lid was a nice bonus. Amazing price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely Love this Pan!', 'author': 'RickC750', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We have had several non-stick 8" pans, which we use primarily for cooking eggs and omelettes. After the coating started to wear, and their were dull spots that couldn\'t be cleaned, we decided to go with a stainless steel pan. The cooking on this pan is very even on our gas stove. Use the recommended low/medium heat level. Have had burnt-on butter and eggs on the pan - it cleans up very easy with Dawn PowerShot, or Cameo for more aggressive spots. After at least 30 times using the pan, it still looks pristine. Is it as easy to clean as a "teflon" or non-stick pan? Probably not. But you don\'t have to worry about deteriorating coating working its way into your food overtime. And the non-stick pans developed spots that are impossible to clean. The stainless pan is not going to scratch as easily as a non-stick pan. We will eventually take all our pans to stainless steel', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good pan', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great pan but not as big as I expected. Im perplexed', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great value and quality and size', 'author': 'dwight', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'quality , vent hole , deminisions', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A very good multi-use sauce pan.', 'author': 'Old cntry gal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really like this pan. I was a little conflicted about a glass top, but it turns out that I love it. I fits very secure on the pan, washes well in the dishwasher, and is made of thick glass, so it is not flimsy. I use my pan on my induction unit because I really hate a full stove. I do not do cakes, pies, etc. that require an oven so my stove top is covered and not used at all and my oven is used for storing my pots and pans. I needed a pan this size for cooking eggs and small to medium portions for meals. The pan cleans up very easily. I use a metal coiled-type scrubber for the harder to remove cooked on remains, but the pan still looks almost new. I have been using stainless steel pots and pans for years and prefer them over the other types. Lately it seems that the sellers have realized that lots of us have graduated to induction, so there is more choices in induction-friendly cookware. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I absolutely love these pans!', 'author': 'Brandy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I absolutely love these pans! The 12 inch pan is much larger than you think as the sides allow for more surface area comapred to traditional pans. Add these features to their looks, and you'll have a skillet set you'll want to use everyday. title: Hestan - NanoBond Collection - Titanium Stainless Steel 8.5-Inch Frying Pan - Toxin, PFAS, & Chemical Free Clean Cookware, Induction Cooktop Compatible
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome cookware for a bad cook!', 'author': 'JPDMyers', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Two months ago, I bought the 8.5” pan as a test before investing further in the Heston Nanobond line. I’d been wanted to ditch my non-stick cookware for several years for health reasons but couldn’t find the right fit. I’m spoiled by growing up cooking with only non-stick cookware. And I’m NOT a good cook so I tend to overheat pans & burn food. AND I sooo dislike cleaning up after cooking that I’d prefer to do it later (like the next day). I’m possibly the worst case scenario for testing any cookware line. I’d honestly much rather enjoy being served nice meals in restaurants. But, I’m immunocompromised so COVID changed all that. So, I’ve needed to up my game & learn to cook decently.I first tested several brands of stainless steel cookware. It was a total nightmare for me to clean. I then tried out ceramic cookware but found it to be too heavy for my arthritic joints. After reading about and researching Hestan’s Nanobond’s titanium coating, I thought it sounded promising & ordered this pan. Besides, the design of all of Hestan’s cookware is simply gorgeous.This Hestan Nanobond pan turned out to be AMAZING. My 1st test was fried eggs that turned out perfect with no sticking and easy cleanup afterwards. I’d read to heat the pan first, then add the oil/butter next & let it heat, and to then add the eggs. That definitely works to make the surface as close to being non-stick without actually having a non-stick coating. I’ve used it repeatedly for sticky foods like fried eggs, scrambled eggs, grilled cheese sandwiches, etc. with thrilling results. Best of all, it’s easy to clean afterwards.The Hestan Nanobond cookware is fantastic & suits my needs perfectly. I’ve now bought many more of the pots and pans in all shapes & sizes. I’m thrilled with the good looks & performance of the Nanobond line, the ease of cleaning up afterwards, and the titanium coating’s overall forgivingness for bad cooks. I accidentally added ground sausage needing to be browned for a casserole directly to their still-warming 3.5 quart sauté pan. The sausage stuck immediately to the bottom & I knew I’d really screwed up. While stirring the rest of the meat with only a silicon spatula, however, the stuck remnants surprisingly released completely from the bottom! I then decided to go ahead & try baking the entire casserole in the covered Nanobond pan in the oven instead of dirtying up a casserole dish. The casserole turned out fantastic with perfectly browned sides & bottom. The servings easily released from the pan without falling apart. And the very baked-on food remnants STILL cleaned up easily. The beautiful design of Hestan’s cookware really makes it equally appealing for stove/oven to table presentation. I’m now totally in love with the Hestan Nanobond line!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great brand', 'author': 'june', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have two nano bond pans from them and both are my two favorite and most used. They clean great. You don't need non-stick if you have these.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This is a high quality pan! Expensive but will last forever!', 'author': 'Charlie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I just got rid of my nonstick T-Fal professional pan and that was great but the coating was starting to come off...Lasted just about maybe a year or year + 1/2...So I was getting tired of buying a new pan constantly.While this is not a non-stick pan, it is solidly built, and the nanocoat looks fantastic, and the rivets are not sticking out inside the pan.You need to warm up the pan and I like to do the water test to make sure the pan is hot enough.Be prepared to use oil and/or butter otherwise you will have food stick.I had to practice with eggs and finally got it figured out to where I can cook a over easy egg w/o making a mess on our electric range.Cleanup is pretty easy, soap + water.I believe if you have food stuck, just soak it and then clean.For anything that blemishes the pan, I think you can buy barkeepers friend and rub it out (cheaper than buying Hestan's polishing compound).If the price was lower, I would jump on the larger pan for sure...This is perfect for cooking a couple of eggs...Just wish it was a little cheaper.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This pan is non stick as long as you follow directions', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This pan is a beautiful little gem. Feels nice in hand and completely non stick if you follow directions and heat it until water drops dance and scatter. Add oil and cook away!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not worthy.', 'author': 'Sebas', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I recently purchased an expensive pan, and I have to say, I'm thoroughly disappointed with its performance. Despite the hefty price tag, the pan fails to deliver even the most basic cooking capabilities. Food sticks to the pan, and it cooks unevenly, leaving some parts burnt and others undercooked.I've tried using different oils and heat settings, but nothing seems to prevent the food from sticking or ensure an even cook. It's incredibly frustrating to spend so much money on a pan that doesn't perform as advertised.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars sticks', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Well made frying pan. We purchased the pan to fry eggs. The first time we used it the eges did not stick.Subsequent egg frying they stuck to the bottom of the pan regardless of how much butter was used to prevent sticking. Not worth the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pan ever!', 'author': 'Naser Ali Abbas Altaib', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This is the Hestan NanoBond 8.5” that I purchased last Oct 2022. After over 8 months of daily usage, the pan is still shining, easy to clean, and nothing sticks if you just preheat your pan properly before adding your fat. The pan is still as GREAT as new, if not BETTER, it’s the best durable high-quality elegant pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars DERAILED REVIEW —— Not perfect but I like it', 'author': 'Bobbler', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought the 8 inch pan.. I am hesitant to buy the larger skillets if they are going to be super thin like the 8 inch is.BOTTOM LINE:I think I’m going to love this pan for scrambled eggs, and I don’t know what else.. I plan to try a reverse sear with salmon or a hamburger.. I usually slow cook vegetables in an enameled cast iron sauce pan, so I don’t have to worry about salt and other seasonings leaching the SS.. But I suppose I will try some vegetables in the nano bond titanium (as a little browning is supposed to add a layer of flavor.. but I suspect browning anything is less healthy).STICK, OR NOT TO STICK?Mystery solved.. I was perplexed by so many reviews complaining about things sticking to the titanium nanobond, because my scrambled eggs were sliding around, almost like a nonstick pan. I just watched a video comparison of three different stainless steel pans.. The Heston nanobond, and demeyere (both of which I have cooked scrambled eggs on).. In the video they got the pans hot until the water drops danced around, which I think of it as a trick that allows you to cook scrambled eggs in cast-iron.. Plus they used what looked like some kind of vegetable oil.. And the egg was stuck in the pan bad.. I use butter at a low temperature (which I believe is appropriate for eggs), and the eggs don’t stick at all..LEACHING INTO FOODI’ve always heard that titanium is extremely non-reactive, but I have been UNABLE to find any information (other than manufacturers claims) whether titanium cookware will leach anything into food while cooking (ie: acidic foods, like tomato paste, or how it’s well known that salt will pit stainless steel).. Titanium is supposed to be completely safe for humans, so we can only hope if anything leeches it would be pure titanium (manufacturers tend to be untrustworthy, I can only hope in Italy they have tighter regulations for such things than in America).. If you search the Internet you can find where testing was done with SS pans.. Some manufacturers claim you can cook tomato red sauce in them (even though tomatoes do leech from SS)..SUPER THIN?When I say super thin, perhaps I’m spoiled by using expensive aluminum clad cookware from other brands that have a hefty amount of aluminum.. Because of the high price of Heston nano bond cookware, they should pop for thick enough aluminum layer to where we should have to wonder if it’s enough.. And to be clear I don’t know how thick the aluminum layer needs to be to do. It’s job..The thin-ness of the pan makes me wonder if it would be prone to warping (with my other stainless steel pans, I clean them while they are hot, but I am fearful to put water into these thin nano bond skillets).. NOTE: I don’t put a lot of cold water into a hot pan, rather a little bit that steam cleans most of the pan (none of my pans have ever warped).HEAT MOMENTUM:The other problem with extra thin aluminum cladding is heat momentum.. Heat momentum is one of the reasons cast-iron pans work so well for certain things (such as putting a frozen hamburger patty, and getting heat momentum to create the seer.. instead of the frozen patty immediately cooling off the pan which destroys the seer). In my particular case, using the control freak induction burner that has a built-in temperature probe, it will probably compensate by instantly turning the power up (which I hear it doing when I take a little off, to try to maintain temperature).. I doubt the thin aluminum will work in this instance, if you’re trying to cook a frozen steak or anything substantial without cool in the pan off..NON-STICK:I have not used nonstick pans for decades, but I have been cooking scrambled eggs in aluminum clad stainless steel pans for years.. And for the past year. I’ve been using Demeyere SS skillets, which have a treated SS surface that concentrates the chromium and nickel and removes the iron (it makes the stainless steel, more stainless steel, and it does stick less than regular SS, but not by much)..[Again contrary to what many reviews are saying], when I cooked scrambled eggs in the Heston nanobond it felt like nonstick to me. There was an obvious non-stick quality even compared to my demeyere). Like my demeyere pans, I expect I will have to occasionally use the special cleaner, or barkeepers friend, to get rid of the haze/seasoning that develops (this is expected)..Likewise cleanup was very easy (like I would imagine non-stick would be).TOO—LIGHT—WEIGHT?I know other reviews think it’s thick/heavy, but it is by far the lightest pan I have ever held in my hands (and I’ve used a few different brands of aluminum clad stainless steel pans).. I realize titanium is light weight, but the nano bond is a very thin layer of titanium (presumably over stainless steel)..The pan is so light weight that it’s causing the problem with my control, freak induction burner.. The 8” or will sit flat by itself, but because it’s so light weight, and the handle is relatively heavy, it will not sit flat on the induction burner for preheating, because there is a temperature probe in the center (that has a lightweight spring)..And (when cooking anything sensitive to uneven heat) you very much need to preheat pans on an induction burner, because the nature of induction heats the pan itself so there is always a hot ring in the center of the pan that matches the induction ring (preheating for a while lets the heat spread out)..BOTTOM LINE: I was able to preheat the pan to cook my scrambled eggs, but one end of the pan was about 1/8” off the induction burner (and induction burners are sensitive to this.I WOULD HATE: to try to preheat the 8” pan for a seer on this induction burner (the 1/8” in the air might end up a huge problem at high power settings)..COOKING TECHNIQUES:There is technique to consider in whether eggs or anything sticks or not..For scrambled eggs I use low heat (228F.. since my induction burner controls the temperature).. and I use plenty of butter (I am convinced, low carb is healthy, and butter and egg yolks are healthy fats).. my eggs were sliding around the pan like the nonstick advertisements..CLEANUP:My experience with cleanup was like you would imagine nonstick. But I’ve seen many reviews complain about food sticking to the pan (I can only assume they were using high heat, and maybe little or no oil).. I can’t say for sure, but I know with my other stainless steel pans anytime something sticks, I just put a squeeze of dish soap and a little water and come back in an hour (or the next morning).. If I’m in a hurry, I’ll turn on the burner for a few seconds so warm soap will work faster.. Then whatever was stuck on usually falls off.. Sometimes I use vinegar (I don’t know whether dish soap vinegar would be more effective)..', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very high quality in ALMOST every area.', 'author': 'Teddy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Pros: the finish looks beautiful as it’s slightly a smoky grey color which is very smooth and though not nonstick is less sticky than other stainless steel pans I’ve used. Good weight, feels sturdy and i love the flush rivets. Heats up quick and the high heat resistance is great so it works I’m pretty much any cooking environment other than a microwave.Cons. Mostly small nitpicks but for an expensive pan small can be big depending on your taste. Pricey. On my induction top at least the pan bottom warps very slightly so as thin coat of oil tends to pool towards the outer edges of the pan, this pretty common in a lot of pans but i do wish at this price it could be avoided. The handle feels high quality but could be slightly more comfortable if the part that rests against your palm was just a bit wider.Overall: If you can deal with those nitpicks this will make a great pan for small tasks like a grilled cheese or an omelet etc. and last a long time. happy cooking!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for searing', 'author': 'L. Bencze', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Yes, food will definitely stick to this pan; no doubt about it. But it's not that hard to clean out. Most importantly, the pan will not pick up any staining. My wife uses it for searing steaks. She puts it in a hot oven. It's perfect for this. So its searing abilities justify the purchase. Other pans, like Swiss Diamond, are much better for cooking eggs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it.', 'author': 'Timothy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It’s a wonderful pan. You buy nice things , You take care of Nice things so don’t throw your hate towards the company that gave you the option to have something so elegant and will last a life time ‘Providing you Care for them’ .All the very best to all that have these , And Happy Cooking 🧑\u200d🍳', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made and pretty', 'author': 'Tiffany Sanders', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I noticed the poor reviews revolve around the heat patina that forms on the copper after use, as well as the food sticking to the pan despite adding oil. To use steel pans, one must learn the steps: 1. Heat the pan first 2. Add the oil once pan is hot, let oil warm up for a few seconds 3. Add food.I have used a pot and my large pan from this ten piece set so far; cooked ground beef and rice, veggies like mushrooms, onions, garlic, and bell peppers so far, as well as made creamed spinach. I have not experienced any sticking whatsoever and find the pans cook my food more evenly with less risk of burning. These are the best pans i have ever used! If you don’t want the copper to change color, then you shouldn’t buy a set with visible copper parts, otherwise you can condition it to remove the natural patina that forms from heat exposure. I personally like the patina, it doesn’t bother me. I would recommend this set to anyone who cooks regularly and wants to do it the way the pros do it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed so far - updated APRIL 7, 2022', 'author': 'Eflows414', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I have decided to get rid of my nonstick Calphalon pans..I love them but the coating comes off and I"m very careful with my pans. I decided to try Hestan. First thing I cooked was scrambled eggs. I oiled the pan well but the eggs stuck really badly and was hard to get out. I forget what I cooked next in it but whatever it was, it was fine..so I tried eggs again, this time using olive oil to coat the pan. It was slightly better but the eggs still stuck to the pan however the pan cleaned up much easier. I\'m hoping it\'s just a matter of getting used to these as I want to get more pcs. This one has just been my trial piece. It is a beautiful pan, I will say thatApril 7, 2022 I thought I would add a little update. I don\'t use this pan that often, but I have cooked scrambled eggs a few more times...first coating the pan with olive oil, getting the oil hot before adding the eggs and then turning the heat down. They still stick but not as badly. I soaked the pan in hot water and it came clean easily. I will need to polish the copper but years ago when I had Revere ware copper bottom pans, I had to polish those as well. I hate not having it be a non stick pan but I spent a lot of money on the Calphalon only to have the nonstick peel off....so that\'s a waste. I never wash my pans in a dishwasher so that doesn\'t bother me either.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Cooks great, looks horrible', 'author': 'Belize Bradley', 'rating': 3, 'content': "My pots and pans are on display on a hanging rack so appearance is not as important as functionality but still important to me. I had such high hopes for this set as it got great reviews and looked stunning out of the box (last photo).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful until you use it. Photos are after one use.', 'author': 'Matt D', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I haven’t cooked with high end cookware before and I’m tempted not to. This is a beautiful piece of cookware but…. It’s not non-stick or dishwasher safe. I did like the heat distribution but cleaning this thing is a chore. I only bought this one pan to test and I’m sorry I spent so much on it. Once you use it the beautiful copper tarnishes. It still works but the beauty is gone unless you polish it. Gonna try another brand that had a copper core but is dishwasher safe. This is a good pan. Just don’t buy it because it looks good. It won’t after you use it once.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Vinchef Nonstick Skillet with Lid, 11In/5Qt Aluminum Deep Frying/Saute Pan with Lid and Heat Indicator, Anti Scratch and Anti Stain, Induction Compatible
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is the non-stick frying pan I was looking for.', 'author': 'Mark A. Pearson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have had an 11 inch Green pan for several years, but it's not non-stick any more. The other thing about the pan is, that it didn't have a lid, and none of the lids of my other pans fit it. So, I have been looking for a new non-stick frying pan with a lid. I really wanted to get one made from cast aluminum, not stamped aluminum, because it's thicker and holds the heat better, distributes heat better, less likely to warp, more likely to stay flat on the bottom, and doesn't have those two little shiny rivet heads that always get food stuck on them and are impossible to get clean. After sifting through hundreds of options I finally selected this Vinchef deep frying pan with a lid. I really was looking for a pan that would be shallower, but I couldn't find one with a lid, so I had to get one that was a bit deeper so I could get one with a lid. I noted the comments regarding the pour spouts so the lid doesn't seal completely, but in the time that I have been using it I have not found that to be a disadvantage. The only food that I have got to stick was when I was steaming some broccoli and put some slices of American cheese on it. One slice got up on the side of the pan and cooked there, and I had to scrub it off, but everything else has been very much non-stick. I really like the pan, the only downside was in assembly, the Phillips head screw that you have to use to put the handle on doesn't go in very well. Even though I think I have the screw in all the way, the handle still feels just a bit loose. I'm afraid to screw it in any further for fear of breaking it. So, it works. I like the fact that the pan fits very nicely inside my 12 inch Farberware stainless steel frying pan for storage. I put the glass lid on it upside down for storage, and everything goes in the drawer very neatly. I don't think that red temperature indicator does anything useful, except it fills the hole between the pan and the handle. Overall, I love the pan. It's just exactly the pan I was looking for, excellent quality, I hope that with good care it will last me many years.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Light weight and cooks evenly', 'author': 'Anthony Filberto', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My very favorite skillet 100 percent. title: MICHELANGELO 10 Inch Frying Pan with Lid, Nonstick Frying Pan with Healthy Granite Coating, Nonstick Pan with Anti-Scald Handle, Induction Compatible
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lo e this pan', 'author': 'vvokie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am almost 75 years old and picking up an 8 lb frying pan is almost.impossible This pan is.light weight and the surface is perfect, food slides off and cleans really easy. Love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars BY FAR THE BEST!!!', 'author': 'Talk2dedgy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ve had A LOT of cookware over the years... This 8" MICHELANGELO is BY FAR THE BEST i\'ve ever owned... no stick... sturdy... easy to clean... food cooks evenly... and the heat is controllable... AND the lid doesn\'t warp in the heat. SO GOOD!!! When it\'s time to retire my other pans I know what I\'ll replace them with.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is one terrific pan!', 'author': 'REM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a really beatifully designed and made pan — the no-stick surface is a wonder! Nothing sticks to it, not even water! Cooks great and keeping foods from burning is easy. The handles stay cool, which is a nice feature, and the domed glass top is another. For this price, this is a sure bet. Nice work, Michelangelo!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not the prettiest pan, but it works very well', 'author': 'Sandra Dyl', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Most of my cookware is stainless steel or cast iron, but I like to have one small, non-stick pan, and my old one was scratched and needed to be replaced. I looked for a pan that was not Teflon that had some thickness and looked like it might last. I also wanted a pan that was guaranteed food safe.This pan is thick and sturdy, and it heats evenly. It is raised very slightly from the outside towards the center, which has both pros and cons, but the raised middle is so slight that it is barely noticeable, and I would not hesitate to cook an omellete in it. It does let the grease drain towards the outside of the pan rather than staying under the food, which it nice. I like the glass cover that lets me see food as it cooks, and it is about as easy to clean as any other glass lid.One caution: the directions say to never use the pan above medium heat, and I have been careful not to do that. Even on medium, the pan heats quickly and gets hot enough, and I have found that at medium temperature the pan cooks very evenly without burning or scorching. However, my gas stove does not have a really high flame or get as hot as some other gas stoves even on the burner with the highest btu, and people with stoves that get really hot will need to be very careful and might need to use low heat rather than medium to avoid damage to the pan. It will depend upon individual stoves. So far, nothing sticks, although I have not tried really sticky cheese yet. It cleans up very nicely with soap and water, and I have not had to scrub it. Time will tell whether or not that lasts.The handle is wood look-alike, and it stays cool when cooking on a stove top. It is very wide - especially where it joins the pan - which makes the pan steadier to hold and pour with less strain on my hand and wrist and without slipping or over-tipping.The only reason for 4 stars is that I personally find this pan kind of ugly because of the speckling and the light-colored wood look-alike handle. That is just my personal taste, and it isn't a serving dish.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific non-stick pan!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had purchased one of these non-stick pans at the same time my husband purchased a different brand non-stick pan. Me - no trouble whatever I cooked and clean-up was a breeze! My husband\'s - not so good. I ended up buying him one of these for his use!...pancake and easy-over eggs and things that you "flip" - because the food actually flips and doesn\'t stick! I would highly recommend this. I do not put mine in the dishwasher because I don\'t want the detergent affecting the wooden handle finish. Actually, no need to put it in there anyway because the clean up is easy - wipe out!! Once in a while I do use some dish detergent to give it a fresh clean, then season it a little like you would an iron skillet. After two years, it still looks new!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made', 'author': 'Person', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Looking for a sturdy but lightweight frying pan?
