Makes a great chicken fryeras it can hold a whole 5 pound fryer split into pieces - also large and deep enough to do a pot roastwith veggies, or a pan lasagna....Point is, it's big enough to cook for a family, it's versatile, well made, heavy duty and well priced. If you're giving this serious consideration I can wholeheartedly say go for it! This kitchen workhorse is perfect for folks who cook in large quantities and want pans that will hold up for decades.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice pan!', 'author': 'Rich L.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I was hesitant to order this pan from some of the bad reviews regarding quality control with the handles and screws. I didn't have any issues assembling my handle, everything went together fine. Been using it for a week now and it's great, like any other stainless pan I have. I saw a lot of negative reviews about this pan, but you have to be able to weed out the reviews written by people who don't know how to use or clean stainless. It's a learning process that has nothing to do with the pans quality. The pan cooked well and evenly and cleaned up like I'm used to, I always boil water at the end and loosen the fond and clean with barkeeper's friend. Great pan at the sale price I paid. Hope it holds up!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great size', 'author': 'islandgirl', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pan is a whopper with some heft to it, which is why it's so great to have that extra handle to move it around. When I took it out of the box it was in its own bag, making me think I was getting something special. The handle came separately with its own tightening wrench and extra nuts. The nuts and handle are well made and nicely polished stainless steel too. It's nice to have the option to remove the handle for cleaning.The pan itself is well made and the screws for the handle don't go through to the inside of the pan; so no hard to clean spots inside. Nice! The sides are extra high and the 6 quart capacity gives the pan versatility. The lid actually stays cool, unlike some other cookware who say they do but don't.The cooking is very even and cleaning is a breeze, as long as you take care of the pan as the manufacturer suggests. This does also clean up nicely in the dishwasher. This pan will be my go-to for many things!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful pan', 'author': 'Just Shopping', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This stainless-steel pan is so versatile and my go-to pan when cooking casseroles, crustless potpie, tacos, and other 1 pot/pan dishes. It is easy to clean and my favorite pan in all of my kitchen pots and pans.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Sits flat on the stove… until you heat it up the first time', 'author': 'Blake', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I sent the first one back because I thought it was a fluke. Even though I very gradually preheated the pan, it quickly developed a high spot in the center on the bottom. Now this thing only gets hot in the very center, because the edges are no longer making contact with the stovetop. It also will spin on the stove like spinning a top… super inconvenient. The replacement pan showed up and did the exact same thing so it is apparently just a poorly built pan, not a fluke. Don’t buy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Must have own tools to assemble.', 'author': 'Joseph T. Allen', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The pan seems fine overall. Definitely works with induction. However, the pan comes delivered without the long handle attached. It comes with 4 nuts (though only two are needed) and a small spanner (wrench) THAT DOES NOT FIT the nuts. Every person in my house-hold tried. It's not like I don't know how to use a wrench. The wrench is simply too small for the nuts. If you are like many urban dwellers and apartment livers and only have pliers, they will scratch the nuts, and maybe the pan too. I think some people just don't know how t use a stainless steel pan in correct steps.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Caraway Nonstick Ceramic Mini Fry Pan (1.05 qt, 8") - Non Toxic, PTFE & PFOA Free - Oven Safe & Compatible with All Stovetops (Gas, Electric & Induction) - Sage
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Most Magical Pan on Earth!!!!!!!!!', 'author': 'Nicole Marie Story', 'rating': 5, 'content': "OMG!! This is the most magical pan on Earth!! And I am certain that I can speak for Pluto, too!! Oh how I wish that I had ordered this pan when it was first introduced to the market!! It produces the fluffiest, tastiest, most beautiful JUST Eggs that I have ever created. And literally nothing sticks. NOTHING!! I make my JUST eggs, eat my JUST eggs, and wash the pan all before my puppies are finished with eating of their bones. It is truly an incredible product. And OH!! Let us talk about its beauty!! I chose the colour of marigold because my younger pup's name is Merrigold. AND IT IS SO VERY PRETTY, providing the perfect aesthetic as my eggs so perfectly cook away. Thank you to Caraway for giving me the greatest pleasure ever known with the cooking, consumption, and cleaning of my JUST eggs. Your pan is DIVINE!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Customer Service, great pan when used with oil!', 'author': 'Mary', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATED REVIEW:I originally was disappointed with this pan as food often stuck to it. Customer service kindly reached out and told me that I needed to use oil or butter when cooking and make sure the pan is properly heated before adding any food. I had always heard that oil can ruin the coating of nonstick pans, but in this case it has really helped. Because my pan was fairly new, they very kindly replaced it and since then I have not had any issues. I would recommend this pan and this company.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Nonstick is nonexistent', 'author': 'Matt', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I purchased this pan about one month ago, and have used it daily since receiving it. And I will say - this Caraway fry pan - well there’s something just not right about it. Something that just doesn’t add up. After a single use, food began adhering to the pan’s cooking surface. Not just eggs, mind you; which is probably the main thing most of us hope to use our nonstick cookware for. Everything sticks. Bacon sticks. Sausage sticks. Potatoes stick. Meats, veggies - shoot, a slice of bread sticks to this pan. Would you like to simply to warm something from the fridge, reheat leftovers? Nope. It will stick. If you can cook something in this pan, it will stick to this pan. And not just a little bit of stick. No, no, no, my friends. Look to some of the other very low reviews. See the video evidence. There’s a whole lot of stick. A tear your food up trying to get it out of the pan and on to the plate kind of stick. And then a soak in hot water and scrape stuff out kind of stick. And then a do it again to get what you couldn’t get out after all that kind of stick. Following the recommended cleaning method of a bringing a cup of water with two tbls of baking soda to boil for several minutes and then rinsing…stuff sticks. No amount of cleaning, nor method of cleaning seems to affect the performance. Neither does cooking technique. Cook on low, stuff sticks. Cook on medium, stuff sticks. Cook with oil, sticks. No oil, sticks. Truly preposterous. This said, however, this is not merely a poor non stick pan; it is a poor pan. The handle, though ergonomically sound and comfortable to grip, transfers heat far too readily. On a gas range, it quickly becomes ‘too hot to handle.’ Beyond the five minute mark, even on low heat, you will be burned by the handle. Additionally, the pan’s exterior surface cannot be kept clean, which for a daily use pan isn’t critical in my book, excepting that the finish seems designed to have stuff actually adhere to it. Again, not especially off putting for me as I believe in function over aesthetics, but I find it strange this should be so. That said, my expectations for this pan were fairly straight forward. I hoped for a decently made nonstick pan that would heat mostly evenly, that would be mostly nonstick, that would function in my working kitchen alongside some other quality cookware that consists exclusively of copper clad stainless steel and cast iron. I looked very forward to a more healthful alternative to the everyday nonstick more typically relied upon. And I hoped to get perhaps as much as a year’s use of the pan before having to replace it. I take care of my cookware. I always use soft implements, never metal, and always rely upon gentle cleaning methods - soft sponges and plastic scrappers only if necessary. Given the performance of this pan, at this point, however, I am disappointed across the board. I also must and do question any and all claims made as to this cookware’s efficacy. As well as the efficacy of any claims or reviews that would laud its performance as commendable. I am, in short, severely skeptical. I know my way around a kitchen, and as far as I’m concerned, I will not deign to so much as boil water in it at this point. It has no redeeming qualities given its performance. And given its performance, I cannot help but to doubt its other claims as to being a healthier alternative to other cookware options. Given the $100 price tag for the pan, one must conclude that such a high relative cost is primarily for covering marketing and profit. And I would challenge anyone willing to make contrary claims as to this pan’s performance to prove such claims as anything better than specious. From my experience, this appears to be a clear matter of consumer grift. Given what my experience with this product has been, there is simply no other reasonable explanation. Out of the box, it does look nice; it does feel nice. First cook: it works nice. And then the honeymoon is over. And the fight is on. Sorry to say, if you bought this thing, you already lost.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible performance!', 'author': 'Lionel P LaCorbiere', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’ve been around for more than half a century and cooked using many types of pots, pans, cutlery, appliances and gadgets. I’ve never been really impressed with the claimed capabilities of a kitchen product until I bought this pan.If you follow the directions exactly, on how to use and care for this product, it will perform exactly as you’d expect! Eggs, literally, just slide out with minimal oil or butter in the pan. This is my primary use of it but, sautéed vegetables and the like are a joy to cook because of its performance. Cleanup couldn’t be easier.Also, I can confirm because I’m a subscriber to Consumer Reports, it’s a CR Recommended product which dictates most of my product purchases due to their unbiased, intensive testing protocol.It’s probably a bit expensive for some at between $85 to $130 depending on where you purchase it but, I feel it’s well worth the cost to know you have one of the best ceramic coated frying pans on the market today.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars What a pan', 'author': 'Medictrode', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I don’t buy anything until Project Farm reviews it, and this pan is no different. A bit pricy, but it works very well, is easy to clean and there aren’t any bad chemicals on it that will harm my parrot. I plan on getting the full set now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Non-stick for only 7 months', 'author': 'Sarah', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'UPDATE #2: Caraway refunded me in full for my pan! Thank you, Caraway!UPDATE #1: I contacted Caraway, and they did nothing but give me the runaround. First it was “let’s make sure you’re cooking your food right on the right temp and with the right oils.” Ok, followed up in detail. Then it was “well, not all stove tops actually cook on low or medium - but rather much higher than that - so it could be your stove top is to blame”. Cool. Then, finally, it was “here’s this recipe to remove the film we think is all over your very new pan”. The vinegar, baking soda mixture did nothing. So, they aren’t willing to replace to her pan and will find any reason to blame you for why the pan failed! Avoid this company!ORIGINAL REVIEW: Was an amazing non-stick until it wasn’t.In 7 months it stopped non-sticking and instead, sticking like crazy!What a waste of money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well Worth the Price', 'author': 'Jim Gach', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I finally got tired of throwing out Teflon pans every year or two. This pan is heavy, heats evenly, non-toxic and is highly rated by CR. I'm looking forward to years of non-stick cooking. And it is simply beautiful!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful pan', 'author': 'A', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this pan in white with the brass handle to try it out before I purchase the 4 pan set which I have been looking at for a few months now. It’s a very good quality pan that is so much healthier than other nonstick pans. Great size too. Very pleased with this purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars exchange', 'author': 'Mama', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My daughter loved this skillet; however, she put it in her sink to dry and it barely touched another pan and now it has 2 small nicks in it. Is it possible to exchange it for a new one? She literally was treating it with kid gloves.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Good, but doesn't last long", 'author': 'Olga', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This pan lasted 13 months before it started to chip. Food doesn't stick to the bottom of it, but can say the same about sides. Once it starting to stick its impossible to clean.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Granitestone 14 Inch Large Nonstick Frying Pan Nonstick Pan for Cooking with Diamond Triple Coated Surface, Family Sized Nonstick Frying Pan Skillet with Stay Cool/Helper Handle, Oven/Dishwasher Safe
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 2 years of regular use', 'author': 'Slid', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have used this pan regularly (not quite daily) for the last 2 years and am still happy with this purchase. The pan is huge, so we can cook a lot of food at once; pretty lightweight for it's size which I appreciate for ease of cleaning; it remains non-stick even though I do use oil in it; it still looks almost new. The key with non-stick pans is to not use more than a medium heat setting (we have a gas cooktop) and make sure the pan is sufficiently cooled before putting water in it to wash it. Yes, I do have some warping in the center, so the oil retreats to the edges, but it's to be expected with an inexpensive pan, and I just tilt the pan to distribute the oil. I would recommend this product!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan, but doesn't defy physics like people are expecting", 'author': 'Alan J. Lachapelle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is way better than any non-stick pan I have ever used, far better than teflon, those copper pans, stainless when used right, cast iron when used right (I even ordered the Misen pan and it doesn\'t touch this) - it cleans up super easy. It isn\'t as no-stick as the eggs effortlessly sliding around, but close.Mine bowed - I have a 14" pan and an electric stove - physics are still real. This is aluminum and that material expands and contracts as it heats and cools. With the stove not heating all of it, thats what happens. It still heats really well and does move the heat well, but that made the bottom bow a bit. Seriously, it still works perfect. and what 30$ for a 14" pan? I can barely even find a pan that big, let alone for 30$, let alone better than even the best I have had.This is the go to MPV in the kitchen. We beat the hell out of it, cut food in the pan, metal tongs, metal flipper, scrap with spoons and forks - it doesn\'t matter. This honeybadger just handles business. We use less oil now, which is night, and have better results.It\'s so big it doesn\'t really fit in the cupboard, and when you have a big pot on the stove things get crazy. I might also pick up an 11" or something.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan', 'author': 'Miniappleman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Had some older non-stick pans start to leach the surface material, so looked around for some replacements. Came across these Granite Stone pans and gave them a try. They have been great to use over this past year. They cook nicely and still wipe up clean like they were brand new. Regarding the 14" pan, I marked the heat distribution down a star. Most of that is that this is such a large pan, it\'s much wider than the largest stove top burner. These are not cast iron, so you can\'t expect to keep pumping heat into them to reach the edges. But it\'s mostly used for stewing or braising with the lid on, so getting the outside edge to highest temp isn\'t really an issue. Everything get some amount of stirring to eliminate any cooler spot issues.Like the helper handle, especially on a large pan like this. Helps both on the stove top and when moving it in and out of the oven.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Truly non-stick!', 'author': 'helenwheels74', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've been using this skillet to make larger portions of my knock-off version of chicken fried rice for a couple of months now. It's nice and large, and the handle on the opposite side makes it easier to lift when it's laden with food. That handle makes it too big to fit into my dishwasher, but clean-up is easy because any food and oil residue is easily rinsed off and sponged clean in seconds. The electric stovetop burner I use it on is far smaller than the pan, but the heat does distribute well, though that may depend on what you're cooking and how precise it needs to be. I would recommend hanging it for storage, as its size may be too big for an average cupboard. There's a hole at the end of the handle for such a purpose. I'm very happy that I bought this, and the price was more than reasonable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No cooking spray allowed', 'author': 'Martha I. Martin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like the non stick surface, the draw back is that using olive oil is not really recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Heats evenly if used correctly', 'author': 'Suzi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I read several reviews about uneven heating. I believe due to operator failure and not understanding basic thermodynamics. If you use this on a small burner (say less than 12") and crank up the heat, you will likely get uneven heating and possibly warping. Not the product, just laws of thermodynamics. Use on largest burner you have on a stovetop, use medium heat to warm up, then cook. Great skillet!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 6, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Big enough for large meals', 'author': 'Joanna', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I really do love this pan. My food doesn't stick to the bottom. It's easy to clean. I do wish though it came with a lid.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Major disappointment even for a cheap pan', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Pan is humped up in the middle. Should be flat across cooking surface. If you put any small amount of liquid in will all pool to outside of pan. So couple tablespoons of oil in a pan to help brown something? Nah, all on the outside edge instead.All non-stick pans are a wearable item and have a lifespan. Bought as a low cost option replacing one where non-stick coating failed. But this pan has kind of sucked since day one. After 4mo I'll be looking to replace because sick of not being able to have anything liquid in middle of pan.Also super thin and light. Which I guess is great if you have no hand or arm strength. But it is bad for heat distribution or retention. Put something cold into a pre-heated pan and temp will go down. But one like this and heat will plummet. A heavier bottom would do this pan a lot of good. I could live with this, but the humped up middle is a non-starter.Do not buy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars The cooking surface is not flat', 'author': 'Feisty One', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'There is a hump in the middle of the frying pan. The cooking oil goes to the side of the pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The pan is huge', 'author': 'RhondaJoy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Just wish it would have had an option for a lid. Works great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Tri-Ply Fully Bonded Stainless Steel 8inch Frying Pan,Chef's pan,kitchen Skillets,Induction Pan Dishwasher and Oven Safe, Compatible with All Cooktops(Removable Handle)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Truly enamored with how well this is made, heavy sturdy ALL stainless steel.', 'author': 'Ai', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been upgrading my cookware and everything to stainless steel and glass for the past couple of years (couple pieces at a time). And I have to say, this pan is heavy heavy duty, it's amazing. Stainless steel is the best to get a great sear on my chicken, pork or beef. This pan does a great job at it, and the weight of it makes it so it sits still on my stove, what my other nonstick coated terrible pans can't do. They're usually lightweight and move around, this one stays still. Heats evenly so I could sear a pan FULL of chicken with no worries about having to do small batches. Eggs with some oil great a great crispy edge too, my favorite. The lid sits nice and tight for when I was to stew anything, it also has a good depth for that. Easy clean up, almost effortless and no worries of any coating getting into my food it i scrub a little too hard. Amazing quality for the price point, honestly. Best thing I couldn't upgraded to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality Pan', 'author': 'NYC_Chic', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pan is a lifesaver. Its great for frying eggs or whipping up a quick stir fry. The high sides are a real plus that enhance the capacity of the pan. I am moving away from using any aluminum products so I was a little bit concerned when it said this pan has an aluminum core but it is so solid and encased in stainless steel that I have no worries. This pan heats well and cooks evenly. It has really become one of my favorites and I use it daily but it looks almost brand new. The pan washes easily. Its great for use on the stove and can go in the oven if you remove the handle which I've done a few times. This is a very good quality piece of cookware and I expect that I will have it for a long time to come.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality cookware at a decent value', 'author': 'Jack', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We’ve had tremendous luck with recent kitchen gadgets and hardware lately, and this pan is no exception. It’s a testament that there are truly great quality products to be found and I have zero complaints about this. It’s made of durable, highly crafted, and shiny stainless steel. The one caveat (which is not a major groan) is the handle will get hot along with the pan itself. As long as you have a potholder or kitchen towel nearby, this is a non-issue. It’s not coated with a non-stick material, so be mindful of that when choosing a pan. However, so long as you use the right kind of cooking spray, it’s still easy to clean. In addition to the pan, the lid is as well a breeze to keep clean. With an ample 12” diameter, you really can’t go wrong here. It’s worth the value you will invest for a decent piece of cookware.5 Stars for sure!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality stainless steel pan', 'author': 'D. Patterson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like this stainless steel skillet and lid. The skillet is roomy, with a lot of surface area for cooking. The lid fits well and can provide ventilation if needed. The handle assembles with the screws on the outside, which helps with cleaning. I am used to cooking with stainless steel, but I tried to follow the enclosed directions for use. I tried to fry eggs the first time I used it, and they stuck like crazy. It was quite easy to clean up though. I didn’t really expect it would do very well with that. I cooked pork chops next, and it worked extremely well. The meat released easily once seared well. As with all stainless steel pots or pans, a good stainless cleaner is a must. (I knew a woman who threw her stainless steel pots away out of frustration because she couldn’t get them clean with regular dishwashing. Unfortunately, she didn’t realize that stainless steel cleaner was a thing.) I expect this skillet and the glass lid to last me many years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Everyday Elegance: Unveiling the Secrets of My New Stainless Steel Fry Pan', 'author': 'Yawnimouse', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've recently had the pleasure of incorporating a stainless steel frying pan into my kitchen collection, marking my first venture away from non-stick surfaces. Upon first handling the pan, its quality was immediately apparent. The craftsmanship is commendable, with none of the machining feeling rough or unfinished. This attention to detail not only adds to the pan's aesthetic appeal but also contributes positively to its performance during use.Cooking with this pan has been a delightful experience. The tri-ply construction promises and delivers on even heating, a feature I quickly came to appreciate. Unlike my previous non-stick pans, the feel of cooking on stainless steel feels decidedly upscale and professional, enhancing the overall cooking experience. Furthermore, its compatibility with all cooktops, alongside the convenience of being dishwasher and oven safe, has made this pan a versatile and valued tool in my kitchen.However, it's important to note that transitioning to stainless steel cooking has had its learning curve, especially regarding temperature management and food release properties. Despite these adjustments, the pan's performance has lived up to expectations. I look forward to updating this review if any issues arise or if I encounter any noteworthy aspects of this pan's long-term performance.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Stains Easily', 'author': 'Scio Dad', 'rating': 3, 'content': "First the good. I really like the size and the dimensions of this pan. It's almost like a short wok because of the rounded sides. And the lid fits nicely and I like the vent hole. The handle on the pan remains cool to the touch and looks as though it is solidly attached. I noticed another reviewer who complained about how heavy the pan is. The pan weighs just under 3 lbs. If you want decent heat distribution, which this pan has, you need a good amount of mass. Not having rivets on the inside of the pan is also a big plus. The downside, however, is pretty major. It stains very easily. I tested it by frying some ground lamb on medium heat. The picture attached shows the pan after I scrubbed it with a course metal pan scrubber. The stains would not come off. By contrast, another pan that I've had for over 20 years and use quite often scrubs much cleaner. I also noticed that the color of the stainless is not as bright as my old one. It has a darker hue to it. It makes me somewhat skeptical about the isolation between the aluminum core and the stainless cooking surface. I really wanted to like this pan but I cannot trust the quality and safety.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Large, heavy, holds heat', 'author': 'ChuckD', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Needed a new pan as we only have cast iron and non-sticks. The bottom is much thicker than you'll find at the big box generic store so it holds heat decently. De-glazing in this pan has been great. Would recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My New Favorite Stir Fry Pan', 'author': 'Willa Reads', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've always wanted to try a stainless steel frying pan and I'm glad I chose this one. I've been looking for a frying pan to stir fry chicken and vegetables and this works great. I was using a teflon coated pan that didn't brown the chicken at all. This pan does a great job with stir frying. It does leaves some stains; however, I have a stainless steel cleaner that takes the stains right out. I do wish that it was a bit deeper so I could fit more into the pan but this does a great job for a smaller meal. I love this frying pan!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good pan but slightly on the heavy side', 'author': 'S', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The pan looks good and cooks well. The handle was cool to touch post cooking food at high temperature for 30 minutes on gas stove.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Big fan of this pan', 'author': 'Allen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love the dimensions on this pan. It's a heavy pan for sure. So far no stick issues, hopefully that holds up. This has become my main pan.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value', 'author': 'Gerry, Las Vegas', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First, anyone who says these are not cast iron is wrong. I take basic skillets, grind them smooth and re-season them. For the money, these are great skillets.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice and heavy pan', 'author': 'Laurence Balsamo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this pan specifically to sear meats. I have high end cookware that I like to keep looking new.This pan does a great job when it comes to searing. It's very heavy so it hold the temperature. For the price you can't go wrong.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good high quality pan', 'author': 'Susan Harper', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Good quality cast iron. I use it all the time.Fairly easy to clean.Good for chopping up sausage as it cooks, don't have to worry about messing up the inside like on the non-stick pans", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Solid skillet', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I recently purchased a cast iron skillet and I am absolutely in love with it! The skillet is of fantastic quality and has exceeded all of my expectations. The weight and construction of the skillet are perfect, and the design is both beautiful and functional.I have used the skillet for cooking everything from eggs to steak and it has performed flawlessly. The heat distribution is even and consistent, which has allowed me to cook my food to perfection every time. I also appreciate the fact that the skillet is versatile and can be used on a variety of cooking surfaces, including induction stovetops, grills, and even open flames.The skillet is also incredibly easy to clean and maintain. I simply rinse it with hot water and wipe it down with a little bit of oil to prevent rust. I love that the more I use it, the better it becomes and the more non-stick it gets.Overall, I would highly recommend this cast iron skillet to anyone in the market for one. It's durable, versatile, and performs beautifully. I can tell that this skillet will be a staple in my kitchen for years to come.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!!!', 'author': 'Lisa C', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great price, quality and size! Lid fits perfectly!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan', 'author': 'Sibby', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I husband loves this pan. He has been looking for a good size pan that will heat up enough to crisp up hash browns.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I have officially formed a deep emotional attachment to a pan.', 'author': 'RP', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I always wanted a cast iron skillet, and I\'m *so* glad I finally got one.For starters, it cooks everything better -- which has made cooking almost like an all new thing for me. For example, when I got up this past Saturday, I said to myself, "gee, I wonder what it would be like to make the world\'s best pancakes?" and then I cooked pancakes on this cast iron skillet, and said to myself, "this REALLY IS the world\'s best pancakes. Does not get better than that!"Cooking everything I\'ve ever cooked before has literally become a whole new experience.I\'ve also had a number of times in my life where I bought things thinking if I bought it, I\'d do more of something I wanted to do. For example, I\'ve bought instruments wanting to play instruments, or bought games wanting to play some games with friends. In almost all cases, I buy that thing and proceed to not do anything with it beyond using it a couple times.Not with this. I\'m discovering more and more that when you have the right tools to make delicious things, cooking is so much more fun than I ever thought it would be.I *look forward* to cooking.And, hell, even cleaning -- because while cast iron is a lot less scary to take care of than some people think, it does require work. And I kind of feel like with my new skillet, it\'s kind of like a new pet. And one that I love. But like a new pet, it sometimes needs attention that can\'t be too delayed.Previously, I\'d have left a dirty pan in the sink for hours... maybe days. Now, I clean it up right after I eat, because it\'s my new \'puppy\' and it needs its cleaning now.There\'s been a weirdly fulfilling ritual to this, though, that\'s connected me to my kitchen -- plus, I enjoy this new cleaner kitchen I\'ve been keeping almost as much as I\'ve been enjoying the food that I\'ve eaten!To think a fairly small purchase has changed so much about me in such a short time -- and made me appreciate so many new and different things -- is, well, damn. I love it.A few little caveats:This ended up being a bit bigger than I expected, but that\'s my fault for not comparing the measurements to my existing pans and skillets. I thought this was a \'standard\' sized pan (whatever \'standard\' is), and it ended up being a good deal bigger than the biggest pan I had before.That said, I actually *really* like the size. This makes cooking a lot of things that was challenging a lot easier -- I made a *giant* thing of made-from-scratch Mac and Cheese (enough for 12 people!), and this actually managed to fit the entire thing. (And the fact that I could use one pan for the stove top *and* the oven was nice.).I also enjoy how much easier to is to flip things, and how there\'s extra space if I want to cook a couple different at the same time. Another nice thing: if you\'re cooking burgers or hot dogs, you can cook the meat in the center of the pan and have *plenty* of space around the sides to heat the buns, and this makes them extra tasty.It is a bit heavy, however. I\'m able to handle it with one hand (though that took a little getting used to), but a member of my household in her mid to late 60s isn\'t. Still, she\'s able to handle it much easier than she thought the first time she picked it up because of it\'s second handle. Consider this the Great Sword of the kitchen -- a number of people are going to need to use its two handles to use with ease.The last caveat: If you\'ve never used cast iron -- like I\'ve never used cast iron -- *wow* do they get hot, and they *retain* their heat. I took the advice of all the blog articles I\'ve read and seasoned it a few extra times before my first use, and the first time I took it out of the oven I burned myself -- right through my oven mitt. If you pick this skillet in the oven at very high temperatures, make sure to use both the silicone hot handle holder and a *good* pair of oven mitts.My burn was very minor because I had the oven mitts on, but they were crappy, cheap oven mitts. I immediately threw them out and bought a good pair of oven mitts on that were designed to be able to protect at 450.I haven\'t burned myself since, but it\'s definitely something to be careful about.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 20, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars Here's what's really going on with this pan", 'author': 'Joe Vasicek', 'rating': 3, 'content': "There are a lot of confusing reviews on this product, with some people claiming that it's not actually cast iron and posting pictures to show it. Here's what's actually going on.The pan is made of cast iron. I've been cooking with cast iron for a decade now, and have various pans, including one handed down from my father that sadly developed a crack in it, which is why we bought this one (also growing family, etc). I'm not an expert in metallurgy, but I've got a decent idea of what goes on in the manufacturing of these things. Melt pig iron, pour it into a mold, let it cool and set, then season for everyday use.This is a cheap Chinese-made pan. Typical of most Chinese-made products, the manufacturer cut a lot of corners. The sides and bottom are slightly thinner than comparable American-made cast iron pans. I'm guessing that the iron itself is of lower quality, and that it was not mixed or cooled properly when cast. As a result of these shortcuts, the bottoms of these pans tend to be slightly convex, with the center being higher than the sides. Hence the reviews complaining about oil not staying in the center.In typical Chinese fashion, the manufacturer fixed this problem in the quickest and easiest way: by machining the center of the pan. However, this machined surface lacks the porous texture that makes cast iron so awesome. The pores expand with heat and contract when the pan cools, trapping lipid chains from fats and oils which gives the pan its sheen and patina. However, with a smooth machined surface, this pan never fully develops those non-stick properties, and the patina comes off easily with a heavy cleaning, giving it the silvery metallic appearance that has convinced so many one-star reviewers that this pan is not cast iron.TL;DR: If you're looking for something cheap and cast-iron that you can toss in the back of your truck or camper, forget about for a couple of years, then pull out, scrape the rust off, and cook over a campfire or somesuch, this is a decent pan. If you're looking for a pan you can use every day and hand down to your children as a cherished family heirloom, spend the extra money and buy American made.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice pan', 'author': 'Private User', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Nice pan was preseasoned only thing I didn't like about it you had to put the knob on the lid which it should have been on there in the first place no instructions on how to do it they give you a bunch of pieces and you got to figure it out yourself that's the only drawback", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars THIS IS A GREAT, CLASSIC FRY PAN, DURABLE AND WILL LAST A LIFETIME', 'author': 'LaTigresse999', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This made a great gift for my sister, who needed a new frying pan. She loves it, it cooks and distributes heat really well, clean up easy and will last a lifetime with a minimum of care.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Highly recommended.', 'author': 'Kate Hays', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Have you been reading through dozens of reviews for non-stick pans? Read on…My wife and I have been brutal to our pans. We leave them in the sink stacked on top of each other, store them improperly and cook at way to high a temp without enough oil. We have ruined so many $50-80 pans that it’s ridiculous. The truth about non-stick pans is that 95% of their failure is do to us, the consumers.I took a picture of my pan after cooking eggs 6 times, frying a burger patty and sautéing vegetables. Looks brand new!Our secret? Read the instructions and season the pan when you get it. Only put it on heat for 2-3 minutes. Cool, then wash with soap and water with a dog sponge. After everything you cook, immediately wash the pan so stuff doesn’t get stuck on it. Keep it in the stove or somewhere it can’t get scratched. When cooking, use low to medium heat. It will be the best $20 pan you ever own.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Only used it twice but seems to be ok.', 'author': 'Lois', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The price is a little high for it but seems to be good quality. I like the fact that you don't have a mess on the outside of the pan either to clean. All seems to clean up nicely :>) I haven't made many things in it but a lot better then those $10.00 frying pans that clam to be the same quality but last about 3 weeks, then everything sticks to them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: OXO Professional Hard Anodized PFAS-Free Nonstick, 8" Frying Pan Skillet, Induction, Diamond reinforced Coating, Dishwasher Safe, Oven Safe, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars love these pans', 'author': 'M. Sotta', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this one and an 10" one and am throwing all my other pans away. These are amazing. Nothing sticks, so it\'s easy to quickly rinse them in a bit of warm soapy water and let them dry.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Fry Pan', 'author': 'RPCS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This fry pan was touted on ATK in a larger size. Super non-stick and seems very durable after the multiple uses it has gone through. My previus favorite was a TFal with the red temp ball in the middle worked great but the non-stick was not as smooth as this pan. Both were induction capable. The biggest issue for me is that the TFal had a taipered design and that made the cooking surface a lot small (wider at the top than the bottom). Probably the biggest complaint with the TFal was that the pans cook surface has a convex shape so when you drop in an egg, it would end up in the edge of the pan. The OXO has none of these issues and the surface is a full 8". I like the smooth riveted handle as well. It\'s still performing like a new pan and we are very happy with it. The hard anodized exterior is definitely the way to go. It makes the outside very easy to clean and keeps it looking like new. Stainless exteriors eventually get burned on stains and heat discoloration.Forget about the really cheap pans and the fancy marketing of the Made-In nonstick pans. The design of this OXO base provides 35% more space in the base of the pan. A huge difference for cooking when compared to other 8" designs. Our old 8" nonstick Made-In pan only had about 5" of cooking area and the nonstick surface did not not last as long as this OXO pan.This is a great product and you won\'t be disappointed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Non-Stick', 'author': 'Benia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Having heard that an old non-stick pan wasn’t healthy, I decided to replace with this one for our morning omelettes and scrambled eggs. I do like it very much. We got the smaller size since there is only two of us, but is truly nonstick and the hard finish should not develop the unhealthy aspect.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan', 'author': 'B. Thomas', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We use ours to make eggs and it has lasted a long time. Only recently has some of the material worn off by one of the rivets. Not sure if that is a bad thing for one's health. Rivets are always hard to clean as food gets trapped by them. Wish Oxo would put out a pan without rivets. Just bought two more pans. Highly recommended.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Mueller DuraClad Tri-Ply Stainless Steel 8-Inch Fry Pan with Lid, Extra Strong Cookware, 3-layer Bottom, Even Heat Distribution, Ergonomic and EverCool Stainless Steel Handle
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Do your research! I promise it'd be worth it", 'author': 'Trish', 'rating': 5, 'content': "If you are low maintenance with your cookware, I don't think this is for you.I ended up going into research mode looking for good pans that will last me awhile and not get absolutely destroyed and I found this. You WILL need to buy Barkeeper's friend to keep this clean depending on what you cook with it (or baking soda and some diluted vinegar and water). Since it's stainless steel, it heats up pretty quick.This has been perfect for me to make eggs in and sautee some veggies. The key is patience so if you don't have that, probably don't bother. Been using this a couple months now and it still looks amazing. It has a thicker bottom and the handle is sturdy PLUS the lid is good for over easy eggs. It did stain underneath but that was my fault, and I'm not a stickler to keep everything neat besides the inside of the pan but I have seen that it's completely preventable. If you don't want scratches, do NOT use metal scrubbers.Protip: Ya gotta learn some science (Leidenfrost effect) esp if you plan to cook meats and fish on this. Google and Youtube is your friend <3", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect!', 'author': 'CDee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'One of my best purchases. Perfect size! Perfect cooking! Perfect clean-up! Love this!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent little pan for induction', 'author': 'Placeholder', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought this ss page induction use to make Ramen eggs - did not need anything bulky and Teflon coated. This little thing heated uniformly and was perfect for my needs, although I wish the walls were higher for a true mini wok exp. The lid was a nice bonus. Amazing price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely Love this Pan!', 'author': 'RickC750', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We have had several non-stick 8" pans, which we use primarily for cooking eggs and omelettes. After the coating started to wear, and their were dull spots that couldn\'t be cleaned, we decided to go with a stainless steel pan. The cooking on this pan is very even on our gas stove. Use the recommended low/medium heat level. Have had burnt-on butter and eggs on the pan - it cleans up very easy with Dawn PowerShot, or Cameo for more aggressive spots. After at least 30 times using the pan, it still looks pristine. Is it as easy to clean as a "teflon" or non-stick pan? Probably not. But you don\'t have to worry about deteriorating coating working its way into your food overtime. And the non-stick pans developed spots that are impossible to clean. The stainless pan is not going to scratch as easily as a non-stick pan. We will eventually take all our pans to stainless steel', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good pan', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great pan but not as big as I expected. However a good pan to cook small items or small servings', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Fairly good quality', 'author': 'Darla Thomas', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The interior discolored and no amount of scrubbing will remove the stain. Im perplexed', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great value and quality and size', 'author': 'dwight', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'quality , vent hole , deminisions', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A very good multi-use sauce pan.', 'author': 'Old cntry gal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really like this pan. I was a little conflicted about a glass top, but it turns out that I love it. I fits very secure on the pan, washes well in the dishwasher, and is made of thick glass, so it is not flimsy. I use my pan on my induction unit because I really hate a full stove. I do not do cakes, pies, etc. that require an oven so my stove top is covered and not used at all and my oven is used for storing my pots and pans. I needed a pan this size for cooking eggs and small to medium portions for meals. The pan cleans up very easily. I use a metal coiled-type scrubber for the harder to remove cooked on remains, but the pan still looks almost new. I have been using stainless steel pots and pans for years and prefer them over the other types. Lately it seems that the sellers have realized that lots of us have graduated to induction, so there is more choices in induction-friendly cookware. I love the selections we now have.I would recommend this fry pan and lid to anyone - it is a great cookware addition that will last for years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this pan', 'author': 'Jeff B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm so happy to have found a small pan with a lid, I use it all the time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality pan', 'author': 'Brendan Heath', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Heavier than I thought in a good way, quality product', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made, beautiful, easy to clean, last longer than most similar pans', 'author': 'Steve Long', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Outstanding non-stick pan without the nasty chemicals that were common until a few years ago. title: Nonstick Deep Frying Pan with Lid, 11 Inch Saute Pan Skillet, Granite Stone Coating for Cooking, Induction Cookware, Compatible with All Stovetops, PFOA Free
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nonstick Heaven!', 'author': 'Lorelei', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I originally bought this skillet as a gift for someone. They raved on and on about it so I felt I needed one too! I put it on my wishlist and received it as a gift from my family. It is so easy to love this pan!Since the reviews do not contain photos of cooked food in the pan (when I wrote this review) I thought I'd add a little color! The first photo is the first flip of the sausage. This was cooked on my electric stove that is so not very level. As you can see on the lighter first flip photo, the cooking is perfectly even on all of the sausage patties. The second photo is at the second and final flip, completely cooked, absolutely evenly browned. This was cooked on Medium-High. Excellent nonstick surface as claimed. Game Changer for sure!On my electric stovetop it took as long to heat up as my iron skillet does, I'm sure induction will be much faster. It has a heavy thickness on the bottom (stainless steel) that I believe will not warp. Though I haven't used it on my induction plate, I feel it will work so well too in fact, on all cooking surfaces as claimed. I've never seen an induction plate cook so evenly on my glass top! My other induction pans are awful on my electric glass cooktop. This one performs!!It has a thick granite nonstick surface and there was absolutely perfect application of this surface at the factory. It works so well. Eggs slide around in the pan easily too! Hello sunny side up!Cleaning is so easy, pour out any liquids or fats, use a sponge with a little soap and water, rinse and you are done. I don't plan on putting mine in the dishwasher because it is so easy to hand wash, however, you could do that easily. Even if the dishwasher is full, you can remove the handle for better positioning in the dishwasher if you like. Also the handle can be removed for storage space. The handle has a button release mechanism which is not hard to push. What a beautiful feature and designed well with the cook and space in mind! The handle attaches firmly and does not wobble or move. It is not slick in the hand and has a slight grip with the bakelite finish. It is very safe.There is an added pour spout which I appreciate and will use often for grease and other hot liquids to prevent spills.The 3 inch walls help with grease splatter and also allow this skillet to hold 4.3 Quarts! This is a perfect size for any food recipe or even cooking application like boiling, frying or sauteeing large amounts of veggies!The lid has a vent hole and is made of tempered explosion-proof glass, which has good thermal stability. The pour spout also has a small vented area. The handle of the lid has a pretty asthetic and also made of the same material as the handle, cool to touch. It is large enough to fit perfectly in the palm of the hand. The lid fits tight (but still turns) on the skillet.It is recommended to use silicone, nylon or wooden utensils so the life of the pan is extended. I also do not recommend to cook at high temperatures for the same reason. The recommended high temp is 302F. The surface is PFOA-Free.The outside walls of the pan are an interesting pattern placed on top of the granite surface. It almost seems like an aligator type print. It is not really a strong pattern.I love the pan, I may buy another just in case!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'brent', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It’s a wonderful pan and cooking with it is great. Cleaning the pan itself is easy also and I’m glad I got it. My mother wants one too so I’m going to send her one as well. Thank you again', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Best I've ever owned", 'author': 'Evelyn Z Richard', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Best pan I've ever owned. Cooking in this pan is amazing. I cook everything in it. Eggs were a breeze. Nonstick, drain, top and handle design is perfect. Love, love, love it !", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent', 'author': 'shane s', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Top quality. I like a nice plump-with-fillings sort of omelet and this pan was a pinch too small for that. There wasn’t enough bottom of the pan width for the eggs to spread out enough to provide coverage for the amount of veggies I like. So that’s the 1 star deduction. “Make a less stuffed omelet!” cries the peanut gallery. Surely a possibility, but I’m not a fan of omelets where the innards seem like an afterthought rather than part of a balanced, harmonious breakfast meal. Plenty slick, nonstick-wise. I do use a bit of oil and butter to assist with flavor and slipperiness. I’ve had enough of the soaking and scraping with my stainless pans, and don’t want to be disappointed with this pan so I’ll work up to an oil-less attempt at scrambled eggs later. Not sure what technology some of the nonstick offerings on the market are to justify their $50 to $150 price tags. This one seems much more fairly priced. The handle is advertised as Bakelite, but it has a really nice satiny feel to it and is very comfortable in the hand, making flipping veggies easy when sautéing. Hopefully the seller/manufacturer will offer additional sizes for those folks who want a bit more real estate to work with when crafting omelets. It is deep enough to do some stovetop frying, and would handle smaller portions of French fries. Could probably fit a couple servings of tots, chicken tenders or fish sticks too. No lid included, so you’ll probably want a spatter screen. title: T-fal Ultimate Hard Anodized Nonstick Fry Pan 12 Inch Oven Safe 400F Cookware, Pots and Pans, Dishwasher Safe Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The best non-stick pan – if you treat it like a non-stick pan!', 'author': 'Scotty B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I think T-fal makes the best non-stick surfaces. They will maintain their non-stick properties for a long time – IF you use them how they were meant to be used. If you use them to sautée delicate foods like veggies, fish and eggs under medium heat, the performance can\'t be beat. There\'s really no need to ever put them in a dishwasher, either, because they clean up so quickly.However, these T-fal pans really don\'t hold up under heavy, every-day, all-purpose use. That\'s not what they were made for. The coating is top notch, but the overall construction is not heavy duty. Get yourself a good, heavy aluminum, stainless steel, or cast iron skillet if you want a scorching hot sear, or want to make pan sauces, or skillet fry something.It might be worth doing a comparison between this pan (the Ultimate Hard Anodized) and the popular Professional Total Nonstick T-fal E93808 Professional Total Nonstick Thermo-Spot Heat Indicator Fry Pan, 12.5 Inch, Black , since I\'ve owned both, now, and some might be considering one or the other.I originally bought the Professional based on the Cooks Illustrated recommendation (as many others have), and it\'s a great pan. So great that my wife simply couldn\'t resist using it as an every-day pan, so it\'s lifespan was shortened. One feature of the Pro pan is that it\'s stainless steel clad on the bottom, so it will work with induction stove tops. It\'s not a thick cladding, though. While the company touts this as "anti-warp protection," I found that this construction actually makes it MORE prone to warping. First, unlike more expensive 2-ply or multi-ply pans, this one just features a fairly thin stainless steel "disk" mated to a fairly thin aluminum body. The different metals expand and contract at different rates under the same conditions. Since the aluminum is not sandwiched between stainless steel, the pan is more likely to warp. And that\'s what happened – just enough that it did not sit flat on our ceramic cooktop anymore. It\'s probably not as much of a problem with a gas burner or a coiled electric top, though, as it conducts heat fairly evenly and easily.So when it came time to replace this pan after the non-stick surface wore out, I decided to go with this hard anodized aluminum version. It was a good decision. since it is made with one, very heat-conductive metal, and is a little more heavy duty (although just as light as the Pro version since it\'s all aluminum). It\'s still straight and flat, even though it\'s gotten overheated a couple of times (we have one runaway burner that we have to keep an eye on, sometimes!)Not that the construction is slightly different. Both skillets have the same non-stick surface and the same oven-safe handle, but the shape is a little different. This one is a 12" skillet and the Pro is 12.5". However, I found that this measurement is based on the lip of the skillet, and the Pro version is more flared-out on the sides, where this skillet has more straight, up-and-down sides. In fact, despite a smaller diameter at the lip, I\'ve found the Anodized skillet has slightly more cooking surface than the Pro version. While the flared sides might be a little more omelette-friendly, I haven\'t had any problems sliding anything out of the pan. In fact, if you are stir-frying anything, I have found that the straighter sides are better for holding things inside the skillet.All in all, I would recommend this anodized aluminum pan over the Pro version – unless you have an induction cooktop. Then the Pro version is your only choice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars T-Fal is quality', 'author': 'Stacy Zellner', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this as a replacement for an hold pan I had for awhile. I never had T-Fal before but I am in love and would definitely buy another T-Fal pan. Nonstick surface and easy to clean up. Heats up fast and is well made. I would purchase again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars An Excellent Value', 'author': 'Charles of the North', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Everyone needs at least one large nonstick skillet. They are excellent for preparing the kinds of food that don't require extreme temperatures but that tend to stick badly to metal surfaces. Most of the brands that I have used over the years show signs of wear rather quickly, but T Fal skillets have always impressed me with their durability. After a couple of months of heavy use, I am finding this 12 inch T Fal to be the best nonstick skillet that I have used.Temperatures are evenly distributed across the surface, it is easy to handle because of its weight and design, and I find that it performs well across a wide range of temperatures. Best of all, it does what we all expect of nonstick cookware: it does not retain bits of the cooked food and comes clean with very light scrubbing pressure.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!!', 'author': 'Sherry Brink', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My daughter bought this pan and loves it. I actually bought her a set of this brand of pots and pans for Christmas. I wanted a large skillet so I ordered this one. I’ve used it just about every day since. I haven’t had anything stick and food has cooked perfectly. I’d definitely buy another one', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I receive the product a little bit scratched due to the cardboard cover', 'author': 'HansP', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The pan is strong but it delivered with marks of the cardboard cover. Another thing is that it’s very thick and the cooking it’s a little bit slow. It is heavy indeed and it’s difficult to manipulate.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just What I Needed!', 'author': 'Karen L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a new 12" skillet and found this one. It works great. I needed a non stick surface and found a reasonably priced T fal . I love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars First one lasted over 7 years', 'author': 'Placeholder', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this skillet as a replacement for the same exact thing that was used almost every day for around 7 years and is starting to show some wear. Excellent product!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars so far the best non-stick model from t-fal, Ultimate Hard Anodized', 'author': 'Hilda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'great non-stick, easy to clean, seems durable, will update', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Does Not Have A Flat Bottom, Right Out Of The Box', 'author': 'Born in Kansas', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I bought this pan, based on the extremely large number of 5 Star Reviews, as being the lesser of two evils, when compared to so many other non stick brands. This particular model had the lowest percentage of 1 Star reviews out of dozens of brands and models that I researched on Amazon. I noted that many of the bad reviews mentioned the fact that the pan was not flat in the middle (being convex, or higher in the center). I also noted that the manufacturer made comments within those reviews that the pan can warp upwards, in the center, if it is subjected to "too high" heat, without anything in it, and/or running cold water into an already very hot pan, which can cause it to warp. With that warning heeded in the 1 Star reviews, when I received the pan from Amazon, the first thing I did when I took it out of the box, was to pour some cold oil into the new unused, cold pan, never heated yet on the stove. Needless to say, I was very disappointed in what I saw (picture attached). If TFal can\'t manufacture a flat bottom pan, off the assembly line then they ought not to sell their pans, while claiming that they are flat in the center.TFal has multiple iterations of their non stick pans, and I purposely bought this one, after inspecting various models in retail stores and noting that this model had the thickest metal, compared to other TFal models. Thus I assumed that the thicker metal would insure a flatter bottom. But, sadly TFal is producing this model with a built in hump in the middle that forces product to the edges. Or they produce some that come out flat and some that do not.....roll the dice and hope you get a flat one.I am a former "upscale restaurant" owner with 20 years of extensive cooking under my belt, as well as being an extremely accomplished cook at home, and most of my kitchen cooking gear is very expensive restaurant grade stainless steel clad, with aluminum cores and very thick bottoms. My "home use" professional restaurant skillets cost $200- $300 for a 12" or larger, and that is what I always cook on, at home, due to their performance and being able to develop "fond" for deglazing, extremely even cooking, heat retention, etc. Thirty years ago, as a young adult, I fell for the "Teflon" rage and had a full set of Teflon cookware and after just a couple years of use, the coating simply wore off, in spite of always using plastic spatulas and wooden or plastic spoons. After that, I swore never to buy non stick again. But technology changed dramatically with all of the new surface materials, although I still resisted trusting any of it.But I recently decided that I needed a durable non stick skillet for some very specific dishes and had hopes that this one would perform as expected and more in line with the huge number of 5 Star reviews. I figured what the heck. It wasn\'t as if I were spending over a hundred bucks for a pan, so the risk/reward factor compelled me to give it a try, after some research. With this higher grade TFal model, If it were not for the convex center which causes ghee, oils, and liquid contents to migrate to the outside perimeter (causing uneven cooking results), I would give the pan high marks for its non stick properties and easy clean up. And the heat spread within the pan seems to be pretty even and consistent, as long as you have it centered over the heat source (I use a gas range), and you maintain the heat source at a level that does not shoot out beyond the edges of the pan (especially with gas, which will toast anything near the sidewalls, while delivering less cooking heat near the center....common sense.Be cautioned though that the surface can be pretty easily scratched with anything that is not plastic. I had used some metal restaurant tongs to gently grab the raised edge of some bacon strips to turn them, while trying not to even touch the non stick surface. When I went to wipe out the pan with a soft sponge after it had cooled down, I noticed an inch long barely noticeable scuff on the surface. It was not enough to in any way alter the integrity of the not stick surface and will probably not result in any negative impact down the road, but I did notice that a very slight scuff occurred. Going forward, nothing will ever touch the surface of this pan, except for rubber coated whisks, rubber coated tongs, etc.Although I am hopeful, that Tfal might be able to replace this defective pan with one that comes from the factory absolutely flat in the center. But that might be an unrealistic expectation because, in order to accomplish that and prior to shipping, TFal would have to do a water test inside of a replacement pan to see if the water migrates to the outer edges of the pan....and if it doesn\'t, send me a flat replacement, because I do like the pan for its performance, if it were absolutely flat, like my professional grade skillets.****************Revised Update********************One week after I received this pan, I called TFal\'s customer service. Of course they were cordial and listened to what I just described above, testing the pan, out of the box, without any heat applied, which proves that the pan came from the factory that way. They said I would have to pay for shipping to send the pan in for evaluation. The cost of shipping is close to the value of the pan itself and there is no reimbursement if TFal agrees that it is a manufacturing defect, of no flat bottom. They will replace the pan and send me a new one. There is no way that I am going to incur extra cost for this pan, and TFal could easily come back and claim that excessive heat probably warped the pan, or that cold water was poured into a very hot pan. I don\'t see how any kind of visual assessment from TFal is going to make a difference in determining whether my claim is correct or whether they want to assert misuse. So their warranty isn\'t worth a hoot, since you will incur unwarranted cost to return the pan, unlike Amazon\'s policy of issuing a prepaid shipping label to return defective products. So, I will return the pan at no cost, for a refund, from Amazon. You are rolling the dice on whether you will get a flat bottom, when you order this pan, so, just know that there is no recourse that makes sense, from TFal, regarding their warranty.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good quality', 'author': 'THERESA ACKROYD', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice pans', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Hestan - ProBond Collection - TITUM Nonstick Triple Bonded Stainless Steel Skillets with Lids, Induction Cooktop Compatible, Made without PFOAs (8.5 & 11-inch)

title: Hestan - NanoBond Collection - Titanium Stainless Steel 8.5-Inch Frying Pan - Toxin, PFAS, & Chemical Free Clean Cookware, Induction Cooktop Compatible
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome cookware for a bad cook!', 'author': 'JPDMyers', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Two months ago, I bought the 8.5” pan as a test before investing further in the Heston Nanobond line. I’d been wanted to ditch my non-stick cookware for several years for health reasons but couldn’t find the right fit. I’m spoiled by growing up cooking with only non-stick cookware. And I’m NOT a good cook so I tend to overheat pans & burn food. AND I sooo dislike cleaning up after cooking that I’d prefer to do it later (like the next day). I’m possibly the worst case scenario for testing any cookware line. I’d honestly much rather enjoy being served nice meals in restaurants. But, I’m immunocompromised so COVID changed all that. So, I’ve needed to up my game & learn to cook decently.I first tested several brands of stainless steel cookware. It was a total nightmare for me to clean. I then tried out ceramic cookware but found it to be too heavy for my arthritic joints. After reading about and researching Hestan’s Nanobond’s titanium coating, I thought it sounded promising & ordered this pan. Besides, the design of all of Hestan’s cookware is simply gorgeous.This Hestan Nanobond pan turned out to be AMAZING. My 1st test was fried eggs that turned out perfect with no sticking and easy cleanup afterwards. I’d read to heat the pan first, then add the oil/butter next & let it heat, and to then add the eggs. That definitely works to make the surface as close to being non-stick without actually having a non-stick coating. I’ve used it repeatedly for sticky foods like fried eggs, scrambled eggs, grilled cheese sandwiches, etc. with thrilling results. Best of all, it’s easy to clean afterwards.The Hestan Nanobond cookware is fantastic & suits my needs perfectly. I’ve now bought many more of the pots and pans in all shapes & sizes. I’m thrilled with the good looks & performance of the Nanobond line, the ease of cleaning up afterwards, and the titanium coating’s overall forgivingness for bad cooks. I accidentally added ground sausage needing to be browned for a casserole directly to their still-warming 3.5 quart sauté pan. The sausage stuck immediately to the bottom & I knew I’d really screwed up. While stirring the rest of the meat with only a silicon spatula, however, the stuck remnants surprisingly released completely from the bottom! I then decided to go ahead & try baking the entire casserole in the covered Nanobond pan in the oven instead of dirtying up a casserole dish. The casserole turned out fantastic with perfectly browned sides & bottom. The servings easily released from the pan without falling apart. And the very baked-on food remnants STILL cleaned up easily. The beautiful design of Hestan’s cookware really makes it equally appealing for stove/oven to table presentation. I’m now totally in love with the Hestan Nanobond line!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great brand', 'author': 'june', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have two nano bond pans from them and both are my two favorite and most used. They clean great. You don't need non-stick if you have these.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This is a high quality pan! Expensive but will last forever!', 'author': 'Charlie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I just got rid of my nonstick T-Fal professional pan and that was great but the coating was starting to come off...Lasted just about maybe a year or year + 1/2...So I was getting tired of buying a new pan constantly.While this is not a non-stick pan, it is solidly built, and the nanocoat looks fantastic, and the rivets are not sticking out inside the pan.You need to warm up the pan and I like to do the water test to make sure the pan is hot enough.Be prepared to use oil and/or butter otherwise you will have food stick.I had to practice with eggs and finally got it figured out to where I can cook a over easy egg w/o making a mess on our electric range.Cleanup is pretty easy, soap + water.I believe if you have food stuck, just soak it and then clean.For anything that blemishes the pan, I think you can buy barkeepers friend and rub it out (cheaper than buying Hestan's polishing compound).If the price was lower, I would jump on the larger pan for sure...This is perfect for cooking a couple of eggs...Just wish it was a little cheaper.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This pan is non stick as long as you follow directions', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This pan is a beautiful little gem. Feels nice in hand and completely non stick if you follow directions and heat it until water drops dance and scatter. Add oil and cook away!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not worthy.', 'author': 'Sebas', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I recently purchased an expensive pan, and I have to say, I'm thoroughly disappointed with its performance.
