It's incredibly frustrating to spend so much money on a pan that doesn't perform as advertised.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars sticks', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Well made frying pan. We purchased the pan to fry eggs. The first time we used it the eges did not stick.Subsequent egg frying they stuck to the bottom of the pan regardless of how much butter was used to prevent sticking. Not worth the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pan ever!', 'author': 'Naser Ali Abbas Altaib', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This is the Hestan NanoBond 8.5” that I purchased last Oct 2022. After over 8 months of daily usage, the pan is still shining, easy to clean, and nothing sticks if you just preheat your pan properly before adding your fat. The pan is still as GREAT as new, if not BETTER, it’s the best durable high-quality elegant pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars DERAILED REVIEW —— Not perfect but I like it', 'author': 'Bobbler', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought the 8 inch pan.. I am hesitant to buy the larger skillets if they are going to be super thin like the 8 inch is.BOTTOM LINE:I think I’m going to love this pan for scrambled eggs, and I don’t know what else.. I plan to try a reverse sear with salmon or a hamburger.. I usually slow cook vegetables in an enameled cast iron sauce pan, so I don’t have to worry about salt and other seasonings leaching the SS.. But I suppose I will try some vegetables in the nano bond titanium (as a little browning is supposed to add a layer of flavor.. but I suspect browning anything is less healthy).STICK, OR NOT TO STICK?Mystery solved.. I was perplexed by so many reviews complaining about things sticking to the titanium nanobond, because my scrambled eggs were sliding around, almost like a nonstick pan. I just watched a video comparison of three different stainless steel pans.. The Heston nanobond, and demeyere (both of which I have cooked scrambled eggs on).. In the video they got the pans hot until the water drops danced around, which I think of it as a trick that allows you to cook scrambled eggs in cast-iron.. Plus they used what looked like some kind of vegetable oil.. And the egg was stuck in the pan bad.. I use butter at a low temperature (which I believe is appropriate for eggs), and the eggs don’t stick at all..LEACHING INTO FOODI’ve always heard that titanium is extremely non-reactive, but I have been UNABLE to find any information (other than manufacturers claims) whether titanium cookware will leach anything into food while cooking (ie: acidic foods, like tomato paste, or how it’s well known that salt will pit stainless steel).. Titanium is supposed to be completely safe for humans, so we can only hope if anything leeches it would be pure titanium (manufacturers tend to be untrustworthy, I can only hope in Italy they have tighter regulations for such things than in America).. If you search the Internet you can find where testing was done with SS pans.. Some manufacturers claim you can cook tomato red sauce in them (even though tomatoes do leech from SS)..SUPER THIN?When I say super thin, perhaps I’m spoiled by using expensive aluminum clad cookware from other brands that have a hefty amount of aluminum.. Because of the high price of Heston nano bond cookware, they should pop for thick enough aluminum layer to where we should have to wonder if it’s enough.. And to be clear I don’t know how thick the aluminum layer needs to be to do. It’s job..The thin-ness of the pan makes me wonder if it would be prone to warping (with my other stainless steel pans, I clean them while they are hot, but I am fearful to put water into these thin nano bond skillets).. NOTE: I don’t put a lot of cold water into a hot pan, rather a little bit that steam cleans most of the pan (none of my pans have ever warped).HEAT MOMENTUM:The other problem with extra thin aluminum cladding is heat momentum.. Heat momentum is one of the reasons cast-iron pans work so well for certain things (such as putting a frozen hamburger patty, and getting heat momentum to create the seer.. instead of the frozen patty immediately cooling off the pan which destroys the seer). In my particular case, using the control freak induction burner that has a built-in temperature probe, it will probably compensate by instantly turning the power up (which I hear it doing when I take a little off, to try to maintain temperature).. I doubt the thin aluminum will work in this instance, if you’re trying to cook a frozen steak or anything substantial without cool in the pan off..NON-STICK:I have not used nonstick pans for decades, but I have been cooking scrambled eggs in aluminum clad stainless steel pans for years.. And for the past year. I’ve been using Demeyere SS skillets, which have a treated SS surface that concentrates the chromium and nickel and removes the iron (it makes the stainless steel, more stainless steel, and it does stick less than regular SS, but not by much)..[Again contrary to what many reviews are saying], when I cooked scrambled eggs in the Heston nanobond it felt like nonstick to me. There was an obvious non-stick quality even compared to my demeyere). Like my demeyere pans, I expect I will have to occasionally use the special cleaner, or barkeepers friend, to get rid of the haze/seasoning that develops (this is expected)..Likewise cleanup was very easy (like I would imagine non-stick would be).TOO—LIGHT—WEIGHT?I know other reviews think it’s thick/heavy, but it is by far the lightest pan I have ever held in my hands (and I’ve used a few different brands of aluminum clad stainless steel pans).. I realize titanium is light weight, but the nano bond is a very thin layer of titanium (presumably over stainless steel)..The pan is so light weight that it’s causing the problem with my control, freak induction burner.. The 8” or will sit flat by itself, but because it’s so light weight, and the handle is relatively heavy, it will not sit flat on the induction burner for preheating, because there is a temperature probe in the center (that has a lightweight spring)..And (when cooking anything sensitive to uneven heat) you very much need to preheat pans on an induction burner, because the nature of induction heats the pan itself so there is always a hot ring in the center of the pan that matches the induction ring (preheating for a while lets the heat spread out)..BOTTOM LINE: I was able to preheat the pan to cook my scrambled eggs, but one end of the pan was about 1/8” off the induction burner (and induction burners are sensitive to this.I WOULD HATE: to try to preheat the 8” pan for a seer on this induction burner (the 1/8” in the air might end up a huge problem at high power settings)..COOKING TECHNIQUES:There is technique to consider in whether eggs or anything sticks or not..For scrambled eggs I use low heat (228F.. since my induction burner controls the temperature).. and I use plenty of butter (I am convinced, low carb is healthy, and butter and egg yolks are healthy fats).. my eggs were sliding around the pan like the nonstick advertisements..CLEANUP:My experience with cleanup was like you would imagine nonstick. But I’ve seen many reviews complain about food sticking to the pan (I can only assume they were using high heat, and maybe little or no oil).. I can’t say for sure, but I know with my other stainless steel pans anytime something sticks, I just put a squeeze of dish soap and a little water and come back in an hour (or the next morning).. If I’m in a hurry, I’ll turn on the burner for a few seconds so warm soap will work faster.. Then whatever was stuck on usually falls off.. Sometimes I use vinegar (I don’t know whether dish soap vinegar would be more effective)..', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very high quality in ALMOST every area.', 'author': 'Teddy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Pros: the finish looks beautiful as it’s slightly a smoky grey color which is very smooth and though not nonstick is less sticky than other stainless steel pans I’ve used. Good weight, feels sturdy and i love the flush rivets. Heats up quick and the high heat resistance is great so it works I’m pretty much any cooking environment other than a microwave.Cons. Mostly small nitpicks but for an expensive pan small can be big depending on your taste. Pricey. On my induction top at least the pan bottom warps very slightly so as thin coat of oil tends to pool towards the outer edges of the pan, this pretty common in a lot of pans but i do wish at this price it could be avoided. The handle feels high quality but could be slightly more comfortable if the part that rests against your palm was just a bit wider.Overall: If you can deal with those nitpicks this will make a great pan for small tasks like a grilled cheese or an omelet etc. and last a long time. happy cooking!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for searing', 'author': 'L. Bencze', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Yes, food will definitely stick to this pan; no doubt about it. But it's not that hard to clean out. Most importantly, the pan will not pick up any staining. My wife uses it for searing steaks. She puts it in a hot oven. It's perfect for this. So its searing abilities justify the purchase. Other pans, like Swiss Diamond, are much better for cooking eggs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: T-fal Specialty Nonstick Fry Pan 13.25 Inch Oven Safe 350F Cookware, Pots and Pans, Dishwasher Safe Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely great pan for the money.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pan really surprised me with its weight and quality. This is not a lightweight pan, it has some heft to it, so if you are looking for a lightweight pan, this isn't it. The stainless steel is of good quality and the pan is durable and should last for a few good years of use. The only downside to this pan is that it has a shorter handle than I'd like, but that can also be a plus as it makes it easier to fit in the dishwasher.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonder Product, Great Price!', 'author': 'Deborah Mullan/A Creative Living Professional', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This beautiful pan heats evenly and can be use on any burner, plus it withstands high temperatures, so it can go in the oven… a must for me! It is nonstick and cleans up easily and when you’re done, it looks like new! I believe you will love this pan so much, you’ll look forward to using it…', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful pan', 'author': 'MrsT', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have an induction stove and this pan is from a brand I’ve used before. Non-stick cookware eventually gets scruffy and this pan is a slightly larger replacement for a pan in my original induction set. Works great for anything you want to cook - a little big for a single omelette. It doesn’t come with a lid but I’m able to use a stock pot lid with it. Very nice pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Get one quick', 'author': 'Peter R.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Best frying pan ever. Purchased the first one a year ago and it still looks brand new. Heavy design assures that the base does not warp even when used in the oven at 500F. Looked all over for a new one for our summer home and finally found on Amazon. Bought two to be safe', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Long-term durability review', 'author': 'JM', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Unfortunately most reviews are done within the first month of purchase, which doesn\'t help for my most important question for a non-stick pan: how long does it stay non-stick?We have had this pan for 2 years and 11 months. During that time it has gotten regular use--about 3-4 times a week. And we do use a high heat (which I have read can shorten the non-stick life of a pan) for burgers and bacon. For the first 2 1/2 years, the non-stick surface worked great. At about 2 1/2 years, things started sticking (particularly noticeable for scrambled eggs). There was no sign of scratching/flaking/peeling of the non-stick surface, but the things just weren\'t sliding around so easily. We\'ve toughed it out since then--it\'s still useable, but the non-stick property has steadily declined. We will probably get a replacement soon--the annoyance factor has about caught up with the combined "don\'t want to be bothered" and "don\'t want to pay for another pan" factors.It\'s tough to figure out how long to expect a non-stick pan to last. The manufacturers will say things like "Years of durability" but from what I\'ve read reject warranty claims because the say they were improperly cared for. I\'ve seen many complaints about ceramic coatings--the latest in non-stick approaches--losing their non-stick properties within months of use. In my experience, I\'m pretty surprised if a pan is still useful after 3 years of regular use and this pan came reasonably close to that mark.Other criteria:Size: this was a big selling point for me. There are very few pans big enough to make 4 burgers, let alone 4 pieces of french toast. This pan will easily accommodate 4 large burgers, and will even take 4 pieces of french toast, if you don\'t mind the corners turning up a bit if using larger (bigger than wonder bread) pieces of bread.Even heat: The outer edges of the pan do not seem to get quite as hot as the inner part of the pan. This is noticeable if you are browning meat. You may want to turn things if you want them to be cooked perfectly evenly.Non-stick (while it lasted): Before it started to degrade, the non-stick surface worked great. No oil needed for eggs, bacon, burgers, pancakes, or anything else. (I may have used a little butter for grilled cheese, but that wasn\'t about sticking to the pan.)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It is what it is, and that's just fine. Works great on induction.", 'author': 'E Peterson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Honestly, this pan is just what is advertised - a heavy induction/conduction plate fused to a (fairly thin) stamped stainless steel pan, with a T-fal anti-stick coating. We have an induction range, and have an All-clad d3 stainless set of cookware that handles most of our browning, sautéing, braising, etc. needs, but when I need that truly nonstick pan for low-fat eggs, drippy grilled cheeses, or just want a quick cleanup after the cook this is my go-to now. This is a heavy pan, heavier than the 12" All-clad d3 pan, so you\'re probably not going to be doing fancy flipping with it. Nonstick pans have a short lifespan, but T-fal has been in the nonstick business for a long time and have figured out how to extended the life of a pretty fragile coating.tldr; A good value. A heavy induction/conduction plate fused to a stamped stainless steel pan, from an iconic nonstick brand. A reliable everyday pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars hump in the pan', 'author': 'S', 'rating': 3, 'content': "It's not good for many things because it doesn't heat evenly due to the pan being humped up in the middle.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Such a nice big size', 'author': 'Marilyn J Wadding', 'rating': 5, 'content': '------', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars N/a', 'author': 'Carol Barlow', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'N/A', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nonstick', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’ve been looking for a pan that doesn’t stick and is easy to clean. This is it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

My other pan was not doing any of this and it was from a very expensive, well known chef. It was pretty old, probably 10 years, but it had warped, the surface was scratched and there was no getting away with continuing to use it. I got a set of 2 large skillet type pans (one of which was this one) for my stepson. He is a fabulous cook and he LOVES them. I checked his out and decided to get one for my kitchen. The lid was a little too tight right at first but after the first use, it fit perfectly. My husband accidentally used a metal spatula on it and I freaked! title: Tri-Ply Fully Bonded Stainless Steel 12Inch Frying Pan With Lid,Chef's pan,kitchen Skillets,Induction Pan Dishwasher and Oven Safe, Compatible with All Cooktops(Detachable Handle)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Truly enamored with how well this is made, heavy sturdy ALL stainless steel.', 'author': 'Ai', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been upgrading my cookware and everything to stainless steel and glass for the past couple of years (couple pieces at a time). And I have to say, this pan is heavy heavy duty, it's amazing. Stainless steel is the best to get a great sear on my chicken, pork or beef. This pan does a great job at it, and the weight of it makes it so it sits still on my stove, what my other nonstick coated terrible pans can't do. They're usually lightweight and move around, this one stays still. Heats evenly so I could sear a pan FULL of chicken with no worries about having to do small batches. Eggs with some oil great a great crispy edge too, my favorite. The lid sits nice and tight for when I was to stew anything, it also has a good depth for that. Easy clean up, almost effortless and no worries of any coating getting into my food it i scrub a little too hard. Amazing quality for the price point, honestly. Best thing I couldn't upgraded to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality Pan', 'author': 'NYC_Chic', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pan is a lifesaver. Its great for frying eggs or whipping up a quick stir fry. The high sides are a real plus that enhance the capacity of the pan. I am moving away from using any aluminum products so I was a little bit concerned when it said this pan has an aluminum core but it is so solid and encased in stainless steel that I have no worries. This pan heats well and cooks evenly. It has really become one of my favorites and I use it daily but it looks almost brand new. The pan washes easily. Its great for use on the stove and can go in the oven if you remove the handle which I've done a few times. This is a very good quality piece of cookware and I expect that I will have it for a long time to come.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality cookware at a decent value', 'author': 'Jack', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We’ve had tremendous luck with recent kitchen gadgets and hardware lately, and this pan is no exception. It’s a testament that there are truly great quality products to be found and I have zero complaints about this. It’s made of durable, highly crafted, and shiny stainless steel. The one caveat (which is not a major groan) is the handle will get hot along with the pan itself. As long as you have a potholder or kitchen towel nearby, this is a non-issue. It’s not coated with a non-stick material, so be mindful of that when choosing a pan. However, so long as you use the right kind of cooking spray, it’s still easy to clean. In addition to the pan, the lid is as well a breeze to keep clean. With an ample 12” diameter, you really can’t go wrong here. It’s worth the value you will invest for a decent piece of cookware.5 Stars for sure!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality stainless steel pan', 'author': 'D. Patterson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like this stainless steel skillet and lid. The skillet is roomy, with a lot of surface area for cooking. The lid fits well and can provide ventilation if needed. The handle assembles with the screws on the outside, which helps with cleaning. I am used to cooking with stainless steel, but I tried to follow the enclosed directions for use. I tried to fry eggs the first time I used it, and they stuck like crazy. It was quite easy to clean up though. I didn’t really expect it would do very well with that. I cooked pork chops next, and it worked extremely well. The meat released easily once seared well. As with all stainless steel pots or pans, a good stainless cleaner is a must. (I knew a woman who threw her stainless steel pots away out of frustration because she couldn’t get them clean with regular dishwashing. Unfortunately, she didn’t realize that stainless steel cleaner was a thing.) I expect this skillet and the glass lid to last me many years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Everyday Elegance: Unveiling the Secrets of My New Stainless Steel Fry Pan', 'author': 'Yawnimouse', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've recently had the pleasure of incorporating a stainless steel frying pan into my kitchen collection, marking my first venture away from non-stick surfaces. Upon first handling the pan, its quality was immediately apparent. The craftsmanship is commendable, with none of the machining feeling rough or unfinished. This attention to detail not only adds to the pan's aesthetic appeal but also contributes positively to its performance during use.Cooking with this pan has been a delightful experience. The tri-ply construction promises and delivers on even heating, a feature I quickly came to appreciate. Unlike my previous non-stick pans, the feel of cooking on stainless steel feels decidedly upscale and professional, enhancing the overall cooking experience. Furthermore, its compatibility with all cooktops, alongside the convenience of being dishwasher and oven safe, has made this pan a versatile and valued tool in my kitchen.However, it's important to note that transitioning to stainless steel cooking has had its learning curve, especially regarding temperature management and food release properties. Despite these adjustments, the pan's performance has lived up to expectations. I look forward to updating this review if any issues arise or if I encounter any noteworthy aspects of this pan's long-term performance.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Stains Easily', 'author': 'Scio Dad', 'rating': 3, 'content': "First the good. I really like the size and the dimensions of this pan. It's almost like a short wok because of the rounded sides. And the lid fits nicely and I like the vent hole. The handle on the pan remains cool to the touch and looks as though it is solidly attached. I noticed another reviewer who complained about how heavy the pan is. The pan weighs just under 3 lbs. If you want decent heat distribution, which this pan has, you need a good amount of mass. Not having rivets on the inside of the pan is also a big plus. The downside, however, is pretty major. It stains very easily. I tested it by frying some ground lamb on medium heat. The picture attached shows the pan after I scrubbed it with a course metal pan scrubber. The stains would not come off. By contrast, another pan that I've had for over 20 years and use quite often scrubs much cleaner. I also noticed that the color of the stainless is not as bright as my old one. It has a darker hue to it. It makes me somewhat skeptical about the isolation between the aluminum core and the stainless cooking surface. I really wanted to like this pan but I cannot trust the quality and safety.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Large, heavy, holds heat', 'author': 'ChuckD', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Needed a new pan as we only have cast iron and non-sticks. This aluminum pan has been a work horse since we got it out of the package. I've used this on a glass top and a coil top and haven't had any issues with discoloration. The bottom is much thicker than you'll find at the big box generic store so it holds heat decently. De-glazing in this pan has been great. Would recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My New Favorite Stir Fry Pan', 'author': 'Willa Reads', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've always wanted to try a stainless steel frying pan and I'm glad I chose this one. I've been looking for a frying pan to stir fry chicken and vegetables and this works great. I was using a teflon coated pan that didn't brown the chicken at all. This pan does a great job with stir frying. It does leaves some stains; however, I have a stainless steel cleaner that takes the stains right out. I do wish that it was a bit deeper so I could fit more into the pan but this does a great job for a smaller meal. I love this frying pan!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good pan but slightly on the heavy side', 'author': 'S', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The pan looks good and cooks well. Its easy to clean. The pan heats up equally and gradually. The only caveat is that it's slightly heavy so a bit difficult to maneuver when it's filled with food. The handle was cool to touch post cooking food at high temperature for 30 minutes on gas stove.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Big fan of this pan', 'author': 'Allen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love the dimensions on this pan. It's very large, has high side, and they kind of taper in, making it easy to cook large amounts of food and still be able to easily mix, stir, flip, or whatever you need without worry of making a mess. It's a heavy pan for sure. So far no stick issues, hopefully that holds up. This has become my main pan.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gr8 little pan', 'author': 'Paul M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect for morning eggs. Easy clean up and works with my induction stove top. This product doesn’t live up to the brand’s image. .Despite taking meticulous care of this pan, it began sticking within 4-5 months, by month 6, it was unusable. Meat and eggs stick to the pan even with added oil.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Read my review to understand why', 'author': 'JohnDavis', 'rating': 5, 'content': "these pans bubble up under high heat and non stick coating comes off..Use wooden or plastic utensils on these pans and they will last years.NEVER heat this pan on high heat for too long! It will deform, it's aluminum not steel. Aluminum is softer and changes shape at lower temperature.On a induction stove, I never go past 8/10, I cook my eggs on level 8 or 7. At lower temps, these aluminum pans don't deform or bubble up. Once you overheat this pan, it will stay warped for good. If you have a gas stove, use stainless steel pans, not aluminum. Flames deform these very fast.Non stick coating, will NOT come off when properly cared for. Overheating and sharp utensils will scrape it off!!! Just like paint on your walls, scrap your wall with a steel form and see what happens.Don't stack heavy pots on top of these pans or any pan with non stick coating on them, they will get scratched! Cut out piece of cardboard and place inside the pan to stack pots or pans inside it.Proper care and use will make this pan do it's job for years.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Light weight. Doesn’t stick like the earlier one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars The pan is VERY uneven...', 'author': 'Gary', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I have the 10 and 12-inch of this series pan. title: 12-Inch Hybrid Tri-Ply Stainless Steel Sauté Pan,Non-stick Frying Pan with Lid,Skillet,Induction Chef's Pan,Heavy Duty and Oven Safe.（Detachable Handle）
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan', 'author': 'TIA LEDFORD', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pan is deep and non stick. It's been a great pan. Having a lid is great too.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!', 'author': 'Ajax', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been using this pan for a few weeks now and am very impressed with it. It has a no stick design that I have never experienced before and it was eager to see it in action. I'll be darned if it actually works! Even more so, I'm able to use metal utensils without worrying about scratching anything up! I'm very excited to get larger sized to use it more.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars An Ok Hybrid Pan', 'author': 'BiDudeWhoReviews', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Comparing this to Hex-CladFirst, the instructions are a bit lengthy and tend to be over translated. More info than you need.Washing before use, I just did what was recommended for my Hex-Clad. (Scotch Bright NON SCRATCH sponge with warm soap and water) I did this a few times and it was fine. No black residue like other's have mentioned. I then did a simple seasoning. (A little oil and heated the pan on high). Wiped the oil out with a paper towel and the pan was ready to go.This heats up/cools just like my hex-clad and I was able to try it on gas and induction.The one thing to remember with all pans is making sure they get to the right temperature before adding food. Skipping this can cause certain foods to stick.We've cooked a few dozen items in this since owning it, but it's really my go to for a small breakfast of Potatoes, eggs and chorizo.I would say if you're in the market for hybrid pans, do your research first. Make sure you're comfortable with functionality and requirements before moving forward.If you simply want a non stick pan to quickly cook things without taking care of them, these type of pans are probably not for you.A keeper for me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pan lover', 'author': 'Kristen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really like this pan! Washes well (I’ve only hand washed) and the “diamond” bottom is lovely. I just wish it was bigger! A+', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Heats Quick and Well Designed.', 'author': 'Jeremy W.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a well-made cooking pan that I\'ve put to use on a few steaks, eggs, and cheese sandwich or two. I\'m not much on cooking but compared to the default induction pans I have in the kitchen; this beats them by a mile as far as construction and heating up quickly and evenly goes.Pros:-Well-made material. It certainly looks and feels better than others I\'ve seen and the handle isn\'t some flimsy thing that\'s going to break off easily.-Heats up quickly and evenly. Very few if any cool spots on the pan while using an induction stovetop. The cheaper pots and pans I have always had some spot that wouldn\'t heat up right and it was noticeable.-Can be used on any kind of cooking surface Gas, electric, induction, etc. it has you covered.Cons: (or things to take note of)-It will tell you in the manual about needing to apply some oil or something to keep things from sticking. So, maybe not entirely "non-stick" if you just throw something in there from the start, but I\'ve had no problem with anything sticking and cleaning it off after use is hardly more than rinsing it off.-They state that a wooden cooking utensil is best to avoid scratching/damaging the surface. It\'s durable but you can still scratch it (and any pan) if you are using metal utensils.-You\'ll likely want to read the pamphlet regarding the manufacturing oils that could be on it. I followed one suggestion and boiled some vinegar and water in the pan and then wiped it down. It hasn\'t had any weird flavors or odors, but you might want to do the same regardless.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not very non-stick', 'author': 'Alex Smith', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The pan is nice and heavy duty, it feels quite sturdy. My favorite thing is that the lid fits nicely, so many pans don't have that much it seems. What I didn't realize was that the design you see in the pan is textured, and I assume that is a part of why it isn't specifically very non-stick. It cooked the food I've had in it nicely, but depending on what it is, I don't feel like I can use this pan for items that are more delicate (eggs for instance).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This pan has become our go to', 'author': 'Honest reviews only', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's not perfect. Things do get stuck a little bit. But it's worth it because it doesn't have the toxic coating on it. We've used metal utensils on and have been using this for a few months and it doesn't have a scratch. We fry eggs and cook small portions of food in it. Works really good. Easy to wash.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A solid high quality product', 'author': 'Philip Wright', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So for this pan lives up to its description.Overall diameter is just short of 9 inches.The bottom is flat and it is induction ready.It has an aluminum handle which is securely riveted to the pan and it did not get hot in my tests, using an induction cook top. The glass top is also of high quality, with the handle secured by two screws and it has a small vent hole to allow steam to escape.I tested it with eggs and sausage patties, (several times) first heating it up, as with most non-stick pans, & it performed very well. Just wiped it clean with a paper towel.It has a bit of weight but is easily handled because the handle is very user friendly.I was a bit sketchy about the textured surface & I'm not sure why it is textured but it seems to be OK.At this time I cannot say how long the non-stick surface will last & only time will tell.It does spread the heat very well and that is good to prevent hot spots.It is a little pricey so I was finicky in this review, demanding near perfection & so far it has passed every test I've done. Only longevity cannot be determined so I will update if necessary.As always, this is an honest & unbiased review based on my personal experience.Highly recommended.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Simple non-stick 'Hex-Clad-like' pan", 'author': 'Phil', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've had this product for approximately one week and with anything new, it all works great. Questions related to durability can only be answered in time. This 8-inch non-stick, stainless steel pan heats quickly and evenly distributes heat. I've stir-fried vegetables and pan-fried eggs with no sticking or burning. Eggs slide gently around the pan while cooking with a gentle olive oil coating. There's no need to 'season' this pan at all.For a small pan, it is weighty and dense. The pan well is deep and coated with a non-stick material. My daughter asked if it was a hex-clad pan. The steel handle is riveted to the pan's well making it safe for the oven. The accompanying see-through vented lid with a steel handle seals securely over the pan during cooking. It's a nice little pan. I wish I had a larger version. This is a $40 pan at 8 inches. The value lies with the beholder.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars love this skillet', 'author': 'Shaw', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Love the skillet. good quality', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

(God forbid microwaving!)The non-stick is pretty good thus far, but I never use it without a small bit of ghee.I like the spout on the side, that’s somewhat unusual in this type of pan, but the little silicone temperature gage is a bit silly because I can’t see the use for it myself. Of course that doesn’t really matter one way or another, just mentioning it because they advertise it as a “feature”, lolIt’s a nice little pan, light and comfortable to use, but I haven’t had it for very long so I don’t know when the replacement day will come.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cooking is much faster', 'author': 'Eldanion', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Heat is really distributed well and quickly with this pan. I had another brand of pan like this before but I ruined that one because I didn't realize how much hotter these pans can get. I kept burning everything and the non stick surface no longer worked. I eventually realized it was user error and not the product so I bought this one to give it another try. I learned I have to turn the heat down at least a full setting, so if I want medium heat I turn it to low. If I want low heat I turn it to warm. Now that I know the trick it works perfectly and I love it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 11, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Lasted me about 2 years', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I really liked this pan. The little heat indicator only worked for a few months, but i couldn't care less about that gimmicky feature. I only paid $17.00, so I guess that's pretty good value. Now i have to decide if I'll just order another one or find something else.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excelente opción', 'author': 'John Alejandro Rojas Alfonso', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excelente relación costo beneficio, se cuecen muy bien los alimentos', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Cuisinart 9522-20NS Forever Stainless Collection Nonstick Skillet, 8 Inch, Stainless Steel
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Durable and dependable', 'author': 'Jia', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently got this pan and it's been amazing in my kitchen. It's pretty heavy, which at first I thought might be a downside, but it actually feels super durable and like it's going to last a long time. I cannot yet comment on it's durability as I have only had it a short-time but it cooks evenly and cleans super easy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Uneven heating and poor nonstick performance', 'author': 'Roger D. Martin', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I have yet to find a nonstick frying pan that can last for more than a year of daily use. Now, less than 6 weeks after purchasing this pan, I am seeing signs that it won\'t last even a year. Although the surface still looks new, foods have been sticking more and more in the last few weeks. I\'m crossing my fingers it doesn\'t get any worse, but I\'ve been using nonstick pans for 25 years and they all seem to start degrading after a few months.This pan is very lightweight, which my 12 year old son likes, but that translates into uneven heating performance. This 10" pan doesn\'t work on the 11" burner of my induction stove (it doesn\'t detect it and shuts itself off), so I have to use the smaller 8" burner. Unfortunately, the center of the pan gets much hotter than the edges, so my omelettes end up overcooked in the middle and runny on the edges.The best parts of this pan are the low price and the glass cover. But a couple weeks ago I purchased the much more expensive Cuisinart frying pan so that I can make a decent omelette. I\'m not sure what the warranty is with the Michelangelo (web page doesn\'t say anything) but at least with Cuisinart you get a lifetime warranty and they will replace your pan once the nonstick surface starts deteriorating (I\'ve done this a couple times in the last 5 years).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality', 'author': 'patricia wuestenhagen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This pan seems to be of good quality and sturdy construction. title: Wok Pan Nonstick 12.5 Inch Skillet, Frying Pan with Lid & Spatula Wok Pans for Cooking Electric, Induction & Gas Stoves, Oven Safe
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful design. Deep sided. Perfect transition from carbon-steel wok.', 'author': 'wordmobile-Raleigh', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Took a long time to decide which wok would replace my no-longer existing wok.RECOMMEND: Yes, but consider a small diameter size if not cooking for a brood!PLUSES:....> Flat bottom is substantial and seems reinforced. (I have a radiant electric stove)....> clear glass lid with a steam escape. Can see what\'s happening....> Very easy to clean....> Food was cooked and kept their heat both on side of wok and on the plate. plenty of room to move cooked items to the side while other items added.....> Used med-high heat mostly. I didn\'t try a higher heat. It cooked ingredients not as quickly as a carbon-steel wok, but not going to be an issue.....> nice wooden handle. easy to grip....> Like the non-stick surface. Seems sturdier than Teflon-type coatings. Time will tell, but I\'m optimistic.CONS:....> I could have used a smaller size. This 14" model is huge. You can cook for 6. There\'s only two of us. This size is a bit hard to store in standard cabinets. We\'re going to hang it on a sidewall. But this size takes a lot of real estate.....> While the lid is beautiful, it\'s gonna be hard to store. This pan is a total winner!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I needed', 'author': 'Chaz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Clean it thoroughly before using with common dish soap. There is a residual coating that is part of the manufacturing that needs to be removed. Afterwards it is really great for stir frying. It doesn’t stick and it is deep enough to keep the food in the pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Wok of Art', 'author': 'Synthia', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First, this is beautiful, like a work of art. The wood handles add that touch of class and prompted me to buy this over another model.The body is huge and definitely nonstick, which makes cooking easy.It's not too heavy, so I can handle it with one hand if necessary and wash it easily.With my prior wok, I had to lay the lid directly down on the counter to stir or serve. Being able to stand the lid on the side, is more sanitary and won't smear liquid or sauce on the counter.The accompanying spatula/ ladle/spoon is a good size to cook and serve with.It would have been nice to have some instructions on assembly. I had never put together an item like this and did not know what to do with the various little washers. I guessed about how to assembly the parts of the lid and left one little plastic piece out. Who knows what that was for. Shrug. Then, the handle took me a couple of days to figure out. There's this screw cap that helps the handle screw on. I put it on the main screw but that didn't work and the handle didn't fully go in. Then I had a hard time getting the cap off so I could try it another way. Finally, the next day I got it off and screwed it directly into the wok itself and then put the main screw through the handle. That worked. Why didn't you just tell me, manufacturer? But I don't appreciate the lack of instructions, which caused frustration.Lastly, I understand you can use this in the oven but I am hesitant to because I dont' want to ruin this beautiful lid.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 10, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars LOTS OF ROOM IN THERE!!', 'author': 'Scott Opinion', 'rating': 4, 'content': '(8/10/2023)So after using it extensively I can say it was indeed a great purchase. (2021)Right out of the box I. gave this Wok/pan high marks mainly because of the looks, the size and it’s construction. It’s way bigger than the picture would have you believe. A word of caution though ; with the lid on its heavy and might require two hands when you factor in full of food later. Also have a potholder handy because the lip opposite the handle is scorching hot. I can’t stress enough that you will need both hands transporting it because it’s heavy.I rarely rate an item so soon so I hope I won’t have to change after using it a few times. The first meal went off without a hitch. It cleans up easily too. It is also large enough to make a meal for my family of 4 without foods spilling over the edge while I am trying to stir it up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easiest pan for cooking everything', 'author': 'Harper B. I like the design of the lid and the overall design is great, but it heats very slowly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Customer service to the rescue.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After reviewing a number of different woks I decided to try this one out. I liked the handle on the lid and the long and short handles on the body. After unpacking we found that the handle to the lid was missing the machine screw, this was unfortunate because the overall look was fantastic. My wife was very pleased with how light weight it is and easy to maneuver. I wrote to the company to see if they could send a replacement. They responded right away but asked if I would take a set number of monies off. I liked the product and wanted to keep it but without the handle screw it was looking dim. I asked the company if they could do something better and they then offered a bit more. I accepted there offer and was able to find the correct machine screw at the hardware store. Once everything was together the wok is great and customer service was quick to respond.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: CSK 10" Red Frying Pan-Non-Stick Skillets with Whitford Granite Nonstick Coating, PTFE and APEO Free, Durable Bakelite Handle, Aluminum Alloy, Superior Omelet Pan Suitable for All Stove.
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars FIRST USE IMPRESSIONS - STONE EARTH PAN. MADE IN GERMANY', 'author': 'Michael Y.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Well, I have yet to find a really durable non-stick pan, these pans all have sprayed on coatings and on every one ive ever seen the coating eventually fails - its just a question of when. The infomercials make wild claims that dont even match the pans own instructions of use, how they get away with this is baffling. They often iimpress at first use and get glowing reviews, then at some point its in the trash - to be fair this is often as much to do with improper use of metal utensils on a non stick surface as anything, but ive had pans I treated with kid gloves and still the coating failed. OK call me negative but its the truth 99.5% of the time and its something only time will tell. So, that aside I will say this pan makes a great first impression - the nice looking if not unusual coating and pan construction seem to indicate better than average quality and durability based on ther pans feel and weight as well as thickness. I especially like the very well made handle that will never burn me and looks very much like real wood but is really a man made high heat synthetic, and thats fine as long as it holds up, but the handle is one of the best ive seen far as comfort and safety go -- the down side is you can not put this pan in the oven with this type handle, and im not faulting the pan for this because the manufacturer tells you this in the instructions and I knew this going in so if you want such a pan buy one made to go in the oven. - Ive only used the pan three times so far and can not deny I am impressed, I lightly cleaned and wiped the pan dry, then fried eggs sunny side up and there was no sticking they slid out with almost no coaxing. Then with no cleaning I fried some breakfast sausage and the pan proved easy to work with and cooked the sausage nice and evenly, no sticking and the sausage came out great. Finally, leaving all the sausage remnants in the pan untouched I fried two more eggs sunny side up, and again there was no sticking the eggs slid right out with no issues - again its still early in the game but I found this very encouraging, often frying an egg after sausage makes it hard to retrieve the egg - but not in this case, in fact though I am a nonstick skeptic I already love this pan -- but I know in my heart only time will show how good a companion this pan proves to be. I would say if this pan could deliver say, five to seven years of this kind of performance its a bargain for $30, almost nothing today is built to last like things used to so the five to seven year rule is just my opinion and in todays world not many things last five to seven years, so I figure that would be a very good lifespan for a $30 non stick pan, and hopefully being made in Germany will mean something as far as build quality making it a realistic projection - but so far I have nothing bad at all to say about the pans performance or overall build quality, given what I know so far of it the $30 price seems well in line and for now I have to say its a solid performer and definitely one to try if youre looking, its not a run of the mill TV ad clone and its one of the reasons I pulled the trigger. Ive only seen the one size so far, hopefully there will be and 8 and 12 inch available, because if it proves itself good I definitely want another one or two of these pans.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful pots.', 'author': 'Deborah Finch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Durability and charm. I love the look and the wood handles are so nice. Easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A year in, still like new!', 'author': 'Morse Code Name', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I actually came to Amazon today searching for matching pans, and realized I was remiss in not reviewing my 11" pan that I literally purchased a year ago today. I\'ve had it a good while, and am comfortable letting the world know that it\'s still like brand new and easily my favorite pan of all time. Nothing sticks to it...NOTHING...it heats evenly, has a nice lid, and is SO EASY to clean. Everything just slides right out--hot water, a squirt of dish soap, a few passes with a soft sponge, and a good rinse and dry and it\'s ready to go back in the cabinet. I was concerned about the warnings to hand wash because, well...I\'m lazy and I admit it. The rest of my pots and pans need some elbow grease to clean up, so I worried that if I couldn\'t put it in the dishwasher, I would just leave this pan sitting dirty on the stove in a fit of laziness. Or WORSE, that I\'d say "eff it" and put it in the dishwasher and ruin it, as I\'ve been known to do with other hand-wash items. But oh, was I wrong! 90% of the time, I put whatever I\'m cooking onto a serving dish and clean off the pan before the family even sits down to our meal, it\'s that quick. Ask my husband and kids, every time I wash the pan I exclaim out loud how much I love it--they think it\'s pretty weird, but hey, I guess this is what it\'s like to be in your 40\'s.Aside from all this, as mentioned, my pan is a year old and I\'ve seen no wear on it at all. I\'m so sad to see all the reviews stating that their pans didn\'t even last a month! I wish that everyone could have a life-changing non-stick pan experience like mine. I stan for pan. Now I\'m off to buy some other sizes.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Even heat', 'author': 'esther', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's wonderful and non-stick. title: DELARLO Whole body Tri-Ply Stainless Steel 12 Inch Frying Pan With Lid, kitchen large Skillet Suitable for All Stove
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pans', 'author': 'Kel', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got these to replace my old stainless steel frying pans because the handles were always coming off. These pans have nice handles that you have to attach yourself but seem solid and stay cool during cooking.I like that they can go into the oven and are dishwasher safe. As with any stainless steel frying pans you have to heat up oil or butter first before cooking in it. After you're done cooking you should soak the pan for awhile, I normally soak for an hour then use a spatula to scrape off any burnt material and food residue then use a yellow sponge with the green scrubber on back to clean it. These are not teflon non stick pans but that's why I bought them, teflon is not healthy so I'd rather use these. If you use oil to cook and soak them there are no issues cleaning. Cheers!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Learning curve but worth it', 'author': 'Shayulghul', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I previously used metal pans when I worked in restaurants, but that was decades ago. I\'ve been using mostly teflon pans since then. After I got these, I ruined the first one by trying to wipe water out of a hot pan with a kitchen towel that had some sort of plastic texturing. STUPID. I\'ve been trying to clean/repair it, but I think the pan is a loss.I moved on to the second size, confident in my ability to resurrect my old kitchen skills. After one or two rough starts and watching a few videos, I finally figured out the basic "formula" for using a steel pan. Now, I love it. These pans are sturdy, easy to clean, and make you feel fancy. Just watch a few videos and practice cooking with them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works Great but Stains Quick', 'author': 'Olivier', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The cooking performance of this steel pan is top-notch, delivering even heat distribution that's perfect for everything from searing meat to sautéing veggies. However, it doesn't stay pristine for long, as it's prone to staining rather quickly. While this doesn't affect its cooking capabilities, it does mean spending a bit more time on cleanup to keep it looking good. Despite the extra elbow grease required, its cooking prowess makes it a valuable addition to my kitchen.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not Perfect but Good Value', 'author': 'Greg from Seattle', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The bottom isn't as heavy as I'd hoped but warming the pan on low or medium heat before cooking . The heat distribution is a little more complicated. I prepared the pan per the instructions, fill the pan 2/3 full of water and white vinegar and boil. The only boil area was in the center of the bottom which was over the burner, and it was a very well-defined border. I do like the removable handle, it makes it easier to wash in the sink. And hand washing is necessary. The ultra-cheap little 'wrench' they supply is too small, it doesn't fit. You'll want to get an inexpensive 10mm nut driver to keep in your kitchen junk drawer. In spite of these less than perfect characteristics, I still give it 5 stars because of the low price. You can easily find a better pan but you'll pay a lot more. I try not to have champagne expectations on a beer budget.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great little pan', 'author': 'jenjam', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pan is awesome and I love it. You screw the handle on when you get it. It is substantial and not a cheap light weight pan. The design is attractive, with a more rounded top slightly than some flatter skillets. It makes it easier to keep food in. The stainless steal is beautiful and cleans up better than other stainless pans I have. It's obviously not non stick and that's what I love about stainless, it's healthier than coated pans, but with this pan food actually comes off of it slightly easier. It washes just fine in the dishwasher and by hand. Very nice, well made high quality brand and skillet. I have ordered more sizes", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value', 'author': 'Allen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Well built with comfortable handle.I gave 5 stars in regards to cleaning. this assumes familiarity with non-coated pans.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars ASSEMBLY REQUIRED -Not as Heavy as you would like!', 'author': 'Steven Barrette', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'REQUIRED ASSEMBLY and wrenching together! Not as heavy gauge stainless and uses only 304SS...not a great stainless for cooking! Lighter in weight than Cuisinart Tri-ply NON stick pan of same size. The Hex Clad copycat is working at the start....We shall see how long this one last! Not as non stick as I would like to see a non - stick pan to be!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Cute Pan That Works As Well As It Is Cute', 'author': 'Edskilove', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The diamond like pattern works well at keeping food from sticking. I bought the pan to test the technology. This was the cheapest pan that had the hybrid technology. I think it was a good buy. When the pan came, I washed it and decided to cook an egg. I put the pan on med heat and put some olive in the pan. Like the manufacturer claims, the oil stuck and spread itself evenly. I put the egg in and it cooked evenly. I think I had the heat up a little too high, but will test it as I use it more. Maybe Med-Low next time. The egg cooked evenly and didn\'t stick as advertised. I used my silicone spatula so I haven\'t yet tested the claim that you can safely use metal utensils. The egg slid right out of the pan and clean up was super easy. The only concern I have is the rim of the pan is turning brown... After just one use...! We\'ll see how it holds up. Also the pan is a very lightweight and I am a little concerned about how even it distributes heat. But I will admit, the egg did cook evenly so I\'ll need to test it a little more to get a feel for how well heat is distributed. The diamond pattern is attractive to look at and the 6" pan is barely big enough to cook an egg or hold a slice of bread. The egg did taste great though. So for the moment, I\'m impressed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Awesome stainless skillet', 'author': 'Oma', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This looks like a great pan, it is reasonable smooth inside, and will get better with use, as all cookware with this finish does. The only negative thing is that even though sold as an 8" skillet, it takes a 9"lid, and the lid fits it properly.This is the lid that fits this pan:Tsnamay 9 Inch Clear Glass Pot Lid for Frying Pan Replacement Cover Can Withstand 356°F (180℃) with Stainless Steel Arch Bridge Handle,Bright Silver. That is the lid in the picture.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Bigger than you expect.', 'author': 'KYP', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I got the \' 8"Frying Pan/Economic \' version, and it seems to be a good pan. The welds for the handle bolts look a bit iffy, but they held fine when waving it around. It came with extra nuts as well. However, the pan is larger than all of my other 8" pans, so you\'ll need a larger lid if you want to use it with one. It\'s nearly 9" at the lip.Overall, decent pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Stainless Steel Frying Pan 8 Inch - Tri Ply Stainless Steel Skillet Healthy Non Toxic Cookware - Fry Pans for Induction Gas Electric Ceramic Stove & Oven Safe (8 Inch)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pans!', 'author': 'Aleksandr', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Exceptional Quality!I've been impressed with these pans since day one. Despite a higher price tag, the exceptional quality justifies the investment. They are not only functional but also add an elegant aesthetic to the kitchen with their sleek and shiny appearance.For those concerned about food sticking, I've found that with a bit of skill, proper preheating and oil, these pans perform flawlessly. The trick is in the technique, proving that good results come from knowing how to use quality cookware correctly. They've also added a guide for stainless steel cookware on this product page which is helpful.The absence of lids is mentioned in the product description and honestly, it wasn't an issue for me. I appreciate the straightforwardness and, considering I seldom use lids, it wasn't a downside.Cleaning is easy thanks to the smooth surface and lack of rivets, making them suitable for both hand washing and dishwashers.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Stainless STICKS - Unless You listen to my mom's advice!", 'author': 'Scott & Sage Pooler', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My mom cooked on Stainless steel pots & pans for 74 years! When I became old enough to want to learn how to cook, she taught me many secrets to her success in the kitchen. One of those "Secrets" was a simple piece of advice... Clean your stainless steel pots and pans with with a steel wool scouring pad (insert your favorite brand name here) before you cook in them and always clean them that way. There is something in the way that the steel wool and soap interacts with the surface of your pan that make it much less likely to stick while cooking, so there my mom\'s tip to you folks complaining that these pans stick! I followed mom\'s advice (R.I.P) and cooked eggs in the small GIPFEL pan with no problem - 1st use.I also used the large GIPFEL pan to cook up some cabbage and sausage, again. no sticking and no problem.Another tip with stainless, if you do get some sticking, is to immediately clean it while it is still somewhat hot, your sticky bits will come off easier.And one more tip, while I am at it, is that there are times when you want sticky bits and stainless is the pan that chefs use to make wonderful sauces and gravy from that "fond" on the bottom of the pan which produces flavor found no where else.When these GIPFEL pans first arrived I was a little disappointed that they were not completely tri-ply. (Just the thick bottoms are tri-ply) I had understood that real chefs only use pans that are constructed with tri-ply throughout which produces a thicker sidewall and thus better heat retention. But once I used these pans a bit, I realized that it did not seem necessary to have this feature as the food cooks fine and the thinner side walls of the pans make for a lighter pan and easier usage. So, I am very happy with my order and have proudly hung these next to my gas stove for quick use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality pans', 'author': 'Cécile', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pans are amazing, I can tell by the quality of my meals how great these pans are.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 👍', 'author': 'Yesenia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Buen producto', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Everything sticks', 'author': 'Luis', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Everything I’ve made sticks to this pan and then doesn’t come off when I put it in the dishwasher', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars great starter set!', 'author': 'boo hallows', 'rating': 4, 'content': "if you're just starting out, i think this is a really great set to get you going! for the price point, you're getting a great deal. pots & pans can be extremely expensive and even at a higher price point youre not guaranteed quality. i like these a lot! just get a good scrubber and you wont have a hard time cleaning them up, either.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Both beautiful and functional', 'author': 'GLL', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These pans are beautifully polished stainless steel. title: T-fal Performa Stainless Steel Fry Pan 12 Inch Induction Oven Broiler Safe 500F Cookware, Pots and Pans, Dishwasher Safe Silver
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Chef approved.', 'author': 'Raine', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My husband trained and worked as a chef. He said this pan reminds him of the pans he used in the restaurant and in school. He is sick of Teflon and worries about the safety of Teflon. He said Teflon is good for cooking eggs and shredded hashbrowns, that's it. When he first cooked with this pan, the smell of the meat was incredible. I don't think we get that with Teflon. It's weird. That's what I noticed. What he noticed is this pan cooks like a professional pan and has a nice heavy weight to it. It will sear meat, if you want, it cooks evenly and quickly. You don't need to use a high temperature.It cleaned up faster than Teflon, according to him. I noticed some scratches inside the pan from my husband using a metal spatula, and showed him the instructions that say not to use metal in it. He was upset by that, as he was looking forward to finally being able to use metal utensils in a pan. I read that you can do that, that the scratches will not affect the performance of the pan, just the looks. So we are debating if we will care about scratching the inside. It's just that it's so beautiful and shiny. I found that there can be a little residue sometimes after you clean them and using a little Ceramabrite takes it right off. I will update my review down the road to say how the pan holds up to my husband's abuse (hehe). Also, note that so far, the handle stays cool to the touch when cooking. We also have a set of these in pots and pans, the handles seem to stay cool to the touch with them too. It does not look like we needed the silicone handles, so I am glad we went without and chose the pans that can take the higher heat in the oven.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great to use, just a little bit shallow', 'author': 'frank', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great to use a pan without coating, put my mind to ease. However wife said this pan is a little bit shallow, if she cook for the family it won't fit, not sure if there'a another version of this pan with more capacity.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I really like it', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I thought I would not like it after reading some of the negative reviews. In fact, I carefully unpackaged it fully expecting to return it after one use - but boy I love this pan, especially for the price. Other top rated stainless pans are near $200 or more so I figured I'd give this a shot. At first I made bacon, and the cleanup was easy. Then I tried the dreaded eggs. I was sure the eggs were going to get stuck in the raised surfaces, but not at all. I did notice a little patina on the bottom of the pan after several uses, but I don't mind. In fact it does clean up if I hit it with my scrubby pad. If I soak the pan with soapy water after use, the cleanup is a snap.I have only had it less than a week but used it a bunch, and will keep it. Oh, it is larger than I would have liked so I will have to go to a thrift store and buy a lid as all of my other lids don't fit, but whatever. Its light so I don't mind the large size, plus I can cook a lot of bacon eggs veggies in there at once. I highly recommend it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for some foods, not so good for other foods', 'author': 'Karl Stach', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The first thing I tried to prepare in the pan was fried potatoes. They began to stick to the bottom almost immediately, and I had to change pans to finish them. When I use the pan with meat, it works great. The meat browns well at a very low heat setting, and it doesn't stick. It took a little effort to clean off the stuck on potatoes, but the pan cleans easily when used for meat. I need to try some non starchy vegetable to see how the work in the pan.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 14, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars no more coated pans', 'author': 'kreed', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought these to replace "non stick" pans. these really are great pans. They heat fast and cook well. My experience with non stick is that inevitably they get overheated and then all food sticks or within 2 years or less you have to buy new ones because the coating is peeling off. I got tired of throwing away pans that don\'t do what they are supposed to. My experience is that these do clean up easy (much easier than the Green Pans I had) and if food does stick it is the same as any "non stick" pan that I have used. So glad to find these and stop throwing out worn out pans. It will be a savings and less chemical exposure from coatings.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Arrived dented.', 'author': 'TheNewCK', 'rating': 1, 'content': "This was the only plan that didn't come in a set. My complaint is that it came in dented. Horrible packaging. Maybe should have boxed it up instead of just putting it in a plastic bag. Not happy. As for the pan itself, I love the entire set. Not sure what the other reviewers are doing to their pans but cleanup is very easy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan, easy to use and wash, does not stick.', 'author': 'sam', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A great pan. It does not stick if you know how to cook on stainless steel. First you need to heat the pan for a minute or two. Then add oil. Turn down the heat a little. Dont let the oil smoke. Let the oil heat up a little. Once the oil starts having ripples add the meat, fish, or eggs. Leave it on medium heat. Dont try to lift it too soon. Never use max heat. Medium heat is all you need. Easy to wash.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Wanted to love but....', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I love how this pan cooks evenly and holds heat BUT even with a Brillo pad, trying to clean in between all of the indents from the small raised sections is impossible. This pan makes beautiful eggs and is great to saute with. It is not light but not to heavy. If it was easier to clean I would have given it 5 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars No llenó mis espectativas', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Lo he utilizado 2 veces y los alimentos se pegan a la sarten, no se si lo he hecho de la manera correcta pero pienso que no debió pegarse, no llenó mis expectativas y no volvería a comprar algo así.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got rid of all my old worn pans. Cooks and cleans up easily.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: 10 Piece Nonstick Pots and Pans Set, Nonstick Induction Kitchen Cookware Sets with Detachable Handle, Induction Stackable RV Kitchen Cookware Sets Removable Handle, Oven Safe, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Están muy bonitas', 'author': 'Vanessa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Me encanta', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic', 'author': 'Teri', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Not only are these pants nonstick they are fantastic. Ass one of the coolest sets I love that they all fit right inside of each other for easy storage. It definitely meant for a smaller apartment or such smaller space definitely convenient these are nonstick and I have cooked quite a few things that should have stuck to the sides to see if I could get anything to stick and they definitely don’t. They’re very easy to clean, when cooking they definitely distribute heat throughout the whole pan so everything cooks thoroughly at the same time.
