I do wish that there would’ve been two handles because when you’re cooking more than one thing on the stove top and you need the handle to hold the pan, you have to keep switching back-and-forth between pans , but other than that that is the only downside that I have found so far, these are definitely a win-win and worth the money . I saw these all over and I was not sure what the hype was until I got them and I definitely understand why if I could compare these to my high end, where I definitely would in the aspect that a lot of things I looked for in my expensive cookware, I have found in these. I would definitely recommend these. They definitely came with a storage bag to store everything inside of. I don’t use it but I do love it. It’s adorable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly surprised', 'author': 'Krista E Banks', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We replaced our gas stove with an induction cooktop and electric oven, and we have a lovely set of high end cookware to go with it, but the high end set is for making particularly large batches. As there are only 2 of us, it can be a bit awkward at times. So when I saw this small stackable set with a removable handle, I was skeptical, but intrigued. The sizes are just right, and the footspace for storage is minimal. I decided to put one to the test with the most likely sticky candidate dish: eggs. I made a frittata, starting it on stovetop, sautéing the veggies and meat, then adding the egg. I popped the pan in the oven and dissociated the handle (great feature, BTW). When it came out, I let it cool on the stovetop for a couple of minutes, then I used a stiff silicone spatula to cut it. The pieces came out flawless! No sticking at all, and I didn't even add any extra fat/oil before adding the egg! This induction compatible cooking set is a perfect addition to our kitchen!Update on review: After having these for a couple of months I want to double my 5 star rating to 10 stars! These pans are amazing for cooking, easy to clean, induction compatible, and have made me a better cook! My husband loves them as well. Great, great product!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars 4.5 Stars', 'author': 'Marilyn', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The only reason I lower the star was I wish it came with another handle and another lid. That being said this is a great set. Because the handle comes off it makes it easy to store them and even place it in the oven or fridge without the handle in the way. They cook so evenly throughout. I made a few things in them that sometimes will stick in places on other pots but these did not stick at all and cooked evenly. They are also so easy to clean, you do not necessarily need to put them in the dishwasher, however I have and have had no issues with that. The look good and everything I have made in them turned out great. Again my biggest complaint is that it only comes with one handle and one lid, but they are still a great set.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nifty design and concept', 'author': 'Emily', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Really nifty concept for cookware. Not having attached handles is definitely a space saver for me. I love the wood looking handle but appreciate that it’s not an actual wood handle. The handle is smooth and is comfortable in the hand. Having hand issues, I felt like it was easy to attach and remove the handle. Once attached, it holds rather well and I appreciate that the release button isn’t something that I could see myself accidentally triggering while carrying a hot pot/pan.I used these on a glass top stove and cooked scrambled eggs. I had zero issues with anything sticking. I do wish that it came with another handle for when I am cooking multiple things at once and need to use all the pots & pans but at the same time, it’s pretty simple to change out if needed.I couldn’t find whether or not these were dishwasher safe but I did put them through the dishwasher before and after using them and they seemed to hold up fine with no issues. Hopefully that remains the case but will update if I run into any issues just so everyone is aware.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect travel Cookware set', 'author': 'tabitha', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This set is amazing!!!They are heavy duty and will endure the fire of a propane stove with no problem.The removal handle allows for that tight fit of using both burners of a camp stove. It also allows for a compact fit for storage and transportation.The travel bag and pan protectors are great bc I feel confident my cookware set will stay secure and unscratched in the packing / storing process.The provided spoon and spatula are a bit flimsy feeling but do work and don't scratch the pans so they are great additions.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely love!', 'author': 'S.Shade', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great pots and pan set.I love that you can remove the handle for easy storage and it is super simple to attach to the pots and pan. I will for sure be looking into getting more of this brand in the future.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing!', 'author': 'Ashley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I know that there are a couple brands that are doing a similar concept as this pot and pan set but unfortunately nothing has been in the affordable range for me so when this popped up, I jumped on this set! The actual handle is sturdy and clamps really nicely onto the lip of the pots and pans. The one lid that comes with this is really nice but I do wish that there was another one that fits the pan, unfortunately the lid only really fits the smallest pot. title: ESLITE LIFE Nonstick Crepe Pan with Spreader, 9.5 Inch Ceramic Coating Flat Skillet Tawa Dosa Tortilla Pan, Compatible with All Stovetops (Gas, Electric & Induction), PFOA Free, Cream
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan, Very Non-Stick, Wonderful Solution!', 'author': 'Collin M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a fantastic crepe pan, and even includes a spreader. It\'s a great size for making larger crepes, at least with the 11" one that I got. And it has that kind of semi-granite feel to it, where it\'s a little bit rough, but provides phenomenal nonstick features. So you don\'t have to worry as much when it comes time to flip, which is super important with crepes. It does come with a spreader so that you can evenly distribute the batter as well so you have a more uniform crepe, with less lumps. Because it is thinner, it also heats up quickly, which is nice for a quick heat up and go. I absolutely love this, and it is much easier than using the regular kitchen pans like I had in the past. Would recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pan!', 'author': 'elizabeth nichols', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is such an amazing pan. I love it so much works so well and cleans and wipes off smoothly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful, affordable crepe pan', 'author': 'Kaulika', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've made crepes about five times with this now, and while time will tell in terms of durability, for now it's by every measure a terrific crepe pan. Even heating throughout on my gas range, and a little bit of butter wiped around the surface with a paper towel means absolutely no sticking. I tried it once without butter and it didn't stick terribly, but the butter makes it much easier to use. If I could change one thing, I would make it a little flatter, as it has a bit of a dome in the middle.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Makes good crepes', 'author': 'JC', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Heats up well and even and makes a good crepe. Could not get the handle as tight as I'd like, but great price for the quality you get.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very worthy', 'author': 'Surayyo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It’s been two years now since I bought this pan, I can definitely say that it’s a must have! It is dishwasher safe, non-stick and very light weight pay, highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for burritos', 'author': 'Roy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this to heat up tortillas. It's absolutely perfect for flour or corn. Just be careful to keep the handle pulled away from the flame just a tad or the wooden handle can get scorched a bit. I put mine on the bbq and learned the hard way....Eslite was awesome in assisting me get a new handle on the situation.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth every penny', 'author': 'Ram', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Looks good. Works well. It does tend to get overheated and so I'm still trying to figure out the optimal temperature settings to work with it. But I hope that's more of a learning curve for me than a problem with the pan itself. Definitely recommend!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars TRASH - complete and utter TRASH', 'author': 'Phil', 'rating': 1, 'content': "DO NOT BUY THIS ANY OTHER FLAT SURFACE WOULD BE BETTER. This thing is terrible. Any flat pan would be better. The middle bugles up so you can NOT get a flat crepe. I've been thinking I've just been terrible at this for months now, but its the pan that is terrible! What a complete RIP OFF! You want FLAT thin crepes, the middle sticks up so high that I have to flood the edges with batter to get the center even a little bit covered - insanely uneven cooking, need to have fat edges on your crepes? Insane. I'm so frustrated right now that it's been the pan this whole time. What a sucker I am for having bought this. Don't make the same mistake. In fact, I wouldn't trust a single thing from this mfg after this experience.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I live in Texas so breakfast tacos are a staple. The grocer sells uncooked flour tortilla so I use this pan religiously and it never gets put up. Literally it hangs out on the cooktop.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Probably not to be used with a gas range.', 'author': 'Fran F.', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I bought it in September of last year (i.e. Sept. 2023) and used it a few times until last week, when the handle broke, leaving me holding the handle, while the pan and crepe were on the floor. Unexpected if you consider the price. The gas range was set at \'medium heat\' (I do not think that you could cook crepes at a lower setting, and never tried); I have other, older, crepe pans, and they are still whole.Looking at the pieces, I noticed that it was the handle that cracked; the pan itself is OK, with a black layer (part of the handle) still tightly screwed onto it. The handle could probably be glued back, but Gorilla glue would cost about $5, with no guarantee that it would hold, just \'hope\'. A better bet is to discard the pan and \'get a better one next time\' (for example a Matfer Bourgeat 7" carbon steel crepe pan for just under $26, or a Cuisinart, or some smallish non-stick pan (anyhow, Candlemas/la Chandeleur is past, so you have plenty of time to find something better).[By the way, small crepes, 5-7", are a lot easier to make than larger ones; and you can also work with two pans at the same time.]As I said, the handle was left in my hand but it was not hot and I did not get burned.Note also that I have a gas range; the pan might be safer with a different type. Read all reviews before you buy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Toast some biscuits(Pillsbury grands)or English muffins. Great sandwiches that you can freeze too(heat in microwavefor 1.5 to 3 minutes)! ITS NOT ROCKET SCIENCE! I wont dishwasher it because its easily cleaned in the sink. title: Capri Stainless Steel Nonstick Mini Fry Pan/Skillet Perfect for Making 1 Egg, 5.5"
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice egg pan', 'author': 'Katie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I just use the pan to flip the eggs instead of a spatula so I found the high edges of the pan appealing. It does work perfectly for just a flick of the wrist egg flip, but the non-stick coating doesn't seem quick as slick as other teflon pans I've used in the past. If you are dead set on using a spatula look for a pan with lower edges.I like that this pan can also double as a small sauce pan so it's a little more versatile than the lower edge egg pans I've used in the past. I've already used it a few times for small things like making garlic butter, which I normally would have used a larger pan for.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Pan for Induction', 'author': 'RobertW', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's a good pan for induction stove. Sides are higher than needed and handle is a bit longer than needed for my purposes, but I see where it would be beneficial on a gas stove. Any more weight on the handle, would cause the pan to tip, but it does work.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The perfect size, deep too - well made Fry Pan', 'author': 'Michael W.', 'rating': 5, 'content': '5-STAR REVIEWWell made fry panEasy to cleanPerfect size - both width and depthWorks on an induction cooktopWell worth the additional cost compared to other small pans', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars definitely not non stick', 'author': 'ahmed qamruddin', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'egg sticks in the middle of pan even with oil.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Thin and cheaply made, was hoping for something to use in the oven, not good for that.', 'author': 'Courtland J. Carpenter', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I was expecting a nice high-quality small-scale fry pan for a quick egg or omelet. What came was a thin walled cheap look and feel pan similar to that at discount stores. Temperature range prohibits this from oven use, and stove should be kept to medium at max. While that's fine for eggs and some foods, for a relatively expensive pan, it's a no go for me. I have a five-inch full cast pan that cost about eight bucks and when seasoned works fine. I wanted something easier to manipulate and that the handle did not heat up. Nothing seems special about the coating, one of the few saving graces is the ability to use on induction stoves as well as gas or other conduction. I don't recommend, the quality is inferior. This is a non-recommend for me. Better alternatives at better prices are available.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for one egg', 'author': 'Somebody', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This well-made (and even pretty!) skillet did exactly what I hoped it would do: cooked one egg, controlling the spread of the runny white part. I spent many hours looking for what might be the best bet for achieving that goal. This one came out the winner after I had studied many various sizes among the small skillets for sale and the customer reviews for each skillet I looked at.About my photos: The first one shows the skillet before I used it. It was impossible to get a picture that wouldn\'t reflect everything around it (the finish is mirror-like). You do have to be careful about placing it on the smallest burner and centering it over the flame part. Otherwise the weight of the skillet\'s handle will throw off the balance (but once the egg is in it, it isn\'t iffy. The second photo shows the egg right after I put it in the skillet into which I had already melted some butter. You can see how nicely the bottom of the skillet fits that single egg. In the third photo you see the egg after I flipped it over. The third one shows the finished product: the cooked egg on top of buttered pumpernickel toast. And the final photo shows the small utensils I bought to go with the skillet. They sell here on Amazon as a two-piece set and both fit nicely in the skillet. Easily removed the egg from the skillet. They popped up when I searched the site for "small spatulas"... not sure if I\'m allowed to post the link in this review, so I won\'t.IMPORTANT: The directions say to use the skillet over medium heat. Any higher and it may distort the shape and/or discolor the bottom. It also turned out to be the perfect temperature for cooking an egg.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Wish I'd gotten the larger size, but works great for one egg", 'author': 'NoVAMetalReview', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'When I opened the package, my first thought was how cute this little pan is, immediately followed by a concern the handle is quite long and how well this would all balance out. Well, that concern is valid. My cook top is gas and has a grill made up of a series of bars about 1.5" inches apart or thereabouts, and with the small size of the pan base, in order for the pan to balance, I need to be sure to get the pan in the exact spot and have the handle pointing in line with the bars to allow the pan to balance and sit flat - at least on my cook top. I think the next size up would have been better (6.3") I think and wouldn\'t have the same issue. Nevertheless, the pan is perfect for a single egg (fried) or scrambled. The non-stick seems good (at least from new... we will see in 12 months!), but for what I got it for it works great. I knocked off one star for the balance issue.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great little pan', 'author': 'Krystal Garrison', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a nice little sauce pan. It's very small, so it's not going to be able to hold a lot, but it's great for a single person or for a dish that doesn't require a lot of sauce. It's easy to clean and doesn't stick.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A rose by any other name...', 'author': 'Adela', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I thought this little pan would be handy for times I only needed to cook one or two eggs.It is a great size for that or to toast a handful of nuts or melt some butter or chocolate.When it arrived I read more about what it is coated with to make it non-stick, and decided against using it as I have concerns about the finish.If you do not, then it is a lovely little pan that has many uses in the kitchen.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Super Cute', 'author': 'Shopaholic', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This 1 egg frying pan is so adorable.The pan is beautiful, with a nice handle, and shiny chrome surface, and the nonstick coating is without any blemishes.It works great and is the perfect size to cook just 1 egg, possibly 2.I use silicon tools and wash by hand and towel dry so I won't scratch the coating.I like the pan so I don't want to risk damaging it.One thing I noticed is, the size of the pan is small so I can't use it on the large burner and need to use the small burner since the flame is too wide.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: SENSARTE Ceramic Nonstick Pots and Pans Set 14pcs, Healthy Cookware Set, Non-toxic Induction Kitchen Cooking Set, Dishwasher & Oven Safe, PFAS/PTFE/PFOA Free
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful pots and pans!', 'author': 'Svenska Flicka', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Sensarte Ceramic 14 piece set of pots and pans I bought my daughter for Christmas are just what we were hoping for. We were looking for something kind of modern/boho for her apartment, and they needed to be non-toxic as well. These totally exceeded our expectations. They have a modern flare, are lightweight but sturdy, the 14 piece set contained all the basic pieces one would need for daily cooking, they're totally nonstick and nontoxic, and are a snap to clean in the dishwasher, especially because the handles can be easily removed for washing. They are a bargain, especially for the quality and look. If I didn't already have a nice (expensive) set of pots and pans, I would buy myself a set. They were an absolute bargain, especially for the quality, and my daughter uses them daily.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sensarte Ceramic Pots & Pans Are Just Perfect!', 'author': 'Sharon', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased the set in cream, and it is just beautiful. They cook great and cleaning is a breeze. It is really nice to be able to take the handles off because then they don't take up much space in the cabinet. Since we do stack them, the provided pads come in really handy so nothing gets scratched. I can't believe how easy food like scrambled eggs slides right out of the pan and there is absolutely no scrubbing or even lightly rubbing necessary in cleaning. I did so much research on a new set of cookware and am SO glad I bought these.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The most exciting cookware unboxing ever!', 'author': 'YAYteaching', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I was so blown away with the reviews and price of this product. These are amazing pots and pans. They really cover just about all the bases: removable handles, free of PFAs, ceramic non stick coating, oven safe to 550, stackable, dishwasher safe, and absolutely gorgeous!! The packaging was so beautiful and compact I felt I was unwrapping a luxury purse instead of cookware. The company puts a lot of thought into quality and removing unnecessary expenses so the price is very good. I will update this post if I see any issues while cooking with the pans.Update: I have been using the pans and they are incredible. I have never cooked with this great a ceramic surface. The eggs just lift right off and nothing sticks to the pan. The spatulas are great too. I don’t need to risk putting these in the dishwasher because they clean and rinse just that easy. Outstanding!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Stylish ceramics for your kitchen', 'author': 'Cookie', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Color: beige/cream. Size: 14-piece set. Composition: 5 ceramic coated pots with aluminium core + bakelite handles, 3 glass and bakelite lids, two silicon utensils, 4 cushioned polyester pot protectors. The four elements in this cooking set (8" & 9.5" frying pans, 11" sauté pan with lid, 2 qt. saucepan with lid, 4.5 qt. casserole with lid) include the essential sizes for an equipped kitchen. Ceramic is great to cook with because it avoids lots of sticky problems, and the included silicon tools make this feature even better. The pots are stylish, solid (almost too heavy for everyday use) and very attractive. Glass lids are wonderful to take some of the guesswork out of cooking. Since I am left-handed, I love the two-sided spout feature of the saucepan. What I don\'t like is that the handles don\'t necessarily screw on all the way, so one wonders about long-term stability. The lid knobs are also bakelite and also screw on, creating the same uncertainty. Now these pots are described as "dishwasher safe", and bakelite is stable when subjected to heat, so the handles and lid knobs shouldn\'t have to be removed when being washed. Therefore why the screw-on design? The handles all have rotatable metal hooks for ease in hanging; I would have preferred less rotation and more stability. Remains to be seen how the ceramic holds up over time. If the wear and tear are excessive, I\'ll re-evaluate after a month.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Handles are cheap', 'author': 'Ezekiel & Brigette Ramirez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Was so excited for my pots, and pans. After 1-2 weeks of light use, the handle broke off the smaller pan. Seems like poor material by the way it broke off. So saddened by this because the pans are so cute, I had high hopes.** UPDATE: Seller reached out, and went above expectations to solve my issue!!With service like this, definitely deserves 5 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED', 'author': 'Shania', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I’ve been using these pots for like two weeks now. TWO WEEKS and they’ve already started to have these stains at the bottom. The non-stick works great and all but the exterior of the pots are just very disappointing. It cooks the food well and it does not stick, but these are very delicate pots you have to wash them gently and put them down very gently, because the moment you handle it a little too harshly the pots gets scrapes and stuff like that. Now the stain that you see on the bottom of the pots in the pictures, I don’t know what caused that because at the time I was just scrambling eggs and after finishing up with the eggs I let the pot cool before washing them(as stated in the manual) when I went to wash the pot I saw these marks on the bottom, i thought that after washing it they’ll probably go away, sadly it did not. For a whole week I was trying to figure out what caused this to happen, after using the other pots I realized that gradually all of the pots were having the same stain on the bottom so I figured it was either not compatible with gas stove (even tho they sated that it is) or the pots are just not well made as I thought. I wouldn’t recommend these pots to anyone.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value', 'author': 'American Soldier', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had been looking to replace my skillet for awhile and looked at several name brands. I have an electric stove top and the paint got so hot it caught on flames! In the picture I have already washed it and cleaned it up to kind of see what had happened. I contacted Amazon and of course Amazon doesn’t want to take accountability because who wants to give people back their money. They only wanted to offer A five dollar promotion credited to my Amazon account. If you plan on purchasing just don’t they were amazing I like how they look I like the way they cook but if the paint on the bottom is going to catch fire over an electric stove top that’s too much and considering I told Amazon exactly what happened and they still didn’t want to take accountability someone in my home could’ve been seriously injured. And they couldn’t care less but it also makes me frustrated because I paid my hard earned money for these. And if one pan catches fire from the paint it would make you think the rest of them have a risk as well. So no I do not want to keep using them shame on Amazon for this this is officially my last purchase I will ever make on Amazon. title: Hestan - ProBond Collection - TITUM Nonstick Triple Bonded Stainless Steel Skillets with Lids, Induction Cooktop Compatible, Made without PFOAs (8.5 & 11-inch)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I absolutely love these pans!', 'author': 'Brandy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I absolutely love these pans! They are very well made, contain no forever chemicals (PFAO/PFAS), very easy to clean, and cook evenly. The 12 inch pan is much larger than you think as the sides allow for more surface area comapred to traditional pans. They are well worth the money and belive Hestan has a life time guarentee on their pans which means the cost upfront will save you in the end!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A joy to use', 'author': 'George K', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These skillets are totally worth their price - I already own a non-nonstick Hestan and loved its looks and how easy it was to clean, but after doing my research and having had enough with 'high quality' non-stick pans from Calphalon and Zwilling, I decided to splurge for this set (it's actually a steal, compared to the price you'd pay if you were to buy two individual Hestans). I'll say they are truly a joy to use. They heat evenly, the surface has just the right amount of roughness to sear, but still after 4 months use, they still maintain their excellent non-stick ability (unlike their supposedly high end competitors). They can also take some abuse: No special instructions for what temperatures they need to be before you can wet/wash them, and they are perfectly fine in the dishwasher. Add these features to their looks, and you'll have a skillet set you'll want to use everyday. Totally worth their price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent brand overall', 'author': 'Reagan S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have several pieces of Hestan cookware.. I love LOVE these products.The quality and workmanship is outstanding, the different choices of pots and pans provides a great selection to suit almost every need. This brand is expensive but I have found deals and specials on almost every item and the value is great based on quality and my overall satisfaction of performance. I have other cookware that simply will NOT clean up but this line looks like new even after many uses. I look forward to expanding my collection as needed. Very Very happy with every item I've bought and will recommend to anyone interested and will buy again !", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for good quality fry pans!', 'author': 'Spook74', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good heat distribution, but it is SUPER at ease of cleaning! These are some good pans! We still do use a pat of butter sometimes to slicken it up a bit, but it will even fry eggs, etc., just as it is!We saw the comments that the handle can get hot, so we added a Lodge silicone hot handle holder (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00C61O4ZI?ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_details&th=1), which fits snug and still lets you hand it up by the hole in the handle.Great pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super well constructed', 'author': 'Doug Walker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really appreciate the flush rivets as the pan is easier to keep clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great deal on great pans', 'author': 'Dean Eric', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We love these as safe from harmful chemicals and they go into the oven, deal on Amazon extraordinaire!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Hestan - NanoBond Collection - Titanium Stainless Steel 8.5-Inch Frying Pan - Toxin, PFAS, & Chemical Free Clean Cookware, Induction Cooktop Compatible
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome cookware for a bad cook!', 'author': 'JPDMyers', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Two months ago, I bought the 8.5” pan as a test before investing further in the Heston Nanobond line. I’d been wanted to ditch my non-stick cookware for several years for health reasons but couldn’t find the right fit. I’m spoiled by growing up cooking with only non-stick cookware. And I’m NOT a good cook so I tend to overheat pans & burn food. AND I sooo dislike cleaning up after cooking that I’d prefer to do it later (like the next day). I’m possibly the worst case scenario for testing any cookware line. I’d honestly much rather enjoy being served nice meals in restaurants. But, I’m immunocompromised so COVID changed all that. So, I’ve needed to up my game & learn to cook decently.I first tested several brands of stainless steel cookware. It was a total nightmare for me to clean. I then tried out ceramic cookware but found it to be too heavy for my arthritic joints. After reading about and researching Hestan’s Nanobond’s titanium coating, I thought it sounded promising & ordered this pan. Besides, the design of all of Hestan’s cookware is simply gorgeous.This Hestan Nanobond pan turned out to be AMAZING. My 1st test was fried eggs that turned out perfect with no sticking and easy cleanup afterwards. I’d read to heat the pan first, then add the oil/butter next & let it heat, and to then add the eggs. That definitely works to make the surface as close to being non-stick without actually having a non-stick coating. I’ve used it repeatedly for sticky foods like fried eggs, scrambled eggs, grilled cheese sandwiches, etc. with thrilling results. Best of all, it’s easy to clean afterwards.The Hestan Nanobond cookware is fantastic & suits my needs perfectly. I’ve now bought many more of the pots and pans in all shapes & sizes. I’m thrilled with the good looks & performance of the Nanobond line, the ease of cleaning up afterwards, and the titanium coating’s overall forgivingness for bad cooks. I accidentally added ground sausage needing to be browned for a casserole directly to their still-warming 3.5 quart sauté pan. The sausage stuck immediately to the bottom & I knew I’d really screwed up. While stirring the rest of the meat with only a silicon spatula, however, the stuck remnants surprisingly released completely from the bottom! I then decided to go ahead & try baking the entire casserole in the covered Nanobond pan in the oven instead of dirtying up a casserole dish. The casserole turned out fantastic with perfectly browned sides & bottom. The servings easily released from the pan without falling apart. And the very baked-on food remnants STILL cleaned up easily. The beautiful design of Hestan’s cookware really makes it equally appealing for stove/oven to table presentation. I’m now totally in love with the Hestan Nanobond line!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great brand', 'author': 'june', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have two nano bond pans from them and both are my two favorite and most used. They clean great. You don't need non-stick if you have these.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This is a high quality pan! Expensive but will last forever!', 'author': 'Charlie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I just got rid of my nonstick T-Fal professional pan and that was great but the coating was starting to come off...Lasted just about maybe a year or year + 1/2...So I was getting tired of buying a new pan constantly.While this is not a non-stick pan, it is solidly built, and the nanocoat looks fantastic, and the rivets are not sticking out inside the pan.You need to warm up the pan and I like to do the water test to make sure the pan is hot enough.Be prepared to use oil and/or butter otherwise you will have food stick.I had to practice with eggs and finally got it figured out to where I can cook a over easy egg w/o making a mess on our electric range.Cleanup is pretty easy, soap + water.I believe if you have food stuck, just soak it and then clean.For anything that blemishes the pan, I think you can buy barkeepers friend and rub it out (cheaper than buying Hestan's polishing compound).If the price was lower, I would jump on the larger pan for sure...This is perfect for cooking a couple of eggs...Just wish it was a little cheaper.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This pan is non stick as long as you follow directions', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This pan is a beautiful little gem. Feels nice in hand and completely non stick if you follow directions and heat it until water drops dance and scatter. Add oil and cook away!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not worthy.', 'author': 'Sebas', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I recently purchased an expensive pan, and I have to say, I'm thoroughly disappointed with its performance. Despite the hefty price tag, the pan fails to deliver even the most basic cooking capabilities. Food sticks to the pan, and it cooks unevenly, leaving some parts burnt and others undercooked.I've tried using different oils and heat settings, but nothing seems to prevent the food from sticking or ensure an even cook. It's incredibly frustrating to spend so much money on a pan that doesn't perform as advertised.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars sticks', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Well made frying pan. We purchased the pan to fry eggs. The first time we used it the eges did not stick.Subsequent egg frying they stuck to the bottom of the pan regardless of how much butter was used to prevent sticking. Not worth the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pan ever!', 'author': 'Naser Ali Abbas Altaib', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This is the Hestan NanoBond 8.5” that I purchased last Oct 2022. After over 8 months of daily usage, the pan is still shining, easy to clean, and nothing sticks if you just preheat your pan properly before adding your fat. The pan is still as GREAT as new, if not BETTER, it’s the best durable high-quality elegant pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars DERAILED REVIEW —— Not perfect but I like it', 'author': 'Bobbler', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought the 8 inch pan.. I am hesitant to buy the larger skillets if they are going to be super thin like the 8 inch is.BOTTOM LINE:I think I’m going to love this pan for scrambled eggs, and I don’t know what else.. I plan to try a reverse sear with salmon or a hamburger.. I usually slow cook vegetables in an enameled cast iron sauce pan, so I don’t have to worry about salt and other seasonings leaching the SS.. But I suppose I will try some vegetables in the nano bond titanium (as a little browning is supposed to add a layer of flavor.. but I suspect browning anything is less healthy).STICK, OR NOT TO STICK?Mystery solved.. I was perplexed by so many reviews complaining about things sticking to the titanium nanobond, because my scrambled eggs were sliding around, almost like a nonstick pan. I just watched a video comparison of three different stainless steel pans.. The Heston nanobond, and demeyere (both of which I have cooked scrambled eggs on).. In the video they got the pans hot until the water drops danced around, which I think of it as a trick that allows you to cook scrambled eggs in cast-iron.. Plus they used what looked like some kind of vegetable oil.. And the egg was stuck in the pan bad.. I use butter at a low temperature (which I believe is appropriate for eggs), and the eggs don’t stick at all..LEACHING INTO FOODI’ve always heard that titanium is extremely non-reactive, but I have been UNABLE to find any information (other than manufacturers claims) whether titanium cookware will leach anything into food while cooking (ie: acidic foods, like tomato paste, or how it’s well known that salt will pit stainless steel).. Titanium is supposed to be completely safe for humans, so we can only hope if anything leeches it would be pure titanium (manufacturers tend to be untrustworthy, I can only hope in Italy they have tighter regulations for such things than in America).. If you search the Internet you can find where testing was done with SS pans.. Some manufacturers claim you can cook tomato red sauce in them (even though tomatoes do leech from SS)..SUPER THIN?When I say super thin, perhaps I’m spoiled by using expensive aluminum clad cookware from other brands that have a hefty amount of aluminum.. Because of the high price of Heston nano bond cookware, they should pop for thick enough aluminum layer to where we should have to wonder if it’s enough.. And to be clear I don’t know how thick the aluminum layer needs to be to do. It’s job..The thin-ness of the pan makes me wonder if it would be prone to warping (with my other stainless steel pans, I clean them while they are hot, but I am fearful to put water into these thin nano bond skillets).. NOTE: I don’t put a lot of cold water into a hot pan, rather a little bit that steam cleans most of the pan (none of my pans have ever warped).HEAT MOMENTUM:The other problem with extra thin aluminum cladding is heat momentum.. Heat momentum is one of the reasons cast-iron pans work so well for certain things (such as putting a frozen hamburger patty, and getting heat momentum to create the seer.. instead of the frozen patty immediately cooling off the pan which destroys the seer). In my particular case, using the control freak induction burner that has a built-in temperature probe, it will probably compensate by instantly turning the power up (which I hear it doing when I take a little off, to try to maintain temperature).. I doubt the thin aluminum will work in this instance, if you’re trying to cook a frozen steak or anything substantial without cool in the pan off..NON-STICK:I have not used nonstick pans for decades, but I have been cooking scrambled eggs in aluminum clad stainless steel pans for years.. And for the past year. I’ve been using Demeyere SS skillets, which have a treated SS surface that concentrates the chromium and nickel and removes the iron (it makes the stainless steel, more stainless steel, and it does stick less than regular SS, but not by much)..[Again contrary to what many reviews are saying], when I cooked scrambled eggs in the Heston nanobond it felt like nonstick to me. There was an obvious non-stick quality even compared to my demeyere). Like my demeyere pans, I expect I will have to occasionally use the special cleaner, or barkeepers friend, to get rid of the haze/seasoning that develops (this is expected)..Likewise cleanup was very easy (like I would imagine non-stick would be).TOO—LIGHT—WEIGHT?I know other reviews think it’s thick/heavy, but it is by far the lightest pan I have ever held in my hands (and I’ve used a few different brands of aluminum clad stainless steel pans).. I realize titanium is light weight, but the nano bond is a very thin layer of titanium (presumably over stainless steel)..The pan is so light weight that it’s causing the problem with my control, freak induction burner.. The 8” or will sit flat by itself, but because it’s so light weight, and the handle is relatively heavy, it will not sit flat on the induction burner for preheating, because there is a temperature probe in the center (that has a lightweight spring)..And (when cooking anything sensitive to uneven heat) you very much need to preheat pans on an induction burner, because the nature of induction heats the pan itself so there is always a hot ring in the center of the pan that matches the induction ring (preheating for a while lets the heat spread out)..BOTTOM LINE: I was able to preheat the pan to cook my scrambled eggs, but one end of the pan was about 1/8” off the induction burner (and induction burners are sensitive to this.I WOULD HATE: to try to preheat the 8” pan for a seer on this induction burner (the 1/8” in the air might end up a huge problem at high power settings)..COOKING TECHNIQUES:There is technique to consider in whether eggs or anything sticks or not..For scrambled eggs I use low heat (228F.. since my induction burner controls the temperature).. and I use plenty of butter (I am convinced, low carb is healthy, and butter and egg yolks are healthy fats).. my eggs were sliding around the pan like the nonstick advertisements..CLEANUP:My experience with cleanup was like you would imagine nonstick. But I’ve seen many reviews complain about food sticking to the pan (I can only assume they were using high heat, and maybe little or no oil).. I can’t say for sure, but I know with my other stainless steel pans anytime something sticks, I just put a squeeze of dish soap and a little water and come back in an hour (or the next morning).. If I’m in a hurry, I’ll turn on the burner for a few seconds so warm soap will work faster.. Then whatever was stuck on usually falls off.. Sometimes I use vinegar (I don’t know whether dish soap vinegar would be more effective)..', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very high quality in ALMOST every area.', 'author': 'Teddy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Pros: the finish looks beautiful as it’s slightly a smoky grey color which is very smooth and though not nonstick is less sticky than other stainless steel pans I’ve used. Good weight, feels sturdy and i love the flush rivets. Heats up quick and the high heat resistance is great so it works I’m pretty much any cooking environment other than a microwave.Cons. Mostly small nitpicks but for an expensive pan small can be big depending on your taste. Pricey. On my induction top at least the pan bottom warps very slightly so as thin coat of oil tends to pool towards the outer edges of the pan, this pretty common in a lot of pans but i do wish at this price it could be avoided. The handle feels high quality but could be slightly more comfortable if the part that rests against your palm was just a bit wider.Overall: If you can deal with those nitpicks this will make a great pan for small tasks like a grilled cheese or an omelet etc. and last a long time. happy cooking!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for searing', 'author': 'L. Bencze', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Yes, food will definitely stick to this pan; no doubt about it. But it's not that hard to clean out. Most importantly, the pan will not pick up any staining. My wife uses it for searing steaks. She puts it in a hot oven. It's perfect for this. So its searing abilities justify the purchase. Other pans, like Swiss Diamond, are much better for cooking eggs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

Becker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are absolutely pieces of art and I don’t understand why there are a hand full of people putting these down?Not one problem have I had and I dont foresee ever having one 👍As for the care of these copper bond line , We all learned in grade school that copper ‘Tarnishes’ and will need some extra care to keep them the same way as you received them , it’s no different than anything else ….. You buy nice things , You take care of Nice things so don’t throw your hate towards the company that gave you the option to have something so elegant and will last a life time ‘Providing you Care for them’ .All the very best to all that have these , And Happy Cooking 🧑\u200d🍳', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made and pretty', 'author': 'Tiffany Sanders', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I noticed the poor reviews revolve around the heat patina that forms on the copper after use, as well as the food sticking to the pan despite adding oil. To use steel pans, one must learn the steps: 1. Heat the pan first 2. Add the oil once pan is hot, let oil warm up for a few seconds 3. Add food.I have used a pot and my large pan from this ten piece set so far; cooked ground beef and rice, veggies like mushrooms, onions, garlic, and bell peppers so far, as well as made creamed spinach. I have not experienced any sticking whatsoever and find the pans cook my food more evenly with less risk of burning. These are the best pans i have ever used! If you don’t want the copper to change color, then you shouldn’t buy a set with visible copper parts, otherwise you can condition it to remove the natural patina that forms from heat exposure. I personally like the patina, it doesn’t bother me. I would recommend this set to anyone who cooks regularly and wants to do it the way the pros do it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed so far - updated APRIL 7, 2022', 'author': 'Eflows414', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I have decided to get rid of my nonstick Calphalon pans..I love them but the coating comes off and I"m very careful with my pans. I will need to polish the copper but years ago when I had Revere ware copper bottom pans, I had to polish those as well. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nonstick on this is amazing!', 'author': 'Brittney Keck', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a super cool product! Carlson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Egg doesn’t stick in pan. It’s perfect for rolled egg omelette! My only gripe is with Amazon itself on this order. This pan was advertised as next day delivery. When a couple of days later I was still getting the “ it’s going to be late” notice, I chatted with a associate from Amazon who gave me some sort of story about the reason it was late was because it was at a far away from me fulfillment center. I knew it was BS as I use Amazon often and you see the tracking as it moves around from center to center, but this order Never moved! They guarantee’d it would get to me….guess what? It didn’t. Eventually got a message that order was lost. Had to cancel the order then order it again and with no surprise it was a next day delivery which I could watch through tracking move to me.Not happy to have someone lie to me. Should of been honest. I understand that glitches can sometimes happen. I even asked if I should cancel and then reorder but the person said no worries the pan would get to me. Amazon is great until something goes wrong and you don’t have real people on a phone to talk to. Even once the pan was officially declared lost and I decided to phone Amazon I only reached a bot who handled the cancellation and the reorder.I’m sorry to have to complain here but there is no real way to complain the Amazon about Soddy service.As I mentioned though, the pan is absolutely great! The kit was exactly what I wanted. I have used the pan numerous times already with no issues. YouTube helped. I didn't mess with chopsticks and just used the flexible spatula that it comes with (which fits the size of the pan perfectly). I was pretty proud of myself after the first try, but I still need to get the hang of the rolling. All and all, a nice set for making a nifty Japanese-style omelet. I recommend getting it if you want to learn something a little new and have fun cooking eggs. It wasn't as hard as it looked and the multiple layers are a fun twist. title: Imusa Casserole with Lid and Handle, STD, Black, Red or Blue (pack of 1)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome pan', 'author': 'Tamara', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It’s hard to find a small pan with a lid. This is nice . Not as heavy as I like but still good quality', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for eggs! Great quality, great value!!', 'author': 'Sara T.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We love this pan! It is smaller than I thought it would be, but it ended up being a very good thing that it is! This pan is the absolute ideal size for cooking an egg. It keeps a fried or sunny-side-up egg nice and round, with even thickness throughout, just because of the size! It's hard to find lids of this size, so I'm really happy this pan came with one. I hate it when you have to use a giant lid on a tiny pan.. it's just not satisfying like a lid that fits perfectly and gets a nice seal. The non-stick surface is of good quality. We've used this pan for months now, and there isn't one stray mark or chip on its surface, after numerous scrapes with various turners. Eggs slide nice and gently out of it onto a plate, making cooking breakfast a bit easier. This pan cleans in seconds. Nothing seems to become stuck to it, so we haven't had to scrape off food or mystery goo or anything else. It looks shiny and new still every time we wash it! It is extremely light. For me, I don't know what difference the weight of a pan would make (I'm not some fanciful chef obviously), but I figured it was worth noting as Amazon had me rate that specifically. My son, an 11-year-old that wants to be a chef when he grows up, uses this pan all the time, and says it's perfect. He probably understands all the reasons why it's such a great product more than I do. One more point - holy moly, the price of this was fantastic! This was an excellent buy, and I'd recommend it to anyone to add to their pot and pan collection!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars I'm happy with this little fried egg pan", 'author': 'MX300', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'No complaints. title: SENSARTE Nonstick Crepe Pan, Swiss Granite Coating Dosa Pan Pancake Flat Skillet Tawa Griddle 12-Inch with Stay-Cool Handle, Induction Compatible, PFOA Free
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan for tortillas', 'author': 'TruthInReview', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this pan because I needed a new tortilla skillet. This one is a great size so if I want to make larger ones I can. It is truly non-stick, it heats evenly, it washes up super easy and I don’t have any complaints.I actually love this brand of pans. I purchased this pan after purchasing a set and loved it so much that when I needed a new tortilla skillet I looked at this brand first. Luckily they had exactly what I was looking for. 10/10.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great', 'author': 'Will', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very very non-stick. Makes great tamagoyaki eggs and is quite easy to use. Feels sturdy and heats evenly. Great value for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for pancakes', 'author': 'E R S', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We bought this to replace a griddle that was no longer flat on the bottom, so it spun around on the burner. This pan stays put, it's easy to clean and makes perfect pancakes. It comes with a very nice screwdriver so you can attach the handle.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great, need a bit of fat in to cook eggs', 'author': 'Joni', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I needed to replace my Greenworks pan (I’ve gone through a few of this brand, in different lines and sizes), and they work great at first, but if you burn something in it, they will never recover from it, and they do scratch even though you’re using a silicone or nylon spatula.I ran across this Japanese style egg pan (even though I really try to only buy made in USA, most affordable pans aren’t made so) and thought I may even be able to make a good omelette or “fry” eggs in it. And I did! (See photos)Preface: I don’t use it for the traditional Japanese omelettes as shown in the photos/video (wish I was that skilled!), just regular “western cooking”.Only used it a handful of times so far, but here’s my opinion:-You must use some kind of fat to cook in it: I tried an egg without any oil and it stuck to the bottom, though it never burned, but I was able to still get my egg off, albeit “broken”.-I made eggs a few times, used very little (like half a tsp of it) coconut oil or avocado oil, and the eggs just slid around the pan like nothing else!-You should keep it on medium/low (says not higher than 302F), and not heat it without food, so it won’t go in oven imho, but it does “fry” well at max 6-7 ( my electric stove has a 2-4-6-8-10 temperature, so I keep it between 6 and 8 usually, so medium): if you brush/spread or spray your oil in it and crack your egg on top, while your pan is just put on heat, it’ll still cook just perfectly so and slide off.-The fat really keeps it from sticking. If you do not plan to use any fat, this probably won’t work for things like eggs, but it’ll do “non fat” bacon or other food that releases some kind of fat even minimally.-I made an omelette (See photos) with inclusions, and it will make you a perfect rectangle, roll well with the provided spatula, and slide easily off onto your plate. Again, very little oil, but it is needed.-I also cooked turkey bacon it it, without any fat, and it crisped it up very well, then came clean with a damp paper towel.-It will wipe off clean with a paper towel or you can wash it with dish soap and a soft sponge (no scrubbing) if you must, but it’s almost unnecessary if you wet the paper towel first.It’s light enough to work with one hand, but it’s not a super-light pan like some flimsy ones. Seems very solid with a thick bottom.Conclusion:-I’ve used this pan only maybe 10 times, so I can’t really tell you how long it’ll last (I didn’t rate that part). I don’t plan to forget it on stove like I’ve done with another pan (yeah I know, my fault), so if all the above happens, this pan will probably last me a very long time.The rectangular size is perfect for many things including ham or bacon.Always use oil, or butter if you must.Only “cons” I can think of is, I wish it came with a lid, as I don’t think I’ll ever find one that’ll fit, and I’d probably pay a pretty penny for one, if I really wanted it, cause of its size. But it doesn’t take anything away from the pan’s functionality.There was another brand that did come with a lid, but this one sold me for some reason.I’m very happy with my purchase so far. Thumbs up. 👍🏼', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Missing instructions but easy to use after a few google searches', 'author': 'Pierce Mitts', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Good product but gives almost no info on how to use.Make sure you grease or butter the pan, especially around the perimete.Soak the wooden piece in water between uses so the batter doesn't stick to it when trying to smooth it out.use with your favorite crepe batter, with little trial and error with the heat of your stove you will be making fantastic crepes in no time.Nonstick and easy to clean", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive-High Quality, excellent pan', 'author': 'debbie norton', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very sturdy, sits flat and heats evenly on induction stove. NO chemical odor. Finish seems very durable. Washes easily with soap and water. Handle does not get warm and seems to be made of a very sturdy composite plastic. This pan exceeded my expectations and I would not hesitate to purchase more items from this manufacturer. They even included a full size screwdriver for the handle screw!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Tabitha', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This pan works soooo wonderful! You need one!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'Aleen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Made dosa n it turned out great. Easy to clean. Came with screw driver too so I can screw the handle. Will buy more items from the seller', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars the right tool for the job.', 'author': 'Fiona Mc Donald', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First time use for this pan ( I'm a private contract Chef), and it performed superbly. Absolutely NO smell, like others have reported, but a soap&water wash, towel dry, and begin heating on lowest heat, gradually raising the temp to cooking level. I did put about 1.5 tablespoons of butter for it to melt and then add to my batter, leaving the residue in the pan before adding my batter. The pan yielded perfect Swedish pancakes. I experimented with not buttering the pan before adding batter, and again, perfect-well, maybe not quite as brown, which the butter aids in. Slices of bacon, a dollop of whipped cream, and some lingonberry preserves, and you're in Sweden! Fantastic tool, performs perfectly, just remember to add heat slowly, as you would to any good pan!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to Use', 'author': 'Tina White', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My husband absolutely loves it! The T-shaped utensil is very useful but not needed. My husband had to practice a bit but got the hang of using it. It’s splinter free and light in weight.
