title: Granitestone Pro 3 Pc Non Stick Frying Pans Set for Cooking, 8+10+12 Inch Frying Pans Nonstick Skillet, Pans Set Nonstick, Non Stick Pans for Cooking, Hard Anodized Nonstick Pan, Dishwasher Safe Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best set of pans out there!', 'author': 'MB', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pans have exceeded my expectations. The pans are heavy duty and non stick. The handles stay cool while cooking. I previously purchased a Granitestone cookware set and was so impressed with how they performed and the ease of clean up I decided do try the Pro cookware set of pans. These pans are superior to the original pans and the originals ended up in the camper. Much heavier duty with better handles with the same great non stick coating. I have bought some very expensive pans from Pampered Chef, SS with the nonstick hexagonal finish, and it is a awesome pan. It is also cost me 180.00 dollars. These pans cost only one third the price and work just as good. No doubt the PC pans will last longer but you can\'t beat the price and value of Granitestone.One thing to remember is you cannot use scotchbrite pads, or any abrasive pads not only on these pans or any nonstick pan for that matter. Running water cleans most of everything out of the pan. Nor can you use any nonstick sprays. The sprays leave a sticky residue that will that eventually lead to a unusable pan. I use a high smoke point oil like peanut or vegetable in a special hand oil sprayer. You can use one of the pump up sprayers but I found the hand sprayer is easier to use with no overspray.Ok now I have to debunk other reviewers claim that the pans are not non stick or their pans scorched while cooking. I really don\'t know how peoples perception of what non stick means is formed. If you cook food in a pan some will end up on the sides or bottom and WILL adhere to the pan. It will happen in all pans. How the pan cleans up is where the "non stick meets the pan" to coin a phrase! You can of course use a large amount of oil but that is not why you bought these pans. You can use a small amount of oil, which improves the cooking and flavor of your food. Why do you think when you try to make something at home that you had in a restaurant it never tastes as good. These pans are way better than Copper Chef or any of the pans that have a smooth finish. I did not think that would be the case.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 11, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great set of pans', 'author': 'RandomGS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought over a month ago, and had to loop back to review this great pan set. I have been resigned to buying new "lifetime" pans every year, without fail. These pans are something different. In daily use I have not managed to burn, stick or stain anything onto these. Cleanup is better than any pan I have ever owned. For this set, I am going with lower heat, and avoiding cooking sprays that have an additive (lethicin?) that plates out on the surface, trying anything to make a lifetime pan last longer. But these seemed to have hit it. The surface feels rougher than normal pans, and oil seems to run right off and pool away from where you pour it, but it does not seem to affect the food quality at all.Overall, I would highly rate these pans. If they give out after a year or two, I will be suprised, but I will buy another set. Well worth it. Well Done!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent non-stick Pans but possibility of receiving a bent or mis shaped pan.', 'author': 'allen_olt', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Quality Control is an issue with the vendor, many have complained about bent or mis-shapen pans and my 8" pan pictured here is no exception. Pans work great. Even distribution of heat except on the very edge on Induction Stovetops. Cleans amazingly easy. Tests done by PROJECT FARM shows these Pans to outlast and outclass most. Would be 5 Stars if they didn\'t send out flawed inventory.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Unexpectedly amazing', 'author': 'Ken', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These pans surprised me, they are amazing. I have cooked so much in them trying to test the limits, but when you can simmer sauce for 3 hours nothing sticks, make scrambled eggs, pan fry poultry, made arros con pollo in the oven, fabulous, I made sunny side up eggs in the 8 inch skillet, no tools necessary they floated on the surface and slid right out with a tilt of the pan, I've cooked homemade tortillas like a camal I'm very very impressed", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love!', 'author': 'J. King', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I cannot say how much I love these pans enough. Everything about them is perfect. Terrific sizes and they work exactly as they say they will. Easy to cook in and easy to clean up. It's been awhile since I changed brands but boy am I glad I made this move! I wanted to use them for a while before I made the review so I could see for myself how well they would work and I heartily recommend them. I confess I do still put a little bit of butter in the pan when I cook eggs just because I like the taste but I did try to see if I would be able to cook them without it and it does work without any oil or butter in the pan! Heat seems to evenly distribute and I've had no issues with anything burning or sticking at all.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great non-stick surface.', 'author': 'Ann Golla', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So easy to clean and has a great surface for even cooking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love them', 'author': 'Toxie Odom', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great product', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Fry pan's", 'author': 'Janice Duren', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Absolutely LOVE these pans!! Totally nonstick and a breeze to wash!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Would buy again', 'author': 'Julie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my second set of these because I love that they are dishwasher safe', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars They're good, but not the best", 'author': 'G Sawyer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'UPDATE 08/2023: I have officially ruined these pans. They began to lose their nonstick coating some time last year with almost daily use. A bit of unattended spinach is now a permanent addition to them (I had Covid, mkay?), and thus the most commonly used pans in this set are no longer nonstick. There\'s also a slight warp in the biggest one - oil runs off the center. It\'s fine for greasy foods, but things like potstickers and eggs need a different pan. If I need to brown something that requires a bit of scraping to deglaze, a steel-bottom pot is still my go-to, as nothing comes off these pans easily anymore. Hope that helps someone looking for a lifelong friend in their pans - I don\'t think these are it. They gave me a good 3 years, though. Cheers.ORIGINAL 11/2022: I\'ve been using these pans for a year in December. I waited a long time to write a review because as someone who cooks A LOT, I wanted to let others know how these hold up over time. So, this review is after a year of almost daily use.My husband got me the 3-pan set for Christmas. There are no lids, just to clarify. Right away I noticed that the surface coating feels a lot like teflon. After a good scrub with a nonscratch sponge, I filled them all with water and lemon to try and boil away the weird smell they were putting off. I tasted the weird chemical odor in the food, too. So I took my time trying to cook/scrub/boil away the smell. I have a sensitive nose, so this may not bother others. The smell did eventually go away after about a week of heavy use.Right away I noticed that the handle rivets on all 3 leak. This isn\'t a problem with water, but with oil it could be a hazard. I took a picture of the handle rivets and the oil burned on to show where it leaks from.How have they held up after a year? So-so. I cook all manner of dishes in these, from morning potatoes to shakshuka, to alfredo, to Thai fried rice. And I\'m cooking for 5, so the biggest pan is always on the stove. My clan has very strict instructions regarding my pans: No metal utensils. No dishwashers. No hot/cold shocks (cold water on a hot pan). That\'s it. Still, somehow, these pans that claim to be safe for metal utensils have scratches in them. I tried to get the pictures, I hope Amazon preserves the quality so you can see. Also, there is discoloration in the center of the pan, and it\'s no longer 100% nonstick.I\'ve noticed through the years that teflon has about a year of heavy use before it comes off. Nearly the same here, except whatever they used on these pans doesn\'t flake off, it just kind of gets... thin? After a year, I have to be more careful with oil and food placement in these pans to avoid things sticking. Things take a bit more coaxing now to be "nonstick." It\'s problematic for sunny-side-up eggs, which need to be able to slide around in order to get that perfect cooked white and runny yolk. The other two pans in the set aren\'t as abused as this one and have held up much better, preserving their nonstick nature.These pans also do not transfer heat very well. That\'s just what you get for having light, easy-to handle pans. My ancient stovetop has hotspots and you can even see in the picture exactly where this hotspot is - by the handle, as I always place the handle in the same place when I cook. I think it\'s a worthwhile trade, honestly, because that\'s literally the only thing keeping me from using cast iron instead - the weight. My wrists can\'t handle a heavy pan AND 5+ pounds of food. So these are great for that.The curved edges of the pan allow me to flip food easily without having to reach for a utensil. And despite my occasional abuse (I have 3 kids, once in a great while things get burnt, mkay?), the surface coating isn\'t flaking off. Four out of 5 stars because they\'re holding up better than teflon, but they just don\'t make that 5/5 star rating for nonstick immortality.For anyone who manages to burn things onto your pans, put that metal scraper away. Just boil lemon juice or vinegar in the pan, get a wooden spatula, and gently scrape away the burnt stuff. Works great on stainless steel, too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Scanpan HaptIQ Stainless Steel-Aluminum 11 Inch Fry Pan
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just a great everyday pan', 'author': 'Cincyguy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was tired of cheaper pans that wouldn't stay flat. This one has a thick base to keep it from warping. The non-stick seems to be excellent. I haven't really tried eggs in it without butter, but that's just a personal taste preference for me. Easy to clean as well. I did get some staining on the bottom but nothing dawn power spray couldn't clean off. So far it's just been an everyday workhorse. The only issue is the handle portion closest to the pan can get pretty hot (not burning your skin hot, but very uncomfortable). So grab the pan by the handle furthest away.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Scanpan is the best', 'author': 'SuperFreq', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am slowly switching all of my pans over to Scanpans. They are solid, nonstick doesn't scratch easy and they are beautiful. Heat distribution is better than or on par with many of my other high end pans. This one is just as great as the others I have purchased and the polished surface of the back of the pan is holding up well to regular use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite non-stick pan, by far.', 'author': 'The Den', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really hesitated on this purchase... It\'s a REALLY expensive non-stick pan... And since non-stick isn\'t an heirloom product like Cast Iron or even Stainless Steel, I hate the idea of spending so much on a pan that will need to be replaced in a few years.First: some background... I cook daily, and geek out on equipment. I have a selection of cast iron pans (lodge, utopia, finex), enameled cast iron (le creuset, lodge), non-stick (calphalon), high carbon steel (mauviel and BK), and stainless (all-clad). In other words, I own and use a LOT of pans.With that said, for truly non-stick purposes, and convenience, this is one of my favorite pans in the house now. And THAT is saying something!Longevity: It\'s nice that it\'s titanium ceramic ("stratanium") and they claim it will last for many years more than a normall non-stick. We shall see.High Heat: Because there\'s no teflon, this can be heated to a HIGH temperature (600 degrees) and thus can be used to sear, without concerns of toxic fumes/particles. It can be thrown into the oven as well, which is really nice.Non-Stick: This pan is absolutely non-stick like you dream about. A tiny bit of butter, and my omlettes release and slide around in the pan with no issue at all. A quick wipe and the whole pan is clean. This is SO great for eggs, sauteeing veggies, etc. Really enjoying the very high performance non-stick properties.Handling: The pan is HEAVY - and this is a good thing. It is sold, and heats evenly, which is exactly what you want. It\'s not heavy on the level of a cast iron pan, but it\'s definitely got heft to it, which means that it heats very evenly, and feels nice in the hand. The hanlde itself is very ergonomic, and the slopes to the sides of the pan are steep enough to give a good amount of flat frying space, while being JUST right for pan tossing food (thus, sautee).I\'m seriously considering buying a second one of these, and just throwing out my previous set of (perfectlly serviceable) non-stick pans. They\'re that good. The 11" pan is an incredible deal right now, (currently $99) and it\'s a perfect size for sauteeing veggies, cooking several eggs, or making a nice omelet. Get it. Don\'t look back.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Much improved Scanpan - I do not recommend the classic version', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I previously bought the Scanpan Classic series. One of the pans that I use very often did not hold up well at all (see photo), despite my following the guidance provided with the product. It still is non-stick but it is definitely not aging well. In contrast, the ScanPan HaptIQ pan that I bought more recently is much, much better - surface is more resilient, easier to clean (as is the aluminum exterior), and heat distribution is excellent.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The best Non stick', 'author': 'barry osselborn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'You get what you pay for!Excellent pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Brand of Non-stick pan for me', 'author': 'Gregory Costrini', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased a Scanpan some years back prior to the HaptiQ line and I was reasonably happy with it. I say that because it wasn\'t the best performing non-stick surface but it was good enough versus the potential hazards of other non-stick pans as far as I am concerned.I\'ve since purchased the HaptiQ pans in both 9.5 and 11" (actually I have three sizes - maybe 8, 9.5 and 11?) and these have all performed very well. The surfaces are still in great shape ( I can\'t remember when I purchased them but it\'s been at least a year. The micro texturing it seems helps food release as the company claims. I find that the pans need a very light wipe of oil (I use avocado oil) and it cooks eggs nicely although I tend to use the LeCrueset pan for eggs.The 9.5 and 11 inch I reach for when I am browning meat as the pans hold and distribute heat very well.I have three kids and am always cooking something. I will likely get the MatreD set in the near future.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite sauté pan.', 'author': 'BillBristolCT', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased a Scan Pan about 15 years ago at a kitchen store. They do not last forever and my old one was getting tired. Things were sticking and it was not looking too clean. This pan is my favorite of any non-stick pan I have ever owned. Clean up is a breeze. I already had a lid and you will want one. Heating is wonderful. Don't use too much heat; you don't need it. And the price here on Amazon was a deal.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent nonstick pan', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent pan. Heats evenly. Heavy. Finish is not smooth, but is very slightly bumpy, which makes it a little harder to clean. I would recommend this pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 19, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars 11" great but issues with 8" and might as well have no warranty', 'author': 'Michael W.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After 9 months of heavy use my 11" looks and performs like new. I love these pans as they are heavy, sear well but clean up very easily and work great on my induction cooktop. I also got an 8" skillet direct from scanpan and on the 2nd or 3rd use I heard a pop/crack sound as I was cooking eggs(on medium high heat with teflon utensils) and the cracks in the picture appeared. Scanpans support called them scratches and not warranted. I waited several months and the edges of the so call \'scratches\' have raised up slightly and a 3rd one appeared. I suspect there were air bubbles or moisture trapped between layers that caused this but scanpan support is sticking to deeming them \'scratches\'. So if you are buying these with the \'lifetime warranty\' in mind then just be aware of this. Great pans so long as you don\'t get a lemon! Perhaps mine will eventually crack to a point they warranty it but they certainly make it difficult.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A super fry pan with a design flaw', 'author': 'LarryAt27N', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This frypan gave my celebratory rib steak ($24) the best char ever in my long history of cooking, over 50 years.The burner was set for what would be #6 of 10 if it had numbers, and that is as high as it should ever go. The pan got quite hot after 5 minutes, when I placed the steak on it. After 2, maybe 3 minutes I turned it over to see a wonderful black surface. A couple minutes more and I was ready to put it on the cutting board to settle for a minute. (NOTE: the steak was already perfectly cooked at 127F via sous-vide.)Cleanup of the warm pan took about 20 seconds. Two days later, I fried 2 eggs over easy with no oil or butter in the pan. Perfect.DESIGN FLAW! The handle is too round where you hold it. Given that it's made of smooth steel, this makes tilting the pan to pour out small hot items and sauces a bit dicey and unsure. By way of comparison, the handles on my other pans are flatter at the ends and/or made of non-slip materials.For this reason, I took off what would have been the fifth star.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: GreenPan Dover Healthy Ceramic Nonstick, 8" Frying Pan Skillet, PFAS-Free, Dishwasher Safe, Comfort Grip Handle, Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works like a dream!', 'author': 'Lucerne07', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Nothing sticks to this pan, and it's easy to clean. Even though it's dishwasher safe, I'm washing by hand for a longer non-stick life.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great little pan', 'author': 'Diana M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great little pan, non stick, covered handle', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Go-to pan', 'author': 'heylesley', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pan is so good my husband (who likes to make his own breakfast) practically fight over it. title: SENSARTE Ceramic Nonstick Pots and Pans Set 14pcs, Healthy Cookware Set, Non-toxic Induction Kitchen Cooking Set, Dishwasher & Oven Safe, PFAS/PTFE/PFOA Free
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful pots and pans!', 'author': 'Svenska Flicka', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Sensarte Ceramic 14 piece set of pots and pans I bought my daughter for Christmas are just what we were hoping for. We were looking for something kind of modern/boho for her apartment, and they needed to be non-toxic as well. These totally exceeded our expectations. They have a modern flare, are lightweight but sturdy, the 14 piece set contained all the basic pieces one would need for daily cooking, they're totally nonstick and nontoxic, and are a snap to clean in the dishwasher, especially because the handles can be easily removed for washing. They are a bargain, especially for the quality and look. If I didn't already have a nice (expensive) set of pots and pans, I would buy myself a set. They were an absolute bargain, especially for the quality, and my daughter uses them daily.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sensarte Ceramic Pots & Pans Are Just Perfect!', 'author': 'Sharon', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased the set in cream, and it is just beautiful. Since we do stack them, the provided pads come in really handy so nothing gets scratched. I can't believe how easy food like scrambled eggs slides right out of the pan and there is absolutely no scrubbing or even lightly rubbing necessary in cleaning. I did so much research on a new set of cookware and am SO glad I bought these.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The most exciting cookware unboxing ever!', 'author': 'YAYteaching', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I was so blown away with the reviews and price of this product. These are amazing pots and pans. They really cover just about all the bases: removable handles, free of PFAs, ceramic non stick coating, oven safe to 550, stackable, dishwasher safe, and absolutely gorgeous!! The packaging was so beautiful and compact I felt I was unwrapping a luxury purse instead of cookware. The company puts a lot of thought into quality and removing unnecessary expenses so the price is very good. I will update this post if I see any issues while cooking with the pans.Update: I have been using the pans and they are incredible. I have never cooked with this great a ceramic surface. The eggs just lift right off and nothing sticks to the pan. The spatulas are great too. I don’t need to risk putting these in the dishwasher because they clean and rinse just that easy. Outstanding!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Stylish ceramics for your kitchen', 'author': 'Cookie', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Color: beige/cream. Size: 14-piece set. Composition: 5 ceramic coated pots with aluminium core + bakelite handles, 3 glass and bakelite lids, two silicon utensils, 4 cushioned polyester pot protectors. The four elements in this cooking set (8" & 9.5" frying pans, 11" sauté pan with lid, 2 qt. saucepan with lid, 4.5 qt. casserole with lid) include the essential sizes for an equipped kitchen. Ceramic is great to cook with because it avoids lots of sticky problems, and the included silicon tools make this feature even better. The pots are stylish, solid (almost too heavy for everyday use) and very attractive. Glass lids are wonderful to take some of the guesswork out of cooking. Since I am left-handed, I love the two-sided spout feature of the saucepan. What I don\'t like is that the handles don\'t necessarily screw on all the way, so one wonders about long-term stability. The lid knobs are also bakelite and also screw on, creating the same uncertainty. Now these pots are described as "dishwasher safe", and bakelite is stable when subjected to heat, so the handles and lid knobs shouldn\'t have to be removed when being washed. Therefore why the screw-on design? The handles all have rotatable metal hooks for ease in hanging; I would have preferred less rotation and more stability. Remains to be seen how the ceramic holds up over time. If the wear and tear are excessive, I\'ll re-evaluate after a month.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Handles are cheap', 'author': 'Ezekiel & Brigette Ramirez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Was so excited for my pots, and pans. After 1-2 weeks of light use, the handle broke off the smaller pan. Seems like poor material by the way it broke off. So saddened by this because the pans are so cute, I had high hopes.** UPDATE: Seller reached out, and went above expectations to solve my issue!!With service like this, definitely deserves 5 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED', 'author': 'Shania', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I’ve been using these pots for like two weeks now. TWO WEEKS and they’ve already started to have these stains at the bottom. The non-stick works great and all but the exterior of the pots are just very disappointing. It cooks the food well and it does not stick, but these are very delicate pots you have to wash them gently and put them down very gently, because the moment you handle it a little too harshly the pots gets scrapes and stuff like that. Now the stain that you see on the bottom of the pots in the pictures, I don’t know what caused that because at the time I was just scrambling eggs and after finishing up with the eggs I let the pot cool before washing them(as stated in the manual) when I went to wash the pot I saw these marks on the bottom, i thought that after washing it they’ll probably go away, sadly it did not. For a whole week I was trying to figure out what caused this to happen, after using the other pots I realized that gradually all of the pots were having the same stain on the bottom so I figured it was either not compatible with gas stove (even tho they sated that it is) or the pots are just not well made as I thought. I wouldn’t recommend these pots to anyone.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value', 'author': 'American Soldier', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had been looking to replace my skillet for awhile and looked at several name brands. I’m getting some for my sister next!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Paint caught on fire!!!', 'author': 'Abby Davis', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I’ve had these pots and pans for two weeks not even cooking in them every day for two weeks. I have an electric stove top and the paint got so hot it caught on flames! In the picture I have already washed it and cleaned it up to kind of see what had happened. I contacted Amazon and of course Amazon doesn’t want to take accountability because who wants to give people back their money. They only wanted to offer A five dollar promotion credited to my Amazon account. If you plan on purchasing just don’t they were amazing I like how they look I like the way they cook but if the paint on the bottom is going to catch fire over an electric stove top that’s too much and considering I told Amazon exactly what happened and they still didn’t want to take accountability someone in my home could’ve been seriously injured. And they couldn’t care less but it also makes me frustrated because I paid my hard earned money for these. And if one pan catches fire from the paint it would make you think the rest of them have a risk as well. So no I do not want to keep using them shame on Amazon for this this is officially my last purchase I will ever make on Amazon. Because they truly showed me they could care less.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wish I had bought these first', 'author': 'mom of 3', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got a new induction stove and did not realize that magnalite pots do not work on the stove. So went looking for different pots and found these. Of course still spray before cooking but no sticking. So much easier cooking over easy eggs. I still use my cast iron pots for things like gravies but love these pots.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I now like cooking!', 'author': 'Jillian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I don't cook and hate cooking BUTI bought these pans & I love them. title: Anolon Ascend Hard Anodized Nonstick Frying Pan/Skillet - Good for All Stovetops (Gas, Glass Top, Electric & Induction), Dishwasher & Oven Safe with Stainless Steel Handle, 12 Inch - Bronze
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars After trying 3 other pans, settled on this one', 'author': 'The Real Mark', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm one of Those People who doesn’t want to spend a dime more than is necessary but still expects high-quality.In this particular case, I initially ordered a 10-inch T-Fal pan. However, it had a scratch on the top of the rim. I promptly returned it for a replacement, but it too came with a scratch on the top of the rim. It was packaged well, so I don’t think it came from the manufacturer like that. So, I returned that too.Next, I tried the PranzoElite pan. I read good reviews, and thought I’d give it a try. But, while it said it was 10-inch, it was actually 11-inches, which was annoying since I still had a 10-inch lid that I wanted to use. Also, the PranzoElite’s bottom wasn’t fully stainless steel, so it seemed to only work on one of my induction burners.I finally decided that it just wasn’t worth my time driving back and forth to the UPS store to try and save a few bucks and got this pan. And I’m glad I did.First of all, I’m glad that those poisonous substances were not used for this pan; that’s not optional.This pan’s full stainless steel bottom easily cooks on any of my induction burners, having no problems activating them.It appears very nicely made and is aesthetically pleasing. The stainless steel and brass-colored design looks nice together.The handle and pan seem pretty thick, and didn’t transfer any noticeable heat.I also like how, where the handle is riveted, it’s coated with a non stick surface there too; a lot of pans don’t do that and, thus, over time get a little grimy, in which case you’d have to take a metal pad to clean them and thus possibly scratch your nonstick pan. But not this one.I’ll adjust this review if it fails me in the near future. However, for now, I’m pretty happy with it overall, and look forward to using it for years to come.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 4 quart pot is a necessity.', 'author': 'JamesR', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Analog ascend hard anodized nonstick. I plan to buy some more larger ones.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Pan', 'author': 'Pete in OC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Well made very substantial pan is very non-stick and cooks very well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Take proper care of it and it should last a good while', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've owned and used pretty expensive non-stick pans in the past (e.g., All-Clad) and they perform very well and will last a long time as long as they are used and cared for properly. So when I had to replace a 10 inch non-stick All-Clad (I got tired of wasting my breath with the pan abusers in the house), I decided to look for something that seemed pretty well made but not as expensive. title: Circulon 81401 14" Helper Handle Hard Anodized Aluminum Skillet, 14 Inch, Oyster Gray
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Size matters!!!! It cleans so easy and I just need one pan to do it all. I would highly recommend it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Almost a 5 star', 'author': 'Katherine H.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I gave this pot a 4 star review because of the lid. Great sturdy pot that I feel was worth the expense.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Now It’s Our Fave Go-To Pan!', 'author': 'John V Richardson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We love that the non-stick is so well done! The cleanup is a breeze.The size is excellent in that it’s deeper than a skillet but sides are not as high as a “Dutch oven” style, Perfect!Last night I made a DOUBLE batch of chili in it—then stored the leftovers in it, in the refrigerator of course. For dinner, all I had to do was put it in the stove & reheat to have a delicious dinner again!!My only criticism is that the handles in the sides of the pan & on the glass lid are not as wide as they are on other Circulon pans & lids we have bought. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great frying pan', 'author': 'S. I love this brand!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Time will tell', 'author': 'Toland E. Reed', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I just received this skillet and did a test with some eggs. Only a fool would not use at least a little butter or oil, that being said the skillet performed very well. No sticking, no burning, and clean-up was extremely easy. I will most likely use this for eggs and such. I do not need to try it without oil or butter. I think that is just silly. All in all it I am happy with it, it will do all I expect it to do. With the tv hype aside it is a well made and useful addition to my kitchen. Time will tell if it will last. I will post updates if anything changes.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars College Student Midnight Cooking Shenanigans', 'author': 'collegestudent781', 'rating': 5, 'content': "As a college student, I have to walk to the campus center to retrieve my package and then walk back to my dorm (about a 10 minute walk both ways). This pan was so light that I didn't even realize that it was my pan until I opened the package. I was tossing the package up and down the entire way back to my dorm and not realizing that it contained my pan, that's how lightweight it is.The pan is extremely easy to use and clean, considering how I use the dorm's communal kitchen. It is easily scratched (but that's also because I don't have any cooking utensils and just use chopsticks to cook) but that's beside the point. Extremely versatile, I use the pan from pan frying to boiling water for the midnight ramen snacks. Must buy and extremely cheap!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Oven safe as well!', 'author': 'Georgie Girl', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've used this thing a dozen times in the past week. It is magnificent! Easy to clean, looks high-end, cooks very well aside from the standard hot spot in the middle that we expect from non-stick cookware.The only thing that would have made this product even better would have been if it came with a lid. When I need one, I use a glass lid from my old 8-quart stockpot, which fits like they were made for each other.If you're on the fence about buying this pan, do it! You won't be sorry.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A great non-stick pan at a great price', 'author': 'Fred Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': '1/4 inch thick aluminum construction provides great heat distribution and the non-stick coating works great. Very sturdy and well made; it feels like it costs several times the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good pan,especially for the price', 'author': 'Mossydog', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I\'m a retired chef, and I can\'t complain about this pan, especially for the price. I bought it originally as a lid for my Tramontina 10" frying pan.It\'s not really a sauteé pan, as instructions say to use it on low to medium heat, so searing and frying will probably damage the nonstick coating. It\'s also pretty heavy, although that\'s not necessarily a bad thing, depending upon what you want to use it for.It seems to heat evenly and the handle rivets hold the handle securely... I honestly don\'t know how to judge how well the handle dissipates heat, since I commonly reach into a hot oven and move things around bare handed, so use your common sense and know your own heat tolerance. It takes years to desensitize one\'s hands to this degree, so just check on your own. The handle design is common and others seem ok with it, so I\'ll have to take them at their word.All in all a serviceable frying pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great skillet', 'author': 'Ruger 1', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love everything about this skillet it’s easy to use and cleans up easily the only non fact statement is you can’t cook a egg without some sort of oil it sticks. It’s heavy duty and has held up to everything I’ve cooked in it. I highly recommend all their pans', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pan ever!!', 'author': 'Steve Kunkle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Will definitely buy more!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Thinner than my other pan, but does not stick', 'author': 'Dave Wheeler', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have used this three times since receiving ir. Nothing stuck to the pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Fried Egg Pan, Egg Frying Pan with Lid Nonstick 4 Cups Pancake Pan Aluminium Alloy Cooker for Breakfast, Induction Compatible
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lid is Integral to Success', 'author': 'Steven Allen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’ve used this egg cooking pan for about a month and really like how it makes the eggs fluffy.Today I discovered the hard way that the glass lid was the key to making the eggs fluffy because I forgot to pull it out of the drawer and Cooke my eggs without the lid. The eggs were just ordinary flat eggs that I had to flip to finish cooking. The eggs were still good, but now I’m spoiled by fluffy eggs and it will never be the same again. Lesson: Always use the lid!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great!', 'author': 'Longevity', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy for my boys to use to make eggs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Eggs come out great', 'author': 'RAP', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Tried rings first = leaked and stuck to the rings bad. Tried another brand of pan (round with four egg cups) - it worked pretty good but some sticking problem and no lid for stove top spatter. This pan works the best - very non-stick and easy cleanup. Only complaint is the FLAT lid - the eggs and any cheese I add sticks to the glass badly - I wish the lid was domed up or higher on the edges to give some clearance underneath.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The pan is great and cooks things quickly. Lid is not great.', 'author': 'Qris', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The pan itself works better than expected. It fits our large burner very well. Very sturdy. It needs a heat proof grip opposite the handle, I have burnt my fingers on that… once. The biggest issue is the lid. It covers too flat on the pan and is extremely hot. It is flat so it touches what is being cooked making it hard to set aside without leaving a mess. And did I mention it gets extremely hot.All said, it works fantastically in making Individual items, it just needs a better cover. I will continue to enjoy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So easy to use!', 'author': 'faith', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this for my 15 year old who loves making all kinds of eggs. You can cook four eggs at once or one to four eggs and use the other wells for veges or frying potatoes and onions, whatever you like. This one has a lid which is a necessity I feel to even out the cooking and minimize the mess. Comes with accessories too. Not crazy about screwing the handle on the lid myself as I worried about cracking it but so far so good!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars The coating on the bottom began to peel off after a couple times through the wash', 'author': 'Jay S. I highly recommend that you hand wash it with hot water and soap after it is cooled off. I have been steaming rice in this pan and flipping over with a nice crusty bottom. The pan is wider than I anticipated and fits my need. Please pay attention to the dimensions so you are surprised. This pan is not super deep. I highly recommend it to those that have a use for it. If you are new to all-clad please consider buying what you need and not buy a set. Although the sets are a good buy for your money, in most cases only a few of the items come handy. This is wide pan as I mentioned above, and you can make food for 3-5 people. One thing I learned over the years is that small pans and pots are good for restaurants were chefs make a dish per order. If you make food for a family small pots and pans are not used as much. Hence this is good item for making food for more than one dish.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The superstar of our pots and pans', 'author': 'T. When our Calphalon non-stick 12" everyday pan started flaking, we replaced it with this model and have been very happy since. It feels high-quality, it cooks evenly, and nothing sticks to it. title: CSK 10" Red Frying Pan-Non-Stick Skillets with Whitford Granite Nonstick Coating, PTFE and APEO Free, Durable Bakelite Handle, Aluminum Alloy, Superior Omelet Pan Suitable for All Stove.
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars FIRST USE IMPRESSIONS - STONE EARTH PAN. MADE IN GERMANY', 'author': 'Michael Y.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Well, I have yet to find a really durable non-stick pan, these pans all have sprayed on coatings and on every one ive ever seen the coating eventually fails - its just a question of when. The infomercials make wild claims that dont even match the pans own instructions of use, how they get away with this is baffling. They often iimpress at first use and get glowing reviews, then at some point its in the trash - to be fair this is often as much to do with improper use of metal utensils on a non stick surface as anything, but ive had pans I treated with kid gloves and still the coating failed. OK call me negative but its the truth 99.5% of the time and its something only time will tell. So, that aside I will say this pan makes a great first impression - the nice looking if not unusual coating and pan construction seem to indicate better than average quality and durability based on ther pans feel and weight as well as thickness. I especially like the very well made handle that will never burn me and looks very much like real wood but is really a man made high heat synthetic, and thats fine as long as it holds up, but the handle is one of the best ive seen far as comfort and safety go -- the down side is you can not put this pan in the oven with this type handle, and im not faulting the pan for this because the manufacturer tells you this in the instructions and I knew this going in so if you want such a pan buy one made to go in the oven. - Ive only used the pan three times so far and can not deny I am impressed, I lightly cleaned and wiped the pan dry, then fried eggs sunny side up and there was no sticking they slid out with almost no coaxing. Then with no cleaning I fried some breakfast sausage and the pan proved easy to work with and cooked the sausage nice and evenly, no sticking and the sausage came out great. Finally, leaving all the sausage remnants in the pan untouched I fried two more eggs sunny side up, and again there was no sticking the eggs slid right out with no issues - again its still early in the game but I found this very encouraging, often frying an egg after sausage makes it hard to retrieve the egg - but not in this case, in fact though I am a nonstick skeptic I already love this pan -- but I know in my heart only time will show how good a companion this pan proves to be. I would say if this pan could deliver say, five to seven years of this kind of performance its a bargain for $30, almost nothing today is built to last like things used to so the five to seven year rule is just my opinion and in todays world not many things last five to seven years, so I figure that would be a very good lifespan for a $30 non stick pan, and hopefully being made in Germany will mean something as far as build quality making it a realistic projection - but so far I have nothing bad at all to say about the pans performance or overall build quality, given what I know so far of it the $30 price seems well in line and for now I have to say its a solid performer and definitely one to try if youre looking, its not a run of the mill TV ad clone and its one of the reasons I pulled the trigger. Ive only seen the one size so far, hopefully there will be and 8 and 12 inch available, because if it proves itself good I definitely want another one or two of these pans.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful pots.', 'author': 'Deborah Finch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Durability and charm. I love the look and the wood handles are so nice. Easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A year in, still like new!', 'author': 'Morse Code Name', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I actually came to Amazon today searching for matching pans, and realized I was remiss in not reviewing my 11" pan that I literally purchased a year ago today. I\'ve had it a good while, and am comfortable letting the world know that it\'s still like brand new and easily my favorite pan of all time. Nothing sticks to it...NOTHING...it heats evenly, has a nice lid, and is SO EASY to clean. Everything just slides right out--hot water, a squirt of dish soap, a few passes with a soft sponge, and a good rinse and dry and it\'s ready to go back in the cabinet. I was concerned about the warnings to hand wash because, well...I\'m lazy and I admit it. The rest of my pots and pans need some elbow grease to clean up, so I worried that if I couldn\'t put it in the dishwasher, I would just leave this pan sitting dirty on the stove in a fit of laziness. Or WORSE, that I\'d say "eff it" and put it in the dishwasher and ruin it, as I\'ve been known to do with other hand-wash items. But oh, was I wrong! 90% of the time, I put whatever I\'m cooking onto a serving dish and clean off the pan before the family even sits down to our meal, it\'s that quick. Ask my husband and kids, every time I wash the pan I exclaim out loud how much I love it--they think it\'s pretty weird, but hey, I guess this is what it\'s like to be in your 40\'s.Aside from all this, as mentioned, my pan is a year old and I\'ve seen no wear on it at all. I\'m so sad to see all the reviews stating that their pans didn\'t even last a month! I wish that everyone could have a life-changing non-stick pan experience like mine. I stan for pan. Now I\'m off to buy some other sizes.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Even heat', 'author': 'esther', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's wonderful and non-stick. On my gas stove though, it won't give me a rolling-boil. The bubbles are small and evenly distributed, but does take just a little longer to cool than my old stainless steel pot.I think it's because my stove's gas isn't turned up as high as it should be.I love this pot, really needed the in-between size of it. Good lid too.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great performance', 'author': 'Steve H', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I\'ve been using a 9.5" Kochsysteme frying pan for several years, and it has out-performed every other brand I have tried. I needed a replacement, but can no longer find the 9.5, so I went with the 5-piece set that includes a 10".Be aware that the instructions say"suitable for gas, induction, and ceramic stovetops". I did not know this at first until I open the box and saw the instructions. I have an electric element stove, so the pans don\'t sit entirely flat at first.
